Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Garibaldi is one of the best Italian restaurants in town.  A meal there is always enjoyable, from Starter right through to Dessert.  Their only letdown is their coffee and lattes.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Choose to have dinner here and select the Signature 3 courses menu. The food quality is excellent, the service is also very good. Highly recommend the seared scallop as starter and tiramisu as dessert.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: They've weekdays set lunch at 39+++ per pax. So I thought why n

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Brilliant brunch! Delicious food, wonderful champagne and amazing service. James was particularly excellent - brilliant sense of humour!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Walked into this restaurant as the nearby restaurant I was going for lunch was full. So no prior homework as to this restauran

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I was there for my birthday. My husband and I tried Michelin starred restaurant twice a year: once for his birthday and once for mine. We tried a few throughout the years and we take enjoyment talking to the chef and the staff. We enjoy having explanation on our dish and learn about their inspiration and what make them special. At Garibaldi, this time, it was a bit different. The staff only mentionned the dish as per what the menu called them. No explanation given, no ingredient origin given, basic :here is your type-your-dish-here plate and enjoy. It was blunt and in a rush. I will blame it on Covid and on the social distancing but it overall did not give me a good impression of the service. The food was great, really enjoyed the fettuccine but their Michelin menu was rather conservative without much room for creativity. Overall ok experience, it was nice to try once.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Authentic Quality Italian food you can find in Singapore with the best friendly and warm staff by the name of Renz. Kudos to your guys!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Wonderful Service and wine recommendation from James. Ask for Irish Coffee (off the menu) from Alexandra. The most decent we had in Singapore by far. Fresh cream instead of whipped cream from can.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Long time I did not step in Garibaldi. Decided to go for lunch with my wife and what a frustration. Got the 39.- set lunch, they should be shameful the orecchiette funghi cream sauce and the carrot soup was just so amateurly done. My wife took the 88.- and frustration was palpable on her look. The pork on a rice dish for example you could just feel the water taste of the rice, but the other dish made the cut. Forget about thinking you have value for money on those set lunch.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I ordered various pasta dishes for my father’s birthday dinner at home. Each type of pasta turned out superb - everyone was impressed at the taste and quality of the food, and portions were very decent. We’re all very happy that we chose Garibaldi (even its takeaway option) for my father’s birthday and we’ll definitely not hesitate to order again. My father loved the veal ravioli. Thank you, Garibaldi team - we would love to visit when we’re able to again!!!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: ordered dinner takeaway of soup, foie gras and pasta. really good quality of food. will be back soon.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Ordered delivery for the family during the COVID-19 lockdown. Never visited the restaurant before in-pers

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I had been craving carbonara for several days. The fusilli gar-bonara totally filled it. Al dente fusilli and super creamy carbonara. Order was very easy on their website and delivery was fast, friendly and efficient. Garibaldi is one of my favourite Italian restaurants in Singapore. Getting it at home was a real treat.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Savoured Garibaldi's take-away menu during the first weekend of the Covid19 lockdown. I ordered the Burrata con Pomodorini for the starter (large enough portion for 2 if you wish a lighter starter) and the Spaghetti Aglio Olio with sea urchin and grilled scallops and a portion of Spaghetti Mare. I picked the items up from the restaurant and when I served the items for dinner shortly, the main courses were still very warm. The Spaghetti Aglio Olio was exquisite as I expected and so was the Spaghetti Mare which was thoughtfully packed in a 2-tier container so that the Spaghetti was still al dente when eaten. Finished off with mama's recipe for tiramisu. Nothing was lost in the take out dinner as compared to dining in at Garibaldis. Totally enjoyable experience and wish to encourage all enjoyed Garibaldis to try the take out to show our support during these challenging times.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Garibaldi Italian is a restaurant I discovered in my new neighborhood in Singapore. Without a doubt the best Italian restaurant in Singapore that I have been to. The menu selection is fantastic with a great selection and variety of dishes that cover just about any mood your

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Great all round menu - everything we had was excellent. Solid wine list and great service. There’s a bit of cheesy glam going on too which makes it irresistible.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: We ordered the 5 course Michelin menu. Everything was spectacular, specially the skin soaking p

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Brought my partner for lunch, no special occasion, just a da

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Bottled water (in a glass bottle) set us back $9 before service charge and GST which was a shocker for us that did take away from the good food and ambience we were enjoying during our meal there. They are only open during lunch and dinner for short windows of time. Would suggest to go for their signature menu, the appetizer scallops are to die for. Everything is beautifully plated as you'd expect of a Michelin-starred restaurant.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Went there for a birthday dinner. Had the osso-buco and the ravioli. My mates had something similar. The service was attentive, professional and friendly. The food was good ol’ comfort food. Italian food done well. Don’t get me wrong, the standards are really good but when a restaurant has a star, I’d expect a bit more. I’m not sure what the Michelin inspectors had but a bib gourmand would be more appropriate.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: We brought our Neapolitan guests here and the moment we stepped in we felt like we were in Italy.....from the hostess to the barman to the sommelier...they're Italians! Most of the staff we found out are from Italy. For our guests they totally immersed themselves in Italian lingo with the sta

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: This was one of the rare experiences where you wondered how Michelin stars are allocated: either they had a good day when the tester was around or we had a bad one. But let me start with the positive bit. Atmosphere and interior are nice and the service was friendly and o

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Suppose to be a one star Michelin If it is one store my cooking is 3 stars. Food was not even mediocre I order a lobster with pasta. It was a like a hockey luck with no taste. If I remember correctly the meal was over $250. Wasn’t worth $10.00

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Michelin reviewers must be hallucinating when they give this place a star. I have eaten at many 3 starred establishments and my benchmark has always been the Epicure and Le Cinq in Paris or 8 ½ Otto e Mezzo Bombana for Italian in Hong Kong. This restaurant is very far from them. They do not deserve a Michelin star. I arrived 10 minutes early and was asked to wait at the bar for our table and they only ushered us in to our table 5 minutes after our reservation time even tough there were many empty tables there. A group of caucassians who came in after us only waited for less than 5 minutes before they were ushered in to their table. Let me say again its not like it was their busy day, there were many empty tables aroun

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I went to this restaurant for their weekday set lunch. It was of great value. They seem to change the menu for the set lunch regularly. I had a salad and a gnocchi. Both were very good. The bread was also well baked. The dessert, however, was just ok. The waiters were attentive and friend

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: We had set lunch $98++ for 4 pax, per head about $132 after ++ I had butter pumpkin soup with almond crumble, home made noodle with white truffle, beef cheek with chestnut & tunip purée, plus cheese cake & raspberry Gelée & good cup of cappuccino. What a perfect way to round up the year!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: We had the 6 course xmas menu and 4 of them were standouts - cold pasta, poached egg, warm pasta and wagyu. Portions were tiny and ok for me, but my friend had to order an a la carte main of seabass with 2 fried eggs. I thought the eggs were special but they were not, though they cost $8 each. Seabass wasn’t a standout eit

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review:
We enjoyed the menu with wine pairings - it was a reasonably priced option allowing us to enjoy the excellent food matched with some wines.

The service was exceptional and the food was delicious. All in all an enjoyable experience for our special occasion.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Small portion sizes, large prices. Nice decor but nothing special. Service alternated between less than great and excellent.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: These were the 2nd time i visited the restaurant celebrating my birthday. Not only the ambience was good and cosy, i and my hubby enjoyed the food very much which were really authentic and value for money. The staff were friendly and hospitality. I will definitely recommend it to my friends and colleagues and looking forward to go back with my friends on 13/Dec/19.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I have come to understand that many people who frequent first class restaurants choose not to write favorable comments for the good food and service they receive and ultimately pay for. Not

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Have gone multiple times and always try to make the effort to go during this season - Garibaldi never disappoints with its consistent quality and tasteful mix of white truffles into their excellent Italian cuisine.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: From beginning to the end, amazing experience. Staff is friendly and professional, food is incredibly tasty and special

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Was invited to a business dinner. The food was as one would expect of a Michelin Star restaurant. The Oyster and Prawns was more impressive on the taste buds to me than the pasta and beef. The cocktails which were tailor made was pleasant enough, didn’t get a wow factor.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Pasta starter and sea bass all the way from Italy apparently. Book cooked very well. Would return...

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Even though I was really late for lunch, the staff let me quickly order just before the kitchen closed. I had the 3 course $39 lunch special which was pretty good value. It came with bread and the waitress kindly bought me some water. I had the polenta with a truffle flavoured cream sauce for a first course which had a lovely flavour and the right size for an entree. The main was spaghetti with olives, sun dried tomato, pine nuts and basil. It was absolutely delicious and I could have eaten a huge bowl. Dessert was a trio of sweet pastries. I also had wine which was on the expensive side but that’s Singapore wine prices for you. I really enjoyed eating here and the staff were very courteous.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Came here with friends for a celebratory lunch and didn't expect much. We left with a great impression and the feeling of wanting to come back. The food was amazing! The service was great. Nothing to complain. We were just surprised at how casually dressed people here to a Michelin starred restaurant. Would love to come back soon!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I went there with my wife using the NS rewards voucher. The voucher was valid for a 4-course meal for two pax. The interior had a very European feel with a warm and cozy atmosphere. Every course was delicious and the ingredients used were certainly of premium quality.The service provided by the staff was top notch. As it was my wife's birthday, they prepared a complimentary slice of cake for her as well. We requested for a staff to help take a photo for us but he went the extra mile by offering to take several photos for us with different parts of the restaurant as background. Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely be back.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Beautiful bar, cellar and dining rooms: the place is elegant with a warm ambian

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I am impressed by the taste and freshness of such a humble dish, pasta. The Rigatoni All Bolognese is cooked al dente and the minced meat sauce blends perfectly well with the spaghetti. It has been a long while since I have delicious spaghetti that makes me crave for more. The wine sommelier Endy is very knowledgeable and gives good recommendations! We enjoyed our wine and dine night. Worth a visit, and I am coming back!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Not the most affordable, but food tasted great, portions were just nice and left space for dessert. Will definitely go back again.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Was in the area suit shopping and were looking for a nice lunch spot and were able to book within an hours notice. Very white table cloth fine dining but the food is extremely high quality Italian, some of the best I have experienced. Perfect if you are looking for some fancy Italian and amazing pasta and an all round fabulous dining experience.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Celebrated my birthday with family and had a mixed selection of orders from set dinners to ala carte. The scallop starters were excellent and so were the panna cotta desserts. The main course was a little mixed bag as I loved the fish dish whilst the sirloin steaks were not as gd and probably because of the cut that they serve in the set. However the portions were substantial. We were seated in a private room for 9 pax and I must say that the Service staff was excellent. Was here 2 days earlier for the set lunch which was reasonably priced. Overall, this restaurant is worth a visit be it for lunch or dinner.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: It's a birthday treat for a dear friend for more than 20 years. She was a little taken aback by the noise level when she entered the restaurant. However, the service and choice of food compensated for the a little imperfect entranc

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Celebrated our anniversary here; food was superb and service staff were not only welcoming but accommodating. We had the michelin menu and the food was definitely worth the price. Atmosphere was great as well; not too crowded and not too dim. Would definitely visit again.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I have been going to Garibaldi for at least 15 years or so but the last time was 2 years ago. This time I had special family reunion and I booked twice for 16 and 18 Aug. We are a party of 5 for 16 and I have to say it was the most horrendous night I have ever encountered for Michelin restaurant. There was a baby lunar month celebration in private room next to ours and I told the staff that this is no different than McDonalds kids party. Babies crying and kids screaming. Obviously all the other tables were also complaining. It totally ruined an expensive evening. To make matters worse, the cod was overcooked and cod is almost difficult to overcook. I saw that at the end of the dinner, they brought our complimentary Prosceeco for all the tables. I asked about my 18th reservations whether there is going to be another McDonald's party or not and I was assured there was none. On the 18, Naz the same server redeemed himself. I asked about the original cold angel hair dish with scallops and prawns as the new variance was too watery for me. The chef was able to prepare the original way. All the other food were back to excellent. We had another nice expensive family meal for 7. My advice for people reserving a dinner is to specifically ask whether there will be any children party or not. I am so puzzle at why the management would accept business for kid's party!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review:
Very very happy with every dish we ordered!

Angel hair pasta with Uni and Caviar ... to die for!

The sea bass was good but pasta’s still the best!

Great service!

Will return for more!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Spent our anniversary there. Had the michillin award set menu. It’s very yummy. Totally enjoyed my night!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I first visited Garibaldi in 2017 as an invited guest for a business lunch. My memory was of great presentation but only okay food. My wife and I’s dinner was sadly a repeat of my lunch experience with the exception this time that I was paying. My feedback to the maestro del ristorante was specifically on the rocket and tomato starter. It looked wonderful ... albeit very small ... but had zero taste. I said at S$24 it was a plate of profit marg

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: When you need a venue for a business discussion but want a great lunch to go with it - then this is a good choice. Attentive service and a wide menu selection. Possibly too many options but we chose simple and well cooked dishes with my sea bass fillet perfect for lunchtime. Crispy skin and sitting in a light broth. Not too large a portion so easily paired with a starter. My colleagues’ dishes were equally good. Try this place.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review:
Never have had a better Italian food. 
No matter the food or the service is impeccable 
I am allergic to seafood and the waiter kindly changed me with duck spaghetti.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Is three years now that we go to Garibaldi, the food is quite good, the combinations are authentic and raffinate, the service attent

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Even though its location is not exactly promissing - this place is really good. Very nice interior, interesting menus, very good wine list. They have a couple of tasting menues, plus a la carte option. Our dinner (with wine pairings - that were really nice) was a bit north of 200€ per perso

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Ambience is great, foods are fantastic and service is very professional. There is nothing to complain about. Always enjoy the cold pasta with caviar. My guests are happy with whole experiences. I truly recommended.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Just love their Italian cuisine prepared here. We reserved a private room for 4 , it was amazingly cosy for private gathering and business meeting too. The menu prepared for us come with 3-6 courses. Thought they would reject our proposed 3 course menu as one of our guest prefer lesser course but was accepted to change to 3 courses meal. Ordered oyster, cold angel hair with caviar. Truffle mushr

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: My girlfriend and I selected Garibaldi out of the Michelin crowd because of the craze for fine Italian cuisine. The set menu didn’t disappoint

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: This Italian restaurant has been operating in Singapore for many years. Without doubt, its food is good because it fusions with good Japanese ingredients, such as Hokkaido scallop, and sea urchin in the pasta. Especialy, I liked the Hamachi which is very fresh with crispy skin. Service standard is excellent. If you can accept the higher pricing than most of the other Italian restaurants in town, then it is highly recommeded.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: For us this is a must every time we are in Singapore. Staff is great, food wonderful and their wine recommendations interesting and sensibly priced if you prefer.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: We had a family birthday lunch. The setting is elegant and very calm. Service is unhurried but timely. The food is excellent. Three of us were vegetarian and they catered well for this. Nothing was too much trouble. The menu descriptions were quite standard and straightforward but the actual dishes were a delight. Beautifully cooked and seasoned. Delicious. Highly recommended.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: We opted for the weekly lunch set and a bottle of prosecco over lunch. Overall food and dining experience were good, the beef ragout was a little salty to my liking but its still ok. Our waiter, Siti, was great. She is attentive, friendly and quick to correct when an error was made on our order.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review:
We been there with 2 families , food and service always great. Amazing selection of wines too.
Coteletta is amazing must try it. 
Cheers 🤙🏿🤙🏿🤙🏿

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: What a delightful gastronomic experience. All 3 courses and the wine were sublime. It’s expensive but if you want to treat yourself you will not be disappointed. Oh and the service was 5 Star. Can’t wait to get back. 🥂☺️

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review:
Good food. The brunch was with free flow of food and beverage. Service was attentive.

We had a private room. So, it was not a problem even with two boisterous kids.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: This michelin star Italian restaurant have elegant ambiance,friendly staff with good service.We had two different set menus; 3 course signature menu was perfect; Cold angel hair with oyster and caviar and linguini with crab and tomato vodka sauce and tiramusu; very delicious. But in michelin menu only marinated cold scallop with sea urchin and caviar was good, wagyu and chocolate ganache was average.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Our first time to this restaurant and it didn't disappoint. We did not have a booking, just walked off the street. The process was a bit weird & I mean by saying that we were asked to take a seat at the bar upon entry to see if they had any tables available. In the meantime they gave us a drinks menu to look over. The waiter came back and said they could give us a table. Walking to the dining room and only 1 other table was occupied. Yes, they may have had other bookings, but as the night wore on, only 2 other tables were taken. I think all the drama was unnecessa

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review:
Good high-end Italian in Singapore.  Fantastic wine list, mainly with Italian wines - one of the longest I have seen outside Italy,  pricy! 

Had a 6 course set menu - overall solid quality, but lacked a true spark!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: We love going to Garibaldi when we want to be spoilt with amazing service and even better food! This is a restaurant that always keeps their standard high and never fails to amaze you - their food just tastes phenomenal and their service is impeccable! Thank you team Garibaldi for always making our night!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Really enjoyed our dinner at Garibaldi. Was our 2nd time at Garibaldi and celebrating my son's 18th birthday. Service was excellent from the time we stepped into the restaurant. The food was simply amazing - very well prepared and portions were just right. Despite being a 1 Michelin Star restaurant the prices were reasonably affordable. Special mention must go to Mr CK our server, who added that special touch to our dining experience. Will certainly return for our next celebratio

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Very good wine list, very expensive but normal for Singapore. First course gratin of white asparagus with porcini and black winter truffles: delicate, simple, very fresh ingredients. Pasta course: sea urchin, scallops on spaghetti little bit of garlic, red chilly flakes for heat, very good extra virgin olive oil, outstanding. Pork scallopini with white asparagus, black truffles and a brown sauce as a main. Again very good. Simple gelato finish: vanilla, hazelnut and raspberry. Homemade and good. The interior of the restaurant is austere and you need to go through a bar to get there. The service is very good, quick and a bit dista

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: My partner and I are regular visitors to Singapore, frequently staying at the JW Marriott. On a recent quick stopover we decided to stick close to the hotel and chose to dine at Garibaldi, a Michelin starred Northern Italian less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Garibaldi is a stunningly decorated bar and restaurant combination that clearly attracts the young and moneyed of Singapore, as well as westerners. Modern, sleek and beautiful--if only the food and service lived up to the promise of the decor! Michelin star notwithstanding, the food at this restaurant would be considered average at a good Italian restaurant in New York, our homebase. In New York, places like Felidia get Michelin stars. Garibaldi is no Felidia. Perhaps the Michelin reviewer was so wowed by the decor he/she forgot to pay attention to the food! In addition, service is cold, somewhat inattentive (when my partner asked that a beef tartare appetizer be served without the quail egg on top, it appeared egg looking cyclopically at her!) although generally effective once the waiter focused on us. The food was serviceable, but very pricey (of course this may be unfair as we are used to better food at these prices in New York). The overall feeling here was, perhaps, of a place that caters to wealthy regulars, but tends to neglect those unknown others who come through the door as not being their bread and butter. Unfortunate, because had the food and service measured up to the decor, this could have been a superb dining experience!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Giuseppe is a real gem. It has excellent food and a well decorated and interesting atmosphere. The ”osso bucco” they served me was pure perfection!!! I will return!!!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Went there for a set lunch but expecting much more for the quality and selection of the food given the price paid, and that it has one michelin star. Not sure if its just my luck that day. Service was alright though. And location is about 10mins from either bugis or cityhall mrt.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at Garibaldi’s. We would both like to say a whole hearted thank you to Raj and all of his staff for a dinner to rememb

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: While it is pricey (for sure), the money you spend here is worth it. We had our wedding anniversary celebration here. The food was really the best although we were vegetarian. The staff was very friendly and made us feel special. They were kind to take a few pictures of our special event.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Had the set lunch on a Saturday afternoon. Food was delicious, service was great and the ambiance was pleasant. Will definitely return again.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Top grade ingredients, rich flavours that do not overpower, good recommendation of wine to go with the  food.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Great food - outstanding starters- the oysters were yummm, tuna ok, food great and a good selection of wines. Good service - a bit steep

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Definitely up to all the hype. The food was amazing - my beef cheek Osso bucco with Milanese risotto was the best ever. Very good wine list and excellent service

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: We visited Garibaldi for a second time, and once again Garibaldi deliver

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Chose to go with the 4 course set menu with a main of duck and foie gras. Food was excellent and service was impeccable.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Spent the evening with friends here. The staff were attentive and friendly. The atmosphere is decent. Sadly, that's where the positive ends. The food was mediocre and overpriced. We had the sea food pasta along with the sea bass. The tiramisu was average. I'm ashamed to admit that the only thing i enjoyed were the breadsticks. My partner enjoyed the bread which at the prices they were charging should have been at least baked in house rather than mass produced ones that can be bought at shops. Will not be visiting again

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Spent a Friday evening at Garibaldi. Both ordered the signature menu which was very nice. Wagyu steak tartare with burrata proved to be a fine combination and the other dishes were enjoyable too. Wine by the glass lacks a bit of quality, the restaurant should offer better options at its price point. Bottle list looks good but not everyone can drink a full bottle in one evening. Service was also lacking on bill settlement: I paid with my creditcard and it took a long time to settle. This included leaving the invoice with my card in an open spot for some time. Not acceptable!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Garibaldi and Alma were the highlights of our gastronomical journey in Singapore and

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: I was there for lunch today. The lady who showed us to our table looked like she didn't want to be there. Our waiter, on the other hand, was great. He's friendly and helpfu

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: This place is absolutely amazi

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review:
Visited this fine restaurant with friends. We were craving white truffle and left Garibaldi fully satisfied.

Well appointed dining rooms, attentive service and quality food.

Definitely worth a visit when in Singapore.

Needless to say, I truly looking forward to visiting again!

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Lunch can be a tricky meal if one is not enjoying a work-free day: eat too much, and feel lethargic in the afternoon; eat too little and feel unsatisfied, hungry even. Garibaldi is well known for its fine Italian dining, and its luncheon offerings hit just the right spot. Two of us chose a four course set, and the third a selection of cold cuts followed by a dessert only. Every dish was delightful, from aforesaid cold cuts, the beef tartare (but for the life of me, I can't see how a sliver of gold flake improves what is already an excellent dish - why do restaurants feel the need to do this?) through the pasta with white truffle shavings (it being the season), the suckling pig, and the desserts. Portion sizes were perfect. Excellent service, and an elegant and quiet ambiance. All in all, an excellent lunch which certainly wasn't a candidate for "cheap eats" classification, but represented excellent value for money. Whether it's business, romance, fellowship or a simple need to partake of a mid-day meal, this has to be one of the best choices.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: We decided to come here to have my boyfriend’s birthday dinner. As soon as we arrive, everyone treated us amazingly. They knew just when we need refilling, they are very knowledgeable about the wine and menu. And the cocktail drinks are just superb. I didn’t even have to ask for a birthday cake because as soon as they found out it was a birthday dinner, they already had the slice of cake prepared. Worth your money! We are definitely fans of this place. Will keep coming back.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Second visit to this 1 Michelin Star Italian restaurant and this time tasted their Creative 6 course menu with specialty on Alba's White Truffle and A5 Wagyu beef. This is one of the best Italian meal so far and this restaurant really uphold their standards. Loves the atmosphere and it is really a pleasure to dine here. Highly recommended.

Name: Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar
Location: #01-02 36 Purvis Street, Singapore 188613 Singapore
Review: Garibaldi is a lovely place to visit with exceptional service. If you're noise sensitive, request a seat in the room furthest away from their bar section as that can be a little noisy when they forget to close the glass separator door. The food is instagram worthy, but standard flavor if you're used to good Italian food. By Singapore standards however it may be considered above average. I don't think I'd return, but to reiterate their service was really good. Plates were promptly changed between courses and tables were dressed correctly. It's not easy, but the waiter was also a perfect balance between always being available and not intrusive.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: The pate and escargots were really good but the steak was average. The rib eye was quite grainy and red wine sauce a little runnier than what I would have liked. Decent overall experience.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: The ambience was great, food was amazing! Service was on 100%, really enjoyed dinner here with my family 😍 Will definitely be back for more! Special thanks to Chris for taking care of our dining needs so meticulously ☺️

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Came here for Christmas Eve and the quail with foie gras was amazing.. and I could eat multiple rounds of escargot :D Service was fairly prompt, but the tables could be spaced out a bit more. Perhaps one area of improvement might be desserts: the crepe suzette was slightly disappointing. But overall, really glad to have found this place, will definitely be returning some time soon.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: I think our problem is we keep wishing for the L’Angelus that existed years ago. The L’Angelus we have today is run differently. We noticed this early last year during a dinner with family, yet decided to try it again this evening with our daughter and are sad to say we will not be returning. The staff was friendly and accommodating, but service was patchy at best. Upon arriving we were told the table we requested was reserved. In the course of our first hour there, three different parties sat at that table, but we decided it wasn’t really worth addressing given the experience we were having. Once the restaurant started to become busy, it was difficult to get waiters’ attention and basic things were overlooked. It took three tries to refill our young daughter’s soda. Since she didn’t feel like eating her dinner, she agreed to share our chateaubriand at which point we were given salad plates instead of dinner plates. Our ice-cream order that meant to accompany our crepes suzette was incorrect and took a few tries to fix, at which point the crepes were cold. Cutlery was incorrect - I was given a fish fork for dessert. So many things were off and the total bill was so high and not reflective of the meal we had. Family dinners with wine tend to be expensive in Singapore, which is fine, but not when you’re agitated the whole evening about trying to reach servers, receiving incorrect orders, and then trying to correct them. To their credit, the service staff was very kind and the restaurant ended up comping our dessert for the inconvenience, which we greatly appreciated. They are not arrogant and tried to be helpful, but it was really too late for us. We miss the old L’Angelus.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Chanced upon this place while looking for a lunch spot with my husband and we were pleasantly surpris

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Nice Ambience, good food, great  customer service and reasonable prices! Recommended!  Will definitely return.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Thumbs up to the food and wonderful service from Mili. Must try the lamb rack, escargots and creme brûlée. Thank you Mili for the attentive service and laughters shared. Special thanks to Larry for taking nice pictures for us. Everything and everyone in L’Angelus makes our 56th monthsary celebration complete. Thank you. Will visit soon.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We went on Saturday night after work. The customer service is horrible and their part timers cannot assist us with orders and we have to wait for another staff to take our order. It's so lousy that our cutleries setting wrong. When we raised our hands, the servers ignored us. While the food runner was busy running with the foods, we asked for her help in changing the cutleries setting, she seems to know what she is doing. Sadly, our main cutleries got mixed up and we asked the servers to change for us but the servers got the wrong cutleries again. We got pissed off and the food runner drop by to check on us, she apologised and quickly changed it for us. We waited for our main for so long too. All the food was okay not as what we read on the review. Slightly disappointed. You need to teach those servers before the dinner starts to avoid this kind of circumstances. Surprisingly, towards our dessert, we were approached by the food runner. She was checking on us again, talked and laughed with us. She mentioned there was a freelow on escargots and we can't wait to come here again not on busy night. If not for her service, probably we won't ever come back. She was approachable, friendly and knowledgeable. I think she is part timer.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: This place always makes me comfortable, not too formal but not also too causal. The staff are nice, they serve excellent French cuisine. L'Angelus is one of my favorite restaurants.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Wonderful French savoir faire and friendly service. Impeccable environment that matches old world charm of French films like moulin rouge with a hip bar counter stocked with French wines.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Went there with a couple of friends for a birthday dinner, blown away by the impeccable service from Mili! The food was top notched, between us we had the beef tartare, lamb racks, sea bass and filet mignon- all perfectly seasoned, delicious and fre

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Very cocky Frenchie atmosphere, courteous stuff and delicious food! Definitely to come back again...

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Good ambience. Location is a bit tough to find. Good is good for the lunch set. Service very warm n good as well

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: The steak was very soft, juicy and fatty. The lamb was crispy and cooked to pinkish perfection, and the shank pie also complemented the steak. The servers were attentive and helpful and the ambience of the place charming.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Service was probably the element that stood out throughout the dinner here. It was your usual outspoken and approachable waitsta

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review:
Had a beautiful meal here. Enjoyed the service and food very much.
A wide selection of wine available to pair with the food. Will definitely come again.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review:
Pretty good stuff! Friendly staff!
Oysters could have have been colder
Fois gras yummy. 
Escargot also yummy
Chateau Briand was tender and juicy. 

Recommend.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: First time dining at L’Angelus and it was for my husband’s birthday. Great ambience and friendly staffs! We had lamb rack and their specials black cod fish tasted superb. Funny enough, most of the tables occupied tonight were all celebrating birthdays and everyone joined in singing the birthday song, such an amazing crowd tonight. Dinner was enjoyable with staffs cracking jokes and making conversations with you. I definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a good french dinner. Do try their gevrey chambertly, it’s having a good promotion now and it is a very good wine.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: The restaurant is beautifully design and very cozy, great french old town vibes. The escargots are especially delicious! (Free flow on wed!) Waiters are very attentive and friendly.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Enjoyed our visit here. Bread was served warm and the free flow escargots on Wednesday’s was an awesome surprise! Steak was good as usual

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We had an enjoyable dinner at L’Angelus. The escargot which we had for a shared starter was really delicious, possibly the best ones we’ve had in Singapore. For mains, we had the lamb rack and the ribeye. Both was very well executed. We liked that the flavors were well balanced, with just enough salt to make the dishes tasty but without overwhelming the natural taste of the meat. Highly recommend the restaurant. Chris our server was excellent as well - warm and friendly and always ready with a recommendation. We will definitely return.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review:
Great staff, great location, great food !
You should try the pâté and the steak tartare !
Will come again :-))

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Celebrated my birthday here, throughly enjoyed the lamb rank and the beef tartare is a must try - different flavours in every bite!  Manager was so accommodating and friendly, come visit this hidden gem!

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: went last night, feel violated. This restaurant has no right to label itself as a fine dining French bistro, worse still to mislead diners with the "Michelin" stickers on its door which as i understand it is given to the chef who has left the restauran

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Great service and great food, some of their dishes were fantastic.Decent price.Atmosphere was alright too due to weekend dinner im assuming. I didn't get the staff name but he was great at what he does and knows his info as well. Accommodated with all our requests professionally and humble , special thanks for the birthday treat.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Very delicious set meal was served. The steak frites was very good and to die for. Certainly one of the best I have eaten. The meringue dessert was absolutely gorgeous and not too sweet.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We three friend had dinner in this place. We really enjoyed the food here. Ambiance was good and the service was very nice.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Fantastic place with very authentic French food ! Must try fillet mignon and steak tartare and finish with crepe suzette, excellent service too ,friendly hospitable .

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: My family and I had a fabulous time celebrating my mum’s 71st birthday at L’Angelus. The food was flavourful. We especially enjoyed the foie gras. The ambience was cosy and welcoming. The natural lighting from the sun through the skyroof made for a very atmospheric setting in the restaurant. What impressed us most was the impeccable service where the waiters served with warmth and cheer. My mother was pleasantly surprised when the service staff complimented her with a delicious chocolate lava cake with ice-cream and spontaneously sang a birthday sing wherein the whole restaurant sang in unison! That capped the wonderful visit for us at L’Angelus!

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review:
I went here with friends for dinner. Lovely place with good ambience. Amazing food! The dessert with rhubarb was just great! 

Some flowers would help to make it cosier

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Had a fabulous meal here with a group of friends. We had lots of sharing food so I got to try a wide range from the menu. All the food was great but the steak was so tender and the rhubarb creme brûlée was amazing. Large wine menu and the staff were friendly- good atmosphere. Will book again.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Went with a few friends for my first time at L’angelus. I wasn’t disappointed. The food was very impressive. Service was very attentive and the evening was fabulous. We had a wide variety from the menu which was all great. I’m definitely returning for the rissotto and steak in particular.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Amazing dinner at a very reasonable price. Highly recommende

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Classic french food done well. One of the better restaurants along Club Street and reasonably priced.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Nice ambient and environment, food is go

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Looking for a new French restaurant we decided to try L'Angelus for lunch. We like the funky Art Deco ambience. We had the excellent set menu; our favourites were Beetroot Goat chese salad, Seared Beef fillet and the Chocolate tart. The Sancerre and the Bourgogne house poor are excellent. We will be back!

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: A great restaurant to celebrate birthday! The restaurant has a great variety of wine selections. Even the house pour is very palatable. Food quality is as good as what you would expect from a French restaurant. The restaurant was very thoughtful too as they arranged a birthday fondue cake on the house!

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Beautiful Art Deco inspired interior (from ceiling to walls). Traditional French cuisine like fresh oysters, escargots, foie gras, onion soup, etc. Friendly & attentive service. Our evening did not start well because the lobster bisque and pan-fried foie gras were below our expectations, although the glass of Sancerre was lovely. We were happy with the mains - rack of lamb and pan-roasted John Dory fillets, especially the side dish of haricot beans. The best of our dishes was the cheese platter - delicious French cheeses. Total bill for 2 persons with a bottle of red wine was S$439

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Usually when I go to my French restaurant, it is my usual practice to order a salad, duck confit or steak and chocolate fondue. When we visited L’Angelus, it was no exception. The restaurant was fully booked for dinner. Their beef tartare and steak seemed popular among diner

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: First time for us here at L’Angelus, despite having lived in Sing for over four years. Found the food to be excellent and the service just as good - will definitely be going back as it was an instant fave. We were very happy that it felt less like a stuffy, formal restaurant and more like a bistro too.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: This was an impromptu dinner decision following a hankering for a cassoulet dinner, L'Angelus being near the office. Reservation made easily enough online. Kicked off proceedings with a "Grande Ferme" salad with roquefort cheese and bacon. The portion overall could have been more generous, as we struggled to find the bacon bits. The onion soup was tasty, and so was the highlight, the cassoulet of Toulouse. The meat portions were satisfactory but a personal preference would have been the version from Castelnaudary, without the tomato base, just pure stewed white beans. We ended with 2 desserts, a chocolate fondant paired with an extremely tangy raspberry sorbet for the missus, and the classic crème brulée in tandem with rhubarbe puree. Cannot fault either one, both were good and an excellent way to top off the dinner. This is not a bistro style eatery so expect to fork out a fair bit for a dinner for 2. A personal recommendation would be to share the cassoulet as it is extremely rich, unless you have been starving a day in advance!

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: I was used to regularly go to L’angélus and really appreciated the ambiance, service and obviously traditional French cuisine quali

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: My boyfriend and i went to celebrate our anniversary there, and maybe cause it was a Monday, the restaurant was not super crowded and the ambience was great. It was dim and quite cosy. We had escargots for appetizer and it was really good, possibly one of the best escargots we've eaten. I had the dinner set meal while my boyfriend had steak, and we enjoyed our dinner greatly! Would definitely visit again to try their ala carte items more.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Great ambience. Not too large dining room. Feels authent

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Did not quite live up to being the oldest single-location French Restaurant. The soup was bland, the mains were also not impressive- pieces of duck that looked more like zhi char. And pannacota served in a wine glass? Didn’t taste very authentic at all. Should have included French onion soup at the very least.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Ordered the steak with foie gras. Delicious. 10/10 would recommend. Fantastic service to boot. Will definitely return.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Came for dinner with wife and daughter. My wife and I had the set dinner, and the portions are very generous and the food the usual good quality. Service was attentive and water was constantly refilled. Food pacing was ok though could be slightly faster. Nice complimentary bread and butter. Always one of my favourite French bistro

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: The food are very delicious. We ordered French Onion soup, Escargot soaked in olive oil and tomato purée with a small toasted bread on top. The Ribeye is so delicious and filling. The atmosphere is the best for couple to celebrate. The service staff and very polite and professional.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: A lovely dinner in beautiful surroundings of a Parisienne Café. Felt as if we were dining in Paris not Singapor

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We used to go to this restaurant a lot when I lived in Singapore. 6 years later we decided on a revisit on a Friday evening. Club Street was heaving and very noisy. Inside the restaurant it is calm, low level music and a great French atmosphere. We ordered pate and goats cheese starters, followed by duck breasts and rump steak. We had a carafe of cotes du Rhône. The food arrived quickly and portions were fairly generous. Up to remembered standard! Yes it is quite expensive, but well worth it.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: A beautiful place, a converted shophouse with lots of French posters, photos and plants. Excellent service and food. I had the speciality of the house, snails, which were wonderfully garlicky, followed by magret de canard, perfect, then the highlight of the crepes Suzette, made perfectly at our table. A very memorable evening with great food, wine and ambience. Thank you !

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Set menu was good value. Champagne by the glass was tiny and somewhat flat. Jazz music was too loud in a small restaurant like that. Food was average compared to my previous visit

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Ok late review we stumbled on Club Street as it was near to our hotel..yes I know every visitor to Singapore knows about Club street..anyway we were struck by the intriguing nature of this place and had great French Brasserie style food with excellent service

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: This place is hands down, one of the best i have been to in Spore. Whether it comes to the delicious food, the pleasant staff, or the location it is set up in. I have had the best experience with french food here. A must try here would be the duck liver pate, absolutely fav!

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We spent 2 dinners at L'Angelus . We loved the atmosphere and the French feel of this restaurant. Lovely friendly service team makes your dinners very enjoyable. The crepe suzette and pistacco icecream and brandy cherry are must try!!

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: The Chef has magical fingers. The food and desert was simply amazing. Had a great dining expereince in a very nice , relaxed and welcoming setting.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We had the 3 course dinner set. The food was good though more rustic compared to other French restaurants on the usual SG list, and the seafood stew I had was not what I expected. Service was warm, friendly, impeccable. Ambience was nice and cozy, conducive to a long leisurely dinner. The staff made the birthday dinner memorable. I would dine here again.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: This restaurant has really a french menu. Mainly focus on meat. Long french wine list. Service is good as they properly take care just take time to serve is long. Food is ok a little bit priced,

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Location is great, food was good, plentiful and very satisfying.  Sat out the front and was approached by a few street vendors selling flowers, however this was fine.  Definatly worth stopping by for dinner.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We had a small diner with 8 people and it was fantastic. I will certainly be back for a few reasons. Firstly, the atmosphere and service was very good. It's low key and comfortable without being too over the top. Secondly, the menu. It has a wide representation of French food and traditional dish

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Had dinner with family. Excellent food and great ambience. Wonderful service without being intrusive. Highly recommended.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: we went for dinner as my daughter likes to have a french cuisine after her graduation. the food is excellent, the wine is good, the service is good, staff are attentive to your needs and willing to explain if need. my graduate has the nicest dessert ever, her creme brûlée

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: I have since rebooked for our next trip to Singapore- it really feels like an authentic regional restaurant in France- totally unexpected.   Excellent produce used in great dishes, with great service.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: This restaurant was recommended by a friend. The wine selection was phenomenal. The service was impeccable. The food Was delicious. Overall, when in Singapore, I would experience it again.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: I have been a couple of times to this restaurant and I was happy with their food every time. Food was tasty and quite generous portion, specially cheese. There was a good selection of wine and reasonable price. Staff were polite and attentive. It was quite relaxed ambience too, one of my favorite French restaurants in Singapore.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We go for special occasions, this was our silver wedding anniversary. We were offered complimentary champagne on arrival which was very thoughtful. We both had onion soup which was absolutely stunning. My wife had seabass and I had ribeye with gratin dauphinois and pepper sauce. We both had crepes suzette which were just gorgeous, every bite was so delicious. We finished with calcados and Amaretto.. A perfect evening with great service and warm ambiance. We'll be back many more times

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: If you are looking for good French food without burning a hole in the pocket, look no further. Located in the lively Club Street area, the restaurant is reminiscent of a typical quaint Paris restaurant. The quality of food was good as was the service.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: A French restaurant in Singapore with this quality is something I’ve never seen before! It was an authentic french kitchen, like in the old days, amazing. The service was also really great! Compliments to the whole team, I enjoyed my evening! Thanks!

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Shockingly slow service for the set menu. Inexplicable. The food was half decent provided you could wait an hour for it to arrive. Many better places....

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Came here for my wife's birthday dinner, though we didn't tell the restaurant since she likes it low-k

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Chose this place due to it's French atmosphere, which I find quite original. The rest was average, crowd started to build up after 8.30pm.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Not very often do you get Value & Authentic French food .. this place is a must try. From the wines to the food, & Desserts to the warm and happy hosts, it’s a place you will go back time and again!

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Walked in for a business lunch, we got a good sized table. It had the upscale ambience that was conducive to good conversation. Had the snapper which was terrific. my friend was vegetarian and got a special menu which was a good suprise at a proper French restaurant. White asparagus was a delig

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: What started off as a meeting place for a group of 4 couples, ended up being a fantastic evening in this charming restaurant. The entrance is quite charming but placid and doesn't quite prepare you for the interiors. As we entered, we were absolutely delighted with the warm interiors! The bar is quite close to the entrance which is presumably meant for patrons waiting to be seated, but we did see casual walk-ins as the evening progressed. We found their French wine collection to be very extensive! The posters on the walls also made the whole restaurant very warm and co

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Went for dinner to L”Angelus and came away in love with the ambiance, service, wine and lip smacking delicious food . When you enter through the doors you feel transported to a Parisian Cafe in Paris. The decor is very warm and inviting and David who runs the place immediately makes you feel at home. I had the pate as my starter, Dover sole as my main course and their warm chocolate lava cake ( the first one in Singapore apparently) all were beyond delicious. Even the butter they serve is awesome. I would def visit as there is a reason this restaurant which is the first French restaurant in Singapore is still in business and doing so well.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We had dinner here on 2 of our 4 nights in Singapore. Excellent menu with just enough variety to the fixed menu (5 options for each serving) at an excellent $68 eac

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: As we walked along Club street looking for a place to have dinner - we ended up at the porch at L'Angelus - eating a delicious french meal - instead of a nice Chinese dinner - as we had planned to do. They served us a delicious sole meuniere - (not even on the menu...) - - and the wine list was impressi

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: + SGD 39 for a three course set lunch incl coffe in the CBD is a good, competitive offe

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review:
An institution of Singapore
We went for the steak tartare and were not disappointed
The restaurant was quiet but is was  Tuesday night
Well worth a visit when in Singapore

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: First of all, the food was good but the service from the female petite manager was really below average. This is my first time having a meal in a local restaurant that i felt i was actually in a foreigner country. Is kind of disappointing that it happened in our own country and is not surprised that the manager is actually a Singapore citizen herself. She has an attitude problem and the best part is towards her own people.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Went back to this little French place in Chinatown . They have now a lunch set quite nice for the price .36$. Got a cold cut platter , a nice steak, a creme brûlée and coffee . What else can you expect ? Superb . Great service too .

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review:
Place to go if you are very hungry 
Go for the set menu at dinner time, terrine was perfect 
Good wine list and service
You can eat outside or inside

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: This restaurant is one with a long history on Club Street. Deservedly so. Good service. Flawless home made pate. An interesting amuse bouche, tasty! And well cooked steaks to order, both cuts explained by the waitress. Service was attentive as we'd come to expect from a previous visit or two. We started on the terrace this time to enjoy the sights of the street. Before mains we asked to move inside because a bar nearby decided to go heavy metal at 7.30pm. Despite the restaurant being near full, this was handled seamlessly. Glad we got to experience the ambience inside. Lovely. A well run, well respected restaurant.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: My daughter grew up in Switzerland near the French border and to her, there is nothing better than authentic French food. So to celebrate her graduation last night, out of all the restaurants in Singapore, L'Angelus was her choice. Never disappointing, simply great French food in a lovely fine dining atmosphere. And they now have a $68 three course menu that has a great selection. If we hadn't gone with our favorite menu items in mind we would have been tempted but we stayed with our favorites: duck liver pate, duck liver grilled and the Chicken Fricassee in a morel and truffle sauce (the recipe's on their website) which is to die for. For dessert, my daughter had her favorite hot chocolate cake with their luscious vanilla ice cream. One more thing, I'm on a low-carb diet (no sugar) and found the menu filled with possible options. But just to make sure, my waitress went to the kitchen and came back with a list of the best of all choices. An unbelievably gourmet meal which also didn't derail me off my diet? At L'Angelus, what's not to like?

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We had dinner with 5 people. The food was delicious. Could not fault anything. The foie gras was fantastic. Reasonable prices for the wines considering the import duties charged in Singapore. Only remark is that our waiter needs some more traini

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Stopped by late one evening without a reservation and, to our surprise, was given a table and served great food. We both had the set dinner in this classic French restaurant. The onion soup was just right - a bit of cheese and crouton in a very nice and very-full-of-onions broth. The tuna tataki with sesame was perfectly done and my wife's cassoulet was just delicious with enough to take some home with us. They offer a wide selection of wines and the wait staff understand how to recommend them. The creme brûlée was perfect as was the service through the meal. It's a bit pricy but that's common for Singapore. If you like classic French food we'd highly recommend L'ANGELUS.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: The food in L'Angelus is absolutely phenomenal. Great restaurant with really good flower decoration from outside vie

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review:
Very good food for value. Traditional French plates. 
The food menu is not taking you too long to read and choose so it is appreciable especially when what ever you take, you will be satisfy by the food.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Good french place on Club street, it is an institution, has been here for ages. I liked the meat selection. Great wine also, though they know how to charge.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: I was there with my wife to celebrate Valentine's Day. The place is wonderful, they pay attention to the detail from decoration in the restaurant and washroom, to the tableware on the table. The waiter and waitress are very friendly and served us very well. We ordered French onion soup, escargot, ribeye steak and Profiterolles glacées au chocola

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We went to l’Angelus to celebrate our son’s 20th birthd

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review:
Friday lunch and if this is always on the agenda.  
Good French menu and awesome wine list at reasonable prices. 
We both ordered steak frites with rib eye.  It was good not great for once something was missing.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Had dinner here with a mix of colleagues and friends while on business trip. Food was very good as well as the wine. Service was good and friendly. The dishes were very large and may be reduced in size. We were not able to have dessert because of the size of starter and main.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: L'Angelus rightly has a great reputation for its excellent French food and is located in the lively Club Street. But our evening was undermined by snail-paced service. We started with the incredible mushroom soup, the fois gras and terrine, all served in a reasonable time. Then we had to wait well over an hour for our main courses. When they arrived, they were excellent: duck, beef and lamb. We complained about the wait and management assured us that this was unusual and because they were short-staffed, and offered us a complimentary drink. One of our party said that they had experienced something similar before, so I would definitely recommend the food but only if you have superhuman patience.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Came to this fantastic restaurant for a friends birthday party, the food was sensational, the service and ambiance was excellent, everyone had a great time, highly recommend this restaurant when in Singapore.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: We have visited L'Angelus during Singapore residence and visits over several years and have always been pleased with the ambience and quality. Noted on this occasion, on a busy Friday night night in Club Street, that it was very quiet and was surprised how high the prices were for even the house wine - significantly above other local establishments. Quality was still good and we enjoyed our meal.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Ok place, seating outside, noisy with uk football from the bar next door, friendly service, food average really for such a long time established place. Much prefer Les Bouchons just next door. Same owner, just better.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: I discovered this French bistro invited for business lunch . I was pleasantly surprised . The food is not only excellent but also very well done . Guess the chef must be French or at least trained in France ! Some interesting touch of originality here and there ( a nice variation on " bavette" with a kind of coriander lemon condiment ) but great classics like cassoulet or roasted lamb with an exceptional ratatouille ( I love ratatouille, this one was great ). Dessert are well done and elegant on the plate . Another thing I liked was the wine list , good choice with some rare bottles, mainly Bordeaux old vintages , very decent in price . Speaking of price , they have a 68$ menu , the one I had , quite decent for Singapore if you check the quality . Bravo !

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Have been dining here regularly for over 5 years. Nice " French" décor and atmosphere. Food and menu has improved recently. The Veal chop is huge, and very tasty. Remains traditionally French, as is the wine list. The wine list is on the expensive side. Closer to fine dining prices in a bistro environment. The restaurant manager is friendly and attentive, particularly to " regular" clients.

Name: L'Angélus
Location: 85 Club Street, Singapore 069453 Singapore
Review: Went to this restaurant following advice from hotel concierge . He told me it was one of the oldest French in town, a bit on the expensive side . But I was pleasantly surprised as they have a fantastic menu for a reasonable price ( around 68 $ if I am not wrong). They are celebrating 18 years in Singapore . Well, I had a very good chicken liver terrine , as good as in some high end bistro in Paris and my friend tried the snails who were to die for ! My main was a very good lamb, juicy tender rack perfectly cooked with a very very good ratatouille . My friend had the duck, a farm one, very tasty. Excellent dessert ( I had their hot chocolate cake, it's a very good one !). They gave good wines too and I understood from the manager lady they import most of them so pricing is very decent for Singapore . We got a bottle of a wine from south of France , Les Brunes , a kind of boutique wine that was superb and only 98$. Good value for money all in one . Honestly, I felt like in Paris in a very good bistro . Service is ok. Great place, good value. I recommend .

Name: Shin Kushiya - VivoCity
Location: 1 Harbourfront Walk #02-120 VivoCity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review:
Enjoyed our weekday lunch here by ordering a Sashimi & Tempura set as well as an Unajyu set - it was marvellous! Also loved the mochi and ice cream desserts. 

Pro tip: Book and use Chope vouchers for some discounts!

Name: Shin Kushiya - VivoCity
Location: 1 Harbourfront Walk #02-120 VivoCity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: They served my kids hot (close to boiling) water in kids plastic cups with stra

Name: Shin Kushiya - VivoCity
Location: 1 Harbourfront Walk #02-120 VivoCity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Very attentive service staff; Good quality food at a good price. Spacious and good for a casual cosy dinner even lunch with good friends. This is already 4th time to the restaurant.

Name: Shin Kushiya - VivoCity
Location: 1 Harbourfront Walk #02-120 VivoCity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Visited on 9

Name: Shin Kushiya - VivoCity
Location: 1 Harbourfront Walk #02-120 VivoCity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: bad exprience,the worst  japanese  restaurant  i have visit.do not wish to comment more,just too bad to talk about it

Name: Shin Kushiya - VivoCity
Location: 1 Harbourfront Walk #02-120 VivoCity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
