Location: 87 Club Street, Singapore 069455 Singapore
Review: I went to Cugini last Friday night. As always it was very busy and bit noisy. The perfect atmosphere for good and happy Friday night outi

Name: Cugini's
Location: 87 Club Street, Singapore 069455 Singapore
Review: We had a pizza twice at Cugini's and second time we had a talk to owner, who is a nice person. Pizzas were fine, nothing to complain and service good. We did not touch wine (expensive here but anywhere in S'pore too) and we were ok with the me

Name: Cugini's
Location: 87 Club Street, Singapore 069455 Singapore
Review: Most of the food is relatively overpriced, compared with what you get. Don't get me started on how long you have to wait for the fo

Name: Cugini's
Location: 87 Club Street, Singapore 069455 Singapore
Review: A busy lively restaurant is always a good sign, or so we thought.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: had the soft shell crab chicken and cashews and massaman curry.  All cooked to perfection. was accompanied with mango blend drinks. everything was fresh and served by a very helpful waiter.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Great Food.................. very reasona

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I downloaded trip advisor and created an account just to rate this. The waitress had a bad tone. They only started cleaning the table when we want to be seated. The food took more than 20 minutes to be served. It tasted bland. Streetfood tasted better. The drink was warm beneath the ice. We paid for water. The bill became expensive with the additional service charge and tax. Third and last time eating in Bugis, the surrouding restaurants were much better.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: They have good vegetarian options . I went during lunch time and surprisingly it was quite empty ( outlet in Jcube) .The tofu was good and spice was just right. Overall good food .

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Visited the Clementi outlet at basement one during a weekday lunch. Set lunch with add on drink for around $10. Portion was good and fast service.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Visited last week with family on the Mother's Day at Vivo! Ordered Tom Yam soup with rice, Phad Thai & Drinks. All were good with fast service!

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review:
Located in raffles city shopping centre. Good spot for lunch service good and prices ok. Good selection of food.

Worth a visit.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Went to Thai Express for a late lunch and had the Tom Yum set. The sea food atom Yum was very good. Spicy, lemony, enough see food... the chicken rice was very disappointing, not really hot and very bland. You could tell all the ingredients were pre-cooked and chilled before they were quickly tossed in a wok... the Thai Tea Pudding was ok... All in all, for SGD8,90... good value for money...

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Good value for money, waittress are frindly, food arrived looking good and tasted as good as it looked

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I checked in early and thought of exploring the airport before going for immigration and that's how I located Thai Express. As has been mentioned by one of the reviewers, the interiors looked nice and I decided to see what they are offering. One of the waitress saw me looking at the menu so she came forward and helped me with my queries about the food type and spice leve

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: The clean interior of Thai Express caught my attention a couple of times so I had to go in and try a few things from the menu. The man at the reception was attentive to potential diners browsing the menu - a successful method of converting inquiries to diner

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Restaurant was not crowded but They did not serve my food and drink. I waited nearly half hour and i left left the restaurant  because  i did not want to starve to death.  I will avoid it forever like the plague.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Me and my husband went to eat at Thai Express only to be disappointed and left hungr

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I visited the Changi Airport (T3) outlet at night, after the dinner rush ho

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: The typical Singapore thunder rain forced me sheltered into the wonderful damn good smell Thai express . I browsed the Manu , suddenly I saw they have a dish I was looking for in that time . It's laksa !!! But a bit different than local laksa , they serve Thai style laksa . Never tried it before , full of curiosity and of course carving laksa and papaya salad . I gave it a try , papaya salad as good as I predicted , and laksa ? Turned out it was the most delicious laksa I ever had . The soup was salty , full of coconut milk flavor , spicy mixed with chilling , strong shrimp paste and Thai herbs taste combined with together . Fresh seafood made the soup an excellent balance . The rice noodle was light without calories burden , and my dreaming Al Dente . Since then , I ate it almost like everyday!

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We went to the Thai Express at North Point at Yishun at about 3 pm on a weekday so it was very quiet in the restaurant. The waitresses were pleasant and welcoming and that was nice as i always look for good service with smile. We ordered their promo sets which cost just S$8.90++ each and consist of a main course, a side dish and dessert. My husband had the set with a bowl of Thai Chicken Kway Teow soup which came with 2 pieces of Thai fish cake and a bowl of red ruby dessert. I had rice with fried chicken, sea food tom yam soup and the red ruby dessert too. The quantity was just right for one person if you are not too hungry. The taste was good. But the red ruby (my favourite Thai dessert) santan was way too sweet. We requested for a glass of plain water to dilute the sweetness and was told they don't serve water! Instead the waitress brought some ice. The service overall was good and for the price we paid i think it was good value for money.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: For the past months, our family travellers have been singing high praises about this outstanding TE outlet above the Departures Lounge of Terminal 3 Changi Int'l Airpo

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: The Tom yum seafood clear broth was good but the Tom yum fried rice did it live to the expectations. Service was super fast thought as the servers were very quick to respond. The drinks are a bit over priced. Overall ok lah for a quick meal.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Ordered a chicken soup noodle for my 3-year-old and had a chicken green curry myself. Chicken in both dishes was not fresh and tasted horrible. Both of us could only eat what is not chicken in the dishes. Gave a feedback upon payment but all I got was a nonchalant 'sure, I'll feedback to the kitchen.' Thank goodness we did not have a diarrhea at the end of the day! The quality of food and service has gone downhill these recent years. Will not visit any of their outlet any time soon, there are plenty of nice Thai food around.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Thai express  is one of my favourite  restaurant love the food especially the green beef curry ,coconut soup and chicken wings..best place to dine with family/friends

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: The food is very tasty and prices reasonable. They're always consistent in delivering high quality food and professional service.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: The food is very tasty...but that's about where the positive comments end. Menu is very overpriced and dishes are small postion....

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I believe that the Thai Express at Vivocity is scamming their custome

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Modern looking Thai Fusion restaurant with easy simple seatings good for any meal. Staffs are friendly and able to suggest on a fine meal. Menu offered variety of choices to ensure the fine taste of the food from the looks itself. All branches of Thai Express are quite reliable for the same taste.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We have tried out about five Thai Express outlets all over Singapore over the years. The best ones are none other than the grand, totally refurbished and upgraded one along the B1 Food Alley in Paragon, Orchard, and its "little sister" in the upper level above the Departure Lounge of Terminal 3, Changi Int'l Airpor

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Super fast service and delicious seafood red curry. Will be coming back! They even have mango sticky rice 👅 they do take aways also if you don't fancy eating in the food court.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Had dinner at Thai Express JCUBE with family a week ago. Food taste a bit too sweet to my liking and food portions were quite small - not suitable for sharing. Service was good even though the restaurant was quite crowded. Food taste and portions need improvement.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: This used to be our favorite, but we had our doubts after the last visit. We gave it one more go and will never go back. The meals were substandard and service was ordinary. They had no alcohol as they had let their license lapse but didn't tell us until after we had ordered. That was their last chance and we won't be going back.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Great thai food here. We have visited Thailand 6-7 times and the food here was just as good and tasted just like the food in Thaila

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I recently visited this restaurant in Temasek Boulevard area for lunch and from the time I entered the place I was getting a feeling that something was missing in there. I was looking for someone in the restaurant who can show me the place where I could sit, not that there was no place or it was busy, there was plenty of space and it was not busy at all, but just that its courteous to be that way for someone from the staff who could guide the customer to where they can sit. So after waiting for a few minutes I waived at someone in the restaurant who seemed to be the staff and requested for a place where I could sit. I browsed through the menu and ordered my food and the server placed the food on my table and just left without even asking if I needed anything else. I had to ask for the thai chili sauce and other condiments. Thai hospitality missing big time! Its a full service restaurant and I would definitely not expect it to be of that low service. This restaurant needs to change the name of the place, its not Thai at all, else please improve the service. You can rather go to Bangkok Jam which is not very far away from there for a nice lunch.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I'm the only diner here at the Clementi outlet on a Saturday night 8pm and there is a reason why. Service sucks for the price charged and they stopped serving plain water while serving up super spicy food hoping to increase beverage sales. But the beverages are exorbitantly priced at $4.90 for what I can get lower at other restaurants. Won't be back at ANY Thai Express outlets. Server who waited on me wore dirty uniform and threw the cutleries on the table like I was her kid.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: While I never was a fan of casual fast food style Thai food at restaurant prices, I recently ate at 2 Thai Express, the first at Jurong Point (somewhat acceptable), and second at Raffles City which is the one I am reviewing tod

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We ordered honey chicken and pad thai. The chicken was good but got disappointed with the pad thai. It wasn't the authentic Thai flavor that I was looking for.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We've visited many Thai Express restaurants over the years in Singapore and recently ate at the one in Bedok Mall. We had to wait for around +45minutes for our food to arrive and then some more. The order was mixed up, something was not there and the portion of the Pad Thai was the smallest I've ever seen at a Thai Express. The people were very friendly and helpful though and explained they only had one chef in the kitchen. Unbelievable they would continue to serve the whole place with only one chef. They apologized thoroughly but still one would expect something else than that. My lime juice was the worst I've ever had at a Thai Express on top of that. I hope this was a one-off and hope to return there in the future as I've always liked in in the past, just never there.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: The outlet here is very good. The service is decent and the food is very tasty. I can't comment on authenticity because I'm not an expert but as the restaurant was very busy, they can't be too much off the mark.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Holland Village location: Really bad service. Although the restaurant wasn't full, the waitress took for ever to come and give us the menu. The drinks came after we were done with dinner. We requested several times to bring us at least water. It seems that they didn't have the ice tea ready. The A/C was not working and everyone was sweating at the tables. Food was fast but honestly I was not impressed with i

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: My wife and I enjoy the food and Thai beer in this restaurant at the airport on the top floor before security. Some people don't seem to like the food or service here but we have never had a problem, I guess we all have different tastes in Thai food...

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Lunch with my spouse & the Heartland Mall venue was empty (giving me a sceptic suspicion of regrets later). Menu looks good with a good spread of dishes. Food came in quick, in just 10 mins. Thus far, we were hapoy until we bite into the dishes, they were bland & tasteless. The Seafood Tom Yum had a few shrimps but they were tasteless, high likelihood of frozen ones & not fresh at all. Hence, there's no flavor at all. So were the squids & fish fillet, seriously pathetic for the 'not-so-cheap' price charged to customers. Diners dont mind paying if the quality & quantity are justifiable. Even the spices were insufficient, could only see lemon grass, nothing more. There's no fragrance of a basic authentic Tom Yum, & no taste. It's like drinking clear sour water, that's about it. Management should seriously look into such matters as it completely destroys the image of Thai's good dishes especially Thai's iconic & signature dish Tom Yum. Frankly, the Tom Yum was hopeless & it's embarassing to serve such quality to customers. I reckon i could cook 10 times better than Thai Express. Next, was another iconic Thai dish ie the Pad Thai, was another disservice to its name. Most Pad Thai we had in Singapore Thai eateries, we could smell the fragrance from afar (like Penang Char Koay Teow) before reaching out table but not with this one. Again, the shrimps didnt look fresh at all & so were the peanuts. It's so ironic & unusual that we had Pad Thai but without the fragrance, how is that possible? We had the chendol with jackfruit & to out horror the jackfruit was soggy, easily broken & not fresh at all, 100% must be canned ones. Oh yes, tasteless!! We're shock how management could allow such a simple dessert could be prepared & served to customers in such manner? Perhaps, the management find this quality 'excellent' in their eyes & taste buds. This is seriously profiteering in the expense of innocent & genuine customers. We had the Roast Chicken as our starter but when it came, it didnt look similar to what's in the menu picture which has crispy skin. All in all, it was a horrible set-back & our confidence & trust on the branding instantly went into the drains. We used to patronise this branch 7 years ago & it was good, good in every way. Good in taste, good in service, good in ambience & price is reasonable to the food quality but today, it's disastrous & horrendous. No wonder, this outlet is always empty every time i bypassed when shopping in Heartland Mall. The last disgusting pointer was the Chinese speaking kitchen staff, a chubby guy, who kept repeatedly beating the counter so loudly that he was oblivious to disturbing the ambience of diners. When I told him to stop this disturbing rhythmic noise, he denied & acted as though what's wrong with his noise making. The only saving grace to our meal was the supervisor, a pleasant & efficient Malay guy. He deserved all praises. Would i return, a big fat NO WAY. Would i recommend to someone else, obviously a big NO. Food was lousy, tasteless & unfragrant. Ingredients were not fresh & inadequate. Price dont match the food quality. Unless management rise up to the occasion to change & improve, this outlet may wind up very soon.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I love Thai so I couldn't resist even if the name had express in it. I ordered a mango salad with freshly, crushed peanuts over mixed with red onion and a delicious, tangy sauce. I also ordered a Tom Yum soup with Oyster mushrooms and even though my eyes and nose were runny it was worth it!! Mmm nothing makes me more happy than a tasty meal when I was expecting just ok.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: ...place to eat when transitting. However in late January my wife visited. After waiting 45 minutes for her meal, she queried where it was. They had somehow forgotten, and the meal she ordered was no longer available. Service (other than of course forgetting her order) was lousy as well. We decided to give it another go as a family of five. It seemed that the computerised ordering system had died as our meals came in a haphazard fashion, had to be sent back due to incorrect orders, and finally we missed out on two meals. Staff were alternately in panic mode or "give up" mode and the food, when it arrived, was average to say the least. In the end they appeared to be turning people away as they couldn't sort out orders. Unfortunately that will be our last visit to Thai Express, we gave it a number of tries but it has singularly failed to impress.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: food was nice and quickly served however lacked same aspects of Thai st

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: You'll be surprised to find such a perfect thai dishes at premium locations and at very reasonable prices.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We ordered Thai fried Noodles (Char Kuay Teow) and it was disappointing in taste and the portion was also very small. We also ordered the Thai fried rice which turned out to be slightly better but still not recommended. For dessert, we ordered the Thai "chendol" which turned to be the worse chendol I had tasted, one third of the cup was filled with coconut cream and there was also not enough ice.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I liked their meals and cocktails. But the sitting could be more comfortable and staff more friendly.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: It seems like a chain fast food restaurant. We found it overpriced and overcrowded. Quick lunch would be o.k. there, if you are in the area.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: This is a review of Thai Express' outlet at Changi Airport T3 Viewing Mal

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Have been here several time. Off late have found the food a bit wanting and portions seem to be smaller. Also staff is challenged to cope with the crowds. Hope they can maintain the quality as it has been a lovely place for good thai food in the past for my family and me,

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I ate at the Esplanade branch. I waited at least 15-20 minutes before my order was taken. After I walked in the restaurant it really started to fill up fast. The staff were very overworked on a Fri night and when I left a large queue had formed outsi

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We ate here last Sunday after a shopping spree at Parkway Parade shopping cent

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: After trying a few places to eat we had a craving for thai food and went to this place upon recommendation. It definitely did not disappoint and the food was really good. Very reasonable prices and the service was prompt

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: The starter soup was nice and then disaster with the mains. Absolutely disgusting ho fun noodle dish , very salty and weird taste. Struggled to finish it. 2 soups, pad thai and ho fung dish plus service charge came to 50 SG. Do not serve tap water.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Really loved this place. Has good variety and taste not to be forgotten. I can keep having the same dish again and again. Specially the traditional Pad Thai. I would highly recommend this restaurant over any other Thai restaurants in Singapore.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: For such a great location, on the esplanade, with a view of the marina, the thai express restaurant is a total let down. Prices are high and service is lacking. We ordered two starters to test the waters before deciding on if to order main meals. These were incredibly greasy with not much flavour.... We did not order mains.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: This is at SIN airport, outside security, on the floor above the check-in lobby...It's not a fancy place but the food is excellent, when you order pay attention to the number of hot chills next to the food item, 2 or more is really hot. They have a full menu including beer..

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Tried this restaurant at Vivo city, it was good and waiting time is okay. It's pricy if compare to other restaurant. The taste is delicious.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: As the name implies, good food at good prices. Well that is by Singapore standards. Excellent service

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I already had bad experience with this restaurant once because they seem to be understaffed, but today's experience has made me finally decide not to come back here again. Tried to order Curry dish with Thai Pancakes but they didn't have pancakes. Finally, when the chicken in curry arrived, I asked for a knife to cut the chicken but they didn't have knives either. I ran across to Cold Storage and bought myself a decent knife so I could eat like a human being. Although the food was decent, I am not coming back here anymore.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I was at Thai Express at the new Zhongshan Mall (Balestier). Thai Express needs no introduction to its afforable, delectable Thai food. and the availability of its outlets islandwide. I have dined here a few times over the years, at various outlets, trying their Tom Yum, Glass Noodles and Curry Soft Shell Crab with Ric

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: My family and I went for a early Saturday evening meal. Food was bland, (relatively) expensive and not as described. Wished we had gone to the nearby food court (at 1/4 of the price).

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I was in BKK early this month, but since there was no queue, decided to eat at Thai Express in Raffles City. The food is comparable to that of Thailand. Not all the restaurants in Thailand served authentic thai food too. The mango salad was quite good (if they sliced it thinner, will be crunchier), the pad thai was not so oily, the massaman chicken curry was tasty and we had a few other dishes, which we enjoyed very much. My friends's kids and mine (they are in the range of 4 to 5) were enjoying the crispy noodles and fried chicken (both non spicy).

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Just avarage. Slightly overpriced - for what you get. Although Massaman chicken curry was very good, the Phat Thai with seafood was a disappointment. After the main, we didn't feel like staying there for a dessert.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: As someone who lives in Thailand, this is a poor imitation of Thai food. The fact that Laksa is on the menu is a bit of a giveaway. And the only Thai member of staff is a waitress - the chef is Malay! It's ok on that basis, but don't expect real Thai food!

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I had eaten at Thai Express down at the Marina and had quite an enjoyable lunch with colleague

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We ended up here after being mostly disappointed with the other offerings on the boulevard. My honey chicken was really poor and they'd over cooked the rice - in a Thai restaurant, how did they manage that

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We had lunch here in the Bugis junction restaurant, we had the red chicken curry,phat thai beef and phai thai seafood, all very good but go easy adding the chilli flakes they are very hot.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We ate at this so called restaurant on 1 of our nights in Singapore, terrible food, no presentation whatsoever and slow service without a smile. We felt rushed as constantly being stared at so we can quickly finish our meals. The food itself is not up to standard, greasy, small portions.I would not recommend this restaurant to anybody, a disappointing experience. Another note I know Singapore is not cheap but the prices here do not reflect the quality of food.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Good value for money, staff quick and efficient, food arrived looking good and tasted as good as it looked.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: The setting looks ok. They have wide array of thai dishes and I have to agree that the price is somewhat high. Service was ok as we have difficulty getting there attention. They need to hire more staffs as I could see their service level is not good. What really surprises me is the fly inside the restaurant. We're inside a restaurant and a fly is just bad. Food tasted ok. Will not eat there again and will not recommend this place unless they have more competent staffs.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Water is a basic necessity and it's unfair not to serve customer especially some dish are spicy.  This is my last time eating here...singapore has a wide selection of restaurants thanks god:)

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: After a day of seightseing, we wanted to have a quick lunch, we love Thai Food so we thougt it might be a good pla

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We have been to 2 thai express restaurants,both gave us good service,there was a g

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Thai express..a good place to enjoy the thai food.Being vegetarian i had only one option to have the pineapple rice & veg curry which was nicely cooked and it has a perfect taste. I would love to visit this place for the pineapple rice.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Ordered a Thai beef salad and was not cooked AT ALL. Completely red on the inside, chewy, could not eat the meal at all. Was given a replacement but same meat and awful food. A family member also ordered the honey chicken and very disappoint

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Went to the paragon outlet on 16 January around 2.45pm. After lunch around 3.30pm my water broke. I was in my 36+week of my pregnancy. had water dripping under my seat. My mum went to the staff asked for an assistance. She asked if they can help to call for help n look for a wheelchair. They said: sorry mam..this is a restaurant not a clinic..no wheelchair. Even the bloody manager didn't offer any help. They just told her where the taxi stand was!!! How stupid and ignorant can they be?? I will Never go there anymore!! Eventhough this happened at the Paragon branch...I will ask everyone I know not to go to any of the branches ever again.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: It's not something very special in terms of the taste and ambiance. Its considered cheap for the quality. Very very casual dining.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We stopped at the Thai Express outlet at l'Esplanade before going to a show at L'Esplanade theater. Service is fast and prices reasonable. You do not expect a memorable meal from this type of outlet but my soft shell crab was quite good and my wife's soup too. It was our second visit and it provides an OK meal . Nothing fantastic but the view of Marina Bay...

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Went with family, ordered lemongrass tea, pineapple rice and couple of soups. Surprised to see the quantity of the dish for the price we are paying. Taste-wise it was quite same to any other place. Nothing extra-ordinary. Same was for the soup. Big price tag, small bowl, ok taste. Wont be going for second time if had a chance.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Went to the Thai Express at Changi Airport and had an ice lemongrass tea, a seafood tom yum soup with rice plus a Mee Krob. Bill came up to SGD27++. The Tom Yum seafood soup though tasty was a misreable small bowl, the ice lemongrass tea tasted like plain water, the rice was hard and lumpy, but the worst dish was the Mee Krob : the supposedly crispy vermicelli was soft and gluey and the fried tofu hard and dry. Service was sloppy. Would not visit again and would not recommend. There are many more better eateries at the airport terminal.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: This was my first hand experince on thai cusine. Visited this place with a friend on a recent visit to singapore. My friend ordered some beef with noodle dish..forgot the name actually. I liked the dish any way. i am not sure whether the dish tasted the best or not; but I liked i

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I was a great Thai express fan when it started operations in Singapore for the quality of food and value for money it provided. I didnt go for many years as they stopped having anything vegetarian on their menu. We went to the Thai Express at Jcube on a Friday afternoon after many years only to be hugely disappointed. The food was horrible and you could taste the stale ingredients. The Thai spaghetti was only chilli with no other flavors of thai ingredients-basil , lemongrass, etc One of the items we wanted to order was not available. The restaurant was manned by senior age staff who were doing their best but definitely could do better with a younger hand. Needless to say, service was slow. At lunch time, in between work one expects faster service. The prices at Thai Express have increased considerably but we do not get value for money.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We went the one at the Holland village after work hours. It was very crowded but we only waited for one mins to get a table. Food was delicious and the prices were reasonable. All orders came around 10-15 mins. I recommend "Tom Yum soup" if you like chili. Seafood dishes like 'Phat Thai Talay' were also satisfying.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: You'd be very lucky to receive a complimentary platter when your birthday month arrives* plus, an additional $15 off (that's the standard $$ per dish + GST) the bill. If you love spicy food with a harmonious Asia taste, Thai Express serves you right.! The elements in many dishes explains it - cashew nuts, chicken, pineapple, prawns. I always ask for 'chilli padi'(birds eye chili) accompanied by some coriander leaves for a good kick.! If you want a good memorable adventure.. try the 'traditional Grannies' dish at one of your visits. My best spot will be at Tiong Bahru, Level 2 -

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Went to eat at Thai Express Tampines One with a friend on Saturday 26 Oct 2013, Ordered chicken ginger rice and also sweet and sour fish, but the chicken ginger rice was so bland and only able to taste the hot chilly. Drink are worst, Too much mint leave, VIRGIN MOJITO, and the Watermelon drink was horrible. Not sure if im going back to Tampines one to eat again however the one at Bugis, ILUMA is consistent and service are very good.. We are regular customer for Thai Express and was really upset over the outcome and taste of our food. Wish it could have been bett

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We went to the Thai Express in the Raffles City Mall one evening when we were tired and just wanted something quick and Asian. We got seated pretty and had the order taken pretty quickly but after that, even though it was quite quiet, it was hard to get anyone's attention to ask for a fork or order another drink. Can't say I would rush back.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We fancied a spot of Thai food and it had been some time since I had tried Thai Express. Service was slow and the staff did not really seem on the ball or particularly motivated towards customer service. We placed our food order and moved on to drinks. My dining companion ordered beer and I asked for iced water, only to be told that 'management policy was that iced water would no longer be served in the chain of restaurants, but we could purchase mineral water if we wished'. The last - and only other - time that this happened to us in Singapore we told the waiter that if they did not give us iced water we would would leave; they gave us the water. This time, we just walked out, asking our waiter to let 'management' know why we were leaving. What a short-sighted, offensive, downright greedy policy.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Thai express used to be the place to go to. But after this, very unpleasant encounter. Unless I am left with no choice. Very unlikely, that I will go back to the branch at Changi airpor

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Stopped here for a late dinner. Area and views of the city are great, however the service and food is nothing to write home about. One item came wrong and another was completely missed off. You can have better Thai food in the local hawker centres.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Came to Thai Express for a quick sit down meal. Came during lunch hours and the place was really busy, had about a 5-10 minute wait for a group of 4. Service was pretty average, lots of servers just running around, all seemed to be in a hurry. The menu is good, lots of choices and something for everyone. Had many dishes including the lettuce wraps and satay for starters, pad thai, soft shell crab and a few others, all tasted very good. All of our mains came at different times and it took a bit of time for more drinks to arrive. Overall the food was tasty but service could definitely improve quite a bit.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Had a good meal served promptly and hot. We would have gone back but time ran out. For a chain of stores the Novena branch is good. It was clean pleasant surroundings and friendly staff. Although novena is a bit out of the city it is a great place to shop

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: During our recent holiday to Singapore we were lucky to have a Thai Express right next to our hotel! We went to the restaurant at Ah Hood Road in Zhongshan Park. The food is good and priced reasonably. The service is nice if not that great. The best part was that they had some really good Thai Vegeterian options which was a blessing for us. We ate there almost every day the six days that we were in Singapore and I recommend that you must try their Spicy Vegeterian Spaghetti or Basil Tofu Rice!

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I hate places that charge for water, HATE especially when tap water in Singapore is drinking water. You need to get bottled water and they also increased the charges of all other drinks. Then to add insult to injury the service is just awful. Non trained, rude, blur, slow sta

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Good food, portion may be a bit small to good size.The prices are reasonable. The restaurants are spacious but service may lack/ wrong order,  depending on how full is the restaurant. I like the soft shell chilly crab or the spicy green curry.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review:
Thai express is Value for money with good authetic thai food taste ...I had phat thai seafood it was superb presentation and great taste, 

The service was also very friendly...

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Thai Express was a good example of Thai food. Beware if you don't like spicy - Some dishes were spicy according to me, not the menu! We enjoyed the soup, chicken and rice, and green tea. Food is served pretty quickly! This is not a romantic spot for couples, it's just good food!

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: I went there for lunch twice, not a bad restaurant to go if you are around the area. Food serving very small, if you are hungry than you have to order 2 plates. Service very slow, took 15 minutes for the staff to serve water.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: My friend and I ate at Thai Express twice when in Singapore recently. The food was delicious! The service was good. Good choice all round. Will definitely return on my next visit to Singapore.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: During my trip to Singapore. .. I visited quite a lot places but the veg food was not all that great... on my last day went to thai express with a friend... and I was delighted to have the veg green thai curry and rice... food was good... service quite decent and nice ambience. .. I would definitely visit again if I had a chance...

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: Meal sizes seem smaller. Staff not as friendly as previous visits. Meals don't look like they are in the menu. This has become too much of a chain fast food restaurant. Had to ask frequently for water and refills.

Name: Thai Express
Location: Temasek Boulevard, Singapore Singapore
Review: We have been to Thai express many a times from Tiong Bahru , raffles city, sun plaza and many more and was never disappointe

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Easy to reserve with instant confirmation, no surprises.  Restaurant foods were consistently good value on the set lunches.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Attentive and friendly service. Yakitori sticks are fresh and tasty. Meat balls are juicy, without being overly seasoned

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Tucked away on the 5th floor of Far East Plaza, this restaurant is an icon.  The yakitori is top-notch as usual.  Menu is extensive and great selection.  Be prepared for your clothes to smell smoky afterward.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Always a joy to eat here. Service and food quality through all my visits are consistently top and good.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Very good Yakitori restaurant. Skewers cooked on charcoal. Very good choice of meat and vegetables. As good as in Tokyo.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Hidden at level 5 of Far East Plaza is this cosy Japanese eatery Nanbantei with interesting skewer bento sets. The tiny entrance that directly faces the escalator belies a cosy interior with a more open outer section and a semi private inner section. It's always busy during lunch time so it's better to make reservations in advance.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: All time favorite place for yakitori restaurant. Great food at reasonable price. Service is always good.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
Very nice and good set lunch
Varieties of freshly grilled yakitori chicken pork veggie salmon quail eggs mushroom among others 
We will be back.  Thank you

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: This place is great! Inside the mall on the 5th floor and surrounded by other restaurants and amenities. My only negative feedback is how they advertise / show the combo dinners. They show them with soup, rice and other sides. When I got the bill there was a charge for each one. This felt a little deceptiv

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: It has been a while since we ate here and we were looking forward to the yakitori bento set. They have kept the prices low, but now dessert has to be paid fo

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Booked online directly with restaurant on the d

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: The yakitori is great! Service is a bit average and actually kinda dropped a bit in comparison to the earlier days. Whatever you do, DON’T ORDER foie gras... it’s awful 😭😭 But almost everything on the yakitori menu is great!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: we overan the timing due to meeting overrun and the staff were still very patient and of course the food was great too.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Small but welcoming surroundings with limited seats, better reservation before visit. The grilled meat and vegetables are very tasty.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: It was a lunch for a group of five. We wanted to try to set lunch but end up trying the bundle set for sharing. Didn’t regret it at all. It was still as good as the lunch set (not the first time we were there). Cozy place and nice ladies servicing us.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Dropped by for a sunday lunch, recommended by a friend. Pretty quiet, not crowded. Ordered a variety of skewers, mostly average in quality. Service also local and blah. They wanted us out at 230pm

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
We had a good time in Nanbantei. It's specialized in yakitori (grilled items) and they are very good in quality and taste.
Value for money as we pick on the set meal which we enjoyed a lot.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: My husband and I have been eating here for years and the food and the staff are always amazing.  The atmosphere is casual and comfortable and we always feel at home here.  The food is so delicious!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: This restaurant has been here for 20+ years, it has never disappointed me . it kept its standards even after so many years.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: The food is consistently nice, the staff is friendly, the ambience is like entering a small Japanese BBQ shop.m, for hang out after work, enjoy the company.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: The favourite bento menu from Nanbantei was revised so instead of just a single set, it has now become 2 sets. The positive side of the revision is that now we have an option of no quail eggs and instead a stick of Shiitake mushrooms (Set B). A good thing for the health conscious. The downside is there's a change of recipe of the chicken balls and pork with leek. The chicken balls now have more ginger in them and the pork with leek are now smothered with garlic. While my family and I prefer the old recipe for these yakitori sticks, they are still scrumptious nonetheless. With Nanbantei Far East Plaza branch, food is only one of the factors. The other two factors that keep bringing my family back are the friendly service and intimate environment that never disappoint us in making our meals there always enjoyable.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: The setting was Cosy and service good. Of course the food was good. The portion was sufficient and grilled to perfection. Price was justified.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Always a good meal when dining there. Waitress there are all nice and friendly too. Nice yakitori place that I will always reco my friends to!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: This is probably one of the more authentic yakitori Japanese restaurants in Singapore. The sitting area is rather small so best to make reservations. Great food and worth a try.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: I have been here many times and I have enjoyed the Yakitori here and it is still good but.... something has happened. Some skewers were burnt and we cancelled so

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: I love this location for their foie gras. I usually go for the yakitori and garlic rice. Service is poor and slow but the food quality brings me back.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: The food never disappoints. Quality is good and the taste is sublime.  Reservations through Chope was easy and no hassle. Have been using this method to get a place and everytime I am successful.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: My family had our annual Christmas lunch at Nanbantei as we love the Bento sets (Set A & B) tremendously. As expected of the restaurant, the food quality is consistently excellent all these years (I've been its customer since 1991), good value, amiable service, and lovely quaint ambience.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Went w family of 8 and managed ordered nost of the yakitoris as well as unagi, tempura and sashimi etc. Everything we ordered was fresh and flavourful excecuted. Was recommended Hiyaoroshi sake, a premium autumn harvest sake with mellow sweet taste so smooth to drink up. Will totally recommend this jap place though its slight on higher pruce about $400 for 8 of us.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: We have been eating here for around 8 years, around 7-9 times per year. However this visit has been not so good because the standard of the food has dropped. The grilled skewers meat are no longer juicy & tender - pretty dry & no longer tasty like before. I think it could be the grilling standards has affected the food quality too.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: A truly authentic Japanese yakitori restaurant where food are freshly prepared and cooked on the spot to the satisfaction of customers.  Nice ambient with a resemblance of having a meal in Japan 😋

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Do make reservations for lunch as the place quickly fills up. Great place for kushiyaki; unpretentious wholesome food.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: found this spot after searching yelp...not many reviews but worth the walk. i'm glad i didn't stop at another spot while walking to this

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Cozy ambience, tables are small and seating space is cramped. There was a point where there wasn't enough space to place the dishes we ordered on the table. Good selection of Japanese Sake. Only 2 choices of red wine and 2 choices of white wine. Food was good as always. I would recommend the Lamb chops... There were so juicy and tender with just the right amount of char.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
The yakitori is utterly delightful, juicy, crispy and seasoned to perfection. The accompanying Ochazuke was the perfect accompaniment to balance flavours.
The service was friendly and quick. 
Would definitely recommend. Reservation would be recommended as the restaurant is popular.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: As the restaurant is not too big, tables got filled up rather fast. Reservation is recommended. Food is good, my family enjoyed it ! Will be coming back to try the set lunch.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Nanbantei never fails to wow us. We always love the food there. recommends to make reservation as they are usually packed.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Nanbantei has got to be my favourite Yakitori place ever since i tried i

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Possibly the best Japanese I have ever eaten. Modern, newly fitted out restaurant. Located in a shopping centre. Fabulous and friendly staff. Very reasonable prices. Dinner for two incl. drinks cost circa SING 70. We ordered mixed tempura, grilled teryaki salmon, garlic fried rice for two, miso soup for two, grilled chicken wings and beer. Absolutely delicious. Absolutely highly recommended.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: I am surprised and delighted to see that this restaurant is still around. Came to this place more than twenty years ago. Food is still delicious and the taste is still consistently good. Drop by if you are in the area.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: We love this place so much, it transports me to the old alleys of Japan, the food is fantastic and the service is always perfect.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: i've been going to nanbantei for many years. i guess as a sign of the times and economy, items that used to be included as part of lunch the sets, now require separate top ups (e.g. desserts). however overall, still generally good value for money, and quality of food is still great.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: This place has been in operation for a Long time. The food are good and deliciou

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Clean, well organized, friendly atmosphere, a cozy Japanese place, the way they welcome you is very friendly, even when you go out all the staff they cheer, its new experience to me, the food was extraordinary, I ordered Tempura mixed seafo

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: We all had the Yakitori Course, which was delicious apart from the gingko nuts (something I associate with medicinal stews brewed up by my grandma, bless her). The dessert was sweet red beans, which you either love or hate. I was so full I couldn't move afterwards.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: We love the hot sake , the fried baby shrimp and the delicious yakitori. Ambience was good. Advanced booking is needed to avoid disappointment.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: During visits to Asia, USA and Europe I have been looking for a Yakitori restaurant that is as good as Nanbantei at Far East Pla

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: The ambience was amazing, small cosy and rustic, felt like I was really back in Japan. The grilled items were also delicious, (do try the dashimaki tamago too!) and tasted authentic - sauce and seasoning was just nice. Staff was also very attentive to our needs. Price point wise a little high but I do think it's worth it for the food, ambience and service.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Sumptuous food, though it's a bit pricier for lunch. There was a lunch crowd but with reservations, able to get a private dining area

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: This restaurant has been around for ages and always delivers in terms of delicious yakitori. Their variety of yakitori sticks is extraordinary and there's definitely something for everyone.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Environment, a plus similar to a Japanese yakitori outlet.  Couldn't asked for more. Attentive waitress and meet expectation overall.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Went with girlfriend for the first time in July 2017 and we love it so much that we went again this year feb. we enjoyed sitting at the counter. Cosy atmosphere and nice food!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Value for money set lunch. Good location at Orchard and a variety of selection on the set lunch menu.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Food was ok. I’m not a big fan of the service experience. We needed to ask multiple times for drinks to different staff before they eventually arrive. Also cooks and staff all speaks Chinese... not great as authentic Japanese experience..

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: The food is fantastic! The lunch menu has slight change so did the prices. No more free dessert. But the quality is still worth for the price.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Since the birth of our son, it has been a long time since the 2 of us found some time to have a meal together, and after a little bit of searching we found Nanbantei, i can't really recall everything except that the house pour sake was nice and chilled and all the food was excellent, damage was 240 inclusive of 2 bottles of sake. Well worth it!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: They revised the price a little and also changed the set too. Basically not much changes but now it doesn’t come with dessert - u have to top up for dessert! Used to be great value for lunch set but not anymore!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: As one of my favourite dining places in Singapore, the experience is good except for one thing. It has revised the menu, especially my favourite lunch bento s

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
Cozy place and great food and service 
There’s some changes to the weekday set lunch menu ... hence it’s slightly priced now ...

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Great experience and attentive service. Highly recommended. Food serving is fast and tasty too. Value for money.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Visited Nanbantei on a weekday night for dinner with a friend. Love the vibes, it wasnt too rowdy for decently audible conversations to take place. The portions were alright, loved some skewers but other like the chicken liver is really more of a personal preference thing. A little hard to get the attention of the staff, other than that, it is a pretty good restaurant, will likely return.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: It's our regular Japanese restaurant for office celebrations as they have value for money lunch sets.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Nanbantei has been in Far East Plaza for more than 30 years and is still packed with people very weekday lunch because there are great set lunch deals. This is a small restaurant famous for its yakito

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Lunch obento set is nice as usual. However, they have increased the price and replaced some of the items in the obento set. Hopefully they will bring back the quail eggs.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: A very authentic yakitori place hidden in Far East Plaza. The lunch bento set is the most worth it, at less than $20 for a meal that feels you up to the brim. It's always a treat to visit Nanbantei with my colleagues for lunch. Do make reservations if possible as the place is popular with officer workers during lunch time.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Requested for a table seat of 2 pax and they acceded to our request. Cosy and private section in the restaurant. Food was fantastic and value for $! Well recommended!!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: The food is quite salty. The restaurant atmostphere is nice. The service is good. Overall, nice food, nice place

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Yakitori sticks that are so authentic!  Always looking forward to nanbantei.  Our fave venue for hangout

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Had lunch here out of nostalgia because I remembered having eaten here some 20 years ago with an old friend. The ventilation is good because despite sitting at the counter in full view of the grill in action, did not smell like a walking BBQ pit after that. No wonder it is filled with executives taking advantage of the set lunch offers. The service staff are personable and efficient, making it a pleasant dining experience. Would come back in the evening to see if the food is any different, or better.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: nanbantei has great choices.  we always have an excellent meal there.  3 orders of seven spices chicken wings grilled to perfection, just nice tofu nabe, not to miss garlic pork,....  can't wait till our next visit.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Not as good as I remembered it before. Did not really like the attitude of the service staff. Food was alright, albeit a tad salty

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: This is a regular gathering restaurant with my friends as the quality has always remain consistently good.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
Wanted a good meal but disappointed with the food when it come, the difference is too big especially for the rice roll, tempura, salmon fish and dessert (I don have the picture for this). 

And for this price it is totally not worth it.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: It was my first try at Nanbantei. The foods are authentic and sooo yummy that I can't get enough of them. Ordered the signature bento that served with their special miso paste dip, awesome!!!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Staff was confused with my booking and took awhile to figure it out. Food was good. Expect the grill smell to stain your clothing haha

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: The place is very small. However, the food is good and price is very reasonable . If you are looking for nice yakitori, visit this restaurant , you won't be disappointed.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: My family had our lunch at one of our favourite restaurants and it never disappoints us. It's always the consistently good food, service and ambience.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
Enjoyed the food very much. been there many time and it never disappoint me and my friends! 
We love all the yakitori sticks.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
Food was so good! We had the skewers set lunch.. value for money! Will definitely be back again! 

A little smokey in the dining area.. but I would say this is unavoidable since its an open grilling area.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Feels a bit like Japan. Excellent food, not only the yakitori. Very friendly service, all the time in a good mood. Also some good Sake at fair prices. My favorite restaurant in Singapore.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Been my favourite Japanese restaurant ! Been patronising them for the last 10years! Food never fail and their lunch bento set is really value for money!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: It was quite noisy at the back but the food was good. Portions for the side dishes were quite good this time around.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: We had one Unadon & Tempura Set, and a Kitsune Udon Set. The unagi was grilled to perfection, while the fried chicken with the udon set was juicy and tender, yet not oily. Simply delicious and value for money. The service staff was very helpful too.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Very friendly staff, checked our reservation and guided us to our seats upon entering the restaurant. Food is fantastic and I will definitely come back again!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: I have been going to this restaurant for the past 25 years. It has never disappointed me once. The quality and standard of food is always superb. The staff who have been working there for a long time - are friendly as ever!!!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Food was generally good but no outstanding dish. Maybe we didn't order the right on

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: It's a place with delicious food prepared in front of you and if you will be willing to pay, this place will be just for you.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
Good service and excellent quality of food.
Some of the food which we used to order 2 years back are not in the menu and we hope the restaurant can bring back.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Small Jap restaurant hidden in far east plaza. staff are very friendly and service was goo

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
I've ordered the 12 sticks yakitori course meal. It is affordable & good. The chirashi don is awesome too! 

And, my clothes didn't have a strong odor of the place, at the end of the day

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Their BBQ skewers are worth eating . But chawamushi and sashimi are not worth the price. Given the price, I can get a better quality.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Never fail to disappoint the family with the lunch or dinner here. Lunch sets is however more economical.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Always love going to Nanbantei at Far East Plaza as the waitresses are friendly n attentive and the food is great.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: very good food.  set in the top floor of a  shopping plaza. service was rude and slow.  wait staff clearly dont want to be there.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Great food with great service. Check out the lunch bento which is value for money! Will come back for more!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Food was amazing, compared to previous reviews we dressed up expecting the best! Location not exactly inviting and the service...don't get me started!! Rude arrogant and unintentionally loud by several employees. No clear away or offer of dessert or hot towels on exit or ask for bill. This place offers so much with its amazing food, new staff and location and you'd be a 5 star!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review:
I loves their freshness of their fish dishes. 
The yakitori are tasty and addictive.

Worth visit and you can consider to go during lunch time. Their set lunch are priced reasonably.

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: This is such a cozy find! Definitely recommended for the lunch sets. Sit at the chef's table to have an upfront view of the chefs preparing the food!

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: I have been a patron of this resturant for many years. They are always full. This is my first time booking it on Chope because I was meeting friends who have never been and wanted to introduce them to my favourite yakitori resturant. The online booking was very easy and no hassl

Name: Nanbantei
Location: 14 Scotts Road # 05 Far East Plaza 132, Singapore 228213 Singapore
Review: Excellent food always. The lunch sets are of great value. It mixes a variety of yakitori so u do not need to order many ala carte.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We had lunch here and the food was very tasty, the service prompt and friendly, the prices the best we’ve seen in our brief time in Singapore

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Being based in a nearby hotel recently as part of a staycation gave me an opportunity to have a dinner gathering with some friends at Redpan. I was early but was able to be seated by the friendly staff, the bistro-styled restaurant having a casual and spacious decor. The food was an mix of both Western and Asian dishes with one cuisine influencing the other to create interesting local interpretations. After appetisers of enoki mushrooms wrapped with belly pork as well as crispy otah dumplings, we tried the duck confit, soft shell chilli crab pasta, and bak chor foie gras pasta for mains, all of which we found quite tasty.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Oh, my Ota

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The food was tasty n nicely plated. Ambience was nice n quiet.  The staff were very friendly n helpful When we placed our order , taking photos n assisting with the chope voucher purchase

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The food is tasty and the price is not too high.  Service is good as well. Nice place and worth to go back again.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Service staff was fantastic! They were friendly & attentive. Food was good too and affordably priced.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Many years since I last ate at Redpan, but I was able to visit again in March 2020 a few weeks before the lockdown started in Singapore. Tasty main courses and efficient service. Definitely worth a visit.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Had a gathering with my friends at Redpan. We enjoyed the Fusion food and had a variety from the menu. Will visit again!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Bright and lively atmosphere - not surprising since the restaurant is part of famous DP Architects group. The fusion food is innovative and good - local dishes (eg. Hainanese chicken rice, bak chor mee) served with a twist. Service could be a bit more proactive.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Nicely decorated restaurant with a bar in the quieter home furnishing area of the mall, their bigger tables are good for gatherings and the fusion food they served is better than expected.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review:
Stopped at this bistro style restaurant for lunch. Limited menu but the food was served promptly with excellent service. Satay Chicken Kebab starter was really good as was the seared salmon main. 
The main clientele appeared to be functional lunch for business people.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Very interesting variety of food served. Good quality, nice taste. Ambience good for meeting up  with friends to chat

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Had aglio olio with truffle floss fries and fried chicken wings. The aglio was vegetarian but had no lack of flavour and was a visual treat as well. The place had nice trendy decor and good service.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Well, just find the menu interesting. Who knows I took about 15min to settle with what I want, as most of them seem interesting and I wish I can try all. Finally settle with prawn with Hae Bi hiam pasta. Love the truffle floss fries. Portion is good, just nice. Get further discount from chop

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Good service and provided a complimentary cake for my wife’s birthday. Very good service staff......

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: An average experience made poor by horrible music making the ambience terrible. I couldn't wait to get out of there.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Western food cooked in Asian spices and style. Restaurant is open and has nice ambience and you can chill over drinks with friends.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: I visit this place often, as the menu is frequently updated. Fusion Western/Asian dishes actually work. Everything I’ve sampled to date is delicious and reasonably priced.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Interesting menu with fusion dishes at a reasonable price point. I had the steak with chinchalok and floss mayo fries, both of which I would recommend to try.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Went to RedPan for business lunch. Price is reasonable, service is ok. Food is a bit of hit and miss. The truffle fries is awesome, the steak is fantastic. The other menu that we ordered were not as great. Worth visiting if you're in the area.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Our gathering with Long time friends was lovely, glad I made the right choice- restaurant was cosy and nice ambiance. Staff were friendly and provided excellent service with their little touches, providing extra plates and cutlery without asking. We had the steak with chincalok, quinoa salad with chicken rice, haebihiam and prawns pasta and fries with floss.. really very good. The desserts was awesome too. Thanks for the lovely evening. Will bring my family the next time

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Definitely one of my all time fav restaurant in spore for date, friends and family gathering. Love the food as it’s with local food elements, value is great and anbience is welcoming with friendly staff who make every visit ends with belly satisfaction with a smile. Will definitely visit again! :)

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Very good value with 1 for 1 offer. Creative and good food. We ordered beef and salmon. Both were good.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: My husband and I used Chope vouchers and they were very welcomi

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: When my boyfriend and I went down to Redpan on a Sunday, the place was really quiet and my initial thought was that the food here would be average since there was only a handful of customers. However, I was wrong. When our food came - we ordered the Steak with Chinchalok, Truffle floss fries and the Haebihiam pasta - we were pleasantly surprised. Everything tasted really good! The steak was tender, the truffle fries were hot and crispy with that wonderful truffle aroma and the Haebihiam pasta was an interesting dish with its fusion of local and western flavours. The service was really good too as the staff were very responsive and attended to our every need. I would definitely come back here again to try more of the items on the menu!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Very yummy. Good ambience, menu was western with a twist of our fav Asian delights and dishes. Will definitely comeback! Fav dish is laksa salmon and otak burger.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Redpan sits in one secluded corner of the popular Marina Square shopping mall, and that might explain why the restaurant was not as busy as expected given its many merits as follow

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: My friends and I had dinner at reDPan last night. It was our first time there and my first impression...whoa I loved the interior design of this place. Well it's owned by Architects so job well done guy

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: the food, venue, atmosphere were great. overall, a very gd experience and the staff were friendly as well. will surely patronize again.

Name: redpan
