Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We ordered 4 of their signature dishes. Only the char Siew nachos is good. Hei bi hiam pasta was ok. Bak chor foie gras pasta was disappointing - foie gras undercooked, pork slices did not smell or taste fresh. The worst dish was the pork ribs risotto in Bak Kut Teh spices - there was very little meat on each pork rib, meat texture was tough and again not fresh, with an overpowering pepper taste. Pls do not order this dish. You are better off with eating Bak Kut Teh. With the prices, I expect better quality food.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Given the price and the quality of the food, i would not recommend the restaurant to anyone. I ordered the Mexican chicken which came with rice. I found the rice a bit too hard/undercooked. My friends and I ordered quesadilla to share, there were only four small pieces. Kinda expensive.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: V nice local fusion dishes, the poached chicken is nice! Highly recommend, staff are friendly! :)))))

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: I had the dry mee siam with prawns and mussels and was a little disappointed as the dish is really too salty. The lychee earl grey is nice though.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Appetizer : Pork pops with sambal mayoOpinion : The pork was fried till crispy with nice balance of fats and lean meat, for people who do not like to have fat meat, this could contain too much fat for them. The sambal mayo has a bit of kick to it without overpowering the mayo. Mains: Salmon in laksa gravy, Prawn & hei bi hiam PastaOpinion: 2 very innovative dishes. Salmon & pasta may require a bit more sauce. The mains are a tad expensive.Dessert: Chocolate Mousse cake & Durian Baked Alaska Opinion: The cake was pleasantly moist and creamy. The base is crunchy and taste a bit like dark chocolate. The Durian baked alaska tasted a bit too sweet for my taste.Ambience: Tucked away in a quiet portion of the mall, it makes a nice place for couples, friends to talk and relax. Service: Staff are super friendly and they did not get impatient with us (We were there for 2 hours)

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Take a train to Esplanade MRT station and walk to Marina Square. On level 2 you will be able to locate Redpan restaurant an upmarket restaurant in the heart of the ci

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Fusion food at a reasonable price. We tried the bak chor foie gras pasta, salted egg pasta with fish, seared salmon with laksa sauce and pork floss truffles fries. All of them are so good. The truffle fries is unique and is a must to have!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Great deal wtih CHOPE! The staffs were friendly and the food are awresome, we Will definitely come back again!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We reserved a table for 5, but ended up with 8 people attending the birthday celebration!The waiters and waitresses were very accommodating and friendly.What I really like about the place is the ambience and i'll probably come back just for their truffle floss fries and happy hour (2 for $20) The rest of the fushion dishes were a hit-and-miss for me.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Decided to visit this place after hearing from a friend's sharing. Tucked in a quiet corner of L2 of Marina Square. We went on a Sat evening at around 7pm - did not make any reservations so we had to take the high tables with bar chairs seating. The other tables were either occupied or had reservations. We thought its ok still as there was only 3 of us (2 other kids were away or travelli

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: I've eaten here a few times and have yet to try out all the dishes! But so far, I have been most impressed by their Steak Cinchalok and their bak chor mee version. Their drinks are also excellent and go well with the food.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: reDPan serves a myriad of local fusion food with a good creative mix of both local and western dishes. Highly recommended for both locals and tourists alike! Do check out their unique dishes such as the Char Siew Nachos, Seared Salmon with Laksa Sauce, and their 'Bak Chor' Foie Gras Pasta! Generous dish portions as well.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: A family friendly bistro with good fusion food. The Hae Bi Hiam pasta and the truffle fries are a must try. There are new items on the menu that are coming soon that I would definitely want to try. Worth a visit if you are in the vicinity.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: I was attracted to pay a visit because of their innovative dishes incorporated local delicacies and western cuisine. It wasn't really packed with people which allow us to have a shorter waiting time for food to be served. I would like to pay a visit again.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: I love hae bi hiam. I also love pasta. But wow who would have thought of fusing hae bi hiam and pasta in the same dish? This genius of a dish literally incinerated everything in my intestines. Definitely a match made in heaven. The prawns are super bomb. I am so obsessed I still can't stop thinking about my Redpan hae bi hiam pasta long after i left the restaurant :/ My friends rave about the truffle floss fries. It's great too, but I have found a new love in hae bi hiam pas

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Service was good and food was exquiste. i enjoyed the hae bee hiam pasta as well as the truffle floss fries.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Serves interesting modern fusion food with Singaporean infused flavours. Eat here if you want to try something special

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The menu was very intersting with Singapore fusion western food. Taste was great. Staff were friendly and attentive. Good place for group meal !

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Always amazed by their innovation. Appreciate the periodic additions to their Mod-Sin menu. Keeps me coming back all the time 😋

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We ordered truffle fries to share, and a main course each. We could hardly finish the food. However, we kept on going because the food was delicious.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We had a warm cozy afternoon at RedPan. The food was good, with fusion of western and local cuisine. The service was excellent, and the staff were very attentive. Good place to gather too as it is very cosy and not too noisy for us to talk.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Made reservation for table at 6pm but arrived half an hour earlier. Since the restaurant was not packed, I was led to my table and was proactively served water by a member of the staff. He also kindly offered me a spare seat to deposit my big bagpack on so that I could sit comfortably.Place was fairly spacious and tables were sufficiently distributed throughout the space so that the diners were not cramped to close to each other.Food was good - my dining companion and I had the chinchalok steak and laksa salmon. Steak was perfectly medium rare done; ensuring that the tenderness and juices were retained. Was not sure what to expect for the laksa salmon since both had their individual distinct flavor. Was pleasantly surprised that the flavors came together quite well, loved the doneness of the salmon; just nice, not overly dry.Would recommend the place for satisfying food and dining experience. :)

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The food was good, but didn't blow me away. Had the carbonara, which was decent. The service wasn't amazing - we had to flag down the waiter, which may just be customary here.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: It is a great place to have coffee and chit chat with friends. It was not too crowded and the ambience is modern and spacious. The aircon is cool and the setting is pleasant. The staffs are warm and friendl

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Great ambience, but really terrible service from the waitre

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Appreciated the service but they forgot when I said no ice for my drink (lemongrass gula melaka). When I told them, I think all they did was take out the ice, so the drink was still cold (condensation on the outside of the glass). My friend found the drink a bit too sweet t

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: G

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Modern restro conveniently located at the Esplanade mrt station with interesting fusion of Western & Singapore cuisine. Decor is bright and minimalist, with friendly service sta

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: I was recommended by my colleagues to dine at Redpan for their signature steak with chinchalok. However, as I do not take beef, I find their non-beef dishes extremely tasty. My favourite dish has to be the Hae Bee Hiam Pasta! Flavourful, spicy & creamy. Have being frequenting Redpan ever since I started to crave for the pasta.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: I recommend the steak with chinchalok! Get it in medium rare! It is my go-to choice of mains everytime I visit Redpan. Been there a few times and their food remains very consiste

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The steak and chinchalok was flavourful and rich, perfect with the truffles fries. Novelty of the food lies in its local ingredients and familiar flavours, infused with culinary creativity. Service was excellent, with great promotion deals. Would definitely come back again.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: heard abt this restaurant from friends and decided to give it a try one weekday evening. tried the steak and chinchalok.....totally love it. In terms of quantity: the portion is more than what is normally served in other places at the same pri

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: I Had a Chinchalok Steak and it came with truffle floss fries as a set meal. It was done in perfect Medium Rare and the Fries came with some floss which was delicious. We even ordered a Duck Confit Tacos which is a must Try !!! The staff was very friendly and attended to us very promptly.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Redpan never fails to amaze me with their delicious food. They whipped up local delights infused with western flavours!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Your staff has terrible attitude. Pls look out for this pinoy male staff with a little facial hair beneath the l

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Being listed as one of the most visited fusion food joints in the Marina Square area I decided to give it a try. Went there on a Sunday afternoon thinking there won't be any rush. To my surprise, it was bustling with locals and expats and I just managed to get myself a tab

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Nice restaurant. Spacious and price reasonable. Food is delicious and children like it too. We ordered carbonara pasta, fries and lychee earl grey tea. Good!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We ordered the TrufflePork Floss Fries, Char Siew Nachos, Sausages, Hae Bee Hian Pasta and the Chincalok Steak. Enjoyed every single dish, especially the fries! A good combination of Singaporean favours with international dishes. Fusion done well!!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We had the starter chilli crab nachos, mains were otah fish burger and bak chor foie gras pasta and desserts teh halia creme brulee. Food still maintained the standard with nice environment and staff.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review:
The mains and starters were all good! An interesting fusion of local with western dishes... 

Desserts were not to our liking. I would come back for the food but I'll definitely skip the dessert. 

Service staff was warm and friendly.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The ambience was good. Ordered Hae Bi Hiam pasta and Bak Chor Fore Gras pasta. Both was flavourful but a tad salty.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Decent Western Chinese Fusion food!! Love the Hae Bi Hiam pasta & Har Cheong Chicken Cutlet~ But not comfortable with the open seating concept~

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Good fusion food and the quantity is pretty large for starters (Nachos). Nice dining atmosphere with above average service..

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Redpan food is a good attempt at mod-sin food, but I feel it would fare better if there was a more homely taste and aroma to the food. The truffle fries, served hot, was good, but unfortunately overpowered in taste and smell by the floss. The foie gras pasta tasted above average for sure, but was lacking in aroma. There wasn't much flavour in the mushrooms. Had the otah burger, which was surprisingly watery. Water oozed out of the patty when my knife cut into it. Maybe the cooking process involved steaming, which caused the unexpected juice ooze. The bun didn't do much for me either cos it wasn't crispy or buttery. Had durian alaska to end off the meal. The outer shell was wispy but sweet. The durian lacked the smell and creaminess of good durian ice cream,and the crust was a little tasteless. The lychee tea was good, though. Service was prompt, which is always pleasant.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Went there with to try the Chope executive lunch set. Food was all good! Service was fantastic! Would definitely be back again!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The truffle porkfloss fries set the tone right for the starters, followed by the fun mix of duck confit with housin sauce tacos and bak chor mee pasta. The durian meringue was decadent but it was the devil in the details such as a sprinkling of kaffir lime that knocked it out of the park. The marriage of flavours in every dish worked out perfectly, what a bold yet successful menu!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Food is great with a twist of the local flavor but the service level needs improvement. It was not busy when we visited on a Sunday afternoon but we were given a table by the entrance (reservation was made) and it was difficult getting the staff's attention.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: 2nd time visit there and am wowed by their food. Staff are friendly and attentive give and great ambience. Love the fusion mix on your menu

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We had a delightful lunch which was a fusion of East and West cuisine.  The ambience was great and so was the service.  Great value for money.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Considerable fusion of Singaporean and Western (Italian) flavour in the food. Interesting taste. Like the spicy fried chicken wings, and the truffle tossed fries. My wife thinks that it was rojak sauce that made the chicken tasty. The son (who is quite particular about food) seemed to enjoy his truffle duck confit tac

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The design of the restaurant is very nice. Good place to chat with friends as the place is not noisy.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Beautiful decor, extremely hospitable service and high quality delicious food ... thats reDPan

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: 1st visit to this restaurant, was a weekday and is pretty quiet. Nice and quiet ambiences for a gathering or meet up. Will visit there again when there is a chance.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Saw this dish o never tried before, was an interesting combo with cheesy nacho and chili crab. Great creativity there. The mushroom carbonara is good, not too rich. Both a bit on the pricey side

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: I have been to Redpan on more than one occasion. I really like the place the food and the way it’s presented . The fries are definitely worth mentioning. I am a vegetarian so have limited choice but I have been friends who loved the steak and other dishes they have . I loved the desserts too on the Menu

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Tried the Truffle Duck Confit and Seared Salmon in Laksa Gravy. The portion size for the first was slightly disappointing. The second fared better; fish was cooked well and I particularly liked the potatoes. Menu had a number of pretty unique items which we didn't get to try. Restaurant was pretty crowded on a Tuesday dinner. Overall a good experience.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Food was pretty good and the price was quite reasonable, together with the set meal. Service staff was also friendly and prompt. Only disadvantage might be that the location is quite out of the way, hard to find but also making it not too crowded. They were also having all day 1-1 happy hour drinks!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We especially love that their menu has dishes with a fusion of western and local flavours. Will recommend friends to visit this place.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The restaurant is situated in an excellent location within Marina Square. It is away from the crowd in the mall, making it a more conducive setup for dining and a nice conversation. We had the Roasted Vegetable Aglio Olio, Cold Pasta with House-Cured Salmon and Lychee Earl Grey Tea. Redpan puts a spin on its dishes with a Singaporean flavor. The food served is nicely plated, and taste delicious. Reservation is a breeze through Cho

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The service is good. The place very well decorated, and the food is not too bad. I like the fries and the chicken wings. There is a 1 to 1 beer promotion now. Can enjoy beer with their finger food.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Good food, ambience, price, dinner was reserved and was kind to receive a call from the restaurant, managed to seal a 1-1 deal

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Hae bi hiam pasta was rich and flavorful, back chor mee with foie gra wasn’t as flavorful and authentic but the choice of shabu shabu pork belly and foie gra added fine touches to this glam up version

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Great food served with good service. Recommended for all to visit. Otah burger is highly recommend. Great!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The reDPan restaurant at Marina Square is usually crowded on weekends especially at dinner time. The restaurant serves a great variety of Western and Eastern food and excellent coffee and desser

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: My friend and I decided to try out Redpan because the restaurant was having a 1-for-1 promotion and the reviews on Instagram looked promising. I love how this eatery offers Singaporean fusion food at affordable prices - we had the bak chor tagliatelle and hae bee hiam tagliatelle, and finished off the meal with banana donuts drizzled in milo powder (TO-DIE-FOR). I would highly recommend this place to those looking for unique fusion food without breaking the bank!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: The hae bee hiam pasta was great, offering a unique take on hae bee hiam. Also, the staff were friendly and attentive as well.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: We love the fusion of the food! I had fish otah burger and it was so awesome! The ondeh ondeh cake gave our old school pastry a revival.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: ReDPan is a beautifully designed space. It is well laid out and tables are not packed cheek by jowl with others, as is customary in most Singapore restaurants/cafes. The service was top-class - one of the partner (staff affectiionateky call him "Boss" was there and he was super friendly. The crew members were very warm, knowledgeable, efficient, and service-oriented. And the food, by the creators of GRUB, was delicious. We had the truffle floss fries, mushroom bacon carbonara pasta, vegetable lasagne, prawn and "hae bi hiam' pasta (my fabourite), har cheong chicken cutlet (could do with more "har" or prawn taste), and crispy fish otah burger, and they were all excellent. A gem of a place - will be back!

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: Stumbled across this really nice restaurant after visiting the Singapore Flyer. Located inside the Marina Square shopping complex. Food was excellent, staff and owner really nice and great with advice on what to order. 1 for 1 offer on beer all day as well as a bonus.

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: It’s was a nice and good experience dining in the restaurant with friends gathering together and eating good food. The service was good too :)

Name: redpan
Location: 6 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square #02-03/04, Singapore 039594 Singapore
Review: This place serves Creative fusion food at a quiet part of Marina Square. My family liked the hae bee hiam pasta!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The restaurant offers very limited items on the menu. It’s a far cry from the same restaurant in Bangko

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Nice food. Dull interior. Dull staff. Surprised they don’t make more effort given the amount of competition nearby.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: We ordered veg pad thai and chicken dish with rice. It was fine. Woudnt go again but fine as just passing through. I understand why people thought the service was poor. They didnt really want to be there. for westerners, eating thai food is partly about the service. We expect a smile at least!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Ask the waitress to clear the table for our dessert and that’s what she left us. Food was just okay.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Just had the wonderful pomello salad - absolute winner 👍 Pretty busy restaurant that has good food and a nice casual atmosphere.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
Service was average, many things on the menu were not available (at 7pm on a Friday??) and then the food that was served was far from good. 
Possibly the worst example of Thai food that we have ever tasted.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Not bad food. Inexpensive, convenient and quick. Good service.   Beware of the spice as it is real!  My husband likes spicy food but almost could not eat the Tom Tum soup even though it was delicious.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Went to CNY day 4 and half of their menu was not available. Whatever we tried ordering, we were told by the server very irritatedly that it is not available. Then she grabbed the menu and gave a loud sigh and proceeded to jab at the items which are not availabl

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: You can get far better service and food anywhere in Singapore. We went to the Ion Orchard branch of Nara Thai and had to wait 50 mins for food. 2 of my colleagues orders the set meal and were served the wrong set first after a 30 min wai

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Context, we only had a small portion of the menu. The Green Curry, a Thai staple was average at best. Lacked flavour and that classic Green Curry zing. We also had BBQ Chicken with tamarind sauce. Again, lacked that punch you expect from Thai cooking. To their credit, service was good and food came quickly.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The food was great, really loved how it tasted rather similar to the Thai food I’ve had in Thailand :) will recommend!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Despite the bad reviews, this place is packed solid. And they tell you in advance the food is going to take 20-25 minutes

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Awful restaurant. Poor service -the place was empty apart from one other table and we waited 30 minutes for a pad Thai that one could do much better at home. They then forgot to bring our other order even 20 minutes after being reminded. Shame for Singapore this restaurant doesn’t meet the high standards generally achieved elsewhere in the country. Ended up leaving without eating because my food never came. A small discount was offered and accepted but the damage was done. Owners should do themselves and potential diners a favour and close the place.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The food was average compared to other authentic thai restaurants that I have been too. Prices are really steep for the quality of food and service is very mediocre.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Went to this restaurant for dinner. To be fair, the staff was quite accomodating coz my father in law is in wheelchair, so they tried to make space for the wheelchair to come in. After 35mins waiting, then we have our table. The staff who received our order was nice. He took our order with few explanation about their dishes. All went well until we ordered dessert which was manggo sticky rice and tapioca with coconut milk. When the manggo came, we split into small plate and at last we saw worm which look health.. sooo gross, we quickly called the staff and they took the plate and change with new batch. They apologized. The bill came they don't even give compensation. The staff said because they've changed the manggo with new one. What a joke!! I told him that obviously they must change with new one!!! Or they expect us to finish the 'worm dessert'??? This kind of nonsense just not worth to entertain. Definitely won't come again. Too bad I didn't take picture of the worm.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: I do not know is the food served here authentic Thai food, however, I have visited the same restaurant (not sure if they are same company group or not though) in Bangkok couple of months back and the food taste pretty much the same. Dishes we liked include the Tom yum soup, prawns were pretty fresh. The shrimp cake were also nice! Service staff were friendly and nice, though only 2 of us, but knowing we ordered a few dishes and 1 table will not be able to place all the food, they took initiative to join the next table together. Will visit again!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: We love Thai food so we tried this place in Orchard. Service is good but quality of food is average, not considering a 2nd visit.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: First time visit. Many places to choose from but this one was the closest to the Marriott on Orcha

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
All time favourites are crab fried rice and barbecue pork. 

Love the dish, service and restaurant ambience.

Price more to on higher side but acceptable.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: I love the shared dessert for Nara Thai and it has always been the Thai restaurant to go too. Since it is one of my favourites, time and time again I made excuses for it but I have to admit. The food standard has dropped badly. Other than the computer glitches for their member discount card, the food was bad. For the first time, I tried their set lunch and all the noodles were undercooked, bunched up together. So embarrassing to have brought friends with me to try their "wonderful food". Calling for attention after the peak hour was also a problem, you literally had to raise your voice which would get the attention of the other customer but not the server. It is a restaurant you should give a miss maybe until they finally decide improve...

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Nara has most of his retaurants in Bangkok, but also here in Singapore. This one was not good at all. I just ordered a Khaw Pad Gai and it came nearly cold on the table. So, I refused and sent it back. The second wasn't even better and comparingf to Thailand even tasteless.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The food is very good and the service reasonable. The starter choice is excellent and the green curry very enjoyable. We had a selection of starters and all were excellent. The BBQ Pork especially. After we shared prawn green curry and BBQ beef and pork. All were very good. Worth a visit if you are in or around the mall.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: After a dip in quality of food and service, Nara seems to have rebounced, although it is much less full than when it first opened. It distinguishes itself for having unusual dishes rarely found elsewhere. Pricey for its shopping mall location next to a Korean army stew eatery!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: I have always been visiting this restaurant everytime I visit Singapore. The restaurant is not a big one but yet very cosy and hospitable. The staff very courteous and the service very prompt. The menu is not very elaborate however they mostly have the Thai specialities like Pad Thai, Tom Yum etc. However this time was told they stopped preparing Tom Kha soup which was one of my favourites. Starters are good and portions are generous. A must visit for all.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Good food and ambience. Convenient location. Fast service and seating. Will come back again as I like some of the dishes I have tried.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Food and atmosphere was good and price is reasonable. Recommend for family and friends gathering. Will be back.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Went to Nara in Singapore a few times and in Thailand. Standards pretty much consistent.first time visit for my friend. Curry crab is a must , followed by Tom Yum Soup. Friend asked for river prawn to be de shelled, but was not able to accede to her request. Otah in coconut was interesting with a good amount of seafood in it. however we felt thirsty after the meal. Could be due to the MSG used, Nevertheless, it was a tasty dinner!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Decent food. Good variety. Service was attentive and people seem to be enjoying both the food and their conversation.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Located in a corner of Ion, is Nara Thai, it looks lovely from outside very pretty and modern looking place. The menu has a lot of classic thai dishes. Expect quality and smaller portions best for shari

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
Good food and ambience.
Great variety of food at a convenient location.
Good value and tasteful interior n decor 
Can host a small get together of 6-8 people 
Crowded and popular everyday

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Never experience a restaurant where the service is the worst of the worst I ever encountere

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Food is good. Service also good.  However, On average we spend $40 per pax.. would prefer to go for a buffet dinner for the amount of food we have.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Golden mile standard isn't quite the old ways and ain't as cheap either. For better service and quality, Nara is the place to go to.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Having been to Nara before, I thought it's worth a second visit. Therefore I proudly introduced my friend who just returned from overseas to this restaurant. The Pomelo Salad is still great but the Tom Yung Kung (Tiger prawns in spicy lemon grass and lime soup) is not spicy enough this time! Definitely not up to par with those I have tried elsewhere. The Kao Phad Sapparod (Pineapple Fried Rice) is not fragrant and the Tord Mun Kung (Deep Fried Shrimp Cakes) which I think is one of their speciality is nothing to shout about. As my friend was unwilling to pay 50c for a glass of water, we ordered a glass of hot lemongrass to share. For $6.50 a glass, the lemongrass fragrance is definitely lacking and I felt that they shouldn't stinge on the amount of lemongrass they used! Sure they have an extensive menu and I haven't tried all their stuff, so I can't say this restaurant is not worth visiting again! Service is not too bad as usual. Ambience is rather good and it's wheelchair friendly .

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
Good atmosphere inside the restaurant. However the food was not value for money. Just one small rice portion red curry i bought was 30 sin dollars. 

Have much btr places to have dinner in singa.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
Tom Yum Soup was spicy and good. Love the pork skewers too!
We ordered a variety of dishes good for sharing,  and introduced the famous "blue rice" to our visitors.  They enjoyed the dinner very much.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Ordered the salted egg papaya salad, turned out very very salty and I couldn't even finish half of it. When my main was dished up, I was shocked as it turned out that my crab appeared to be drowning in the pool of yellow curry. It was completely different from the picture on the menu. I even double checked with the waiter prior to ordering and was assured that it's only a spoonful of curry as sauce. The chef overdid it and was again too salty. Can't finish. My mango sticky rice did not work for me, despited waited for 20 mins! The dessert was weird as the mango was too sourish and not the typical sweet aromatic mango you normal take in Thai restaurant! Another dish that was left unfinished! I've been to Nara in Bangkok and was very impressed. Can't say the same for this particular branch! Customer service was also bad here. Will not recommend and will not be back. I should have taken heed of the reviews on facebook!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: @TheKuoKn

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Thai cuisine is one of my favorite foods and I have tried most of the Thai restaurant in Singapore. This is one of the best Thai restaurants in Singapore. The food is super yummy, staffs are friendly and attentive and atmosphere of the restaurant is very good. We went there for family dinner with my wife, my mom-in-law, and brother-in-law. We ordered Papaya salad with shrimp, Clear seafood tom yum soup, mixed vegetables, shrimp cakes, tom yum fried rice and fried soft shell crab with garlic. Fried soft shell crab with garlic is super delicious and it is one of the must-try dishes. All the foods were served within a reasonable time. The price is at a bit high sided and the portion of foods is not very much. However, the quality of food is superb and they are absolutely delicious. I would definitely go there again and whoever love Thai food should try there.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: My first time here and experience was great. Comparable with food quality in Thailand. Would visit again

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: This was our last meal in Singapore before hopping back on the plane to Austral

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: We tried a few dishes, the green curry chicken, phad thai, morning glory and crabmeat omelette were absolutely delicious. I would definitely go back there again!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Today we went for late lunch at Nara Thai . The food here are delicious but the service  need to improve because late lunch no much customer yet serving are too slow.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Me and my friend went there while shopping in Ion Orchard. It was late lunch so the restaurant was not so packed. We ordered 2 set meals and 1 dessert & soup set. My set meals came after a few minutes. But my friend has to wait for 30 minutes to get hers. After we finished, I noticed that I receive only juice from dessert & soup set and no soup at all. So, I told the waiter to remove soup price from my bill before issuing bill. Then he said he would get the soup right now. What's the point taking soup after whole lunch was completed. They need their service level upgraded.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: We rarely visit ION Orchard as it is such a busy place but we made special effort to dine at Nara Thai restaurant as I and my colleagues have catered from them a number of times. We did not feel much of an ambience when we arrived and were shown to the table. The service was not very welcoming and when my husband and I sat side by side rather than across each other, no effort was made to shift the placemat, cutlery and the menu to where I was seated. No drinks were offered and I had to ask for water twice. We were disappointed to learn that the chicken served were all from frozen meat and only dark meat; none of the chicken dishes offered breast meat like what we so enjoyed in Thailand. One of the wait staff was particularly sour-faced. I asked very politely for some nam pla (I have used the Thai word for fish sauce from my Thai recipe books since the 80s) and when she did not understand I said fish sauce and she replied curtly 'I do not speak Thai'. I felt the remark was most unnecessary as I only used one word. A better response from a service staff interested in being friendly to a customer would be, 'Oh I am not familiar with that word but I learnt something today'. The Thai fish cakes we ordered were delicious as we remembered from our catering. The Massaman Beef Curry was very tasty, the meat nice and tender although a bit oily. The crab omelette was alright but did not have crab flakes on the top as showing in the menu. We also each ordered a set dish that came with rice, chopped chicken with basil, a fried egg and a few cucumber slices. The waiter said he could change the white rice to the (bluish) butterly pea rice (which I always order when catering) and we appreciated that he was thoughtful and flexible only to find out later that we were charged additional $2 each for the change. We told him he should have mentioned and checked if we wanted to pay extra as we would have not since white rice costs $1.90 and butterfly pea rice $2.50. We should have only been charged at most the difference of 60 cents!! It is not the amount so much as the principle behind it. We also noted that one of the other waiters was extra pleasant to a European customer and addressed him as 'Sir' which was different from the service we received. Overall, as much as we would like to have the Massaman curry again and try some of the other interesting dishes, I doubt if we would return at least not for a while. The meal cost $102 for the two of us with only tap water to drink (charged $1 each) so a bit pricey for us. I guess for a quick set lunch where you have no time to pay attention much to service but just have time to eat and rush, the set lunches seem a good option.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: We had a bad experience and would not coming back. Food was mediocre but the experience was just bad. Everything takes a while here. The waitresses are poorly trained as they aren't polite if not rude. In addition to the regular dishes, we ordered kids meal and it comes with an ice cream for dessert. But although we have reminded the waitresses twice to bring the ice cream, it took almost 10 minutes till they brought it out (I mean how long does it really take to scoop an ice cream and sprinkle a few chocolate on top of it?). We dined around 2pm and the restaurant wasn't packed at all. And when we asked the waitresses about our food, their faces didn't seem very nice. I wasn't alone to notice the waitresses' response but so did my wife. No wonder they're no longer rated as one of the best.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Not having tasted Thai food for quite a while, I thought I will bring my mum to try out this restaurant with me. I like my usual Thai Olive Rice and the Chicken Wings stuffed with Minced Pork but to my disappointment, both of these items are unavailable in Nara. We requested for the Prawn Tom Yum Kung to be changed to Seafood Tom Yum Kung as we preferred to hv a mixture of seafood. The soup is good although not better than others served elsewhere but what is really yummy is the Yum Som O (pomela salad). I would have loved to have double portions of this as it's so appetising and much better than a lot of Thai Mango Salad. The next item is one that I have never tasted in a Thai restaurant before-it's the Kao Phad An Chan (butterfly pea fried rice $2.50). I don't know if this is an authentic Thai dish but I would definitely come back for this dish alone. We also ordered the Hors d'oeuvre Nara-Assorted Nara's Hors d'oeuvre at $17.90 featuring BBQ pork w Tamarind dip, Thai fish cakes, Pandan chicken and a small pomelo salad. This dish gives one the chance to try an assortment of Thai dishes but I find them all unremarkable. Will still give it a chance by coming back for a repeat of the butterfly pea fried rice and the pomelo salad and perhaps try other items on the menu.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Authentic enough Thai food with wide variety.. food is slightly pricier but worth it if you want a relaxed environment that isn't noisy. Suitable with space to put baby pram. One of a disappointing food was the soft shell crab in curry - too salty. Other foods we tried that were good - pandan chicken, fish with chilli lime sauce.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: if I ever try to go back there again. They managed our expectations that the food will take at least 15-20 mins to arrive. The chicken curry arrived cold. The crab omelette...well it was more a plain omelette. The sambal Kang Kong was good. But the price we paid for the entire meal was not worth it

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Good dining experience for the first time at Nara Thai and great service. Ordered most of their signature dishes.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The food was mediocre. The service was not very nice as it was around 2 PM and all employees themselves were eating. The ambience is also nothing to talk about since it is in a mall. In Bangkok, they can make every dish vegetarian but not here in Singapore.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: One of the best Thai food in town. Love the Pamelo salad. The fried and steam fish are good value for money, great for sharing. Leave room for dessert - they have some unique creations here that cannot be found at other Thai restaurants. Note that they don't serve water. It's 50 cents per person for tap water. When the restaurant is busy, it is hard to get the wait staff's attention so be patient.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Went here for dinner with colleagues. We ordered a number of dishes to share and it was amazing. Lovely food, great Thai tastes... Loved it!!!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Basic dishes disappointing. Not the authentic Thai tastes. Fried food hd bad old oil taste. Red curry is more like a coconut gravy.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Decent thai food with relatively nice ambience. But price was a little high, not exactly most value for money..

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
The Thai food here is quite authentic.  Tried a few dishes and like their fried noodles

Prices are also affordable.

Service is ok.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Lunch sets were yummy and large in portion, also reasonably priced. Food was fresh and their Thai fish cake was especially yummy!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Ala carte prices are a bit steep but the lunch sets are worth it. Service ok. Convenient location in Ion.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: I just realized that they charged me for tab water (the total bill for two was close to SG$100). I am totally surprised and disappointed. Nara use to be one of my favorite Thai restaurants -especially the BKK branch-. Now that they have changed their original menu, having not so good service and charging for the tab water....I will not eat there again. With this attitude -seems quite empty inside- they will not survive much longer in Singapore.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Wow!!! Such amazing food treated with care and cooked with amazing spices and flavours. The soft shell crab in curry sauce is a must, it was so crispy and flavourful. The chicken and pork dishes were also yummy alongside some powerful dipping sauces and seasonings. My brother had to continue eating after we were all full because we didn't want to leave anything behind, it was just too good to throw away! The price is great since the food was so amazing and authentic.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The food was really good and the ambiance was amazing too. The price is slightly on the higher side as its not a fast food joint obviously. If you need to take someone out of a celebration or a proposal this would be quite ideal. Dont miss their sticky mango rice. Its generally sold out as its totally awesome.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: It all started with a warm welcome, and we were impressed all the way, from the service, food to the ambience. Wow, it was beyond words. We ditched the standard Tom Yum seafood fare and ordered the Tom Yum Pork ribs and boy, it won us over instantly. We had a hearty meal, fantabulous dinner and bound to be back for more! Overall, it is all hits and no misses! A great bang for your bucks!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The service is good  and the food are nice and reasonably price.... Will visit again next time. Recommended.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
Nice full menu with lots of options. Something for everyone. 
Lunch special options as well 
Convenient location

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Food was very nice, staff were very pleasant and attentive. Overall enjoyed the dining experience, will go back again

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: my first time in singapore, but not the first for my family. went to food hall and picked Nara based on advertising out fro

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: we just chanced upon this restaurant while shopping at ion mall at orchard road where we chanced upon this restaurant . to our surprise it had a separate vegetarian menu . All the dishes we tried were just excellent but one has to try A DISH WHICH IS A DEEP PURPLE COLOURED RICE. WELL NEVER EVER TASTED SUCH A DISH BEFORE. just out standing.. The raw mango salad was also great. A must visit for a staunch vegetarian like me.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The food was below average and the service even wors

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Ambience was not too bad. Food was tasty. We ordered the fried rice, tom yam soup, and chicken phad tai which was not bad. It was tasty but wasn't great as I've had better.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Had their Tom Yum noodle soup and stir fried soft shell crab in basil sauce. Excellent dishes that were rather authentic. Prices are steep though.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The restaurant was quite dim (which would be perfect if it's a spa venue) for a eating environment. Food is subjective. Green curry was recommended but kuay teow noodle soup is a no-no for the meatballs were plain and soup gravy was too strongly spiced. But I would said the service was good for not many restaurant staff will addressed patrons by their Last Name when making payment.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: We were happy with how fast the food got served to our table and were satisfied with the service. The food was delicious as well. We would go back to the place again. Thank you Nara Thai Cuisine:)

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: All the food tasted the same 🙄 rice was too soft . presentation average . Ambiance not too bad though.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Tried the tom yum kway teow and it was amazing. The sourish spicy soup was perfect with the kway teow. The roasted pork neck was perfectly done too.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Overall food was good. Service was friendly but on the slow side. I dont like places that charge for water especially when I am paying over $100 for a meal.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The food makes me feel that I am in Thailand and the set lunches are very worth it! Should check them out.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: While staying at the Orchard road hotel in Singapore I was wondering where to have lunch. I wandered into the Ion ma

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Went there with my wife. Food quality is very good. Some food recommendation the spicy pork ball and red curry beef are my favourite. They need to improve on the service side and too overwhelming. Where the hostess stand also the cashier stand. Otherwise it is my fav thai restaurant

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: I had lunch here, the ayuthaya noodle soup. The food was good and service ok. This would have been a 3.5, but it's over priced and they charged for tap water which is way it gets a 2.  Much better options around.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: We had tried the dishes at Nara Thai in Bangkok and loved their dishes. So went to Nara Thai in Ion Orchard to tr

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: I like this restaurant very much, the quality is consistently good and what's on the menu well represents the Thai food culture. I have tried several options, and I am normally very satisfied.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Nara always been our fave Thai restaurant. Food is great. Never dissappoints. We regularly visit Nara Thai restaurant in Bangk

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Words can not describe how much my family and me love the food in this restaurant! Favolous! Amazing! Perfectly executed exotic thai dishes with memorable flavours and tastes which make you fall i  love with it!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: If you are looking to have early dinner and Thai food, Nara Thai is an option. Not many Thai food restaurants open throughout the da

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Recently the menu had gone through a change with a list of new items added. The place was not crowded when I came for a light weekday dinn

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Unfortunately Nara Thai is in a space that had a fe restaurants come and go a failed. The food is ok, but there is no character or any vibe to this place. Went there twice this year and both times only because I had thai food craving and I live near Ion.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Was looking around ION Orchard on Monday evening for a place to satisfy my craving for Thai food and chanced upon this restaurant. The drinks selection was pretty alright (two kinds of beers, two kinds of cocktails) , although when I wanted to order one of their two cocktails, they told me that they ran out of the rose syrup that they use to make it, so I got their other cocktail, the siamese sour, which became a little cloying after a few sips. I would rather have gone for their iced tea since their bar wasn't very big. For the food, I got their Gai Pak Panang (spicy barbequed chicken), which was rather tough and dry, but had a tasty marinade; and their Kuay Tiew Tom Yum Kung (Tom Yum noodles with prawns), which was pretty alright - nothing too special, although the prawns were delightfully crunchy and juicy. The service wasn't too bad, although it could have been better considering there were only 4 to 5 other tables when I walked in, and the counter and other floor staff were simply standing around chatting and joking around with each other. The servers were friendly, however. I enjoyed the interior of the place, and if you're thinking of charging your phone or electronic devices there, there are power outlets at the corner of the table booths. Honestly, if not for the table service and decor, I would rather have eaten at the ION food hall for the same quality of food.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Went for dinner on 31st July. They serve you blue rice. The Massaman curry is also good. Worth a try!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: this time back with my wife & family we'd a feast :) for dinner we didn't have a reservation but at 5pm we were seated just behind the greeter's desk but still perfect for younger childr

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
this is the only thing that i am allowed to say in this forum apparently after it axed my original comments. 

Ok i'll go with this then: horrible overpriced Thai food. bad ambience.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The food was great! This is my first time trying blue jasmine rice! It tastes like original white steamed rice but with prettier color. I really recommend the soft shell crab with garlic, tom yam kung, and scallops with asparagus. Unfortunately, my additional order took to long so we had to cancel it. But overall, the food was pretty great!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
Stopped in for dinner 1st night in Singapore. 
Seated promptly. 
Efficient table service. 
Wide ranging Thai menu. 
Great authentic Thai food (we were visiting from Bangkok)

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Food not exactly great and yet expensive.   Jasmine rice looks good but tasteless.  Nothing great.  Their mango sticky rice is their best item.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: The food was just authentic thai! Fish cakes Larb gai Grilled squids and the Tom Yum was just perfect and delicious. I absolutely loved the spiciness in the dishes. The chicken satay was extraordinarily succulent with crispy bites - the peanut sauce was very good too. Also the chicken red curry was super thick and so the chicken fried rice was a perfect complement with the beautiful chunks of soicy chicken with hints of lemon and spices in rice as well as the curry. I will definitely go back again!!

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Good Thai food. Loved the Steamed Seabass in Lime Sauce. The stir-fried Kang Kong was crunchy and good too. The hot and spicy prawn soup tasted like chilli crab sauce though. Should have gone for Tom Yam soup. They serve only blue-coloured rice, no white rice.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: If you looking for good Thai cuisine, try this place. The tom yam koong is just delicious and flavorful. Do try their mango salad - sour and spicy. Wide selection of dishes to choose from. Finish of your meal with red ruby and mango sticky rice.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: Went with expectation but turn out great disappointment..the Tom Yum was so salty that I hard can swallow 3 spoons..the salad too sour..the beef was over fry and the veg barely make it..and it's very expensive as well..

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: We order Tom Yam Soup. My mother can only eat fish and we especially order Tom Yam with fish only in which they can accommodate. Purple rice is quite unique and tasty with thai herbs and spices. Very good food and services. Good recommendation for Thai food

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review:
service was bad.
food was bad.
prices too high for such bad food.
servers not helpful and treated us like crap.
terrible.

Name: Nara Thai Singapore
Location: 2 Orchard Turn Ion Orchard Ste #B3-21, Singapore 238801 Singapore
Review: I'm not all too fond of eating in restaurants based in a shopping mall. However, I have to say that you get value for money in this restaura

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Just another relaxing day and great vibes at Paulaners Millenia ~ beer 🍺 taste fresh always and great service from their friendly staffs . Highly recommended! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: I had great food and service from Idah. Will definitely recommend this place for German food. Great ambience and it satisfy my German food craving.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Paulners has always been a classic place for beer. Felicia is a great host and the sausages are excellent as always.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Paulaner serves one of the best craft beers in Singapore and it is value for money due to the 1 for 1 promotion. Great ambience too!

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Rana was amazing! Thank you for patiently taking our orders and answering our queries :) will definitely recommend this place!

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: We were served by Rana and he made sure we were well taken care of. Super fast service and such a friendly staff. Highly recommended for a chilled out evening!

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: First off: I’m originally from Germany, so I’m a picky eater by birth and have been exposed to a lot of German food over the years. My expectations when someone promises me “authentic German cuisine” are therefore both: high and slightly peppered with suspicion. The latter is due to the tendency of “German” restaurants abroad to only cater to the stereotypical German dishes. German food is not only Bratwurst and Sauerkraut. Every region has their own specialties and while it is certainly impossible to cover them all on a menu, I appreciate it, if you can find at least a bit of variet

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Visited with a friend in December 2020. Ordered Kasespatzle, Schweinshaxe, and Pork Schnitzel. The food quality was wonderful, with brilliantly warm and creamy cheesy goodness in the Kasespatzle, which was not jelak unlike some other places, and neither was it overly salty, which can be a problem as well. The pairing of fried onions elevated the dish by adding a crispy savoury-sweetness that goes very well to up the level of creamy cheesy sauce and the springy egg noodles. The Schweinshaxe was paired with a rich and very savoury dark beer sauce which added a nice punch to the dish, and elevated the taste of the pork knuckle. Loved the sauerkraut pairing as it was well balanced, not too sweet, not too sour, and not too salty, and not too mushy. However, the other item that was in the Schweinshaxe dish as a second side vaguely reminded me of a potato dough dumpling. That was slightly bland and a bit too doughy for my liking. The schnitzel was quite good, not greasy, and the flour batter thin enough, and meat tender and not dry. However, the pairing of fries felt a bit lacking and weighed a little too much on an already-heavy fried dish like schnitzel. Perhaps swapping for mashed potatoes or potato salad and an acidic option like a slaw or sauerkraut would make for a better option to balance out the heaviness of the dish. The Weisbier here is sublime, crisp, fruity, and refreshing, tasting like liquid gold in my opinion. However, many of the staff were quite inattentive and rather cold, even if they were efficient. Luckily there was a lady who was very nice and was very willing to help us take photos and proactively brought out extra cutlery when my friend had dropped his on the floor. Made the good food even better and compensated for the lack of friendliness on the part of her other colleagues.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Food and beer here are very authentic! I must say this is the best place for authentic pork knuckles. The German dumpling served alongside is also very delicious! What we enjoy a lot here is also the attentiveness of the staff, especially Rana. He’s always attentive, alert and very friendly. Great service!

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review:
Awesome beer and awesome food, pork knuckle is epic - thanks!

Rana was very helpful, even special menu item for vegan friend. Thanks!

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Pork Knuckle was hugely disappointing. Firstly, it wasn't even served hot. Skin wasn't crispy and meat too tough. 1-for-1 beer promo was awesome though!

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: awesome service thanks mr rana i did have a very good time the service is cool i did have a good time 👍👍👍👍

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: We came here to Paulaner Brauhaus SG for a mid afternoon lazy lunch. Our meat platter comprising a roasted crispy pork knuckle, sausages, chicken schnitzel meat loaf slices and meat patties was cooked to perfection. Can’t forget the beer - it’s the year end festive season and PB has a great hoppy festive beer on tap. Service staff, particularly Ida, always helpful as ever. Great food, wonderful service and a really nice place. It’s no wonder why we keep coming back.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Ms Idah has always been very helpful and does provide all the request and services we expect from this lovely bar. Not to forget that the beer is nice but the people serving makes your visit more relaxed. i can’t forget that I even asked for the title of the song being played and she went to check the title. Good in suggesttive selling too when we asked about wine to order For your visit look for Idah, thumbs up for her very good service.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Came for a nice german lunch and was pleasantly surprised with the german staff Annabel and David. They were very knowledgeable and friendly and gave superb recommendations. Loved the currywurst! Would come again.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review:
Great place to dine in

Thanks mr rana will be back here soon
Looking forward to be back here

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review:
Thank you rana you have a satisfying service looking forward,
Ciming back here again soon hopefully we meet once again

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review:
The best place to dine in
With the best service
Thanks mr Rana looking forward to be back here again

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: My partner and I decide to check this place out for for our anniversary celebration. We came here without reservation and we got a nice table immediatel

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: I really like how authentic the food here is, compared to what I use to get from my hometown in Bavaria. They have a nice selection of beers from their own microbrewery as well! On top of that I visited a few times already and their waiting staff is always very attentive and flexible to requests. Can only recommend and will come back.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Whenever we want to feel like home we go to Paulaner. The food tastes authentic here and is very delicious. A nice variety of Bavarian Delicatessen. Our waitress Lizel was absolutely lovely. It was very easy to change the sides if we'd liked something else. I'm usually not a beer fan but here the beers are delicious!

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: What a wonderful beer at Paulaner ~ nice food and alway using the best ingredients and service always excellent , staffs always smiles p.s especially RANA lol thank you

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Was here a couples of time. Foods and beers are great especially the all day beer promotion ( except Friday till 7pm). The staff Rana he is very attentive and friendly.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Nice food nice food beer .. staff is very friendly.. specially Rana .. thanx again Rana see u again .. u make our day very special

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review:
Great western food, awesome service. Many thanks for the recommendation, Rana. :)
A great place to chill.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Tip top atmosphere, exceptional service by Rana and not forgetting their amazing beer! Definitely a great experience.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Staff Rana is friendly and helpful. Nice environment and ambience. Fantastic beers & food. Easy accessible

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Have been always coming back to this place very often, excellent, yummy and tasty beers! Crispy and delicious pork knuckles that makes my mouth water whenever I think of it. Staff, anne is very friendly as well! Always will be back here for a hearty meal and awesome beers

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review:
The food was very good and nice place to sit. Staff very friendly and Rana was 
 amazing' see you again

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: The service is very quick and attentive. The food was fresh, properly prepared and a great value for the price. Great atmosphere, We highly recommend it. Staff was very friendly specially  Mr. Rana

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review: Came here for a Christmas dinner with family. We ordered the platter. Good ambience and food. Excellent service by Idah.

Name: Paulaner Bräuhaus Singapore
Location: 9 Raffles Boulevard Millenia Walk #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore
Review:
Mr. Rana provided us with super excellent customer service throughout our stay at the restaurant. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends and families.

All that was missing was the um pah pah!!! Waitress very attentive.

It was not a busy Friday night but the restaurant staff repeatedly ignored us. It took them 20 mins to bring us 2 pints of beer (we were just 2 people) and another 45 minutes for our food to arrive (cold, dry, oily roast beef and some pretty sad looking potatoes). There is no point following-up because they are experts at averting your literal cries for help! Come at your own risk.
