Review: The two of us were STUFFED from a small Funghi, Parmigiana and the La Nonna pizza but it was so worth it! The food was so full of flavour and the staff members were really friendly. We went on Wednesday evening so the place wasn't too crowded :) Thank you La Nonna!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: If you are planning to chill in Friday evening, this is a great place. Food is good. Place is good. Only one thing. No music. Hey, you might not even notice that when you are eating and talking.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Full house on a Friday night. La Nonna is a go-to Italian restaurant with amazing pizzas. Two stories and has alfresco dining options. Would recommend anyone new to La Nonna to try their classic signature, also called "La Nonna" - a pizza with egg, truffle, asparagus and Parmesan. Deli!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Small cosy place. Enjoyed the La Nonna Pizza and Tiramisu. The truffle on the pizza was perfect! Great lunch deal available!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Not really a good experience, because of I bought the Chope voucher and if to redeem the voucher will lose 1-for-1 offer. So, I wasted my Chope voucher don’t know when I can use it.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Love their weekend 1-1 mains deal which I can enjoy since I don't have Entertainer. This was the first place I ever tried truffle pasta and it was amazing. Comes in close second after the truffle pasta at Hopheads Bar! Staff are very attentive. There was once I noticed a "foreign particle" but decided not to point it out as I was almost done with my meal. But a staff noticed my gesture (directed at my date) and promptly apologised and offered to waive the cost of that pasta. It was a proactive gesture that I greatly appreciated. :)

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Food was actually quite tasty, though nothing out of the ordinary. Amex platinum card holders has 50% off for 2 main dishes orders so it was very affordable. Worth trying!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: We went to La Nonna for an office dinner. Ordered the wine bottle and starter combo followed by the special pizza & beef carpaccio. Food was generally good. Service was good. The place itself has a nice vibe to it. We sat outside and enjoyed ourselves.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: We loved the food. The pizza in particular was delicious! The only thing that wasn’t great was the tiramisu. I was slightly disappointed but everything else was great!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Repeated visit at this italian restaurant. The menu is easy to read, The man who seems to be floor manager is really friendly and approachable, everytime sees him there. This visit, We tried the RISOTTO ALLO ZAFFERANO and Oven-baked Classic Lasagna, both are delicious and the lagsana was served sizzling in the pan! maybe a little bit salty for the lasagna. Previously we tried their CALZONE pizza- Folded Pizza filled with Tomato, Mozzarella, Mushrooms and cooked Ham, it was really special and fall in love with it. another reason that I keep coming back is the AMEX dining discount at this restaurant. nevertheless, the price is decent even before discount!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Good place for pizza! I usually order pizzas here since they are one of the best in this area. Went to visit the restaurant and ordered the lasagna, was good but the pizza is what makes them stand up to other Italian restaurants. Prices are fair and service is excellent. Inwould highly recommend this restaurant.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: I came here a couple of years ago and am happy to say the food is as good as I remembered it to be. We went for the La Nonna pizza ($24.50) and the risotto allo zafferano ($28). I was pleasantly surprised at the size and generosity of toppings on the pizza. The risotto was cooked al dente and the king scallops delightfully seared.We enjoyed the weekday lunch deal (1-for-1 pasta/pizza/main), but I would definitely come back even when the discount is not available!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Have been visiting this restaurant for years. Good for friends gathering.Enjoyed both the food & service, especially with promotions. Advisable to make reservation if you prefer indoor.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Good food great service. Manager Naina was fantastic. He is a Asian Chap but knows the menu well. The stewards need to be trained abit more especially this particular guy called Steven. When I asked for pepper he ignored me and gave me a strange look of disgust. Not cool at all. Will definitely come again...

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: We had a farewell lunch for our colleague organised and we all enjoyed the food and the ambiance.Overall rating is very good

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Clean restaurant with attentive staff, possibly due to smaller lunch crowd on weekend. Got a corner table with just enough space for pram. Bread was room temp and slightly tough, wld prefer for it to be toasted. Risotto and crabmeat pasta were good, meat lovers' pizza and calzone were so-so. They have a good prosecco + free side promo at $35++ on weekdays.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: As an Italian root from my mother side I would say not worse to eat here but I mentioned I only had pizza which I wouldn’t recommend it for the pizza....plus it is even more expensive a simple Margherita to compare i real Italian restaurant... pity because I like Holland village sphere.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Nice venue. Good service. Ok food. Nothing special to write home about. Nice little place but food was average

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Service wise, the staff was very attentive and shown initiative. I dined together with a colleagues and ordered 4 menus and we cannot finish it. The staff attentively asked us if we wanted the left over to bring along. Location wise, it's very accessible since it just a walking distance from Holland Village MRT.We love their LA NONNA pizza! We even take away 1 more box :) Their pasta is to die for (for me). My friend requested to order their lobster ravioli and she loves it.I recommend to visit them during lunch and they have 1 FOR 1 promotion.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: The quality of food is average, orders the burrata cheese, lamb ribs and spaghetti with cream sauce. The burrata cheese a little too hard by standard, asked for medium cooked lamb chops but come too raw like a medium ray.. so have to bring back to cook. First ever eat the spaghetti with cream sauce like a soup noodle as it is too watery! Ordered to wine but waiter forgot to serve till I asked, the food we ordered was taken down wrongly too... waiter not so attentive but the price to pay for serve a 3 Stars. Else it would only 2 stars as the service and food are not that good .

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Absolutely love their Taglierini Truffle pasta and Parmigiana. Intense flavour, satisfying texture and generously portioned.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Popular Italian haunt with a long queue; we tried the Cod, Salmon, as well as some pastas and pizza - rather good, and most of the mains are large enough for sharing

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: serves good Italian food for pastas & pizzas.good portions with valued pricing during lunch time.main courses are great choices too.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Every dish we ordered tasted delicious n above our expectation. Extremely happy w the 1-1 promotions!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: The food was good and great value for money. The only feedback is that we were seated on the ground floor and the area seems a bit small for a party of 6 adults and 1 child.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: I have already been to La Nonna 3 times over the last month or so and the food is generally good. The menu is not very long but they do the items they offer well. The staff are helpful and motivated. There is both indoor and outdoor seating spread over two floors, both of which are pleasant at night. The price is really very reasonable when one makes use of their partner promotion programme, which accounts for why they draw a good crowd most of the time.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: its a great restaurant with great food. U mustn't miss the La Nonna pizza which isn't too thick and yet crispy and well dripped with pure Italian love and sauces!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: The food is decent (pizzas are excellent; lobster ravioli so-so, it has so much sauce and so little lobster you can’t taste the latter; wet risotto very wet and quite unusual but not great; forget about mediocre antipasti). However, it is satisfying, almost like meals cooked by a loving grandma who is not a fabulous chef. The place has two qualities: it is very good value (especially when special 1-for-1 offers are on), and service is exceptionally warm and friendly.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: La Nonna is an Italian restaurant situated in Holland Village, a popular dining and shopping choice for young Singaporeans as well as expatriates. The restaurant is often considered to be a preferred choice for meals with families and friend

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: The place is usually very packed during lunch hours because of its buy one get one free pasta and pizza deal. If you want to have air-con seating, early reservation is a must. Otherwise you have to sit outdoor which is quite comfortable too if you don't mind the hot air. Food is delicious and service is nice and prompt. Thumb up.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Manager provided such lovely service - welcoming, humorous and went the extra mile by plating the slice of cake we brought for our friend's birthday! loved our la nonna signature pizza (think truffle, asparagus and runny yolk yum yumsss) and the lagsana we ordered as well!!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: From the friendly service staff to the amazing food, the visit was nothing less than magical. We had the Nera pizza - thin crust and good amounts of fresh seafood.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: La Nonna was a family favourite years ago but we have not visited for the past couple of yea

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: We are regular customers and can't recommend this place enough. All the staff are super friendly and the food is excellent. I'm not Italian, but I've visited Italy five times and was never able to find food as good as La Nonna's over there.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Reserved a table early in advance so we managed to get a quieter area on Fri nigh

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Second visit to this place. Service was good, complementary bread served prior to your main course was as delicious as ev

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Atmosphere was appalling as acoustics are SO bad in this restaurant. It was lunchtime, full house & I couldn't hear myself speak! The noise was bouncing off the walls & the waiter had to lean a bit too close to me & raise his voice almost to a shout, for us to communicat

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Great place for lunch and a meal with the family. Excellent service and one of the few restaurants with the friendliest service staff. Food was cooked to perfection and very very appetising. Will definitely return to La Nonna!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Ordered magherita pizza, parmagini( egg plant) , risotto and crab meat linguine. All were good . However risotto could be too creamy for one person to finish the entire dish. Better for sharing. Beautiful rustic decor. Been long standing at this neighbourhood,holland village

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: I love the pasta as it’s freshly made. The texture and flavor is wonderful. The portions are very generous. I think this price is reasonable considering the quality and quantity. Service was excellent as well.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Food this time was so much better than my previous visit and the staff was very friendly, so kudos to them.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Value for money with the 1 for 1 lunch promo during weekdays. Food an service are decent. Definitely worth going again.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: I went there with my Wife on the Valentine’s Day for dinner. It was fully booked for the day. However, they were nice to offer us a table outside. We ordered one Prosecco bottle, a La Nona pizza and a risotto. Food was tasty and portions were sufficient. Overall we had a nice time

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: The signature pizza, penne and lasagna are real yummy! This place is definitely a favorite. Thank you too Nai, you made our visit very enjoyable.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: The La Nonna pizza at the restaurant was spectacular. Pasta was well cooked although it was very saucy.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Enjoyed the Pizza and Pasta tremendously. Place was rather noisy but food was great! Will definitely go again!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Meal was very disappointing as the pappardelle that I ordered tasted nothing like it was homemade, but out of a box. Also, there was hardly any meat at all. The staff even dared to tell me that there's not supposed to be any meat, "as it is a ragu" thinking that I was a fool. Very disappointing.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Not much to rave about. Decent food. Location in Holland Village means that you can pop by pubs for a drink

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Food was great, friendly staff, awesome ambience for couples on dates. Was unawaringly allergic to something in one of the cakes (not their fault) but the staff demonstrated exceptional service by giving us the dessert as complimentary. Thank you!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Serving size of the dessert was not uniformly cut, my friends had bigger piece of cake than me, significantly different.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: The la nonna pizza is still very tasty and delicious as I had tried before and I am quite surprised the spaghetti Bolognese was really good and nice.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: We had their signature La Nonna pizza that came with a nice and gooey egg in the centre with lots of truffle! The crabmeat linguine and lobster ravioli were good and rich as well. The cod fish was really yummy too (: Overall it was worth it especially with the Entertainer app!

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review:
Food and service was good. 
Place is well decorated and there is also a huge oven where you can see pizzas getting cooked.

Atmosphere was marked down because of the packed layout and the sound bounces off surfaces making conversation slightly difficult.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: Nice pizza place, good deal during weekday lunch with one for one offers. Will return in future. thank you.

Name: La Nonna
Location: 26/26B Lorong Mambong, Singapore 277685 Singapore
Review: It took 30 minutes for the chef to inform us that the gnocchi ordered cannot be served. Replacement risotto was rice in mushroom soup (which we had) with added cheese. .much too salty on palate . The Namly place outlet used to serve much better food. Sad it closed

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The punjabi curries are amazing.. their chaats are not so great.. so when u go there, order all the punjabi curries! very good. But dont waste time on the chaats..

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
the beer was ok..
the food was mediocre.. the service was poor..
We went there to have a good time on a friday evening. But, it soon turned into one of the worst ..

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
The best Indian Restaurant I've ever been to. Service is always great and the setting is nice, sat outside in the hustle and bustle of Little India.

Even something bland like a Butter Chicken is super delicious, still to not find anything to compare.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: This is our to-go place for deliciously spicy Indian fare. The chicken tandoori is tender & moist. Best of all, it’s skinless to

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Traditional Indian food and consistently good quality and value. When visiting we always look to sit indoor and upstairs at it feels more like a restaurant and I prefer the air condiytioning when eating, however, for the authentic feel, downstairs and on the street may suit you better. Don't miss the Chicken 65 which is spicy and amazing, so much so we had two portions during our last visit. A little dissapointed by the lamb vindaloo as not as spoicy as I had hoped but will give it a try again on the next visit. Definitely a go to place in Singapore for an excellent Indian meal at good prices.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We waited for more than an hour for our food. Food was good other than the mutton curry being too salty.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
One of the better place to have North Indian food and moderately priced 

Food is too oily though, good for large group

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Ordered takeaway dinner for the family which was confirmed by email and over 2hrs later still no delivery. To make matters worse the restaurant hasn't answered the phone and I've called 30 times. Disgraceful customer service. Surely if the food is delayed a simple call or message would have been reasonable from a business that cared about the customer. Why support a local business during these difficult times when they clearly hold the satisfaction of a customer's all in such contemp

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Terrible delivery service. They are only looking for your money and there seems to have been a change in manager/person who picks up the phone on calling their number. About a week ago, when I asked for chicken dum biryani, I got nice, saucy curry inside my biryani. However, when I ordered today, not only was the biryani cold, but it had DRY CHICKEN, as if boiled without seasonings (yuck). Adding insult to injury, the person on the phone told my family to add an extra item for $50 minimum charge with free delivery whereas last week the person was kind enough to do free shipping on $48. Truly horrible delivery service with terrible, dry biryanis and terrible management. Please considering going back to your old, not-so-stingy ways so the restaurant can be a success. Posting this everywhere so everyone knows about your crappy service (my day is ruined and my disappointment is immeasurable).

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The restaurant is large, two stories high and the menu is quite extensive. The Tandoori Chicken and Chicken Tikka were very good but portions were small. The naan we as excellent but the portions small. Overall the food was very good but the restaurant is very touristy with high prices.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Ate at Khansama Tandoori Restaurant at 166 Serangoon Rd at junction of Norris Rd. We shared Aloo Tikki, mixed veggie Pakora (6 pcs), garlic & butter Naan and Mutton Kebab. Several sauces and yogurt were provided with the dishes. Several different spices and flavors tickled the taste buds. Very interesting dishes and very tasty. Washed it all down with two large Heineken beers.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: When I want to eat Indian food there are very few places that come to mind. Khansama is one of those places. The food is amazing, there is honestly nothing that can be faulted when it comes to the food. The service is also very good. The staff is incredibly attentive. The only thing that I would like to see a change in would be the furniture that they have...it is aesthetically fitting the theme of the restaurant, but it feels like it may just break apart! It feels dangerous and the furniture is incredibly heavy too. So it’s really difficult to push back the chair to get up and when you do manage to do that then there is the added fear that it will just break. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone I know. But I will most probably take away the food.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Food is really good. Some of the tables on the pavement are a bit grubby but service good and they have revamped to create more outdoor space. However the food is excellent. Been a few times and the last time we went the food was even better than previously.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Just around the corner from the Hilton Garden Inn is a brilliant Indian restaurant called Khansama. Fantastic food, service, and beer, all at a reasonable price especially for Singapore. Well worth a visit. J

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Slice of India in Singapore. Visited little India after a craving me and my wife had on honeymoon. Which was satisfied at this restauran

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Whilst in Little India I asked a local 'which is the best Indian restaurant around here. Without hesitation she directed me to Khansama. It didn't disappoint.... great authentic dishes and wonderful friendly service. Highly recommended.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We had seen a gentleman on the other side of the road promoting the Khansama Tandoori Restaurant and as it started to rain we were walking past it and the friendly staff ushered us in to a table. The menu is extensive with over 25 pages of food and drink choices. I ordered chicken biryani and they offered a less spicy masala sauce. They also did a special lemon tea with no sugar which wasn’t on the menu. We enjoyed chicken biryani and egg biryani with a chick pea and spinach side dish. We asked about the size of the plain naan bread and were told to order just one and see how we go. We did end up ordering a second naan and it was light and crispy. The meal was delicious and so much more authentic than Indian food in the UK. Excellent value. The staff all came over in turn to chat with us and were friendly.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Amazing food and service and a must in Little India to get a true authentic flavour of your surroundings. Well worth the walk along the street.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Super-delicious North-Indian food. Perfect aroma, perfect blend of spices, served in right portions and with a lot of warmth. All snacks and tandoori items are great – kebab platter and Chicken-Tikka are my favorites. Main-course is good too. Energetic bunch of servers, wearing a smile and doing their best to expedite your order. Don’t miss the Kingfisher Premium Beer and enjoy the Indian music in the background.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We happened upon this restaurant while doing a self-guided day tour of Singapore by Hop on Hop off bus. We were hot, tired and in need of some food but given my food sensitivities I am always cautious. This place was a gift. We were immediately given a curbside table and made very comfortable with extremely attentive service. My needs were heard and the chef prepared delicious food which did not contain gluten or dairy which I need to avoid, especially when travelling. We found this by sheer luck but were reassured to see Trip Advisor and Yelp stickers on their entry so that we gave it a try. They certainly deserve the accolades they regularly receive.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Food was terrific. The tandoori pamfret was amazing! We also ordered the mutton biryani and butter chicken which were great. Biryani was moist and came with extra gravy. Staff was awesome. They even helped with a taxi as Grab was not working.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
Great Indian food!
Friendly staff!
Lots of locals dining is probably the best review!
Would go back in a second!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We enjoyed lunch here while shopping in Little India. One of the culinary highlights of our trip. Food and service was excellent. My husband has traveled to India several times and said this food was true to Indian cuisine. Interesting non-alcoholic drink options and Indian beers. Air conditioned upstairs room, or "on the street" patio experience downstairs in open air. It was not too hot or humid so we enjoyed sitting outside in casual open atmosphere.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Average restaurant with average taste and exorbitant prices.Taste is average and portion sizes is okay.Ambience is also nothing great.Can eat in half the money at other places like Delhi restaurant and Komala restaurant on the same road and at almost same price in better restaurant like Kailash parbat near Hilton village inn on same road.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Nice food specially cheese kebab they were recommended by my son in law, they did taste good, very busy place friendly staff and good service

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Excellent curry, and great advice. We visited the place twice - on two different visits to Singapore. The advice we got was what the staff there preferred, with further recommendations on other curry's. If it was not so far from the UK, we would visit the place more often. Rainy season outside, comfortable and dry inside. All the staff are very friendly and helpful.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We had lunch here and it was really good.  The Tandoori chicken and butter chicken were both delicious.  We would definitely go back.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: On Thursday 18th October 2018 – The OCC visited Khansama Tandoori Restaurant, Little Ind

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: When it comes to Indian Multi Cuisine place , I think of KHANSAMA as the best choice .

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: I ate dinner here twice during my business trip to Singapore in October 2019. I sat outdoors and you are near hustling and bustling Serangoon Road. There is also an indoor seating and dining area upstairs. I had palaak paneer (a spinach dish), basmati rice, onion naan and a mango lassi the first time I went there. The second time I went there I had dal (a lentil dish), basmati rice, onion naan and a strawberry lassi. The food and service were very good. The server explained to me the difference between "Deepawali" and "Diwali". Both words are used for the Festival of Lights but "Deepawali" is used in South India and "Diwali" is used in North India. So I learned something in addition to the delicious food.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Let me start saying that this is the best Tandoori Indian restaurant I have ever tried befo

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Excellent friendly staff ~ Fabulous food really enjoyed the meal ~ I would  certainty  recommend the tandoori prawns

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: I eat at Khansama in Little India all the time. Whenever I stay at the Hilton Garden Inn, I can walk over in 5 minutes. Usually, I sit upstairs where there is air conditioning unless the weather is not too hot. I love the boneless Tandoori chicken, the Masala Papad and the Paneer Butter Masala. Knock that down with a Kingfisher. It's the best!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The food of Khansama is fairly good. But I have mostly gotten delivery from this restaurant. They claim to deliver throughout Singapore, please do not fall for this. They never use the delivery features of Grab or Deliveroo or Food Panda and they are pathetic in the delivery. A promised time of 45 min can easily become 1.5 h to 1 h 45 min. You will be waiting for the food for ever. The food is fairly okay, not fantastic or anything. That is why I stopped at 2 stars

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Took my wife and children to Little India to check out the Deepavali festivities and to have dinner. We decided on Khansama as we had read very good reviews of the restaurant, friendly staff and extremely tasty food!! The restaurant itself has an undercover eating area downstairs and an upstairs air conditioned dining area. The menu is extensive (perhaps too many options) with all the usual suspects you’d expect from an Indian restaurant. We ordered some onion bhajia and samosa to start, followed by Butter Chicken, Korma and Tikka Masala curries with plain rice, roti and naan. I must be missing something though. For me, the food was ordinary where the taste didn’t meet the expectation! The Korma sauce for example tasted more like “hot milk” whilst everything seemed to have a hint of being “smoked”!! The restaurant itself was also very dirty especially the tables whilst the toilets were disgusting - don’t go unless you absolutely have too! Yes the staff were friendly and yes, you could sit there and soak up the atmosphere but the restaurant and meal (for me) were a huge disappointment! There are plenty of other restaurants up and down the road - next time, we shall try one of them!!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Solid 4.5 stars. Came here for dinner during the week. Was pretty crowded even on a Tuesday, but we managed to get seated pretty quick. It reminds you of restaurants in the 90s in India (in a good way). We got the hara bhara kebab and aloo tikki chaat to start off with. Was very tasty especially the kebab. Had garlic naan and paneer butter masala for mains, again very tasty and very fresh. I was super impressed, and will be back to try their non-veg options soon!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We had just arrived from an inbound flight, and after checking into our hotel needed something to e

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The waiter  was very nice , prawn curry superb ,but I never seen the dirtiest toilet in my life Disgusting !!! You serve food!!!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We had an early one, just after 5.00

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We love Khansama! We had dinner there three evenings during our week’s stay in Singapore just as we did during our previous stay. It’s really that good! We liked everything, especially the lamb curry, tandoori chicken, the paneer tikka and the Chana Masala, among many other delicious dishes. The service was excellent, too. Akash, our waiter, was wonderful, very helpful and personable. We highly recommend this restaurant!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Whether its lunch or dinner, this restaurant never fails to get me like ‘wow’. Truly one of the best indian cuisines around. My all time favorite is the palak paneer, pani puri and butter chicken. Although the food is a bit rich with cheese but the taste is unmatched. The restaurant also presents a very royal looking indian ambience. Highly recommended

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Was there yesterday as part of a company dinner gathering. Due some booking error on our side, our reservation for 25 pax was at a different branch of the restaurant. However the management team of the restaurant quickly contacted the other branch and got the copy of our booking and pre ordered menu. They arranged and accommodated all of us for dinner albeit their restaurant was quite busy. Kudos to the Khansama team at Little India. They managed to prepare and serve the food quite promptly. Food was good and we all enjoyed our dinner. This is what I call going the extra mile to satisfy customer. Would highly recommend this place due to the attitude they demonstrated even without a booking. Please book in advance and you will get even better service.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
Very satisfied with our meals. Would definitely eat here again!

We over ordered because meals are bigger than what we get at home (keep that in mind if on a budget)

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Located in Little India Singapore, in our experience this is a very good little restaurant, we visited twice during our week here, the staff were a bit miserable and service was a bit topsy turvey but the food quality, quantity and flavours were quite supe

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: I have been to many Indian restaurants over south east Asia, this is one place I wound't return. The staff is nice and friendly, but very pushy with the order

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
Khansama Tandoori Restaurant in Singapore’s Little India was a lucky find during our visit. 

The menu is extensive. Something for everyone! Service is attentive, prompt, and extremely polite.

We loved the Chicken Manchurian and Aloo Matar 💓

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: I dined at Khansama twice during a recent trip to Singapore because the food was so good. Very prompt and friendly service, the wait staff were conversant with suitable options for a coeliac, and the food came out steaming hot and very quickly after we placed our orders. Try the tandoori chicken and the paneer saag!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The solicitations to make you their customer start when you pass by Khansama on the street. The upstairs A/C sitting is good. The waiters are courteous and friend

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: I discovered this place on my first work trip to Singapore 2 years ago. Now everytime im in Singapore I always make sure I visit this place at least onc

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We opted for the air conditioned upstairs space. No atmosphere and lots of staff.  Food was good and prices ok. Menus were tatty and staff not bubbly or friendly.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We ordered Naan + Mixed Kababs + Lamb Biryani + Lemon Soda + Tiger Beer. Food was great, except Biryani (it is colored rice with good quantity and quality of Lam

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Great food, generous portions, speedy service - I really like this restaurant. Very wide menu selection, so lots of choice for spicy or mild, vegetarian or carnivore, curry fiend or tandoori lov

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Tourist rip-off place. Avoid. If they can tell that you are a tourist then they will tell you how famous they are and then hand you a paper menu with higher prices. For example, garlic naan for S$4.50 that sells for half that price elsewhere. At least ask to see their regular/formal menu and you can save a little money.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Best tandoori food. The restaurant is expensive, but the taste is great. They have a bar and the ambience is mind blowing.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: I really liked Indian food. Staff is hospitable. Sitting though is in open but good food covers everything

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Little India is changing. About 10 years ago, you could find an idli joint in every corner. It’s good to see some options for those who like North Indian food. The prices are decent, the beer is chilled and the service quick. Now if only they could replace those rickety chairs and tables with something a bit more comfortable. But good enough to return.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Eaten at many Indian restaurants but the taste here is just something different! Veey authentic North Indian taste and very good variety. The service is sometimes chaotic with waiters not knowing whether to seat people upstairs or downstairs and food takes longer than usual to arrive. But it is still worth the wait.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Greeted by pleasant waitirs, got a table outside and served up cold beer straight away, starters of mixed tandoori chicken and sheesh kebab, main of prawn curry, chicken tikka masala and garlic naan and rice. To be honest there was to much food but it was to good to leave, they did offer a to go box, but hotel may not have been to impres

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We sat at street level under cover and got the breeze from a ceiling fan. Very pleasant. As you'd expect from the Indians, service very prompt.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We were looking for a good Indian Restaurant that night. It met our expectations regarding the food but the service was disappointing for us. The waiter was standing the whole time beside our table and asked already after 1 minute what we would like to eat. Furthermore, other waiters were starring at us at the same time. It was un uncomfortable feeling for us. At the end we felt that they were craving for tips which is a no-g

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: During our visit to little India we stopped here for lunch. This was some of the best Indian food I have ever had. Service is efficient and friendly. Butter chicken and mixed vegetables were incredible. It was my mistake but wish I would have ordered my veggies a little hotter but the flavors and sauces were exceptional. They also have fairly priced wine.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We are a regular visitor here and this is our goto place when we crave for punjabi food. The curries and servings are decently balanced on spices and would surely satisfy all palates and is great value for money.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Came here because my friend had a naan and butter chicken craving. This place showed up at the top of our Google search with 1000+ reviews so we thought we wouldn’t go wro

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We have eaten here at every visit to Singapore and it never fails to please us

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We spent a week in the Little India area and ended up having dinner at this place thrice. The food quality as well as portion is good and the taste is very Indian. Pair it with a local beer and you get a dhaba type experien

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The food is good but the service is pathetic. They do not serve you food if asked to and say it’s self service but charge service charg

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The food at Khansama was absolutely delicious. The naan, the butter chicken, samosas, bhendi, and all the other dishes we tried were fabulous. Can’t wait to eat here again

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
Visited again with friends to have the Biryani , Moong Daal Halwa & Gajjar ka Halwa .

Will see me more often 

Always happy to be at Khansama 

Thank you

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The food here was excellent. Someone was handing out flyers for this place near the temple so we thought we'd give it a try. It was about 5pm and not too busy. We had tandoori starters and a tikka main. The food was impressive, much more that I expected. I would highly recommend anyone in this area to come here for lunch or dinner. Staff are also very friendly.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Really great food, although pricey it was worth while.  If cheaper would eat here a lot more.  We had 3 dishes, 2 kebabs and a curry - all fantastic and good with the heat being hot as asked

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The staff outside trying to lure you in are the friendliest .. well it ends the

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We ordered fish tikka which was expensive but nice, chickpeas (big serving), mixed chaat, raita and garlic naan (great) This with 3 beers came to just over $100 including service and tax. It's been a while since I paid that much for Indian food. Ok but I wouldn't rush back.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: My wife and I were looking for a good tandoor restaurant but we were very disappointed. We ordered the mixed Chats which were inedible, the tandoori chicken was so spicy we couldn’t eat it. We also ordered the dhal which was bland and tasteless. Not recommended. We paid $64 dollars and had only a few mouthfuls before we walked out. Wasted money. The naan bread was fine but that was the only up side.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
We had dinner here, it is a spacious restaurant with quiet upstairs and a bit crowded noisy downstairs.
We opted upstairs where all the tables were cranky. Food was good but overpriced.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Went here because of the good write ups and ratings. The menu was huge and impressive however the food was average. The pepper chicken had little depth of flavour - I think reflects the fact that it was added to a cooked sauce to enable delivering such a large selection of dishes. The service was not great and the waiters looked like they wanted to be anywhere else but there. Beware, the prices on the menu don't include taxes or service charges - this adds another 17%. Had much better food in the Tekka centre

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
The chicken curry was identical to my grandmothers!
Food was brilliant and I didn’t feel bloated like most Australian Indian restaurants!
Staff are also fantastic!
Really enjoyed everything!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Busy Friday night sat upstairs in cool AC. Buzzy atmosphere. Lots of choices for vegetarians. Favourite dish was a chick pea flavoursome curry. Well priced for Singapore. Service surly but attentive.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: After a tiring day, one needs a good meal to end the day and go to b

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: This was recommended to us by a local as his favourite Indian in little India. He was right. Some of the nicest Indian food I’ve ever tasted. Very good Dahl and tarka masala, and of course the tandoori chicken was amazing. We sat street side and it had a good buzz and atmosphere all evening. If like us you love a good curry then you won’t be disappointed.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Ordered from this restaurant via Deliveroo app. Not only did the restaurant not follow up on my order, they blame the system for the delay in delivering the food! Called the first time and was told by one of your staff that the food was on its way and I should give another 5-10mins. Waited another 20 mins to give the benefit of traffic, was told that my order did not exist! And claimed that my order was missed due to a second order request that came in shortly after mine. How convenient it is to blame the system. Humans invented the system, fault lies in humans so don’t blame your system when your staff overlooked. Have never tried their food and probably never will.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We selected this place based on TripAdvisor reviews, but please note that some Singapore reviews are not as accurate as the reviews in US or EU. The food was good, but definitely not at the level we expected, especially for the price we paid. Next time I would go for small family restaurants, much more authentic and well pric

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: This is absolutely better restaurant as compared to other INDIAN restaurant in Little India, nice North Indian food

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We came across this restaurant whilst having a wander around Little India, we only went for a drink but looking at the food coming out of the kitchen we booked to come back the next night. I’m very pleased to say it was excellent. By far the best Indian food I’ve eaten. Staff were friendly and the price was good (for Singapore). I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review:
I love the food even the place is not very fancy.
Service is OK, but the food is worth to go to Little India.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Went for an early dinner and was not disappointed. Staff very friendly and food superb. We probably ordered too many starters but the meat on the sharing platter was delicious- have never had such tender chicke

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We ate our first dinner of Singapore her

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Butter chicken and veggie tikka masala spot on 😊 beautiful food, efficient service and overall great experience!! I'm really glad we took a gamble and went in without checking reviews beforehand as well worth it

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: After leave Singapore, this place is one of restaurant that I’ve miss a lot. All of BBQ and curries with mixed naan basket. Love it!!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: We ate at this place on the very first day of out visit to Singapore. Me and my husband are both fond of chicken so we ordered butter chicken and chicken tikka. Both dishes were wonderful, subtle spices, beautifully cooked chicken and road side seating took our hearts... It was too awesome that we went again and had best chicken biryani ever. Must visit place

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Really delicious authentic Indian Tandoori food. Friendly staff. Outside seating. Nothing fency, but still a place to go when visiting Little India. Strongly recommended!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Beware of lying waiters lurking outside the restaurant. They claim they are number 1 on TripAdvisor Google etc. but they really aren’

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: I ate here during my time in Singapore. It is located in Little India and I thought the food was quite good. It was pretty busy so you might want to get there on the earlier side. They have indoor and street side seating. The service was pretty good though the guy did recommend I order more food than I needed. It was also a little more expensive than other places I ate in Singapore. I would recommend it though if you're looking for good Indian food.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: My husband and I where only in Singapore for 3 nights so Little India was on the 'to do' list. Taking a stroll down the narrow streets and seeing all the 22cart gold makes one hungry!! So we decided on this place as it was 'traditional'. We ordered 2 soft drinks and proceeded to check out the menu, with a waiter hovering over us the whole time!!! These decisions can't be rushed!!!!Veg Pakora to start and some poppadom ....covered in tomato, onion and chilli when I clearly said no chilli, but hubby enjoyed and I shook the stuff off. Mains came, chicken tikka masala, (for Hubby)king prawn biryani, (for me)rice and 2 garlic naan bread. Nearly blew the head off my husband who loves hot spicey food!!!! Way toooooo hot for a masala dish!!! My prawns were hot too for my liking but I added the natural yogurt from the poppadom to mine and it was bearable. Unfortunately hubby's got the better of him and he had to give up!!! and I'm sure I asked for half servings, (which they advertised in their menu). So such a waste of money and at $99.80 Singapore dollars, it was a brave chunk of money. Also dont get me started on the toilet!!!! Unisex with a toilet bowl, a urinal and a shower hose!!! Floor was soaked, pubic hair and pee on the seat...(was desperate so hovered clutching tightly to my shorts!!) and the smell!!!!! I came out SCRUBBED my hands and made disgusting faces too hubby who refrained from using it!!! But they must have seen my horror as the mob and bucket came out and the smell of disinfectant would have knocked you out, but so much better than it was!! All in all not a great experience!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: The restaurant serves traditional north Indian food . The food was ok. The portions were medium sized. Ambience and services were good.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: This is a great place for a curry with friends. I also love the fact you can sit outside. Delicious food and good prices.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: bad choice: food was greasy and overpriced and to make the dining out experience even worse, the waiter was rude.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Was trying to find a place in Singapore to get some Indian food and picked this place because of all the food reviews. Well it did not disappoint, the food here is so good . Must go!!

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Located in the heart of Little India, it's on a busy corner with outdoor seating (no A

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: This place was a real treat my girlfriend and I came to Little India looking for an authentic meal and we sure found it! The service was wonderful and the food was exquisite. I highly recommend the prawn masala and chicken Korma. Chili pakora was spicy but good, and the strawberry lassi was decadent. Big menu with lots of choices for everyone, plus cheap Tiger pitchers. Would absolutely return.

Name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant
Location: 166 Serangoon Road Little India Junction of Norris Road, Singapore 218050 Singapore
Review: Undoubtedly the best Indian restaurant in Singapore. The food is unbelievably delicious. The staff are friendly and respectful. The location is great, with lots of buzz. I took my Punjabi mother and she loved it, the ultimate test.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Awesome ambience and very family-friendly too. We popped by for a post-dinner drink. My family and i enjoyed ourselves thanks to the friendly waiters, Aron and Vivian, who were very attentive and made the night a memorable one!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Lovely ambience at night in Chjimes! wonderful Singapore Sling! Friendly service! And the brownie with ice cream is not too bad too.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review:
Food was well-done, atmosphere was beautiful and staff was prompt to address our needs.
Perhaps a little more smiles could have made the experience more welcoming, but overall a good place for cosy birthday celebration.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: I’ve been going to the different Prive outlets and it’s always the same case, it’s either really good or really ba

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: We had a great time tonight. Sunday was busy as usual but we didn't realise because the service was still good and fast. Aaron and KJ made sure to make our 2 year old daughter smile t

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Was here for a birthday celebration. Served by Aaron and team. He was very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the dinner experience!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Great Service. Great food. Good choice of vegan dishes. The vegetarian chicken rice is a must try. The sticky date pudding is great and vegan. Aaron was very cheerful and helpful

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Great service by Mok really friendly. Great ambience at Privè. Would love to come back next time. Thanks 😊

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Beautiful atmosphere and we had a great time as our server, Jonathan, was very attentive and courteous! Crab cakes were very delicious.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review:
Aaron you was great! Overall service from the rest was only ok. 

Food is ok, no great. 

Great location!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review:
I tried here a few times. Nice ambience.
Service is pretty fast.
Staff was friendly. 
Portions are pretty good.

Coffee is the only part I can say should improve.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: We had a wonderful time at privé tonight. I would simply say,it was all made possible by the waiter(aghilan) through his warm hospitality,prompt and attentive service.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Prive (Chijmes) is our go-to place to celebrate any occasion. Great food, delightful service and an awesome atmosphere.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Had Sunday Brunch with the family, having dined at the Keppel Bay location previously. KJ and team were very friendly without being intrusive, and made the experience a welcoming one. Unfortunately, the food quality left lots to be desired. The burger for my son had an overcooked bun and charred meat patty, while the omelette I had was paltry in portion with again an overbaked brioche bread.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: i had an outstanding 2 vegan cakes and vegan chicken pasta at this place , first tine tasted brownies without butter , milk and egg and vanilla icecream with almond milk , too devious; lovely vegan choice resteraunt in Western style .

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: The food was really amazing! We ordered food such as the club wrap, salads and finished off with pancakes for brunch. The food didn’t take very long and was cooked well. The area is open and had a nice breeze, it was enjoyable sitting outside.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: I had a fantastic vegan lunch here. The atmosphere, service and food were excellent. Highly recommend.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Nice ambience with romantic and dim lighting, friendly and helpful waitress with sweet smiling face, delicious food with nice display.  Will recommend to friends and will visit again.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Service was excellent and restaurant was busy despite it being a Monday. Would definitely come again

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Service was excellent! The environment is splendid. Will definitely come again with friends the next time.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Aghilan was very attentive to our orders and always served us with a smile on his face. Made us feel comfortable during our drinking session.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: KJ was very hospitable and made sure that we had everything we need throughout our dinner. The culinary team also did a good job of providing quality food. Their nachos with a Japanese twist is highly recommended.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: yijun is the best, good service! very attentive and prompt! was patient and friendly in handling our orders

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Would recommend! Great food for the price with big portions and variety for vegetarian and meat eaters alike.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Amazing food. Amazing ambiance. Great service where crew even went out of their way to check on us. Even got a cake request for our anniversary!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Would strongly recommend this restaurant for others to celebrate their friend's birthday. Staffs were courteous and went an extra mile to give a slice of cake with candle, to the extent to off the fan in order to light the candle for us. Super thoughtful and great service. Food and drinks are worth the money.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Staff were all nice and friendly. Had a fun chat with the staff. Drinks and food were very good. Thank you!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: great customer service from the staff here. food is great too, with the beer from happy hour. overall excellent!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Thanks to the crew for the amazing service and food! The beer was tasty as well! My family had a good dinner time

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Staffs were really friendly and helpful , good service and made our visit enjoyable. Thank you for a good time

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Nice ambiance, good music and great customer service! Very accommodating to requests :) Good food as well!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Spent a wonderful evening here with my friends. Great food, beautiful ambience and lovely staff. KJ served us and was very attentive to our needs. Would visit this gorgeous place again! :~)

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Had reserved a table for two for our anniversary dinner with Prive Chijmes - requested for a corner table and al fresco. Requested for a complimentary cake to celebrate the occasion. The Prive staff who contacted me - Shayne and Amanda - were very accommodating and assisted me in arranging table seating and the cak

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: The food was very affordable especially for a large portion! since it was my partners birthday, they offered me a complimentary cake for free. We order the linguine pasta which gave a lot of mushrooms and we ordered the mini burgers which were scrumptious! Overall I would rate the place 5/5 and highly recommended! Would definitely come again!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: food were honestly good but have to say the staffs serving and taking our orders were rather unprofessional. One of the staff served us truffle fries when we recalled we didn't order it, the staff came back and asked us if we have touched the fries and when we said no, she said "thank god" instead of apologising (hopefully she returned it to the kitchen instead of serving to another table

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Lucky we had reserved seat for the dinner. The service is just average and staff must stand there and don't know how to serve the customer. The food is just average with nothing special except the desserts are good.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Made reservation and was attended by a staff at the entrance. Not knowing why, he attended to someone who arrived later than us. Was rude in his reponse when we enquire on incremental weather plans when we were told that our seats were outdoor. Rude body language and gesture was totally uncalled for. The day was saved by another female staff who despite a long day, served us with a smile everytime she attended to us. Shame on the staff who could be the manager.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Overall good experience. Service is slow though and don’t have much vegetarian options. Ambience is good

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Food was excellent, kids loved it and David was amazing, super friendly and super busy.. David our visit memorable on my daughters birthday!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: A wonderful dinner in Privé on a Sunday night. Surprisingly the turnover rate was really high on a Sunday night and it seemed like the outlet really short of staffs. The service was quite slow and it was hard to get all the servers’ attentio

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Thought I’d treat myself in between meetings and made a reservation the day before for 1 person. I mentioned this at arrival, but the head waiter gave me a seat outdoors. It was mid-day and got too warm for comfort. I asked to be seated indoors, instead he fan just behind me switched on. Food was good, but not enjoyable with the fan blasting behind me and seated under minimal shade. I hurriedly finished my meal and went to the counter for payment. Lo and behold: there was a seat near the counter indoors, with my name written on it. The head waiter hadn’t bothered to check - I suppose solo diners aren’t taken seriously enough.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: The waiters were all friendly, attentive and helpful. We enjoyed our meal very much! Scrumptious! Family-friendly restaurant that is worth a visit.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review:
Good & friendly service to us.
Felt suprise when staff sent a birthday cake to me. Really appreciate

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review:
there were items that my friend ordered and they were not available. we assumed it is because it was a monday.

the beef ordered was a bit hard too 

otherwise all other orders were good

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Privé at Chijmes is always our favourite for its ambience, service, food and drink choices. Was amazed by their lovely gesture when they served a complimentary cake to make my daughter’s birthday memorable ❤️❤️

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: When i first reached the manager asked me and my friend to sit on a half exposed to rain table as it was still raining, his response when i said its still raining on one side was, both of u can sit at the same side and face the rain. When i asked for a change in seats as it felt unreasonable to me when i clearly booked a reservation a week earlier for my friends 21st birthday, the manager's response was "you all want you all go lo, i already explain to yall liao what" in a very rude tone. The food was okay and other staffs were nice, but the manager was very rude and unreasonable.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: I had my birthday celebration at Privé Chijmes. It was awesome and memorable. I went there with my friends and all of the staff greeted us with a smile. Then came a surprise cake for me with 2 sparkle sticks. There was a particular staff named Jon who was very attentive to our requests. Also, he would automatically change our jug of water if he sees it running low. Of all of the restaurants I’ve been to, we have to request it most of the time for a change but because of his attentiveness towards the customers, it saved us the trouble. Overall the place was very nice with ambient lighting. Really good for meet ups and catch ups with friends. Would come here again!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Outdoor ambience was absolutely stunning at night with all the fairy lights around the outlet. Had my dinner with my friends on a Monday night and surprisingly it was excellent not only the food but also the service. Despite short of staffs on Monday night but MJ served us well with vegan dishes recommendations (tried Their Heura chicken rice last time) This time tried their vegan half and half pizzas !Heard that chijmes outlet launching their new vegan dishes Tmr and I can’t wait to try!She was an excellent server that took our orders, served our food as well as drinks. Wow. Very appreciate her service and also others servers for the night ! My friends had carbonara and slipper lobster linguine and they love it

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Outdoor seating on a cool night was lovely.  Service staff named AR was great!  poactive in making recomendation and tried his best to ensure that our evening was a good one.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: This restaurant has a wonderful view and so pretty at night. My personal opinion that the standard of the food had gone down quite a bit. I would still go there for a drink just for the ambiance and friendly service.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Experienced excellent service from staff(AR) for explaining the menu details patiently and professionally. Really enjoy

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: The environment and service is good, especially the staff AR and the manager Mok is kind and helpful. Enjoy the dinner here. Definitely will come again!!!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: The environment and service is good especially staff AR and manager Mokis kind and friendly. Enjoy dinner here.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: The food and ambiance are great - ordered pasta, pizza and fries. Mr AR is very attentive and friendly. We’ll be back again.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: We really enjoyed our time here in Privé, great ambience and Mr. AR was accommodating and at the same time very good in service.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: First time here and food was great! Nice ambiance! AR was serving us-  he gave  food recommendations, friendly and quality service! Will be back again!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Had a lovely evening with friends, cocktails were great and a large choice of drinks on happy hour, staff are lovely and friendly too.  Definitely recommend visiting

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: First time dining at Prvi Chijmes. Nice place to catch up with friends. The service staff Shauna is exceptional in making our dining experience enjoyable and happy. She is cheerful, courteous and knowledgeable about the food menu. Will be back again soon.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Had a reservation at 7.15pm, reached there at 7pm, and personnel specifically promised me that we will be given a table at 7.15pm on the dot. Came back at 7.15pm again, but the personnel had us wait at least 20 minutes before giving us the tabl

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: We had a lovely dinner at Prive chimes. Nice food, pleasant easy going casual atmosphere and Customer service was great! We were shown to our table, but we preferred a different one which was a bit more undercover and asked if we could move. The staff member swiftly went to check its availability and kindly helped seat us there all in a few minute
