Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: This restaurant is a cozy little place in one of the heritage buildings in Singapore called Chijmes. It has a Lovely ambience With great waiting staff especially Shauna knew exactly all about the food that they served and she served with a smile. The other staff were also nice to us. The food was very well made and on point.. especially I love that they have good vegetarian options too!! Enjoyed our time at Privé

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: A 5+ star experience to make it a perfect weeke

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Enjoyed a boozy Saturday here. Our server AR was  very accommodating with our numerous drinks orders and he made sure we were well taken  care of. Highly recommend!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: ambience was really nice and cosy yet classy!! Server AR really made our experience so much better, going out of his way to make sure all our needs were met!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: the lobster linguine and fish and chips were both exquisite, and our server AR was fantastic, catering to our every need. the complimentary birthday cake was surprisingly great, will definitely back for not just the beautiful ambience, but amazing service and food!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Amazing service from waiter AR! Gave us solid recommendations on the food! Even asked if there’s a celebration going on! We will definitely be back! :)

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Food and the ambience was awesome ! Service by the staff was perfect ! Thank you Wan for the complements.Thank you both the service staffs (MJ and Wan) for their excellent service to make my night with my friends a special one. They are so attentive and friendly ! Love their HAPPY HOUR deals but too bad the drink of the moment was very diluted :( did not enjoy much on the drink of the moment.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: This restaurant is great to unwind with good ambience and for special occasions. Huge shout out to A.R for the excellent service and making my birthday a memorable one! Nice food too! Will come back again soon.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Celebrated my husband’s birthday here. Ambience is nice, the food is great and the service is superb! Especially, to AR who served us warmly. Thanks for the birthday cake! We’ll be back soon.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review:
It's a restaurant with nice environment, good service and tasty food. Great place for brunch.
Not too crowded in the morning but better make reservations before go.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Food and drinks were pretty good, but the ambience and service by AR were amazing. A really wholesome experience :)

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Great service from the staff and shoutout to AR who was wonderful - thanks for the anniversary cake! Food selection was also good especially with a wide selection of vegetarian dishes. Will be back again soon!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: With nice dangling headlights as the backdrop along with some G&T, what made my night at the Privé was excellent customer service. KJ was flexible and responded promptly to my requests! The pizza is excellent btw. Shout out to you KJ, you're pretty good at your job!!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Had dinner at Privé Chijmes earlier with my friends, love the ambience. Spent about $25 per person in total - food was 7.5/10 ambience 9/10. Our food was kindly recommended by the friendly staff called AR as we couldn’t decide on what to eat. Would like to thank AR for his attention to detail as he constantly refilled our water without being asked and caught the hint that we were celebrating a birthday so he offered to give us a birthday cake on the house. Overall, a great experience as we were lucky to get a table shortly despite not having a prior booking!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Was served by waiter name AR for our dinner and he was friendly and kind. Provided with good food recommendations and would definitely visit the restaurant again :)

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review:
Impeccable service from AR! 

Really enjoyed our dinner and birthday celebration - AR was very observant, friendly and even offered to ask if it was a birthday celebration! 

Will come back again just for the great service from AR. Really impressed.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review:
Wonderful ambiance and service especially from AR!
We loved our time celebrating our friends birthday!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: The Mediterranean salad was not bad but the pizza was a disappointment! Overall everything were just average.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Having brunch last Sat 11am with a friend at Prive Chijmes was the worst ever experienc

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: AR is a great waiter, with a shortage of waiter, he can still serve us with smiles and often return to us to fill up our water without us asking. He even joke with us to lighten our day. He makes us feel so at home and ease that we cannot feel there is shortage of servers. A sincere server with fantastic attitude and enjoyed his work

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Prive is always a very popular brunch spot but the branch in Chijmes has a nice and chilled outdoor atmosphere. A great spot to take a break from the bustle of the surrounding area. The staff are great too. My wife and I have been a couple of times and AR, once of the Prive team, has always been very welcoming.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Wonderful experience by one of the waitress, MJ! Requested to surprise my friend before ordering any main courses and she has done a wonderful job ! From surprising my friend with the complementary cake and Oreo pie (+ sparkles) for birthday to taking our orders and giving dishes recommendations, to helping us to take tone of photos with different angles. Definitely no regrets coming to celebrate my friend’s birthday because of MJ ! SHE IS SUPPER ATTENTIVE and FRIENDLY ! Hope will see her again on my next visit ! :D

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Stepped into this Privé outlet and felt so welcomed by the staff here, especially our waiter, A. R. He was extremely friendly and served us with so much joy. Definitely recommend going here to celebrate any occasion! Give A. R. a raise!!!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: My girlfriend and I were pleasantly surprised at the excellent quality of service here. Our waiter AR was super friendly and attentive. Also the food was really good. We really enjoyed the anniversary surprise also.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Love the service here! All the waiters here are awesome and courteous, especially Rachel whom try her best to meet our request:) The other waiters were also well mannered and patience to our request and demands! The ambience is really good and chill, good for all kinds of celebrations or even just casual hang out. Waiting time will be very long though so advisable to make reservations before hand.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: We had a nice dinner with my friends, and one staff caught our attention coz he makes our night more awesome and the service was incredible and superb. Thank you so much  "Ar" staff, who make our night unforgetable.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: First time to dine in at prive and my experience was above of my expectations the food was great with a reasonable price and such amazing service With one of their staff AR, he was very attentive from time to time he came to check if we need something else and a surprise that he gave us a surprise cake with sparklers For our friend who’s celebrating her bday.. thumbs up for your great and amazing service

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Visited Prive Chijmes to Celebrate my Friends Birthday. Our First time here so we did not expect much, but! The place is awesome! Chill vibes, Good Music and Of course, Good service. Shout out to A.R! Thank you!! And to Christian :)

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Amazing food, ambiance and service. Thank you Christian and AR for your top notch service. Special mention to AR for going the extra mile and providing us with a cake and some sparklers after knowing it is my friend’s birthday. He is always checking on us and approaching us with a smile. Will definitely come back!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Give those vegan option a try!! Meat lover will definitely love it too. Also their staff are really polite and helpful!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: After a yummy Italian dinner @ South Beach Avenue, my friends and I decided to try out a place we have never been to for desserts so we walked over to Chijmes and discovered Prive. We ordered 2 types to share and thoroughly enjoyed the tiramisu and Oreo ice cream cake. We were very surprised to see the place was packed even though it’s only a Thursday evening.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: The ice cream deserts of kid meal taste so weird. My kid got stomachache after eating it. My girl said the ice creams smell like play-doh which I taste it and felt the same!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Due to Covid-19, we opted for outdoor dining. Comfortable and beautiful seating surrounded by greeneries. We had a thin crust pizza that tasted fantasti

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Top notch service, staff were thoughtful and attentive. Great Ambience to chill, excellent suitable for celebrations.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Came here for a date. Service staff were very attentive and professional. Ambience was pleasant tho I would suggest sitting on the inside as it got quite humid outside. Food was good too!

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Overall experience was all fine UNTILL when the table behind me was seated. I was very shocked & upset that there wasn’t any social distancing at all. The back of the guest behind me could literally touch mine, if I were to lean back slightly! That was how close we were! End up, my friends & I had to move the tables away ourselves. This is something we couldn’t accept especially during this pandemi

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Food is generally well, except the fish and chips a little bland. Was there to celebrate anniversary and was told beforehand that cake will be served after dinner but the cake didnt come.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review:
A lunch meeting with peers to ponder how to enable Myrita2 to reach further and wider. 
I had a Mexican salade that was a delicious balance of rainbow colours . 🌈

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: The ambience at Privé was good with all the lightings. However food wise was just normal. In fact my friend’s carbonara was pretty bad. Good place for a little drink but maybe not so much for dinner.

Name: Prive Chijmes
Location: 30 Victoria Street #01-33 Chijmes Chijmes, Singapore 187996 Singapore
Review: Being attend by AR (waiter) during my visit to Prive. He was knowledgable as he recommend us some of their menu dishes tk try it out. As well as being attentive to our details. The food were great for everyone's tastebud!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Considered this as “ high end “ nasi lemak but quality of meat and rice is good. Chicken is almost half. That is a lot! Rice is very fragrant. Chilli at the side is yummy. More “ dry” then the usual “ wetter” versions of sambal. The otah is a good side option.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The nasi lemak is okay if you can’t get to Kuala Lumpur for the real thing. We were seated near the counter and within earshot of a crew member who was rather rude and brusque to her colleagues. She could well be a supervisor judging from her interactions with the rest of the crew. She clearly wasn’t happy working there and had the expression to suit her tone too. Not very enjoyable to dine and have to listen to someone on a power trip.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: With much disappointment, the Nasi Lemak is over-rated. The Fried chicken is not well marinated as it rather bland; the sambal is not spicy and lack the real sambal taste. The rice was however, fragrant and well cooked. For such quality, $14.80++ is a ripped off.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Had the chicken thigh nasi lemak and the taste was really excellent! The sambal given was good too! Tried also the eggplant and lala, equally excellent choices! The lala can improve further by ensuring no sand bits and most are cooked through as we had quite a few clams that are shut tight, the sauce was really good! The cendol is indeed a perfect and cooling end to the meal, unfortunately despite it's higher price as compared to normal hawker offering, it does not have a single attap chee added to complete an otherwise excellent sweet ending! Hope the management can consider adding attap chee to the cendol!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review:
nice food
nice environment
worth the wait
nice colleagues

probably can add more variety

maintaining good recipe

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: It's our 2nd visit, after COVID-19 phase 2 op

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: I won't say this is the best nasi lemak I've had because I definitely had better ones in Singapore that are half the price of what The Coconut Club charges. No doubt their chicken leg portions are great, love the chilli but for the price, I won't necessarily come back again unless I've got a friend in town who wants to try it. They're quite strict on the queue too, so make sure all your friends turn up and queue altogether since they'd only alloe you to enter when everyone turns up.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: I love to give the 5 stars but there’s something short .. the otak is kind of dry in my view and the assam pedas snapper is average. The chicken leg was good as well as the sambal lala. The rice is quite well cooked and chili sambal taste great.. not too sweet. They gave generous fried anchovies and peanuts too. The chendol is exceptionally good ... service is TOP notch and everyone work here so happily. Small waiting time during peak meal time... will comeback to try the fried fish and spicy squid again.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Had lunch here. Came at 2pm and there was a queue. Waited about 15 mins to enter. Ordered the nasi lemak chicken thigh set as the chicken breast set was sold out. Ordered a calamasi with sour plum which was a tad too diluted. The food came after a short while. Plating was quite attractive. The condiments were good, the rice was quite fluffy and the chicken was fried fragrantly. Overall a nice plate of nasi lemak and it was not thirsty later either.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Came here for lunch, service was very good and impeccable. I ordered wrongly and the staff was more than happy to sort it out, wanted my egg to be done a certain way and the request was happily accepted. As for sitting arrangements the tables are just too close for comfort, like sitting a hawker centre or food court. Table size are also small if you order extra side dish. Had the Chicken Set , cucumber pieces were fresh, peanuts and ikan bilis were crunchy with the righ texture and not oily or salty. The fried chicken leg was very well balance, moist inside and slightly crispy on the outside the way it should be, which is not easily done. The downside is the rice and sambal. Rice was not aromatic at all like plain rice, sambal had no kick or spiciness.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The best nasi lemak we have tasted so far. The chicken leg (thigh) set has really well roasted and tender thigh. The chilli was the highlight of any nasi lemak and they give a really generous portion of chilli. Sides like sambal kang kong and otah is great. The meal finish off with the best chendol in town. Perfect.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Since moving to Singapore 2 months ago, could not find a good nadi lemak until now. Rice was fluffy with just the right amount of coconut cream. Chicken was fried to perfection and moist. The sambal was great and not too sweet like most places. I truly enjoyed it and will be one of my favourite cafe.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The Nasi Lemak here is expensive but of really high quality. We loved the otah, the crispy chicken wings and the rice was extremely fragrant

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: We went the last Saturday for lunch and it was a great experience. The menu has a good choice of food, service is fast and the Nasi Lemak is absolutely yummy. The vibe of the restaurant is nice and it's a relaxing and casual place to go with friends.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: This apparently gay friendly (judging from the small rainbow flag outside) restaurant serves an excellent nasi lemak with chicken, fried beef, peanuts, dried anchovies and a delicious sambal. A cold drink to go with it and your in for a treat. I even got a free dessert to go! Delicious food for a fair price!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The food was delicious and the service was fine. I had no complaints while eating there.. however, something was off - probably the side dishes that were sitting out on the counter - and everyone in my party got severe food poisoning late in the night! It was a horrible experience unfortunately. I hope they can get their food safety standards up, as the food actually tasted quite good.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Delicious food. Super clean and chic vibes. I had the Nasi Lemak and Cendol which were both amazing. The service was fast and friendly.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: This was near to our hotel in a smart part of Chinatown, close to Maxwell Hawker Centr

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: I was there for lunch, lucky for me, I didn't have to get in line because I was quite early, Normally, the restaurant was really crowded and people waited for their turn and the line was really long. I saw it when I left the restaurant. I ordered basic set with chicken thigh. Because I had allergy to peanuts so I asked them not to put any peanuts there. Rice was really good with smell creamy of coconut. Chicken thigh was juicy. I liked their fish, it was crunchy and fun. I didn't order any drink just had ice water and I thought it was cool enough for lunch because it was hot outside, I asked for a little spicy sauce and ice water cooled down spicy food . The crazy thing was that people ate with fork and spoon which were kind of hard to use for chicken. I wish it was a knife there. Staff were really friendly.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: rocked up Saturday lunchtime and headed the queue to get in for about ten mins. This place is busy and great atmosphere. Good vibes, good demographic mix and simple menu. Went for the coconut rice 'basic' which is rice, ton of fried spicy chicken - delish!, and some fried anchovy, peanuts and fried egg. very fast service considering how busy the place is. Very inexpensive and great value, couldn't eat another thing all day. Worth queuing up for, one day you won't be able to get into this place so go now while the queues are small! enjoy !

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Way overpriced for what we got. Super boring food and we were still hungry afterwards. Would not recommend

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: A ‘must ‘ when you visit Singapo

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: We went on Saturday evening and was surprised to get a seat within 5 mins. Our order was taken very promptly; the basic nasi lemak with a couple of side dishes (otah-otah and sambal squid). The order came around 30mins; not that we are complaining, thats pretty the expectations for all the famous restaurant

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Nasi lemak is good with chicken thigh meat, the sambal for me it is spicy but still manageable, okra is amazingly delicious, beef rendang is a superstar here for me. Beef rendang is so tender and soft and full of flavours. You can't leave this place without ordering one here. The Cendul also good ^^ yummmmmssssss.... try to avoid after 12pm as it gets long queue.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The only nasi lemak to eat if you are willing to dish out 12 bucks for a plate. Excellent customer service. Will definitely return.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: When a restaurant focuses on one dish only and there are lines at both serving times to get in, you know it's for to be good! Coconut club doesn't disappoint with their star dish being amazing. Succulent chicken coupled with fragrant coconut rice with peanuts, ikan bilis and a lovely and deep sambal make for an amazing dish. There are a number of side dishes which are also lovely, curry chicken, sambal kangkung, ladys fingers help to make a perfect meal. The portions are great and the price just right. If you want to get a seat, come late in the afternoon on weekdays or 15 minutes before the afternoon and evening service starts. Weekends are busy but the wait is worth it!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Always a queue, even on weekdays. Run by millennials. Efficient service. Open concept. Add ons are generally more expensive than the basic meal itself. Avoid the otah which is an add on.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Heard about this place from a foodie friend. Was told that while their nasi lemak (coconut milk flavored rice) is priced on the higher side, it is delicio

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: we were walking around at lunch time when we came across this beau

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Was walking around chinatown in Singapore and I cane across the CoConut Club. Fantastic atmosphere, great staff, extremely friendly to a weary traveler. You may need to share table with others, but I didn’t find it an issue.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Saturday brunch with friends from KL. We had the nasi lemak with chicken thigh and shared the otak, sambal kang Kong and paru sambal lado (beef lungs) which was surprisingly good. My KL friends liked it, very close to the traditional nasi lemak they get back home, especially the chilli paste. It gets crowded between 1130-12 noon. Good thing we arrived at 11am.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Restaurant atmosphere is real nice located in good location. Service is beyond expectation,restaurant explained us about their meal including its ingredient. Our fav dish,Nasi Lemak,tastes good. Sure we will be backnext time.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Wife an

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: What is the worst thing and the first thing to settle when you go to a restaurant or hawker centre in Sin? Where to sit, right? Coconut Vlub has this nailed. Rows of basic yet comfortable seats, and they get diners to line up outside so they can be brought in when seats are available. We cheated the rush by arriving for lunch at 11.45. The food? Who does not know or like nasi lemak in its many varieties? Food comes fresh with hearty portions. Extras included long beams and a lodeh-type gravy with pumpkin. Due to a small ordering hiccup a dish arrived late - the server brought us some kueh FOC to make up for inconvenience altho we expected nothing. A good lunch experience and good to see a happy and passionate staff.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Their "The Basic Nasi Lemak" is a must ordered dish come with Breast or Leg set. The otak-otak is worth to try as you can eat the fish meat inside. Worth to queue for their food. But it is not near to the train station.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Delicious coconut rice with chilli, runny egg, fried chicken thigh! Easy on the palate for most tourists and a must try local Malay food. Located in the upmarket Ann Siang hill, prices are four times that of what you’ll get in a hawker but a good choice for tourists to try local food in a comfortable setting.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Sambal makes good nasi lemak. In this case, they have proven right. Expensive if you compare to hawker centre standard. About 25 dollars per person. But worth the family outing together on Sunday.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: We went to Coconut Club last night. There was a long line. We got in line and waited for about 30 minutes to get a table. The service was horrible. It was at least another 20 minutes before a server even talked to us. The woman who seated us seemed shocked that no one had taken our order. She took our order and our food was so-so. We then ordered dessert and waited and waited. We asked about it and the person who took our order never submitted it so they had to take our order again. We were not thrilled by the experienc

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: We were seeking authentic Malaysian and landed on Coconut club vía TripAdvisor. The clientele was clearly local & young. The food was out of this world! We needed a bit of help deciphering the menu but both staff and people around us helped and made recommendations. Everyone here was friendly from the waiter, to the girls who made food recommendations, to the woman who handed my husband her water when he coughed, to the man who explained the origin of the deserts & paid for our Grab! It was like joining a community, the beef Rendang still haunts me for its multilayered spicing , the nasi lemak is perfection & the deserts - aah! This place is perfection and I WILL be back.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Had a fantastic meal here and the staff were really helpful and friendly.  Had the traditional Nasi Lemak followed by Cendol with adzuki beans. Would thoroughly recommend.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: overpriced tourist trap. the nasi lemak is nothing special. the chicken meat is hardy and looks like not properly cooked. the staffs are unfriendly and seem to rush everybody to order. the cashier play with his phone when we are paying and we have to wait until he's done with his business before he attend to us.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The famed Nasi Lemak and Chendol were decent but not exceptional. The best part of my visit to the Coconut Club was surprisingly the 5-star service rendered by one of its servers named Fifi. He was cheerful, chirpy and caring. He would regularly swing by to ensure that we had enough rice, made sure we sample the best desserts and vegetable dishes. Fifi is the best server in SG that I have come across in years in SG.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: What a fabulous place! The team was nice enough to make a reservation for me on request as it was my husband’s birthday. We tried their Nasi Lemak, sambal sotong and ladies fingers. All full of flavour, spice and absolutely delicious. Well worth the money and the staff too was great!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Yumm!! Ordered “the basic” which seems to be the most popular and I can definitely see why. Flavours were amazing and for the price you couldn’t find better food in a sit down restaurant. The staff even brought over an extra chicken curry dish for us to try for free.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The huge piece of fried chicken (you get to choose between breast/white meat or thigh/dark meat) and large portion of ikan bilis and peanuts plus the ambience helped justify the price you pay for that plate of Nasi Lem

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review:
The food is good as in most places in Singapore!
The location is great, the ambience is very nice, and the prices are so cheap for big portions!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The Nasi Lemak here is very good. But the service could be improved. We waited 1 hour for the table, which is fine. But they need to better manage their turnover tables. With people queuing for over 1 hour the staff need to help rotate the tables. Their was a Chinese family that had finished and paid but were allowed to stay at the table 25 minutes after they paid. It was not until we came in that they finally vacated. Given the long queues they need to better manage this.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: This is my 1st visit to The Coconut Club. I have read about it online as one of the TOP 10 for serving the best Nasi Lemak in Singapore. I had Nasi Lemak (chicken breast fillet) as my main & Cendol as my cold dessert. The Nasi Lemak consists of coconut rice, chicken, Ikan Bilis, peanuts, cucumber, fried egg and samba. The Nasi Lemak was well prepared, the fillet was juicy and easily chewable, the flesh was soft. The rice was with a delicate coconut flavour and soft. The Ikan Bilis (Dried Anchovies) was not fishy, it was pleasantly crunchy, the egg was perfectly cooked and with no egg smell and surely not overcooked, the peanuts tasted fresh and well roasted. The balance of flavour was just right. This was my 1st Nasi Lemak and a perfect one. I went ahead with the cooling dessert of Cendol. I love this dessert with Pandan leaves flavour and coconut milk, it was smooth and delightful. My drink was the fragrant lemongras

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review:
Had a great meal with friends and my 2 year old. The staff were amazing with us and my daughter as we waited and ate.

Famous for the Nas Lemak and I can understand why! The Beef Randang was also delicious

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: I have been to coconut club before not to their new location that is just up the road of their old address. I visited with my husband and 2 year old daughter. We went on a Sunday at 11.20am. They don't take reservations but the wait isn't too long. Whilst you wait, you can help yourself to some refreshments of water, iced tea and wines. This was pretty nice. Once our table was ready we were escorted to our table. They brought a toddler chair for my daughter as they ran out of baby chairs. This was perfect for her. I have never been to restaurant with a toddler specific chair before. We ordered 2 sets of nasi lemak and a child's set. Children get to eat for free. Their set comes with coconut rice, peanuts, ikan bilis, and cucumber which is just nice for kids. The staff were so friendly especially to my daughter. The nasi lemak was good and a good portion too. After lunch we ordered Cendol and Coconut Jelly. Both were a nice refreshing dessert to have after nasi lemak. We will be coming back. Thanks Coconut Club!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Very friendly and attentive service. Apparently use Tapioca flour on the chicken and you can request a gluten free sambal. Overall I found it a bit light on flavour but the chicken was certainly moist and I enjoyed the sambal. Expensive compared to hawker stalls but I can’t eat this dish at those and this is not a hawker stall.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: I have visited the coconut club at my very first time in Singapore. While exploring the place, I was looking for food options and come across with the place. The staff were very polite and friendly. Served the meal quickly even though the place was crowded. It was indeed a decent meal just like what you see in the picture. The quality, presentation and the taste of the food was excellent. The price is relatively high but I'm sure it is fair vs the good food they ser

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Went to the Coconut Club for the first time a couple of nights ago. Have been wanting to try this restaurant for months. The food was very good especially the fried chicken. The coconut rice was very tasty and the chillie sambal was excellent! We tried some of the side dishes like sambal sotong, lady’s fingers, sambal la la & the tofu. Everything was good. We had the chendol for dessert and that was good too. The restaurant takes no reservations so be prepared to line up and wait up to 40 minutes. The wait is worth the while.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Read so many good reviews about this place and we decided to give it a

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Suggested by Lonely planet so went there with my family for dinner.  Great food and very friendly people.  Free meals for the kids!  The chicken was great but also likes the crispy fish side dish very much.  Will not hesitate to come again

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: We decided to try patronizing coconut club for a colleague's farewell on Friday. Fortunately queue was managed well with thoughtful offer of iced water and lemon tea to combat the blistering noonday s

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: I must be slacking. This must be my 4th if not my 5th time back at at The Coconut Club for lunch and I have written a review for i

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: As a local, its the first time I tried the food. But I’m willing to pay for the amount as the ambience, quality of food, and servtitude are excellent. Quatity of food is generous and well execut

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review:
Coconut club is probably twice expensive as any other nasi lemak in town, but you got a full flavorful set with a nice environment and friendly staff. 
Not to miss.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Being a local I have tried many of the different kind of Nasi Lemak( Coconut milk rice, served with sambal, fried crispy anchovies, toasted peanuts and cucumber.) and its accompanied dishe

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: I won't say the food isn't tasty - the nasi lemak is excellent. But I ate there last night and two hours later felt quite unwell and had a bad stoma

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Heard about this place and wanted to try it. Didn’t disappoint. Where else can you get really good nasi lemak with draught beer. Good stuff.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: My wife and I went here on 17th May 2019. We had only one portion of their Nasi Lemak with extra Sambal Sotong and Otak-Otak. In addition, I had Ice Barley as my dri

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Though the price is higher than normal nasi lemak, i can see and taste the effort the kitchen team has been putting into this rice dish. The chicken leg (really a chicken leg, with drumstick and thigh, not just a drumstick mentioned as chicken leg) is tender and juicy, just cooked to perfect, not overcook

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: They specialized in one plate (nasi lemak) with various side dishes to choose from. While it’s a bit far to walk from either Telok Ayer or Chinatown, it’s quite popular for lunch and you need to expect lining up after 11:30 or so, while it’s worth waiting. Staffs are all friendly and they serve your orders quite fast - they even shared us a few kinds of Malaysian desserts on the plate. This is my must-go place in Singapore.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Overall, the nasi lemak set is filling and tasty. Simply love the sambal okra! Really tasty and flavourful. The fried chicken is tender with some crispy bits but it could have been better if it is seasoned longer with the herbs / spices before frying them. The tender chicken drumstick meat is tasteless with some pinkish bits as compared to other nasi lemak chicken I have eaten elsewhere. If you are thinking of coming here during the weekends, be sure to come early as the wait can be 20 mins or longer, depending on the size of the group. The group is only seated when everyone is present.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The Michelin Guide has started making a point of recognizing the very best examples of 'real' food at reasonable prices. Like Jay Fai in Bangkok, the Coconut Club is a perfect example in Singapore. They have a simple but perfectly prepared Nasi Lemak. All the components are done to perfection (especially the chicken) and the sum of the parts is even better if that is possible. A simple dish that is done with great attention to detail. Get there early as there will be a line.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The Coconut Club was on our list to eat at. Serving the best nasi lemak in town was the claim, and we now have the evidence to back it up. We arrived just before opening time for lunch. It was already busy, though not open. Large bags of takeaway containers were being carted aw

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Had such a lovely dinner here with friends. The neighbourhood is very vibey in the evenings which just adds to the appeal. The Coconut Club specialises in Nasi Lemak which I'd never had before so can't review comparatively but was absolutely scrumptious here. We were hoping to also order the vegetables in coconut milk but they'd unfortunately run out; however the chef was more than happy to whip up some veggies for us which was appreciated. I also had a lovely G&T with kaffir lime leaves in which was a first.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: An interestingly different area to visit very close to Chinatown, and a tremendous venture, specialising in tasty nasi lemak and cendol, plus a handful of specials -we enjoyed the okra special.. Craft beer, wine, or iced lemongrass drinks. If you love great nasi lemak, go to the Coconut Club!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The best nasi lemak in town! Fried chicken coated with shredded coconut is the best you can have in Singapore

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Went there on a Saturday night after seeing good reviews and was not disappointed. There was no queue when I arrived and was seated promptly. The menu is understandably small but has the different variations and dishes to go along with the delicious plate of nasi lemak. The coconut rice is fragrant and goes well with the sambal chilli. The rice refill is free. The usual ingredients such as ikan bilis and peanuts elevated the palate and the best part of the dish had to be the chicken thigh. It is so succulent and juicy with a thin cripsy layer of skin and fat. It's a splendid plate of local dish and I am already craving for more. Special thanks to the restaurant for a complimentary dessert, the coconut tart is light and texture is well done.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Good team and great food, always consistent and certainly a excellent example of one of our favorite local fare! Treats their customers and their staff with respect and kindness... inspiring

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: had the nasi lemak and otak for dinner. Chendol for dessert. their prices are a bit on the higher side. rice is really little. gets busy easily.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Arrived at 2pm for lunch and there’s still a line. Staff look stressed and service quality is not great. Ok and overpriced food

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Was recommended to eat here by a friend and after a lovely walkabout visiting temples, we decided to try and look for The Cocon

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: quaint shophouse setting serving peranakan dishes. nasi lemak was flavorful, chilli was a little too spicy for me, but overall a very good experience on a sunday afternoon.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The nasi lemak, fried fish and all the other dishes are as good as all the other reviews had written about it. Our waitress recommended the fried lady fingers which is very good too. The desserts are in a class of their own. The cendol is out of this world good tasting! All the kuehs were sedap! With such good food, you would think that this restaurant is already tip top. Here comes the icing on the cak

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: We came here by chance at around lunch time and had the specialty of the house as the main dish. It’s simple, but good. Be prepared to queue for 15 min if you come here at lunch, it seems to be very popular! Since we arrived for women’s day, we got free desserts on the house. Both delicious, although we still don’t know what we had. One of them was white, like jelly and tastes just like a fresh coconut. The other was a layered dark rice and green cream cake. Sometimes simple is better than fancy and complicated and this place makes this point really clear. The stuff is super friendly and even explains you the dishes in spite of the really hectic lunch period, where the place is packed! I would definitely recommend it! Did I mention the prices are actually pretty decent, too?

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The staff taking the number of guests refused to give an available table and tell us straight that she is reserving the table for the guests right away behind us. Isn’t the queue for guests waiting to be selected on a first time first basis? She wanted to squeeze 3 of us in a table for 2 until I told her that I will ordering sides and the table is way too small. She repeated “confirmed huh” 3 times and told her colleague that you hear him huh... he will ordered sides. It’s extremely rude!!!! A real spoiler to me hoping to enjoy a good lunch!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: I loved everything about the restaurant. The queue to get a seat was fairly short and we did not wait long. The decor is very nice. The food great and the waitress was very patient and explained the dishes. I had Cendol for dessert which was fabulous. And we were really pleased to be given a complimentary portion of Kueh which are local style sweets which were fabulous. Thank you to the team.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: I was only in Singapore for a few days on a work trip and wanted a break from the business of the amazing hawker markets. I found great reviews of the nasi lemak online so decided to check it out. As mentioned, it's not the cheapest by any stretch, but it is delicious! Tender chicken and beautiful sambal. Washed down with a glass of rosè, and quick efficient service, it was a great place to stop for a meal.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Mainly serves Nasi Lemak rice and more local cuisine like Sambal lala, Sambal sotong, otak otak, and few more. Easy to find locate at Ann siang hill rd, delicious foods with chill ambience. I like the Nasi Lemak rice here, soft and mild. Crispy yet tender chicken and tasty seasonin

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: For the moment i was thinking $12 for nasi lemak is ridiculous. After queuing for 15 minutes we got place to sit.. Nasi lemak was awesome and worth it.. Try cendol too.. It was good.. Will recommend it to all TripAdvisors travelers

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Loved the food here. Delicious, authentic, spicy, flavours in a relaxed setting. This place gets busy, so be prepared to ‘Q’.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The Chendol lives up to its reputation! Made from scratch, it had the right combi with nice portion size. The gula melaka was the star of the dish and simply amazing

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Have heard several times on the interwebs about this Nasi Lemak place and when we were in Singapore were brought there by a local friend. This place didnt' disappoint. The owners went to Malaysia and brought back recipes that had been passed down through generations of nonya families. The fact that they only serve nasi lemak shows that they have perfected their dish. Rich, full of flavour and delicious chicken paired with exquisitively spicy sambal and crunchy Ikan bilis and peanuts, topped off with a perfectly fried egg. Otak otak were equally tasty made with freshly caught fish! If you are craving a truly authentic Nasi Lemak outside of Malaysia, don't miss Coconut Club!

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The nssi lemak is highly recommended. Fried chicken is nice.  Chendol is great, seems home made. They served IPA beer which was very nice.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Heard many good reviews about this food establishment, and we gave a try. Definitely the price is at higher side, compared to other local nasi lemak places, but it was worth it. The fried chicken was well marinated, and the rice was just delicious. Please also try their sambal sotong ...

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: If u are looking for very good authentic Nasi lemak that's rich in flavour and portion. This is the place to.go

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: One of the best Nasi Lemak!! Ordered a second round of rice and loved it ! Will definitely be back !

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: After strolling around Chinatown decided to stop by at this place for lunch. Wow, it was delicious. I will definitely come back many times.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Was here with local friends who recommended Coconut Club and was delighted that they did - single plate of food that was excellent (it is all they do so it should be super consistent!) but we also ordered side dishes of clams and squid which were both excellen

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: We loved our visit to the Coconut Club! I took my parents on a Sunday lunch and we had to queue. Thankfully we only waited for about 20 minutes (though water was provided, and you could buy other drinks whilst you waited

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Great food, great service. The kopi was really good too. Get there early to beat the rush of the crowd.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Stopped off in chinatown mid tour Hop On Hop Off bus. While waiting for the next bus, we got caught in a rainstorm so ducked into the nearest restaurant and was pleasantly surprised. Place was packed with locals so we knew we were in for a treat.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: The house specialty is Nasi Lemak which they do beautifully! You can add a variety of dishes including Otak Otak and vegies in coconut milk. The dessert of choice is cendol which is also great especially the candied red beans

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: If you are into coconut and spices, this is the place for you. The coconut rice is so fragrant; the chicken leg is cooked just right; Sambal adds mild flavor of the river and the runny egg yolk just round it up....yummmm :) no reservation is available here, try to avoid lunch hours if possible to avoid the long line.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review: Lovely busy little restaurant, attentive staff and one of the best Nasi Lemaks I have eaten. Freshly made, promptly served and the spicy sambal really lifted the dish. We also had a dish of clams in a spicy sauce and they were delicious. Definitely worth its reputation and amazingly cheap (around AUD12 for the Nasi Lemak). The wine was expensive, but it’s Singapore.

Name: The Coconut Club
Location: 28 Ann Siang Road, Ann Siang House Ann Siang House, Singapore 069708 Singapore
Review:
Every time we visit Singapore we always come here. We always come in a big group - 10 plus and the staffs are always very accommodating to give us the table. 

The nasi lemak, samba Sotong and pipis,
Chendol are very yummy

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Great place, great atmosphere and lovely food. Super friendly staff,  knowledgeable and able to make great recommendations. Good food, mixture of some Italian, Mediteranean, English and Asian

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
Nice food and good ambiance and nice Staff.
The food is worth the money and affordable.
Better to reserve before visiting as we encountered once problem as no space when we walked in.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: A gem hidden at one of the Safra Clubs, along Rifle Ran

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
Cha kway teow is wet style but not bad, waffle good, hokkien mee not good.
Try to sit at window to get nice view of pool and trees. It’s quite crowded so better reserve first. 
Haral foods.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Ordered takeaway from the restaurant. I was sweating due to my 3.5 hrs long walk from Macritchie Reservoir to Temasek Club. The service staff took the initiative to give me some paper towels to wipe my sweat while waiting for the food. The food turns out to be very delicious and well presented! Good job!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: 3 of us came for weekday lunch, we had a really enjoyable lunch - nice greenery outside the windows, quiet place for catchup, portions are substantial without burning a whole in your wall

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: The appetisers - Saracha chicken wings sauce was nice in general, however I had a drumlet that was undercook and red and raw near the bone. The winglets were fin

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
A friend brought me here for lunch. I like the coziness of the location but I have to say the service was quite bad. Like they cannot be bothered to serve customers.

The food was OK

That is all I can comment

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Nice food, nice ambiance..  great place for lunch and dinner with the whole family or your loved ones..   Kind of a regular customer here and always coming back for more...

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Went to the Temasek Club outlet. Had the fried chicken burger together with shared truffle fries. The truffle fries were really good, having both truffle oil and truffle mayo to give double the happiness! The burger, however, was average at its price point. The chicken was cut slightly too thin and so ended up being slightly drier than it should/could be.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: We had a reunion at this restaurant, to celebrate the passing of another year. The menu selection was good, the ambience was very suitable, and the service was great. The food variety is also good. I enjoyed the burger very much (although my colleague commented that I could have had the same food item from McDonald's at a much lower price). The truffle fries and dessert options are good ones to have. Worth the price!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: If you are at bukit timah area, drop by this affordable restaurant located at Temasek Club. Seemed to be run by Malay chefs, so you won’t go wrong with ordering Malay food and decent western menu. Forget about the chinese menu section.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: My first visit to the restaurant. The food were quite nice and of good quality. Cost is above average, good varieties, service staffs were polite and helpful.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Good place for a leisurely meal. Dont forget to take in the fantastic Bali/Bandung like views. Portions of local and western fare are generous and food is generally tasty all round...Truffle fries and teh tarik go hand in hand here...

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
Went to the Temasek Club outlet.

The menu has a wide variety from Asian to Western cuisine. Food tastes great with good portion.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Finding this restaurent was a delight! It has High ceilings, and very bright with full glass windows. The evening sun shines very brightly into their dining space until about 6.30 pm. Service could be challengingly slow and on weekends, and many food items could be sold out by dinner time. Not a place where we could bring our special guests. They have a very interesting varied menu, from steak to spicy Nasi Biryani. We ordered many dishes so we could have a good assessment of the quality of the cuisine. We had scallop fried rice with squid and prawns with belachan - very tasty, also oily. The Oyster blade was good. The lamb biryani was amazing!! Their chicken wings was red spicy, crabmeat mee tai bak was too soggy and spicy. Very family friendly, noisy and popular place.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Kibda alfresco dining at temasek country club overlooking lust greeneries...relax n chilling...local fusion meditteranean...

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Came here for my birthday celebration this year. Food was really nice. Had an Australian Ribeye steak which was cooked really nicely and was very flavorful - the fries was good too. The other members of my family had a variety of food from the menu and were all pleased with their dishes. Being in Temasek club, the location is pretty inaccessible on foot and driving or cabbing would be necessary. As Spize is a popular restaurant, it would be good to book the place in advance especially if you are bringing a big group.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Set in beautiful Temasek Club,this restaurant serves really good food. The presentation is impressive for all the dishes we ordered, and we ordered plenty. Prices are quite high as expected in this setting. Service though not bad, could be friendlier.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: I was there for a afternoon and I had a good long black, enjoying the nice environment and coffee. Despite raining outside, this place is quiet and cool. The price is not exactly very expensive as I expected in the country club, but its roughly the Starbucks type of expenditure. Tried the finger food, not great, but its ok.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
The menu is slightly different from their usual spize menu..they have western/Mediterranean & Asian food which is perfect for a group..you can book in advance to avoid the Long queue during peak hours..
Reasonably priced for good quality..

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Outlet was crowded and noisy on a Friday lunch. Ordered Nasi Goreng Ayam $9.50++, Bee Hoon Goreng $9.50++, Roast Chicken $19.90++, Earl Grey $5.80++, Kopi Terek $3.00++. Have to wait for a while for the food. Ice water is served. The Bee Hoon Goreng is good. Nasi Goreng was oily. The Roast Chicken is a little too sweet for me. Must make reservation on line. Would be good to eat the window view. Service was good despite being buzy. Portion size is good. Will visit again.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Lovely place for meals. View of lush greenery. Food is good. Service is pleasant. Prices reasonable considering the portion and location. Thumbs up!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: We were a group of 4 adults + 2 children. Ordered 2 mains, 1 kids meal and 1 spaghetti frizzante for 2. All were served except the spaghetti which took more than 30mins to come despite reminding or checking on our orders. The waiters just shoved us aside and said it was coming.. the rest finished their food and the outstanding order finally came. It was not very pleasant as it was our treat to our elderly parents who had to wait ao long for their food. We hope Spize can up their level of service in this. If order was missed, or would take very long, please advise. If there was an error, amendments or apologies could have been mad

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: We did lunch on Friday here to celebrate our anniversary. The online booking failed as we arrived without a confirmed booking nevertheless they have a table for us. The restaurant is situated on the Temasek Club. Service is fast and prompt. We had the mussels and crab meat as starter which was good in the sambal chili gravy, the NZ ribeye was great and the fish Briyani was not bad. The coffee was decent and we were to full for dessert. Restaurant seem to take many reservation even on a Friday lunch so best to reserve ahead. Price wise is average.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Today was my second visit to the Rifle Range outlet as I really liked the ambience on the first visit. This time, I am extremely disappointed by the service by one of the female middle-aged wait staff. Her rude attitude totally spoiled my birthday celebration. She spoke brusquely to my family and I, and when she missed out my order, rudely insisted that she had repeated the order when she had not done so. I was so speechless at such offensive behaviour. We did not deserve to be treated like that. I was appalled when I saw other reviews (TripAdvisor) by other customers who also experienced rude service by the wait staff. The food was also on the salty side. This is the going to be my last visit to Spize at Temasek Club.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Went there with friends for dinner. We had to queue about 10 min before getting a table. The menu is Asian, and western food. For Asian food you will find Indian, Malay, Indonesian, Thai, and Chinese food. The service was fast and the food was very good.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Was there last Saturday for dinner with my family. We ordered both Asian and Western selections from the menu and were not disappointed. The portion for the Asian selections like Nasi Goreng Kampung was huge. I had The Royale burger which was made with a buttered brioche bun (yummy!) and served with fries topped with freshly grated parmesan. My daughter had the ribeye steak medium rare and it was cooked perfectly - nicely pink without being bloody. We also had waffles and gelato for desserts. Overall a very satisfying meal for the family.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
I like the food . Good portion and are tasty . It’s a place for family to go and enjoy . 

Environment is cozy and the price is reasonable.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Lazy Sunday late morning and we're looking for places that not too crowded with Asian & Western Veriaty food choices. My wife suggested Rifle Range Road. We drove there as this will be my first time and I didn't know what to expec

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: ~it's gonna be a long way driving in to the Temasek Club on Rifle Range Road but once there, just dropoff your passengers at the main entrance since Spize is right in front of it's do

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Brought my dad for a weekday dinner after two positive experiences with Spize(Rifle Range). Online reservation was smooth. A tip would be to indicate the preferred seats along with your reservation. Service at dinner was swift and prompt. For starters, we had hummus dips along side with the mussels + crab meat. Main courses we had Royale Burgers, lamb wrapz, fillet fish burger and morrocan chicken. The chicken was not impressive and lacked lustre, probably won't order this again. Drinks we had Grande Longan frosty and coffee latte. The frosty was absolutely great for a warm evening and a perfect way to complement our dinner.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
Good food! Both Asian and Mediterranean choices are fantastic! Try the Hokkien Prawn Mee and the Sriracha & honey chicken burger!! 
If no reservation, can probably get a table either 5pm or 8pm during weekends. Therefore, reservation is highly recommended. 
Thumbs up!!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: We had a group of 24 for dinner. Since it's a big group, we sent out order to them in advan

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: We had a office get-together here for the 1st time. As it is lunchtime, we need to wait a bit longer for out food to be served. service is good. will be back again

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Food presentation was great, table was tidy and ready before arrival. Confirmation sms was sent 2 days, the day before and on the day itself.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Good service, delicious food! Great for group gatherings but need to reserve early! Italian and Malay cuisine were good!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
Enjoyed the lamb chops that I went back two days in a row... the grilled chicken was also very good.

I like this place as it has a great view of the Bukit Timah forests and a relaxed environment!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: I've been eating at the other Spize outlets down at River Valley and mostly, the one at Bedok. This outlet has got to be my favourite - simply 'cos of the ambience and setting. The food presentation as well as staff service was great. The price is abit on a high side as compared to the same dish you can get at their other outlets. But it's a good price to pay for just a nice meal out with your loved one

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: I have never like portobello mushroom and I never had any idea if it tasted that good in a burger until I ate one in this restaurant. The service was excellent, their staffs are very nice and always check whether your need is satisfyingly fullfilled. Will return for sure.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: The burger is very nice. The servers are friendly and helpful when we cannot decide what to order... Happy that they have waffles!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: The food was nice and reasonable. Booked 10.30am and food can only be served after 11am. Overall good. Worth the visit.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: We are a group of 7 people and we made a reservation on the morning for a quiet spot. And this was met. The food was great. However, the speed at which the food was serve may need to be reconsider. One of my colleague has finish her main course but the main courses for the rest of the 6 people has not yet arrive. Also, it is rather hard to call for the waitress/waiter to add orders.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Was at spize for a birthday celebration and apart from good mains the staff were very sporting with a rich salted caramel waffle with a candle and singing

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Love the brownie!!! Love the ice cream! Love the lamb briyani! Coffee is great! Service is fantastic!!! Absolutely love this place!!!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Food is nice and the servers are polite. The ambiance is cosy and the pool view is magnificent. Food is also value for money.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: SPIZE @ rifle range is becoming one of the family's fav dining spot with its wonderful ambience & great food. One minor peeve was music was too loud.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: The restaurant offers very good food at reasonable price. It's housed within Temasek Club at Bukit Timah. Twice when we went for lunch, it's almost full house, with many army officers. Therefore a bit noisy. We made reservation and had a table overlooking the swimming pool and greenery. The menu is extensive from Asian to western. The truffle fries is very good! Must try! Nasi Goreng Kampung is spicy and yummy. My friends like the Royale - beef burger comes with fries and a big portion. The Penang Char Kway Teow isn't the dry version but has some gravy and a tad sweet. Not quite my liking though. Servicing is good and fast.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: all went smooth....great service even with change of timing...food came out not too late..food there was amazing..atmosphere is very calm n peaceful..

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Staff Gathering. Good service and good food. Staff responds promptly to any queries. Friendly service. Nice ambience l

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: This place is very popular. Remember to make reservation. Food is very decent for the price. Very nice atmosphere.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Thumbs up to the Boss for the excellent food and service! Will certainly be back for other items on the menu!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Overall was great just that maybe the staff be more attentive for ordering food especially. Few incidents is we try to order food but they were busy with other stuffs or gesture saying will come back later or focus point maybe did not see us. Maybe can allocate more staff?

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: The only bad thing I could think of would be the waitwe being to slow on taking order .can seem to get order in 10 mins sometimes

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: The food is nice and the price is reasonable too. Ambient is good and I would recommend friends n family to dine at Spize.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: My second time visiting. Brought my parents for Parents Day dinner. Love the atmosphere. Crowded as usual. Food portion was huge. My family certainly enjoyed themselves.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: A place with great ambience, delicious food & fantastic service. Made reservation through Chope & it was such an easy & hassle free experience. Thank you!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: It was very nice! But service could have been better, took quite a while to get staffs attention, as they were very busy.

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
We went there (Riffle Range) in big group. The service pretty fast and the people there are very friendly. 
Love the ambience too!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Food 5/5, ambience 5/5. It was just perfect! Great for any events; dates, family dinner, friends. Food was high quality and the atmosphere of the restaurant was top notch. Will recommend to others and definitely pay another visit!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Without asking, they have prepared plain water and dates for us to break our fast before food was served. Great service and good food!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review:
Good customer service... 👍
Nice ambience... ☺
Cosy place to hv a romantic dinner... 😊
Service was fast too...

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Waitress/waiter dressing Looks all service are excellent me and family love this place to eat and will come down again..

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
Review: Went there to break fast with family. Food was great, little waiting time for it to arrive, and the atmosphere was lovely. Service staff were good too! Would definitely return!

Name: Spize
Location: 131 Rifle Range Road #03-04, Temasek Club, Singapore 588406 Singapore
