Location: 3 D River Valley Road #01-12 Clarke Quay, Singapore 179023 Singapore
Review: Had a wide variety of authentic sounding Mexican food. Never had them in Mexico so I wild know exactly how they taste like, but generally good!

Name: Senor Taco Clarke Quay
Location: 3 D River Valley Road #01-12 Clarke Quay, Singapore 179023 Singapore
Review: Food is value for money, was served by friendly and attentive staff making my dining experience enjoyable. Will go back again

Name: Senor Taco Clarke Quay
Location: 3 D River Valley Road #01-12 Clarke Quay, Singapore 179023 Singapore
Review: Taco ingredients were not generous at all, music was abrupt and played off YouTube. Happy hour was decent and so was the service

Name: Senor Taco Clarke Quay
Location: 3 D River Valley Road #01-12 Clarke Quay, Singapore 179023 Singapore
Review: We stopped here mostly for margaritas, but did have some food as well. We sat outside, where on can observe the passing crowd and surrounding action in the busy Clarke Quay part of town. Although it was raining hard, the wonderful high canopies that have been constructed over the outdoor areas between the buildings kept us nice and dry. The margaritas were good, if expensive (as is all alcohol in Singapore), and the food was typical Mexican fare.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Family owned and very authentic. Food is delicious and the staff is as warm as an Italian staff should be. Worth the price you pay. Best in town!

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
Went on 23 Dec with another couple. The place is full. Very decent space between tables perhaps becoz of safe distancing so you feel comfortable. Staff are cheerful and effecient.

My steak is excellent. Another had sole and said it was excellent too

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: It was a very good experience at No Menu, we decided to try the "surprise" menu and we were totally satisfi

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: I heard positive comments about "No Menu" so I came with expectations... what a disappointment it was

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: You know what you get when you go to No Menu. Great food, the pasta here is amazing. I had the Vitello Tonnato, it feels like I am in Italy. My pasta was also delicious.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
This intimate family Italian restaurant is such a fun place for lunch. Friendly service where most of the staff are from Italy. 

If you like truffle and burrata, this will be your place. I was fond of the ossobuco. The wine selection is impressive.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Own and cooked my Italian family restaurant with very authentic Italian cooking. Simple food like fried calamari, burrata cheese with ham and sautéed clams with white wine can be so so good here. The truffle pasta kind of average. The pork chop with crispy potato toppings are just average . Lovely wine selection with friendly waiter to attend to you.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Love the food and the service at No Menu. We’ve been back a few times after discovering the restaurant in January. I love the Buratta with Parma ham, it’s so fresh and the cherry tomatoes are delicious! Also recommend their Tiramisu and panacotta. We’ve been there as a couple, and with family and friends and had a great experience each time.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: No Menu has delicious Italian food. The service is excellent, the place is nice and very busy. We had their “degustation” menu which consisted on an antipasti plate which was delicious. Then the pasta dish which has three types: gnocchi, bolognese and a risotto. Then you can choose from fish or meat. And last the dessert which consisted of tiramisu, apple cake and pannacot

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Food is ok here but I would say for the amount you pay not worth it. My husbands family is Italian so he makes all of our Italian dishes so maybe my pallet is tuned to his food but I think in general the food was not overly impressive. The tiramisu and apple cake were really good and the pasta was fresh good flavor and not eggy so that was another plus. I think it’s hard to do good Italian in Singapore without it being super expensive...it’s just not worth it for me

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: A cozy family style Italian restaurant, giving you a felling of having a fine Italian meal at your home. We order 3 appetisers from house recommendation to share with 4 individual dishes and everything was delicious. Good wine selection however found bit expensive.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Loved this restaurant. Great food , excellent service. The upstairs dining room is small and intimate- with an antique, cosy feel. Even let you try wines before ordering - when only having a glass and open a new bottle for you! We’ll definitely be back .

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: The kitchen is authentic Italian. They are great at catering to intolerances and allergies. Staff professional, helpful, nice.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Our group had dinner in the homely private dining room upstairs. The best things about the evening were the superb friendly and proactive service, and the focaccia! The mains - be it asparagus risotto or chicken milanesa - were decent, but nothing to write home about. There are many better Italian restaurants around, including in the CBD.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: New Year's Eve dinner, the place looks good, small but welcoming, although the place was full it was not noi

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We had made a reservation and saw that we really didn't need one, not that busy. I had the lasagna which was ok, but a good size. My husband had the chef menu which was a lot of courses and pretty good size portions. He thought the food was ok. I was not too impressed by restaurant, just ok Italian.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Friday night at No Menu, dinner for 4. The Burrata was the highlight and best I have had The main course duck was dry with a few steamed vegetables. A simple, small dish that I have had better in many establishments at near half the price. Pasta dishes were good but not particularly special and the most expensive pasta I have seen. Similar dishes on the cruise ship we arrived on were definitely better. Other items were good but not better than can be easily found elsewhere, again at half the price. We were seated downstairs in the main restaurant. I am not sure why that would be preferred. It was crowded and so noisy that conversation was near impossible. Service was friendly and quite prompt. So in summary I just cannot find it in me to give more than 3 stars for a fairly average Italian meal with prices the highest I have seen anywhere for similar fare. I expected much more and left feeling disappointed.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: No Menu used to be one of our favorite restaurants. The service and food were consistently good and the staff was always friendly. My husband and I decided to go there a few months ago for a date night. We were immediately ushered to the front room upstairs. Of the other four tables, three of them were families with children. Having children myself, I normally don't mind being in restaurants with well behaved kids. However, in this situation it felt like we were misfits who were conveniently put in the "family" room. We would have appreciated being seated in the back room upstairs room or downstairs where there we no kids. Instead of requesting to be moved, I assumed we would have a great dining experience which would erase any bad feelings about the seating situation. Unfortunately the server was not very friendly and seemed to rush us. Besides our server none of the other staff or owners came to our dining room, another reason we felt ignored. Food was fine, not as good as we remembered. We ate our meal and went somewhere else for drinks and dessert . We were out of there in less than an hour. It's too bad that we had such a disappointing experience and will not return. We used to really like the place.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: How often do you see an Italian lady chef commanding the restaurant in Singapore? You know the food will have authentic taste of Italy. The black truffle smells intriguing good that makes you salivate. Delicious comfort food! Can't wait to be back to try more dishes

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
Perfect place to enjoy delicious Italian dished (eg pasta with butter sauce and truffles, burrata salad). Wine list is also large including great wines at reasonable price
Finished dinner with very tasty deserts 
Overall great experience

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We came here unplanned - caught our attention with plenty of dishes to choo

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Great Italian restaurant and food. Friendly staff (albeit a little lax in the actual serving) and a very intimate setting. Food isn't cheap but is reasonable for Singapore for restaurants of a similar standing.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: No Menu was a last minute decision, recommended by a frie

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: decent italian food. serving was on par. 2nd time here. we opted for the no menu courses just for the experience. the fish was under seasoned to me. the risotto was a creamy but slight hard. the mixed started plate and dessert was perfect. i would think the cheese was too much for me.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: This restaurant is an insult to Ita

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We visited No Menu smack in the middle of the trendy Telok Ayer Food and wine district . Distinctly Italian , the food , wine where all pretty authentic. Service is very good. We had the squid Ink pasta ( very good) , a few other dishes and the beef shank ( so la la ) .. the wine was a great Merlot from Italy priced at S$95 which I thought was on the high side . Be prepared to spent S$100 per head wine inclusive ..

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We've been coming here since they opened the restaurant at the turn of the decade. It's a family run restaurant, which is great. What's better is that Osvaldo Forlino himself is a Michelin star chef, and their service has always been impeccabl

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We have been here on multiple occasions and the quality is consistent.  We always leave ourselves at the hands of the chef and we have never been disappointed with the meal.  My daughter liked it enough to host a dinner here on her 16th birthday.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: I went there for my birthday dinner and the staff was very nice. When we came the table was not ready so they seated us at a waiting table and served us some prosecco and some bread with olive oil and it was delicious, the main course was delicious and because it was my birthday, they got an organ and started playing some music and they started singing for me. Highly recommended.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Had the tasting of all food introduced by the restaurant. Meaning not from the menu. Everything was good. Had a small scared when the glass broke when the waiter was refilling our glasses. The bottle had probably slipped out of his hand. The staffs were quick to clear everything up and changed our table cloth and chairs. The owner of the restaurant was apologetic and offered us a kind gesture in return. Their food and services were great. Do try it out. Good to make a reservation before going although they have 2 floors of dining area.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: This is quite a cozy and classy restaurant which gives you a sense of authentic Italy. Great to entertain business guests as it’s in CBD. Food is of course yummy.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
We let the host select the courses except the main - ribeye steak

All courses excellent, the Barata was top notch 
The wines were also very good

Not cheap but quality food and service

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Premise - cosy and welcomi

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Cozy and unpretentious, No Menu serves authentic Italian food just the way Mama would make it. We had the four-course No Menu menu for my birthday and a divine bottle of Amarone. I need to come more often.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: The Forlinos family have established a unique italian restaurant in the heart of Singapore serving home cooked italian food from mamas kitchen. Very authentic with that italian class. Defiantly worth a visit with friends for a great meal.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: I love the atmosphere of this restaurant. Never been upstairs, downstairs the mix of interiors makes it for me. The food is great. The olive oil is to die for. Very authentic, but I am not Italian to judge. Once you have been a couple of times, I found the surprise “no menu” not as surprising anymore. No matter what: Every bite was delicious. The wine list is extensive and covers several Italian wine regio

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Went to the restaurant as a party of 3 - street parking is a little limited, may have to park at nearby buildings. The restaurant is located in a shophouse - thought the restaurant was small, until we found that there was a 2nd floo

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We went here to celebrate my Birthday. There were 12 of us, all ages. Everyone enjoyed their food. We had various fresh pasta dishes and fish. The tomatoes were from Sicily, the Parma ham from Parma and not to forget the delicious burrata cheese from Italy. They obviously take great pride in their food. The service was good. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The chocolate tart for dessert was divine. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who appreciates good Italian food.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: The ambience is good, very exquisite design. Food was okay but kinda pricey. Variety wasn't fantastic thou.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We recently moved to Singapore, but I traveled through the region often which mostly consisted of me eating in the area of my hotel. After moving here and meeting a few local residents they highly recommend this place as a fun night out with good food and good selection of reasonably price wines. We decided to share plates between the 5 of us. Most of the dishes we very good there were a few misses, but nothing to fuss over. A lovely evening out in restaurant that feels like it belongs in a small and friendly neighbourhood.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Had a dinner get together with friends from overseas. They were the ones who suggested the venue. Encountered for the first time how the "no menu" concept wor

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We were clueless in searching for another restaurant nearby as our booked restaurant was having a private function. After booking No Menu, we went there and it was also fully packed. We were given free complimentary wine and snack at the table top chair before we come secured the table. Everything went well and food was pleasantly good. Nice to go place for dinner and will be left alone to dine but with many helpful advices from Christia

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
Definitely a very cozy restaurant.
Food was superb! The Burrata was “to die for”!
My teens ordered the beef and really enjoyed them.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
Simply fantastic!! Great choices and great taste, everything so fresh. I loved it. Every dish look so appetizing. Will surely go back again. 

Seems like a family run restaurant, great operation and service.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Service staff were rude at first. She insisted we should take water when we repeated 3x that it was not necessary. Sister asked for a menu and was told not until she stopped playing with her phone. Find it very odd, bordering on rude. Though later on, during the meal, the service was o

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: The Team is Amazing, Friendly and Warm, The food is absolutely delicious, the wine List is very well balanced with lots of quality and the prices are totally ok... BRAVO it can't get any better then this!!!

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: This is genuine Italian cooking and a family run restaurant. The food is always very fresh, the service is excellent and you don't even have to order they will serve you dinner without even looking at the menu.  You may need to book in advance.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Was asking around for Italian places to bring my friend for her birthday dinner and was recommended to No Me

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: A great family run business situated in an old shop house ni ely decorated. The service is authentic and the family nearly always present. Great food explanation and presentaion

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Had the absolute pleasure of dining at “No Menu” last evening. The ambience, the service and the food were just outstanding. All ingredients were so fresh. We went for the Chefs Specials of the day. You could tell this was a restaurant and kitchen run by a family who made it their only mission to serve up the very best. Every dish was prepared with passion and from the heart. The spicy salami spread was unique and the burrata was so rich and creamy. One of my favorite Italian meals ever. A special mention to our hostess, Ms. Illy, who took such good care of us. Her attention to detail and knowledge of the ingredients was evident. And her suggestion of a Sauvignon Blanc from Northern Italy was a perfect compliment to the meal. A restaurant highly recommended if you’re looking for a quiet cozy dinner or a business dinner or just a great evening. Great food and vibe guaranteed. Thanks to all the staff for a super evening.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Very authentic and just beautiful! They have the most amazing food! Don’t ourselves a favour and eat here you won’t be disappointed!

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: By far the best Italian restaurant in Singapore 5 starts everything about this place is fantastic food staff ambiance

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Several visits to this restaurant. Service always excellent - including all the little things such as friendly and authentic staff, menu suggestions, and keeping covers on meals of two of our party who were outside taking a call when mains arrived. Certainly not cheap but worth it and the most authentic Italian food and atmosphere you’ll find in Singapore.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Friendly staff and service. A wide menu even if the name suggest otherwise. We had appetizers that we share between the four of us and the main courses were big enough. Twoo of us ate black rice with squid wich were faboulous, the best ones we have had for a long time. We had a Sauvignon blanc from Mutti in Italy wich was great.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We have been here a couple of times - the service is delightful, the interior is cozy, and the wine list is fantastic. However, after enjoying phenomenal appetizers, we are always somewhat disappointed in the main courses - which seem to fall short of there meal predecessors. Highly recommend the burrata cheese - incredibly generous portion, with perfectly salted roma tomatoes and lightly dressed greens. The fried scallops are a must-try as well. And their complimentary focaccia has a perfectly crusty, dimply exterior. Feast on the appetizers and then opt for the lemon tart for dessert.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Venue was suggested by my sis and I did not do research before going to the restaurant and regretted not doing so early as the bad reviews here are exactly what I went th

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: My husband and I had a delicious lunch at this restaurant last we

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: This place offers very good food on a simple menu, but with loads of daily specials. This is a bit disconcerting trying to remember what our talented server rattled off, and repeated on request. The service is amazing and the ambience is fabulous.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Contrary to name, there is a menu. They also have some omakase as well as "specials" not on menu. As with most places this goes by trust if you are too proud or careless to check prices before hand. In my case I took a chance with the main (appetiser was off menu) and both price and quality were high so I didn't feel cheated. Perhaps I should say the quality was high enough to justify pric

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: When we walked into the restaurant the waiter explained that the no menu concept included a cold starter, a hot starter, pasta, main course and dessert. The cost of this was Sing dollars 118 per person. I asked for this to be repeated twice and then my husband and I decided it was too much food. Then we were given an a la carte menu. Whilst we were looking at that a lady came and reeled off a bunch of specials. We decided to share a cold starter and a hot starter. My husband then wanted pasta but could not decide between the pork, cheese or prawn pasta. The chef came to our table and when we explained he made us understand that he would do a plate with small portions of three pasta’s to share (we thought it was the three pastas he wanted). What we got was a penne arabbiata, risotto with truffle and a spinach and ricotta tortellini ( all vegetarian). We then shared a Tiramisu. When we got the bill they had charged us for two no menu meals. We shared starters, had vegetarian pasta, no main meal and shared a desser

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: It is a very rare case when I would be not happy about the restaurant experience, because I prefer to go to places recommended by people opinion I tru

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: I went to No Menu last week with my business partners. Perhaps one of the best Italian meals I have ever had. It was so good, that we went back again the next day. Incredible selection of wine, buratta to die for, and the Sicilian tomatoes are unreal, I can just eat a plate of that. The restaurant is run by a Italian family, father is the chef, mom runs the register, and the daughters keep the main dining room going. This is one of the best Italian food anywhere, period!

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Walked in late for a reservation.  Were seated immediately.  Good selection of food. My companions loved the wine.  A family restaurant that treats customers like family.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Went here for the first time a few days ago.  Was so happy with the food and service.  I will definitely be back again very soon.  Will now be my go to Italian in Singapore!

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Located on Boon Tat - a small street in the CBD but served great and delicious Italian dishes. We especially loved the dessert!!! I would say it was the best Italian restaurant in town, at least to us!

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Come here often for dinner on business and sometimes with my better half. Always a great atmosphere in the restaurant with super helpful staff. The food is outstanding; fresh and authentic with no pretense. The fiorentina t-bone is immense with a good wine list to match. Lots of little courtesy dishes from the house just add to the charm of the place!

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Ice cream? 18

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: The place was nice and service was also great. Food were well prepared with great generousity. I would say it turned to be a bit too commercial rather than small cozy place but with such a good service, you can still feel a little bit of family run biz here.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: My husband has been to no menu several times and he enjoyed it so we made a booking with friends. Everyone’s food was good (not amazing, just good) apart from mine which was tasteless. I had garlic and chili spaghetti and the garlic cloves weren’t really cooked and so it was like eating raw garlic, the large dried chilies used didn’t really add any flavor to the dis

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: When a business associate told me that we had reservations at a restaurant named No Menu, I was a bit skeptical, but once I arrived and was greeted by the owner and shown to our table - I was hooked. Food was delicious, generous portions, and the wine list was exceptional.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Superb food, atmosphere different from most Italian restaurants, a feeling of Ita

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: There a good number of Italian Restaurants in Singapore, but it's not easy to find a good one. My husband took me out for dinner at No Menu last Saturday and we were greeted warmly by Gaia who guided us through the menu, the food was excellent and I wished I had room for all the food she recommended. I highly recommend the Pasta with Sea Urchin (it made my mouth water just writing the name of the dish); the taste was delectable and mind blowi

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: As the name suggests you have the option to put your faith in the chef and enjoy what he serves on the day as oppose to choosing from a menu. My friend and I are a little fussy and clearly not very adventurous so we choose dishes from the specials me

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
This restaurant is should be on your bucket list when in a Singapore.

Fresh ingredients flown in from Italy daily.  

Wine selection is vast and comprehensive.

Service is five star.  

Menu items are exceptional

Reservations highly recommended.

Bon appétit!

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: So I agree with the general view that the burrata is amazing, it really was. Service was also strong, staff are knowledgeable and hover nearby without imposin

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Cozy atmosphere and friendly service, rest assured you will find the best burrata in town ... Pasta is not to be missed either. We loved the welcoming and yet extremely professional service

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
It was on my birthday - 7th of February.

Probably the best restaurant experience ever. The food and wine excellent, the service incredible - the owner and family made this the event for life.

Every lover of Italian food should visit this wonderful place.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Authentic Italian food with a homely feel. The staffs make you feel welcome and the food is amazing. We went with the No Menu Option which was something like an Omakase. The dishes were fantastic and balanced throughout. The only downside was it was quite pricey so go only when its a special occasion.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: No Menu is a rarity in Asia: proper Italian ingredients with an Italian chef and family to cook, serve and most importantly, welcome. One could tell immediately that the Roma tomatoes were not the pale soggy Asian-grown tomato substitutes used in most of Asia's so-called Italian restaurants. These tasted like tomatoes and like Italy. The burrata was heavenly, likewise the prosciutto. We sampled the cannelloni, the insalata mista, and my perennial favourite, linguine vongole, a dish usually mis-managed in most Asian restaurants. No Menu's proper execution included the white clam sauce derived from the simple act of heating the unopened clams in a savoury garlic, white wine and parsley broth. No inundations of tinned clam sauce or lashings of, heaven forbid, cream as an ill thought rendering of "white" sauce. The bread at the table was always topped up throughout the meal, and was brilliant - the few leftovers there were came home with me and the bread and burrata was gorgeous next day. The only drawback is the noise level in the restaurant - being popular, it was full and being in Asia, was noisy. Nothing to do about that - the food more than compensates.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Celebrated a special occasion , and the team made this a very unique one . Food is fantastic and authentic, made and served by the family - returning again and again and love it

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Located in a shop house this Italian restaurant provides expensive Italian food. The waiter was very determined to up sell ( we wanted a simple pasta meal) and it required some determination to resist his suggestions. We had brought a bottle of wine as Trip Advisor reviews has indicated no corkage. The waiter demanded $50 as corkage for our wine. We reverted to the menu where the cheapest single bottle of wine cost much more than the meal. The food was very good and apart from the upselling the service was excellent. Complementary extras of small plates of cheese and sweets after the meal were very welcom

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Just simple professionals who love to feed :) Been there more than 3 times in a week. It says it all.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: This was my second visit and I love everything about this restaurant. The food is authentic and delicious, the service is wonderful. You are warmly greeted when you arrive and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. It feels like an authentic Italian family restaurant.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Paying a premium for a good meal, in a nice restaurant, on a big night out with friends is to be expected in Singapore, we're used to it. However, when you're spending in the range of SGD 250 per head, you expect things to come close to great and sadly, No Menu does not come anywhere ne

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Cosy family run restaurant that serves whatever the chef has prepared for the day. One cannot go wrong with the recommendations and the dining atmosphere make you think that you are in Italy, if not for the subtle Singapore elements that the owners make it a point to incorporate.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Simply the best. Pricey but you know what you’re paying for when you see and taste the dishes. Every plate leaving the kitchen is perfe

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: If you like splendid food, in Singapore, then

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Food here is above average but the portions are a little on the small side. We had the degustation menu and it was ok but nothing great. There are better places in Singapore for Italian food in this price range.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: A friend booked this venue at short notice and, not having had time to find out more, I had no idea what to expect. Wow, what a delicious surpri

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: No Menu. Located at 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore. Been of an Italian background, I am always on the watch for good Italian restaurants. This restaurant offers authentic Italian food. The environment is relaxed and you feel like you are dining in a friend’s home. Food is very well presented and nice portions too. We tried several dishes that was on offer, all delicious with the real Italian taste. The highlight for me was antipasti, several type of pastas, and the grill beef rib eye all were outstanding. Unfortunately after all that food we were just too full to try the desserts, which I'm sure they must be delicious, anyway I must confess it was the tastiest Italian food I've had for a while , the price tag is on the high side but what the hack if the food and wine is outstanding . About the Service and atmosphere also get really high marks! Staff are very professional the service is excellent and very friendly and attentive. A perfect night, beautiful ambience, exquisite food and great wine selections. I truly recommend this place if you want high quality Italian cuisine. I’m sure we will come back very soon.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Had a wonderfully dinner here last week, the food really is excellent. Strongly recommend keeping an eye on the daily specials, they always have some excellent dishes on ther

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: One of the best , real authentic Italian food , the entire family working there , feels like a private home , fantastic atmosphere and the food is absolutely amazing , don't worry they have a menu , and it's plenty , will definitely return

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: We walked by and very lucky to have a table but only for 90 min after that we were told the Place was fu

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
Everything was great! The food is delicious (especially the burrata cheese).
Very cozy place with excellent and friendly service

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review:
This restaurant is very cosy. They serve great Italian food with great great service. 
I recommend for couples and business groups.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: After almost 10 years living in Singapore and great lovers of Italian cuisine, I can say we tried lots of Italian restaurants. Last week we have dinner in No Menu restaurant for the first time and I can say this is the best experience we’ve ever had if we consider the food, the service and atmosphe

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: The title ‘No menu’ isn’t strictly true as you have choice from an extensive selection but being ‘brave’ and allowing the very well informed staff to look after you is the best optio

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Cozy atmosphere, excellent service.  Had the burrata, garlic prawn spaghetti and  tiramisu which was excellent except for the prawn which was overcooked. It is pricy. i would reconsider returning.

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: Pure Mafia experience: everything is done with poor ingredients you can find in cheap supermarkets in Italy, dumped in poor dishes without any sense of beauty for presentation, and priced ridiculously expensi

Name: No Menu
Location: 23 Boon Tat Street, Singapore 069621 Singapore
Review: No Menu had been highly recommended by a friend. It did not disappoint. Service was excellent as was the wine. The restaurant has a very pleasant ambience too. The food was simply fabulous. Parma Ham as a starter and Asparagus Risotto for main. Can highly recommend.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Awesome. It was a rainy night. Simply was too inviting to have some drinks n good food with great company. Although pricing is on the higher side, the service staff were great. Very attentive and professional. Riverfront dining n with good company, its always a plus point. Do consider Boomarang. There r also other bars n restaurants along the stretch so do keep your options open.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: The services are good. Unfortunately, the waiting time for our food were delivered super late. And it's at 1130am. My kids are famished and I have to ask for my food, than it's delivered. Please pay more attention with family with young childre

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: $18++ for a beer is an absolute joke. Especially when you can get a decent draught pint just around the corner at Kanpai 789 for just

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Been a couple of times since circuit breaker but this was not impressive - ordered two buckets of Perroni without being told this was the most expensive bottled beer in Singapore. $55 for 5 on a late Friday afternoon - just a rip off. Bull & Bear would have charged $45 for both buckets combined!

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Poor quality, poorer service. We ordered fish and chips x 2 for pick up. Upon walking home (5 mins), we noticed that the side salads were missing and the chips were a in a sad, stale state - they had clearly been cooked looong before the fish and were inedible. Had we been dining in, we would have sent the chips back to the kitchen - and asked for our side salads! Most disappointing of all, when we contacted the restaurant, the restaurant would not offer any remediation. Would not recommend.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: During recent stays in Singapore, we ate breakfast 3 times and dinner once at this great restaurant. The menu has lots of choice and everything we tried was first-class. It gets a bit noisy in the evening but its location means it’s great for people-watching whilst eating a meal.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Went to Boomarang for a business dinner. Atmosphere was good, lots of screens with sports playing. Some decent drink prices, found the food to be above average.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We attended the Boomerang restaurant on Australia Day, 26th Janua

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Well cooked food with nice beers and wine at a reasonable prices. Enjoyed a couple of nice meals here, the ribs are great and fish and chips is also good. The chairs are not so comfy and they should improve the seating a bi

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Bar with Australian theme. Nice beer selection and food more than ok. TVs showing sport. English Premier League games. Nice quayside location.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: This is a great place to start your day and end your day as they open at 6am and closes at 3

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
We called in for a quick coffee and toast and it was perfect. 
The staff are really friendly and it’s just a great place to chill out.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Not many places open before 9am but Boomarang opens at 6am.  Had a fantastic breakfast here.  Order of The Ashes which is full English but without mushrooms which they swapped for something else and poached eggs.  Staff great.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
Fantastic food. The place to go for a proper breakfast bacon eggs sausage etc. 
On the expensive side of things but not unusual for the local area. 
The staff are very friendly and very attentive to your needs.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We stopped here for a snack on our first night in SIngapore, not really hungry but needing a snack to tie us over we found this bistro filled the requirement perfectly with its sharing platter. The food was excellent with friendly staff and other meals we saw looked equally delightful.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Found this place whilst wandering along the river. Have a huge menu of both western and eastern food. Burgers, pizzas, fish and chips plus lots more. They have Australian beers and wines, do happy hours and functions. Great spot overlooking the river, great food and great service. Prices aren’t too bad.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: This was definitely our favour bar whilst we were on holiday in Singapore. It was a lovely location in Robertson Quay next to the river with indoor and outdoor seating. We found ourselves here most nights as they always had the main sports events playing and even came for breakfast one morning to watch the NBA game that was being shown. Drinks aren't the cheapest however nowhere really is in Singapore! Would recommend if looking for a fun bar with good sports and music and good atmosphere. We also tried the pizza here that was amazing.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We wanted some great Aussie food and we were not disappointed. While not the cheapest meal the quality was great. My husband had the rib eye which was enormous, I had an entree of calamari which was very tender. We had to have the pavlova for desert. I was pleasantly surprised as it was a real pav and not one of the masses produced type. It is in a lovely spot on the river. A taste of home.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: I feel in Singapore this place is the best sports bar to watch a live match. While watching you can enjoy their delicious finger food and cocktails.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
Despite a huge crowd watching Wales v South Africa the service to our table was amazing!  A bucket of cold beer and a superb pizza really was perfect!
The huge thunderstorm didn’t seem to effect anything - loved it!

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Great food. Meal sizes are quite large and the cost is good for the sizes. Good tasting food and friendly staff. TVs all around showing sports.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We ate lunch here yesterday and the steak sliders were great. It’s not your typical bun style sliders, more like small round toasts but worked well. The beer was cold and the place was busy with the rugby on so it had a great atmosphere. We will come back here before we leave.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: I've been frequenting boomerang for a couple of years now and in general my experiences there have been pleasant. Great atmosphere for big games, decent food and great beer. However I must say that I've always found the service to be wanting. The place is extremely understaffed for big match days and this in turn compromises the ability of the waiting staff to attend to us. All of this could be excusable but what I was most recently disappointed by was their reservation system. I reserved a table for a RWC match about a week in advance via their website and was told that I would receive an email response from them. No response was received and I assumed that everything would be fine but decided to call them the day before the match to check for myself. After my first phone call not even being answered and subsequent call being diverted to 4 different staff members, I was told that my reservation had not been accepted and they had already been booked up for the match. This was a world cup match that I had planned my ENTIRE day around. Do I need to say more?

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: While walking in the morning after arriving in Singapore we came across the BoomArang bistro at Robertson Quay. As Singapore tends to wake up late this was one of the few eating places available There was plenty of choice for breakfast from the Bondi to the Coolangatta (see the Aussie theme) with good size portions, casual atmosphere and great servi

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Do not make the same mistake we did! We ordered a sharing starter and then shared a pizza!! There is no need to order a main after the meat sharing platter! We was warned by the waitress but dismissed it as we were hungry. All the food was good and cocktails were nice! Typical Singapore expensive prices but good luck finding anywhere cheap in Singapore !

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Had breakfast , lunch or dinner at this place many time

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: An Aussie-based cafe and restaurant on the north side of the ’river’ about 800 m west of Clarke Quay at Robertson Quay, it was the ideal place to have an early breakfast each day of our 6 day, 5 night visit to Singapore. Finding a moderate priced restaurant for breakfast open before 9 am is difficult. Boomerang hours are from 6 am to 3 am - yes 21 hours. Why? It is also a sports bar were Aussie and global sports games are played on the screens and people come at all hours. While playing on the needs of aussie or westerner expats its menu is from the Australia of the 2000’s and doesn't cater for the obiquitous diet variations of modern Australia; if you are gluten free you will likely be ordering sides for breakfast. That said it was good enough to have us back every morning and one evening to see a Aussie rules game in mid-Augu

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We went to this restaurant purely to have and break from the rice, noodles and spices we were experiencing and also it was only a 100m away from our mot

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Went to the bar last night friday 26/7/2019 to watch the afl have been many times and it has been good except for last nig

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We came to eat dinner here as it was Aussie and were craving Western food. The prices were a bit expensive generally. Mo

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Went to the Circular Road outlet to watch England v India.  Had fantastic service from the waiter Rick who was very attentive and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for him. He made my four hours spent there very enjoyable.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: This place is a favourite amongst Australia,. The food and staff are great for large groups. Went there when there was the cricket World Cup playing and the environment was phenomena.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
Ate breakfast here a couple of mornings. 
Food was fantastic, eggs Benedict, French toast & smashed avo. 
Good value, fast & friendly service, clean and spacious. 
Would happily eat here again, only sorry we weren’t there long enough to sample their lunch & dinner menus!

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Enormously understaffed. Worst service have been here 2 times to watch the games but both times I wait until half time to get my first order of drink

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: I have visited the Boomarang many times over the years. One of the few places you can reliably watch the cricket and NRL in Singapore. An easy walk to / from Chinatown (where I usually stay), is another bonus... On my last trip to Singapore I enjoyed an excellent Cafe Latte here and video logged it, on my Coffee Chill YouTube (check it out if you like ...) channel. I will be back again later this year, to enjoy the water breezes, professional service and superb coffee.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: If you’re staying in the Robertson Quay area, this is a great spot for breakfast. The Boomerang Bar offers a wide range of hot food options including feta and avocado toast, pancakes, omelettes and the French toast is sublime. Freshly squeezed fruit juice costs $3, a large coffee is around $8.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: My partner and I decided to have a break from Asian food and had seen Boomarang Bistro when we were walking along the river in the morning so headed there to give the beef cheeks a go for dinner. We were not disappointe

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Looking for food at 23:00hrs proved difficult until we found this place that closes at 03:00. Man U v Watford on tv - Man U won 2-0. My wife and I had beers and a Wagyu beef pizza. Great service from Roy who chatted to us. The place was busy and loved the cork screw tailed cat

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
Great bar for a meal, drink and watching the AFL or NRL

Was plenty of tables, bar stools and pf course plenty of great Aussie beer to keep you hydrated

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Very convenient to the Intercontinental Hotel and it is open until 300 in the morning. Has lots of beer choices and lots of food choices, all good.. Bar is handicapped friendly and wait staff very friendly. You can find a better deal on a bucket of beer further away from the hotel 35 vs 60 but not right next door to the hotel...

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We asked for ice in our water and were told that you can only hsve ice in drinks that were purchased. Singapore is hot in March, you need a cold dri

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We called in one evening for a casual meal. We stayed at Clark Quay and wandered up to Robertson Quay trying to decide what to eat, as neither of us was very hung

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Have used before when staying at nearby hotel at Clarke Quay. Robertson Quay is not as busy as some parts of Clarke Quay. Mostly used for dinner but once for breakfast t

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Spent a few days in Singapore on holiday and ended up at Boomarang most days. Once for breakfast and a couple of times for drinks. Food was excellent and the atmosphere good with many TVs for watching sport and the river in front for people watchi

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We have eaten at this restaurant several times both on this visit and last year. The food is well prepared and presented and portions are generous. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and meals are produced quickly. The position of the restaurant overlooks the Singapore River and the open frontage enables you to enjoy the atmosphere of this very attractive area while you enjoy your meal.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Eaten here many times in the past and always been happy, until now. Food (pizza) was indifferent despite being described as 'deluxe'. Only had taste in patches, wide crust area with no topping at all. Staff totally uninterested whether I enjoyed the meal or not, just interested in selling more beer. I saw other customers leaving large amounts of food as if they had no enthusiasm for it. There are plenty of places to eat, don't waste your money here

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: This sports bar type restaurant is right next to the Singapore River.  Nice place to have a sandwich or pizza while watching the cricket.  Very diverse menu.  There are fans over the tables so you can eat outside without being too hot.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We were looking for a late lunch and popped in to Boomarang. So glad we did. The service was good and the quality of the food was excellent. This is a little bit along the river from Clarke Quay but well worth the 10 minute walk. If you like sports then you are in luck as there was cricket, football, basketball and rodeo playi

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: VISITED A YEAR AGO ABD STILL AS GOOD TODAY. Lots  of options on the menu to choose from. Service is outstanding, Angelo and Jack a credit  to you.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Waygu beek burger very good, salads quite good but with being brilliant.  Would not have a pizza at this location.  Good bloody mary if that takes your fancy

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: In Singapore for 9 days a breakfasted here most of them. Between us me and my wife covered most of the menu options and were pretty happy with our fair. Portions were a good size, service came with a smile and compared to the rest of Singapore the cost was reasonable. Great coffee too.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We had been travelling for a month our last destination was Singapore on AUSTRALIA DAY. A short stroll from hotel and we found this pla

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Took a long walk along the Singapore River and stopped here for lunch. It is a half open air restaurant that faces the walk path. The service was quick (Saturday lunch time) and the food was good. One in my party had a prawn salad that was expertly prepared and I had the chicken schnitzel sliders (pictured) which were very tasty. A good stop during a walk along the river.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Good for a day of sports, food, beer and kids on scooters. The food is very good beer selection good, prices average.  The schnitzel is simply massive and great value. A fun afternoon for the family.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
Beers are very exensive even when ordering by the bucket.

Food is just ok but again not great vakye for money.

Raj is a stand out and his level of service is exceptional.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: The restaurant have a sports bar setting with lots of TV screens. The menu is Australian inspired. I tried the Wagu beef burger which was tasty. Service was good. The bill was on 50 SGD for the burger and a beer

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: My wife and I had a nice breakfast in Boomarang at Robertson Quay. The Avocado Feta on toast and I had the Bondi breakfast. Washed down with 2 coffees and a fruit juice and the bill was 86 dollars! Whilst nice and tasty it was very expensive for what you got. Beware of the compulsory service charges of 17% onto your bill!!!

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
A great place for Melbourne Cup Day however the drinks 🍸 are horribly expensive. 
One beer, one coke, one coffee $28 - so pleased we didn’t order food!! 
Good service from Tony!

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Disappointed in the slowness of service once our order was taken. We only ordered 1 coffee and 1 tea which took about 10 minutes to come out to us with only around 15 guests in the cafe. It cost $18  for this which was expensive.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We had dinner there one night whilst on a Singapore brea

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Went for a chicken parmy Saturday night and went for the Coolangatta Sunday morning. Both were great examples of Aussie food and just what I needed after being away from home for 6 weeks. Service was fast too. Lots of screens playing sports as well if that's the intent of the visit.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: After a few days you miss Aussie food great place to get to get your parmas and great aussie burger and the only place I saw that had VB beer .

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: On the way to the Grand Prix called in for a few beers. Table had not been cleaned and was not cleared for the two hours we were ther

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We called in here for a late lunch after a busy morning doing touristy things. We found a table easily, and the service was attentive. Big meal sizes for the price, but drinks were expensive so don’t recommend from that aspec

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Boomerang is a slice of Aussie heaven in the restaurant heart of Singapore. We booked a table for the preliminary finals of nrl and afl. They provided us with great seating for both sports and table service throughout both games. Would highly recommend for Australian sporting events. The food was absolutely delicious and topped off a great night. A++

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
A great place for Aussies to meet when in Singapore. We were there recently and enjoyed a great evening cheering on the AFL finals game on the big screens.
Great food and reasonably priced drinks.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: A riverfront restaurant/bar that has plenty of TV's showing sport, and more particularly, Aussie football (AFL & ARL). It has a good atmosphere and the food is typical pub/bistro fare. The prices weren't too bad, especially when compared to some of the other venues along the river front. Drinks also were reasonable (when compared to other nearby venues) but not when compared with pubs in Oz. We enjoyed our visit to watch the footy (although our team lost.....) and would happily return next time we visit Singapore.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: After a few days on a Singapore diet it was good to sit down to a good old Parma salad and chips. Staff were great and lots of cricket on the many tv screens. Beer was cold well worth a stop. This place is currently supporting the Parma for a Farmer for drought affected farmers in Australia

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: This is a great Restaurant for Aussies. Good Steak Sandwich, great location, great vibe. Nice to sit and have a relaxing lunch and drinks. Does get busy though.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We stopped in to have a @Aussie drink at Aussie bar”, $17.10 for a beer,$16 for a champagn

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Often very busy which is good if you like that kind of vibe. Full of ex-pats. Beer buckets are good value. Nice location along the river - convenient if you live nearby but not necessarily somewhere I would travel to specifically to frequent.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: The Bistro was close to where our daughter and her husband live in Singapore.We found the staff friendly and efficient, the premises is modern, with quite a good food and drink menu.It is also a great place to enjoy a coffee and watch the world go by.I believe it can become quite busy and noisy when sport is on Saturday afternoons and Sundays.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Had half an hour before meeting a friend for lunch. Sat down at this place for a pint of VB (great Australian Beer). Very nice place for a brunch as well. Great service too. Basically an anytime hop in place.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: I come quite often to Singapore and whenever I stay near Clarke Quay I try to come to Boomarang. It’s very pleasant, great location and food is okay. It’s also great place to watch AFL in the many screens around the restaurant...

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Please very careful when ordering during happy hour. The pricing is not clear. This is a very expensive bar.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: One of my favourite bars in Singapore- always busy in a great location and always has the main sporting events on. If you want a table for these book in advance as it’s crazy for big event

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
We had the Granola muesli and Avocado on toast with a side of bacon

Nice relaxed place to enjoy breakfast with a light breeze coming past. 

Good service and ambience and the coffee was a fitting finish to an enjoyable start to the day

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Homesick Aussies certainly unite here for sports, drinks, expensive food and a yarn. Also popular with all other westerners around the world .. probably locals would not be able to stomach the prices here too often. After all there are hundreds of other options round the corner, with better food, drinks and price

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: I was in Singapore for business in March and staying at the Four Points Sheraton Riverview. This was a very easy walk after a long day and relaxing place for dinner. So relaxed we ate here twice during our trip. We found the service to be friendly and had the burger/beer special on Wednesday night. Best Waygu burger and on previous dinner had the Chicken Schnitzel sliders. My only regret was I could not finish all 3 sliders!

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: This is my favourite place in Singapore to meet friends for brunch, or dinner, or to watch a Sports match or just about anything! It’s right on the Singapore River at Robinson Quay.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
Damn expensive for nasty swill, and $25 burgers?

I guess some Aussies really miss home. Too bad this is how you compensate - with VB and the footy. Smh.

Great atmosphere for sports, but horrible atmosphere otherwise.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: I was in Singapore in June 2018 for a business and was looking for a place where I could have drinks and France/New Zealand rugby game .. this is the place! Great choice if drinks nice food and a lot of TVs .. just beside the Singapore river!

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: The staff and service were great and really enjoyed the food my husband said best 1/2 chicken and chips ever .

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Lots of big screen televisions here. Convenient location on Riverwalk.  Prices are expensive.  It was a nice place to have drinks, if you don't mind the costs.  Didn't order any food, so can't comment.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Lots of screens so you can watch sport from pretty much every table. We went to see the Queens Birthday AFL game and were not disappoint

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: I used to like this restaurant as ambience is nice and they have a large selection of comfort food favourites with easy going staff. However my last visit yesterday, changed my opinion of the place. We waited for 45 minutes for our drinks to arrive and 1 hour for our food to arrive. This despite having a booking at the restaurant. Staff is all over the place and seem overwhelmed with the busy and number of orders. Isn't there a system in place? You take the order. Punch it in to the computer, and it tells kitchen and barristers what to do. As a result of being over whelmed, they seem arrogant and reply to order enquiries in a rude manner. "We are busy. Maybe a 30-45 minutes wait." (This after 45 minutes of waiting). We even had our 17 month old toddler with us, and even then kids meal came last. Over the years, their standard has dropped. Sadly I will not be visiting again.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
Arrogant waiters, lack of service.
Looking after those they know and avoid others.
Blame systems and being busy. Never again.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: My wife and I visited the Boomarang Bistro on a Friday night for dinner. The bonus for me was the live AFL ga

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: This is an all around good place to eat along the river, great kangaroo burger and their breakfast is awesome with fantastic coffee roasted in Australia and delivered every 2 weeks give it a try

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: I had an excellent burger but my wife’s prawn salad was less exciting. Quite expensive but all restaurants on Robertson Quay seem to be. Pure Blonde beer was very nice but wine by the glass is expensive. Service was good.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Wanna relax and have a Nice place to sit,close to the river and at really great place go to boomarang in Singapore,the food is super good and the whole atmosphere and the staff are fine!i really like this place to sit,eat and relax!

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: I had a long lunch there with some mates. Great place for aussies to hang out and watch the footy and the ruby. Plenty of screens around the open air bar. Food was typical sports bar type food, pizza Chips steak etc. beer was ok value for Singapore and service very attentive. Good place to chill and watch your favorite team

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review:
We been there cuz after soccer they arranged this place. Food quality average,Good service and great location really nice. Wine list can be improved even if most of the customers drink beers or cocktails.
🤙🏿 cheers

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: We were staying at a hotel near Boomarang & after walking past it for a couple of days we decided to call in for lunch on our last day. After 12 days of nice food across a couple of countries we felt like something closer to a home style. I’d seen the TV’s playing football games from home with groups of travellers or ex-pats taking advantage of the fa

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Was walking along Robertson Quay on a Saturday evening with my friends and thought of watching one of the live matches that evening. Pop by boomerang and asked the waitress standing outside if they will be showing the game, she said yes. Got ourselves a table and ordered our starters and beers. For starters we had chicken win

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: After more than 10 years supporting Boomarang it is sad that I have decided not to return. Sunday brunch today invited son and his family after telling them how good it is. Sat for an hour and 20 minutes and then found out the disinterested waiter had not even submitted our order. So embarrassing. Took about 20 minutes to even order a coffee. Not many people in the restaurant. Manager was understanding when we decided to up and leave. The service has been slipping for a year or so and I'm over it now. Goodbye Boomerang. I won't be boomeranging.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: A convenient place for quick coffee & beers near the CBD buildings, with friendly staff and competitive pricing.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Great place for an informal relaxed meal. Reasonable choice, well cooked and presented. service v.good. By the river great setting.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Great place to have dinner. Across the street from the hotel. Clean and service is good. Good choices of beer and did not take a long time.

Name: Boomarang Bistro & Bar
Location: 60 Robertson Quay #01-15 the Quayside, Singapore 238252 Singapore
Review: Located on Robertson Walk near Robertson Quay, you will find this place quite easily. The numerous TV screens showing all the Australian sports,(AFL, Rudby Union and League, as well as tennis.....you get the picture) The beer is cold, the food is quintisential Australian with Kangaroo Burgers, Bangers and Mash and a whole assortment of other stuff. In all, if you are feeling homesick, or just want to hang out with fellow Australians an watch some sport, this is the place to be on the weekends.

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Curious after reading all the rave reviews so popped by at about 1pm intending to have lunch but after filling in particulars with phone contact, was told wait would be 40 minutes so went to Soon Soon Teo Chew Porridge 2 doors away to have local fare and wait to be contact

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Tried their Pulled Pork and Avocado Egg Benedict. It was decent and a good portion. What I love most is their Crab cake benedict. It was something interesting, not the usual stuff you find on a menu. So those up for something interesting can try this.

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Cool place to chil

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: It's good value for quality cafe food. One dish that stands out to me is the Paprika Crispy Wings this food is very nice u must try. Food was served very fast. And the place is very convinient it's located within walking distance from Kovart MRT.

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Had and love their bangers & mash, their honeyed wings, and lychee cake! I remember having their standard breakfast years ago and it was pretty good too!

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Excellent foods and service very nice atmosphere, I was enjoying a lots my meal. Thank you so much for best foods

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Went there with friends for lunch! The place was quiet and cozy. I really like their honey chicken wings. Prices and portions are reasonable!

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Lola's Cafe is my favourite cafe whenever i meet up friend for brunch or chit chat et

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Food was terrific. I found out about this place on Trip Advisor. I’m very happy with our delicious lunch. This is not a fancy place but it was packed with a long queue. Be sure to make a booking. Enjoy Lola’s!

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Okay the food is not bad, but I do not know why the queue is crazy even with reservations! The place is not very accessible but if you live east or north east, then it is a good regular neighbourhood joint. We did not try the cake and I only had truffles fries and a matcha latte. Although it is simple, the latte is real matcha made, you can taste the green tea and its smell.

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Lola's Cafe is without a doubt my favourite cafe in Kov

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Went here for dinner with family on a weekend. Beef cheeks was tender and flavourful. Loved the chai tea latte as well. The honey apple cake with ice cream was a nice way to round off the meal and evening. Service was prompt and friendly. Located fairly near to Kovan MRT Station.

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review:
The food never fails to satisfy my taste bud. Be it the main meal, dessert, coffee or just a juic.e. A place to be on the 'must try list'.
Crew always attentive, friendly and fast with orders

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Food was good. Ambience was great. Loved their brunch menu. Their chicken wings and Lola's breakfast was fantastic.

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Overall nice cafe and accessible, but price wise can be a little steep. But I really like the miso salmons bowl and the home made lemonade!

Name: Lola's Cafe
Location: 5 Simon Road, Singapore 545893 Singapore
Review: Decent food but slightly expensive. The portion is satisfying and the pulled pork taste good and not too salty. The burger is normal but I think is abit overpriced which cost about $20( with GST), with only one patty and some fries. The wings is crispy and well seasoned.
