Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: First ever visit to Waterfall, ambiance was great and food was also amazing, especially the burrata, friendly hostess and great service by staff Liz, Ken and Dinesh.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Pasta and pizza suggested by Chef Leslie is excellent and authentic, best food in town. dessert profiteroles made a perfect finish to our meal. Kudos to Derek the pastry chef.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Thumbs up for the services provided by Andrea, Dinesh and Praba. They give full attention to the guests although the restaurant is full house.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: visited the outlet on monday which was unexpectedly busier than usual (assuming due to the holiday in lieu). it was our first visit to waterfall, meal was fantastic and well recommended by tommy. special thanks to tommy who was very attentive and promptly helped with any requests and questions about the menu despite the crowd. liz and aoi were a pleasure as well. hope to be back soon!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: This place has a stunning environment and the food is great, Chef Terry , Kelvin , Derrick did a great job preparing such awesome food. The service staff John and Gwen did a great job and they are so friendly , Will highly recommend people to come here to dine in.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Had a very pleasant and enjoyable dinner with really quality Italian food that was tasty with every bite. The team of Aoi, Andrea and Tommy were efficient and knowledgeable with the menu, offering us suggestions based on our preference. Portions were good and flavourful. Will definitely recommend this place and be back soon!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Aoi, Andrea and Tommy were really kind and friendly . Especially Aoi , she was really sweet and was smiling all the the time , really good customer service! And we love the complimentary cake , will definitely come back soon!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: We enjoyed our dinner and had a great time, the delicious food prepared by Chef Michael is the highlight of the night. We also thanked Andrea, Dinesh & Praba for the excellent service.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Absolutely excellent service, ambience & food! We were served by Ms. Andrea (super attentive, friendly & very fast), Paul (very polite & responsible) & Dinesh (Manager). With a service crew like them, I’m certain the restaurant can go far in winning the hearts & loyalty of customers. Food was very good too. But honestly, the service & ambience is really what made our experience a 5-star rating.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review:
Ample range and good quality spread, as you'd expect of the Shangri-La.

Special mention for the burrata and the decadent desserts. We were well served by Praia and team.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Attentive staff, excellent service, good food - the antipasti buffet lunch was value for money and excellent

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Big thanks to the team! Awesome food and service. Paul, John, Roy and Dinesh are very friendly and nice. Thanks waterfall chef for the delicious food. Fantastic meal, will definitely come back again with family and friends.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Good service and food. Staff were very attentive to our needs. Food served was hot and very nicely cooked.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Paul, John, Dinesh and Roy were very attentive to us throughout our dining experience with The Waterfall, serving us with ample time inbetween to enjoy our food. The food was nicely plated and was fantastic!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Excellent service by Paul, Praba and Dinesh! Great variety of appetisers, soups, meat and deserts. Nice ambience too!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Celebrated daughter’s birthday dinner here and John and Praba made us feel very welcomed! Not only was the food fantastic (oh the al dante pasta and savoury seafood broth...), these 2 gentlemen were very attentive and engaging. Indeed a 5-star service! Well-done, Waterfall Shangri-La team

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Great dinner with good food. Kids meals were great value and they loved the Hawaiian pizza. Very spacious, maybe it's COVID, but very luxurious and large tables and dining space. Staff were very attentive, Liz was very friendly with the kids. Very accessible restaurant in Shang!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: A fabulous dining experience made even more special with the detailed and attentive service by Kaylee, Andrea, Kent and Dinesh. It was buzzing but service was smooth and efficie

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Lovely staycation and staff were brilliant - especially Aoi! Highly recommend. Our daughter who is 16 months old loved the penne and the pasta and pizza we had was as good as in Italy! Delicious!!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review:
Fantastic authentic Italian cuisine
Kids friendly
U can look forward to stellar stewardship by Aoi and John

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Very nice food. We orderee Pharma pizza, carbonara, fish. Special mention to very accomodating staffs Aoi John and Andrea. Worth the money.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Paul at the Waterfall made our day.  We came for daycation and he was fantastic.  Attentive, knowledgeable, never had to ask for a thing.  In my opinion, the Shang is the only place worth while to do a daycation in Singapore.  Forever committed.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: We had selected this restaurant to celebrate a milestone birthday. Right decision. The food was five star, ambience worthy of celebration & service even better. All dishes, including cocktail, we ordered were excellent, but the veal & panna cotta were the best we have had outside Italy. A special thanks for accommodating my request for keto food for one. We will return for other special occasions.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Had a staycation at Shangri-la orchard Hotel over the weekends. My family and I had our dinner at the waterfall ristorante. Thanks to Praba Adi he has a great sense of humour, very helpful and service orient

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Very attentive and friendly service from Aoii and Prava, great food and lovely ambience. Thanks so much for making our stay memorable. We will like to visit again!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: We reserved a table at the restaurant for lunch to celebrate our anniversary together with our children. We were seated in a private corner and had a fantastic mea

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Food was good and well prepared. Service is great thanks paul, aoi, dinesh, roy for servicing us well

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: We came in for the antipasti buffet lunch and were a bit worried about what this would entail with covid regulations but it was amazing. Paul was our waiter and he was super accommodating to our vegetarian restrictions and served the buffet plate by plate so it was more like a multiple course lunch, and we could order multiples of anything we wanted more of (we got four serves of burrata ). I'd definitely recommend the lunch here, it's good value for money, they accommodate vegetarians, and the service we got was really good so that topped off the experience!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Really nice food, really nice service! And they aere able to accomodate vegetarian requests. Thank you to Paul who was our waiter.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: the PIZZA PROSCIUTTO CRUDO RUCOLA E BUFALA and seafood stew is excellent,Jodie ，Paul and Gwen very friendly and helpful

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I am back again at Waterfall! This time with my friends. Food as usual very delicious. Happy to see my friends enjoying the food and also excellent service by Paul, Gwen and Jodie. They are very attentive, friendly and quick in clearing our plates. Thumbs up for their service n food.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: The arrangements were made by the birthday boy’s wife. They and we had never been there before, so it was ris

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Antipasti lunch was value for money and quite suitable for families or couples as due to Covid, they serve small portions for all the dishes. Highly recommend the cold cuts and mussel clam soup. Go for the cappuccino if you like your cafe style coffee. Service was outstanding even though they were packed. Shout out to Aoi and Prabbra for their wonderful service and birthday song. :)

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Received exceptional service here last August so I recommended this place to celebrate my friend’s birthday today. Quite disappointed with the level of service from following up our bottle of wine and birthday cake. The service guys never paid attention to our requests and we realized that it’s better to be seated inside so they’d see us straight away. One guy even served plates like we’re in a fastfood joint. Although the manager took an effort to make it up by being friendly and giving us a glass of Disaronno but with the $$$ paid, service and food quality, I’d rather go somewhere else.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Super delicious food such as salmon, pasta, salad, pizza, etc. by Chef Shanta, Chef Lesly and Chef Jong. Ms Andrea at service is very pleasant. Thank you and we look forward to come back again.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: i had a gathering with my friends, there foods are so delicious and waiters so friends. we serve by Dinesh, Praba, Liz and Paul. thank you for their service.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Had a wonderful and memorable birthday at the Waterfall! Aoi, Tommy and Dinesh were attentive with the service and went the extra mile to make our dining experience good, such as the surprise birthday cake!

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: We had a wonderful evening at Waterfall - the staff were fantastic and very helpful (let us try various different wine and very attentive). Paul in particular was excellent.

Name: Waterfall Ristorante Italiano
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road Shangri-La Hotel Garden Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review:
Second time to the Waterfall, served by Gwen and Adonis. Great service, very attentive and engaging.

Thanks.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: We returned for a quick dim sum lunch and it was less busy on a weekda

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: The service was poor, we have to pour our own tea, hard to get waiter/waitress service, no extra hanger /chair for ladies bag.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Visited during lunch on a Sunday. Restaurant was full. Restaurant was short handed, service was slow. Staff just walked past our table despite us requesting to place our orders, only managed to order after multiple attempt

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Tried the dim sum 2 weeks ago and was impressed by the standard of food and services. The dinner was just as good if not better .. Thumbs up

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Tim sum , fried frog legs, fried century eggs and the roast meat platter were simply amazing. My favourite is the frog leg dish with ginger. What a treat. Enjoyed all the dishes and they were classic and straightforward. Keep it up.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: For the first time my wife and I decide to go to Wah Lok at the Carlton hotel after hearing from several friends on how good they Traditional Chinese food is. Upon arrival the service was very attentive even do the restaurant was packed and buzzing with customers. We ordered quickly our dishes including a few Dim Sum selection and give specific instruction on the flow of food delivery should be. Wow every dish arrived in proper sequences and the food was amazing good, temperature texture flavours was fist class. We will for sure be back for more and last but not least the bill was very reasonable. Kudos to the team keep up the great job!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: We’ve dined at Wah Lok restaurant located in Carlton Hotel several times and always enjoy returnin

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Wah Lok has been my favourite and regular place for Timsum...fresh n good quality. Excellent service.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: This restaurant has survived the cut throat F&B industry for more then 30 years - testimony to the food quality they have been serving through the yea

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: This is my first visit to Wah Lok and we have had a very enjoyable experience there. We ordered only the Dim Sum items which both the adults and kids enjoyed very much! The waiter who served us was very attentive, friendly and experienced. I was also pleasantly surprised that the bill was not as high as I was expecting from such high quality food and services. Will definitely visit again!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Had lunch last week the dim sum was super we had the herbal jelly with almond cream for sweet was must try item for dessert. The service was good too. Looking forward for the next visit.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Very good service & food. My overseas friends enjoyed the wonderful Tim sum & the ambience. Good comments & will recommend to their friends.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: My first visit to Wah Lok was more than 20 years ago.  Back then, the dim sum was really good.  The ambience and service are still like good old days.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
The room was packed with families celebrating the coming New Year lovely to watch the rituals
Our waitress was excellent. Gave us lots of advice on dishes without being overpowering
The food was so tasty
Loved everything

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
I suppose it’s the same as to expect to go to fine dining in New York at New Year’s Eve. It doesn’t exist 
So why was I expecting same for a Chinese restaurant during Chinese New Years festivities in Singapore?

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: This was our second visit there. This time round the service was terrible. Waiters taking orders for food were inattentive, showed impatience, couldn’t get the orders right. In essence, just gave the feeling that they had other more important duties to do. When all the food was served, and it was the last orders, they seemed to can’t wait to get rid of u

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Been here countless times and it never disappoints. It can be more expensive then your usual dim sum joints but it serves up good quality food and efficient service.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Good Cantonese food in overall, good service. Dessert was disappointing though and needs more work. Will go back again

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: The dim sum is good and value for money. The restaurant is spacious and provide good service. Highly recommended for those who love dim sum.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
Lovely dim sums , friendly staff,
grand , clean and comfortable ambience  .
Definitely will return for more !

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: First time back here in perhaps a year, and was made to wait almost 20 minutes despite having a reservation. The lady at the front desk could have relayed the information in a kinder ton

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
Our go to restaurant for family get togethers. 

Dinner and Dim Sum service alike is always consistent, prompt, and personable. 

Must orders: 北京鸭, Beef Cubes, Salted Egg prawns, the deep fried durian ice cream 

Items on Dim Sum menu are all good!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: A safe bet for dim sum. Just need to make a reservation as it is really crowded especially during the weeke

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: All in all, a really pleasant birthday dinner. The food was excellent except one dish which we found to be quite average. Service was top notch as well. Price is a little on the high side, but definitely worth it.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Wanted to eat Peking Duck. Ordered a whole duck and duck came up TOP. A pity they didn’t perform the carving of crispy skin in front of us, unable to appreciate the crackling sound and the glossy skin. Ordered the wagyu beef. Meat is soft and tender and melts in the mouth with good marbling of fat. The roasted quail was tad too dry. Order 3 variety of individual soup. Best was the shark fin and crab soup. Overall service was fantastic, value average. Love the spacious and grand layout.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Mom loves the dining experience there, food are great, the customer service is excellent. Even though the price is at the high side, at least we had a wonderful mom and daughter bonding time.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Together with the deep fried century egg with prawn paste. Tasted unlike the usual century egg on the market. Even my young kids loved it when they avoid century eggs. 罐汤饺was not as good as last visit.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Overall dining experiences was great and the staffs are so friendly and helpful. Lastly, food is good! I love the abalone pie

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Wah Lok has had a facelift but the excellent service and famous dim sum remain as good as they always have been. This is a moderately upscale place on the second floor of the Carlton Hotel, with a relaxed atmosphere and truly wonderful dim sum. It is a good idea to book.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Food quality is good. Crowd no so cool though. You would need a private room if you want to have a quiet time on weekends. It resembles more of a HK 'char chan teng', rowdy guests with flip flops. I suppose you cannot change that unless the restaurant impose some form of dress code. In some ways, you do not expect that in a city central top-end restaurant.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Restaurant opens at 1130 sharp, manager and waitress very friendly and helpful. Gave good recommendation on what to order for just three of us. Dim Sum was unique, I like the taste. Will visit again.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
Went there for birthday lunch with family as the reviews was good. 
Feel that the food taste average after trying.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Food was great. And service was great too. All the dishes came out on time and tasted awesome. Better than most canto restaurants in SG.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Dim sum was really good. Pleased with the friendly, well-trained and professional service staff. Like the warm towels on the table. Overall, an enjoyable and pleasurable dining experience.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: like the crab spring roll and Beijing duck. the salted egg bun also nice, must try. the service is good, definitely will recommend to friends

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: I returned here last month for a dim sum lunch with some colleagues. As on previous visits, the dim sum was of a very good standard. Efficient service and quality food: an ideal lunch experience.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Definitely one of the best dim sum restaurants that you can find here in Singapore. Very well made fine dim sum especially the por lor char siu pau is really yummy! Carrot cake is also good and the list goes on..... service is excellent too. Definitely the place to go for authentic nice fine dim sum.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Wah Lok's Mao Shan Wang durian snowskin mooncakes are addictive! Their assorted mini Berrylicious snowskin mooncakes are also worth trying. The 4 snowskin flavours include blueberry, cranberry, raspberry and strawberry. Bite into it and you will find a ball of white chocolate with filling. Yummy!! Their packaging is not "loud". It has small cute rabbits hopping about.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Haven’t been here for two years. The restaurant is renovated, with a large spacious reception area. Tables are rather close to one another, like typical Chinese restaurants in HK, so can be noi

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Very good traditional dim sum. Service is very prompt. Good atmosphere to hang around with friends and family for a meal

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: This is always my to-go for dim sums in Singapore. Must eat dishes are the Char Siew steam bun and egg tarts.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Food was delicious. Pot of daily soup seems bottomless - good enough for 3 rounds x 3 pax. Best of all, no corkage charge!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Good food and nice dim sum with regular promotion. Very good service from the staff. Will be going again

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Some outstanding dishes (chili crab springroll and seafood crystal dumpling) and thoughtful service. A rushed lunch and rather too short to appreciate the experience they had to offer, but even so we enjoyed ourselves.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Dim Sum standards might have dipped a little since we were there 1 year ago, but the carrot cake and egg tarts were still the creme de la crem

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
Lovely restaurant and very central. It is expensive but without a doubt it is best Yum Cha in SG.

Lots of choice and they’re Siu Yuk (my favourite!) is almost perfect!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Following our guide’s recommendations we went to this restaurant to discover cantonese foo

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: One saving grace was their char siew pork buns. It could rival some of the grand dames of cantonese restaurants out there. Juicy pork morsels, tempered really well with the sweet charred undertones and enveloped in the thinnest of crusts. And atop the bun, a lovely crusty coating of crispness akin to the crusts on melon buns and Bo luo bao

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Always a yummy trip for authentic cantonese dim sum ... you get real value for price paid, the dim sum comes piping hot ... the roast pork is not to be missed! Never fails to deliver ... good food plus nice ambience 😋

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Went there for lunch, 5 persons. Ordered dimsum dishes. We ordered 13 different dimsum, all not bad, but not ready fantastic. Very salty. Restaurant ambience not bad, very spacious and cosy. Price quite steep, $7.50 per plate with 2 or 3 pieces. Overall good.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Went for dim sum lunch on a weekday. They almost cancelled my reservation as they were not aware of the update reservation time for some reason. I had made reservations via their websi

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Arrival experience was mediocre. Hostess didn't look like she enjoys her job. Service staff at the table were excellent - engaging and knowledgeable (in menu items). All the hot items were great but the dessert is extremely disappointing. There is no corkage charges, so feel free to BYO wine!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: One of the pioneer restaurant that shaped the Cantonese Fine Dining scene he

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Best Peking duck. Great service. Very attentive and prompt. Quiet and nice atmosphere to dine in. Price is on the high side. But worth a visit once in a while.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
We went there to celebrate MIL’s 70th birthday dinner.
We were impressed with the service by the staff and the food was yummy! Good job Wah Lok and thank you for making the visit memorable. We will be back for sure!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Good ambience, good food, and excellent service. Price a little st

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: the dimsum is excellent. the har kow is so fresh and yummy. i love the fried carrot cake most. crispy to the core.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
Back after many years. But quality still good! Eg: 
- thin, translucent skinned prawn dumpling; stir-fry al dente noodles in soy sauce; steamed carrot cake (rare find in dim sum joints); good ‘ol egg tart in puff pastry

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: V yummy dishes. Creamy porridge. Service was good too.. was there till after svc time over whc is at 3pm. The staff was v polite and let us stay awhile longer.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: For me, wah lok still holds the best dim sum in singapore, everything tasted great and freshly made. Never disappointing

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Service was immacula

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: I was advised to eat here and I was really disappointed. The octopus was tough and my main arrived when I was half way through my starter - making me leave the octopus so the chicken didnt go cold. It was kampong chicken and I was put off seeing blood still visible around the bones. The crab rice definitely had crab in it but I couldnt taste

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: I've been hearing the good reviews about Wah Lok and has always wanted to try. I was sorely disappoint

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: It's my best tim sum in Singapore. Atmosphere is good. But if there is a long queue outside during weekend, they hope you dont chit chat for long after you complete your food 😉

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: First time visiting after hearing recommendation from friends. Brought my mum for Mother’s Day lunch & she enjoyed it although some dishes was slight salty. Overall experience was good. Food was served promptly & service was good.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Nice restaurant for family gathering. Amazing food. One of the best dim sum restaurant. Service was good and prompt..

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Service was excellent. Upon seated, my little one was served with a set of kids cutleries and a cup of warm water with straw! Our plates were also regularly changed to a new one without having to request. The staff were all very attentive to our needs and we enjoyed our dinner without a fuss!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Service was very good - thank you Chai Fong! Haven't been there for a long time and the food is fresh and still as good.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Foods just average. And quite rushed to dine there as felt like been rushed to finish the meals by the staffs. Not worth as we can have better choice which costs lesser with definitely better foods.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: This place has been around for a very long time, which is a testimony to its delicious food and excellent service. Great for couples, families or business meals.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Wah Lok never fails with their dim sum. Maybe except for their steam custard bun (流沙包) which does not really "flow".

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Service was superb and staff were attentive. Celebrated my grandma's 90th birthday and we specially chose a restaurant that specialize in Cantonese dishes. She was full of praise for the food and the kind attention from the waiter/waitresses. Glad she enjoyed her birthday celebration so much though we didn't get a private room. Recommended to try dishes such as sweet sour pork, super fresh grouper, peking duck. Kind of disappointed with 2 overrated dishes - poached crispy rice and sauteed egg white with crabmeat. I expected too much from these 2 dishes which turned out to be "not that flavourful". Overall a great experience! Avocado ice cream must try!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Went for dimsum lunch on a Saturday afternoon. Restaurant was pretty packed, we were glad that we made reservations in advanc

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: It was my first time to Wah Lok but 2nd time for my family members. Though it was quite pricey, but the quality of the food and service is very good.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: The food and service at Wah lok did not fail to impress as always. Got to try the Siu yoke and char siew

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: We were fortunate to book as this popular restaurant was fully booked on Sunday for at least 2 lunch covers, even with additional tables set up. Accompanied by Singaporean friends we enjoyed an excellent selection of Dim Sum tastes, and busy wait staff coped well with servicing all tables satisfactorily. Clearly, Wah Lok attracts loyal patrons as well as tourists, but we have experienced a consistency of v.g. satisfaction over the years.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Visited the restaurant again for lunc

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: I have been having lunch at Wah Lok Restaurant since young and the food standard has been very consistent for the last 20 year

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
Samantha was exceptional and helpful in everything we need.
Thank you for making such a great experience.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: We had the company dinner on Last Friday at this Restaura

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Wah Lok Cantonese Restaurant has continually been applauded as one of Singapore’s finest Cantonese restaurants but I personally beg to DISAGREE. Taste is inferior compared to most restaurants in Hong Kong.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: We had a dinner and yum cha lunch there and must say the food ws good and the service was great. For dinner we had a big group, 15 of us, we ordered their banquet offerring and were not disappointed. Food was ample and tasty. No wonder this restaurant came highly recommend

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: If ever I was to return, I would go for lunch because I think this is what would work best in this grand (old-style, yet modern) restaurant. But it was evening and we were hung

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Staff are friendly and customer oriented, my family really enjoyed the food recommended and had a great time for the meal.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Good food for set menu for dinner and the dim sum liunch is excellent al

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Despite paying a bit more for the usual items on comparable dim sum menus, the quality of the dishes are consustently above average. The level of service is friendly and the staff seem to have worked there for some years (so that there are a lot of regular customers to create a family like environmen

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review:
Great dim sum and pekinese duck
Calm atmosphere, tables widely spaced
excellent service
A most gracious experience

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: I normally VISIT Wah Lok once every quarter whenever I COME to Singapore. Food is very good and so is the SERVICE but SEAFOOD can be expensive. The trade-off is that it is corkage free for up to 5 bottles of wine. So for serious drinkers: it is a good deal! There should be more places like WL.....

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: The business set menu for dinner is affordable (@$68++ per head) and the food was deliciou

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: All the dishes we’ve ordered were fresh and delicious. Not too sweet not too salty and not too oily. Just nice ;)

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: must book in advance to get in to this upmarket restaurant.  dim sim is tasty but overpriced.  However, the 3 signature abalone pies are delicious  and good value for sgd 12.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: The food was excellent and service was impeccable. Price was on the high side but that was to be expected from Wah Lok. The fact that they readily give out the parking coupon is a nice touch.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Recommended by a local and where we happened to be staying at the Carlton.  The food was just delicious just so very tasty, service quick and price very reasonable. A great way to end 2018.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Must make reservation as we nearly didn't get a table. The chicken and abalone pie and steamed custard egg buns were really good. Chicken feet not so good, and mini egg tarts dry. Sticky rice tasty.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Usually dine here every 2 months with my own family and the in laws. Food and service are very consistent. Excellent, keep it up!

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Really enjoy the restaurant. Highly recommendIt is the second time I visited the restaurantMost staff can also speak Cantonese

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Dim Sim was very good. Ordered one fried yong fu dish. Cost $28 for just a few common fried pieces -! Regretted ordering that. Paid $120 for 3 pax.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Love the charsiew buns!! Being a custard lover, the custard buns were very yummy! I enjoyed the zhaliang very much, it wasn’t too hard and was kept just crispy! The yam puffs were not like anything I have eaten before, the yam was so smooth and went well with the seafood in there. I had high expectations of Wak Lok, perhaps a little too high and maybe a little unrealistic. Overall, it was very good but I need to eat more competitors to know where it stands.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: Great place for business lunch. Food quality continue to be top notch. Have been bringing business partners for lunch at this place & will continue to do so.

Name: Wah Lok
Location: 76 Bras Basah Road Carlton Hotel, Singapore 189558 Singapore
Review: We were there for their dim sum. Some of the items were out of stock, leaving us with a little option as the menu for dim sum wasn't a lot. Wish that they could have more variety.The restaurant was full but yet the service of the staffs are awesome.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: English hubby had Christmas dinner here 5 years ago & he still remembers it ! As a local Chinese, I’ve brought my family this year and we are amazed by the great Christmas spread. Generous portions & very tasteful. Great ambience of English Christmas music & deco too. Highly recommend & thanks to manager Roni too for also being flexible to our requests. Thanks guys!

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Excellent! Loved every bite. The Yorkshire pudding is best I ever had. The gravy is lovely. Comes with some horseradish sauce, not too spicy, which I like.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Well, Its my point of view since I never got a bad exp over there. It was always fun and friendly evenings! Located by the river and right at the central of SG. We were always coming here to start the nig

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: great place for networking in the CBD with great skyline and river views - also great range of beers - friendly staff too

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Good location on the waterfront. Music. Seating inside and out. Large pub inside. Good range of craft beers, but pricey. Good for people spotting whilst sitting outside. One consolation, as a smoker, you can smoke outside.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Good drinks and friendly service. A bit pricey but typical for the area. Nice view, made friends quickly

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: full of expats and tourists looking for a traditional London experience and this aint it. but its fine if your looking for a quick pint or two and don't mind some of the financial people shouting in your ear! I was going to say bankers but hey you know....

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Good for a quick dinner, with a good menu for a pub. Very good quality, fast preparation and good service from waiters.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Good service cold beer and screens for the rugby. A great atmosphere - one to recommend if you want to see a special game.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We had a couple of pints and enjoyed being able to catch up with the World Cup. Just went for the drink and did not eat.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Called in for a meal at Lunch time. The Food was great. And the portions were very generous. We had Hunters Chicken. Pork Sausage pie. Cottage Pie. GUINNESS PIE.THE FOOD was very warm. And we all had a lovely meal. And we all had apple crumble for dessert. We will be calling again soon

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Stopped by during lunch but was massively disappointed by the good. Totally tasteless pasta with cream, chicken and bacon. Wouldn’t think it would be possible but it was sad. Will not go again.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Hovel of a place that could skew your view of Singapore. Been more than once and seem to be more disappointed each ti

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: The Penny Black is situated on Boat Quay in the Central Business District area. Right on the riverside it is located beside the MRT station (underground/tube), taxis stands and bus stops so no excuses for not getting there! The place has a great selection of larger, stout and ales. The food selection is just as good and the quality is excellant. This spot has a fantastic vibe about it, great fun in the evenings and good spot for the sport all year round. Well worth the time to visit as the staff there are very friendly and professional. Thumbs up for the PB...5 stars!!!

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Like everywhere in Singapore everything is expensive. Here we had four drinks and a main dish each which totalled 95 dollars. The service was okay, the food was nice and the drinks were as expected. In the UK id expect to pay around £35 for the above ‘pub grub’ so as this is equivalent to around £56 I wouldn’t boast to go here and be happy at spending this much. We were hungry so it filled our needs but I wish we’d have been more savvy!

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Visited the Penny Black for lunch today. They have a very appetising menu consisting of Western (Irish) favourites as well as Asian food. The bar is primarily a Sports Bar with a number of large TV screens showing a variety of sports. I had the Sunday lunch of Veal, mixed veg, Yorkshire pudding and mashed potato. Smashing! We then shared the molten lava cake which was equally good. All that said I would not go there if travelling on a budget as both food and particularly drinks are a bit expensive ($14 for a pint). Nevertheless a nice experience!

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: The food here exceeded my expectations and the wait staff provided excellent servi

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Unpleasant bar at side of the wat

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Looking for a place to watch the State of Origin Rugby League was a challenge given the cricket World Cup also being televised. Gimmicks aside, we got to see the game (Queensland were victorious) and sampled a range of beers and food. Pub food is what it is....benign and harmless to all palates but the beer was a big disappointment. The Speckled Hen was expensive, flat and nothing even approaching an ale in terms of taste. Thankfully, the game dominated the evening and our taste buds were never even remotely challenged....it is quite simply a typical Singapore facsimile of a London pub....authenticity unknown....but the State of Origin was thankfully, the main event

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We’ve been dropping in here for years when we visit our son in Singapore and ,when friends visit,they always mention this place as it’s in a great location being on the river and on the corner of Boat Quay nearest the Ci

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: After walking around the water the husband was in search of a cold ale. We decided to stop as there was seating available out the front and watch Singapore pass us by. Staff were friendly and happy to answer questions. Beer was cold and pims was great. Ordered some fries as a snack which came out quickly and we're nice and fresh. Other customers had ordered some sort of pies and they looked amazing. Amentities were clean and pub had a general English atmosphere going on with the soccer on screens. We enjoyed our visit

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: What a good find, totally by accident eneded up here on St Patricks day. It was a slow start there was a march with a band and the place just filled up and was really busy. Soon after we were having the craic with everyone. It was a really memorable experience.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Came here to celebrate my birthday and wanted some good British fa

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Great bar to watch football, rugby, F1 etc. Went in for the Aussie F1 race which was also St. Paddy’s Day. Great atmosphere and table service from staff. Often drinks offers on too and the fries are nice!

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We met an old friend for a drink before eating at the Marahaja (cf) nearb

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Great location on the river and excellent food. At the of Boat Quay, so you can watch the river boats pass by, while you eat and drink.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: After walking around the Singapore River for a few hours in the heat, good to stop in a pub for a cold drink. Stopped in this pub for a pint and it's a very nice, traditional English pub. Has a good selection of beers and the staff friend

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Stopped by after a short walk from the taxi stand. Really fancied some pork pie so where else to choose than Penny Black tropical England bar? I really dislike the chemical tasting Tiger so ordered a couple of good British cokes. Pub was busy with sexpat men but nice ambience. Toilets were Victorian era but comfortable enough for my wife to sit and relieve her chronic constipation.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: What a great spot on boat quay right at the end from where we were staying at Clark’s quay but a nice walk along.We got a table next to the river and had a few drinks ,they sold Guinness which pleased my hubby.the service was excellent.the place was heaving .the guys did really well very attentive

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: One of the old bar located at the entrance to boat quay, great for meeting and catching up with friends.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Wandering the area we wanted a Tiger draft beer so we stopped into the first one of the row along the rivers edge. Mid afternoon and not too busy so we chose a water side seat. Service was OK, once our beer order final made to the bar for filling. OK spot for a touring break.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review:
The pub was situated by the river and was an all right place for a beer. This was in the evening and the quai was crowded with people. 
Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Nice pub situated by the water. Not cheap for a drink but nice atmosphere. Lovely to have a drink and watch the boats go by

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We had a lovely and unusual supper snack here washed down with a chilled tasty beer and cuba libra. We sat outside but there is also fairly extensive seating inside. The venue is described as a Victorian London pub and the interior definitely reflects this. The small outdoor seating area is popular with smokers as you would imagine but being outside this is not a problem. The staff was very helpful in describing the beer which hubby said was impressive. The food was hot and delicious. The menu here does offer good pub favourites but it is actually quite vast and certainly creative. Prices are not cheap but won't break the bank either. We intended to return to try more of the menu but there's so much on offer in Singapore we didn't manage it. Penny Black would definitely be a local if I lived there.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We were looking for decent pork pies and chanced upon the penny black. Initially they wanted to seat up next to the trash bin but we requested for anther seat. they served pretty decent british food, service was average, atmosphere was good as we took the seat beside the river. Do make reservation during Fridays and over the weekend, as the place does get crowded.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: A traditional British Pub right along the Clarke Quay walk. Stopped in during our walk around the river for lunch. Great British food as well as Asian food as well. Lots of football (soccers) for us Canadians. Definitely had the British atmosphere.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: It was a great exprience to dine and drink beside the Singapore River. The food is fantasic and the ambence was grea

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Really nice place in the river front which especially after 18:00 daily is very crowded, with most of them with a beer in the ha

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: The Penny Black is a historic pub which was transported brick by brick from the UK. It is also the home of the Singapore Branch of the Newcastle United Supporters Club so we had to pop in. Irrespective of the football the pub is great in its own right with an excellent selection of beers, lovely staff, good atmosphere and great pub food - definitely recommend the fish and chips, red snapper was superb

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Just passing by and popped in for a Guiness (which was fine) and a ordered a Mojito too. Yikes it was bad, small, warm glass, no apparent rum in the mix, no sweetness either, so small and hit that we had drank it before realising how bad it was ..... fed back to the waitress at the time. Scored 1 for the Guines

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Excellent place to see the Singapore scene. Crowd is mixed locals and expats. food is good. on river fro

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Nice British Pub Ambiance, both inside and out, pub grub and imported beers. (Food highly recommended, but not sampled, because we ate at Indian restaurant a few doors awa

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Enough said. Great night. Can get a little packed. Service is ok. But again - cold beer and rugby - what else is need

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Being in Boat Quay , my wife and I called in at the Penny Black , having been there on previous visits to Singapore. Oh dear , the place has gone downhill seriously -- service was unbelievably slow , the food was no better than avaerage and the cost was a bit more than I had expected for a couple of drinks and a mid-afternoon sna

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review:
Worth a look if you are into the British pub scene

Had a great night there and we met some new friends

Good place for westerners

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We decided to stop here for lunch after reading reviews on here and we wasn’t disappointed. We had been touring the city and spotted this pub and decided to have lunch, we both opted for the Bacon Sandwich which was delicious and it was nice to have some proper bacon! Service was a little slow but it was too be expected as it lunchtime and busy! I’d definitely stop by next time I’m visiting Singapore

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Arrived late in the evening to Singapore and met up with family member. Quiet on a Monday night and squeezed in food, generally ok, chicken salad was a bit overwhelmed by rocket. Service prompt and beer good, popular with locals but would prefer to explore other food options along boat quay.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Came here on a monday during happy hour. Expectedly and thankfully not too crowded. Average pub grub and drinks

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: I have been here many times during my visits to Singapore over the years. They are always happy to accommodate and ensure your food and drink service is the best. Great location over looking the river and downtown.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: good place to go to join Newcastle United fans although the service is hit and miss and they continue to play the music outside when the match is on even though they couold be playing the commentary, have complained but nothing done

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Nothing much has changed here since my last visit in 2010. I still have the Tshirt that I purchased but like the hotel, it is a little tired and faded. Beers were expensive but then again so is everything else in Singapore. Nothing special to speak of with disinterested staff certainly not helping to lift anyone's spirits. So after a couple of beers and a bowl of chips we left this little English oasis.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Went here for a get together with quite a large group. When we arrived it took some time to find the booking. We ordered 2 drinks which took 20 minutes to reach us. The sport was very loud but you have to expect that at a pub. Not many staff behind the bar & the staff that were in were rude.. We were told we’d need to leave by 7 as they’d booked the tables for another group. This wasn’t explained when booking. Around 7 they waved some of our group away from the tables and moved the others in. The way they did it was rude. Drinks are expensive and there is no way I’d eat there after the poor service so we lef

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Had a great lunch by the water here at Penny Black. Food was a very high standard and was great to watch the action of lunch time rush in Boat Qua

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We arrived at boat quay about an hour before nightfall, plenty of time to enjoy the sites and sounds in daylight. We then had to pick our restaurant. We liked the variety of The Penny Black. I had a curry and my companion a classic burger. Both came out promptly and were delicious. I had the Shiraz which was very good. My companion was very pleased to see they had Kilkenny on tap. After dinner we were in the perfect spot to take night time photos of the river.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We were out exploring and saw the Penny Black.  Needed a pint and some chips.  Good location, righ on the water.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: I was in Singapore and had a few hours to fill in until I went to the Airport. Found my way to the Penny Black and spent a very happy couple of hours there - attentive staff, nice cold beer and nice location on the river. Was just what I needed. Certainly recommended

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: A lovely pub at the beginning of Boat Quay on the banks of the Singapore River. Pub has a lot to offer including pub grub and a nice assortment of beer and other beverages. How much more British can you get than "Penny Black"? And you may hear a hint of British accents while having your tipple while gazing across the lovely river.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: The wife and i paid a visit to the penny black to watch our game v Liverpool which kicked off at 1.30am and finished at 3.30am opening times were no problem and it was totally enjoyable apart from the usual result at Anfield. Loved the toon army barmaids tops and bits of memorabilia in the pub. Felt like being home again although the bar was not as full as I would expect, drinks are reasonable.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: It's a prime location right on the Singapore River, near the CBD, likes to show football and rugby match

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: WIfe and I popped in here for afternoon lunch and a cool drink. Waitress was very friendly and although the out door restaurant was very busy the service was very good. We both had fish and chips which was very good followed by a nice cool beer for me and a glass of wine for my wife. We really enjoyed here and would recommend it.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: I had four evenings here, it was one of the most genuine dining experiences I've ever had in Singapore with prompt friendly and honest service and a delightful outlook. I met lots of interesting people and the beer is good. The food , well it doesn't pretend to be any more than a pub, you get pub grub and it's not bad at all

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Visited the Penny Black 3 times whilst on holiday. Happy hour and for food several tim

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: As a pub this place seems pretty fun but my review is of the flood. Besides the location and the ex-pat menu there is not much good to say. The service was so so and the food was meh—

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: when we entered bar waiter gave us menu, but never came back to get our order. at the end one of us needed to go inside the bar and place our order. so finally we get our order on the table. my wine glass got lipstick stain

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: It's about as close to a British pub as you'll find in Singapore, and you can get a good pint of Guinness there too. We sat outside beside the river, which was a very pleasant way to just sit and watch the world go by. You'll often need to reserve a table if you want to get the best tables right on the Riverfront though, unless you're not eating at popular time

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Had lunch here. Good service and wholesome food in a lovely setting on the riverbank. Needed to be reasonably quick and they were.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Penny Black is an infamous drinking hole by the water - so it's usually loud, fun and bubbly with beers from around the world. if that's your thing, this is your place. However, I recently had a lovely Sunday brunch by myself after the lunch time. It was so peaceful and quiet, and the service quite friendly, too. The food exceeds expectation. I had a stylish salad of some interesting mix and a thick soup - all quite tasty, definitely many notches above standard bar food. Of course, you can't beat the view - stunning to look at the sites and there's interesting people watching, too. A fun place which suits many moods.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Had a department event here, and ordered the beef pasta, which was pretty decent. We sat in a private area on the 2nd Level shophouse, well decorated to the Christmas theme.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We stopped here for a drink and had a seat overlooking the water which was lovely. Service was prompt and they had free wifi, although I don't quiet understand why the waitress had to enter the code into my phone for me.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: The pub offers the expected British theme with a reasonable choice of beers. On a warm evening its offers a lovely place to simply sit on the riverside and enjoy a decent pint along with the excellent mini fish and chips.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: The mini pizza is about 15cm in diameter, so fits the description of MINI. Service was slow, even though the place wasn't crowded. On the plus it was easy to get a waterfront seat. When you go inside, they are running air so it's about 5-10C cooler and may suit some folk.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: This pub chose itself as it probably was the only one in Singapore to be showing our Premier League match live!. It became apparent why, when we turned up in the evening, as it had morphed into the official fan club pub for our opponents! Not sure how a London pub became a base for Newcastle? Turned out one of our hotel managers was a Newcastle supporter! Good atmosphere. Worth checking out as a central base for watching footie without any hass

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: At the end of Boat Quay with seating by the river or ins

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: I always enjoy lunch and a cold beer or two at Penny Black on Clarke Quay. Reasonably priced (for Singapore) and good choice and quality of food. Very relaxing after strolling along the river or around Marina Bay.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Great little pub with outside seating on the river.  I love to sit in the outside area next to the river and relax.  Always my first place to start my walk down Boat Quay to Clark Quay.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: This corner restaurant by the river boasts a good view of the river (if seated outdoors), has decent food, but was most impressed by the good service of the bubbly waitress there. First time there with my girlfriend to grab a quick meal after work, but certainly not the last; will come back again.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Located right by the river, this is a great place to catch up with friends or watch the world go by. Good for a beer, a gin and tonic, finger foods or a full meal.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: I was heading to Harry's to watch the Sunday afternoon nrl game only to find the Harry's no longer has live football. So called in next door to find an truly excellent British pub. Expensive drinks ( but that's any where in the tourist spots of Singapore) it's reasonable during happy hour and they service all the pub classic meals. Well worth a visit

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Decent choice of (pricey) beer, and whilst the food isnt great it is better than Harry's (next door). The pizzas they bring in from outside but are pretty good. Staff are friendly and reasonably efficient. Nice to sit outside on the riverfront and watch the world go by. They show most major sporting events with commentary on.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: This is a British- styled pub in the Clarke Quay complex. We visited here during a massive rain storm. Greeted by friendly, attentive staff and great atmosphere. Well appointed decor...and it's the Newcastle UFC fan spot in Singapore! Gre

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Not my first visit to this pub but we dived in because of the rai

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: After a day of being a tourist in the heat the cold one under shade at the Penny Black in boat quay was perfec

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: This is the first bar/pub to find as you enter Boat Quay from the finanicla district side. As such it gets a lot of "city types" both local and expat and there are times it wil lbe busy soon after trading. However, its still a reasonable pub in a prime location with outdoor seating on the river. Being the first one it has the advantage of a bit more breeze, it can get hotter as you move into the Quay. Good drinking hole and home to the Newcastle supporters of Singapore (not many of them local, obviously). Good for sport and starting the night.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Excellent English pub in Boat Quay. Has a good mixed crowd of locals, expats and tourists. Fantastic place to watch sport, particularly rugby. Has quite a regular crowd and staff service is friendly. Food menu is British pub food. The riverside is great for tourists to relax and sit by the river. Nice for people watching and watching the world go by.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Good for watching rugby union. outside has no sound. Sound was on inside. Menu typically British. small serves. service ok.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We stopped at The Penny Black for lunch. It has outside seating so you can sit right next to the river and watch the world go by. We opted for a drink and a light lunch and it was served quickly and the food was good pub food. There are lots of restaurants along this part of the river bank so you will have plenty of choice but we would have no hesitation about going back to this place.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We visited here on a Friday evening from the office. It was busy at that time but it took ages to get served. Was also difficult to find anyone when we wanted another round. And when we did they took ages and got the order wron

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Called in for a bite to eat, a few beers, and as it turned out, to watch my football team getting humiliated on the large scre

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Great atmosphere. Reasonably priced drinks. Friendly staff. Great sport coverage. Really good to start a Saturday night off at.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Getting more runned down since last time we were there. And service is slower too.. But ok to have a beer and watch some sports.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Had Fish n Chips for lunch with a lemon lime bitters and a pint of Guinness on St.Patrick's Day. Great location, food, drinks and service. Very relaxing. Was a busy day, so staff was a bit lost. Only one little issue. One of the staff members dropped a fork on the very dirty floor, picked it up quickly, gave it a quick brush and put it back in the tray for setting up tables. Oops!

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: It's a beautiful place to enjoy your beer in the evening with lovely breeze and good view. The place is usually booked so better to make pre-arrangements or arrive early. Food is good and especially the spicy chicken wings are good snacks but the service is extremely slow. In fact after waiting for 30 min for our snacks when we checked again they said it will take another 15-20 min so we had to cancel our second order. Price is average but you can enjoy happy hours till 8.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: It looks a bit run down inside. They do play the english football games but they don't have many televisions. It's not really a comfortable place to hang out.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Like any regular visitor to Singapore I am familiar with the Penny Black as a reliable venue for food, drink and people watching. On this occasion I attended a 60th birthday party in the upstairs function ro

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Good pub grub at reasonable prices. Good selection of beers and well made cocktails, Nice atmosphere and a great place to catch up on sport on the TV

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Walking to the museum suddenly came across a London pub lol so had to try their beer, it is done exactly like a London boozer so very comfortable not sure about prices I haven't paid yet ???

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: While enjoying my cold beer sitting near the river at Boat Quay decided to have a meal. Wasn't disappointed had the Chicken Parmigiana which came with wedges and salad and tasted really good. Great place to relax and enjoy a cold beverage and if in the mood a feed. Will be going back.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: We stopped here for a quick drink and bar snacks as we walked around Singapore. Service was a bit slow but the bar snacks were fine. We had wings and fish fingers which helped assage hunger without being too large. Not fine dining but a nicy buzzy place to stop.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Good location on the river and a good atmosphere, being fairly busy. Was expensive for a beer however.

Name: The Penny Black Victorian London Pub
Location: 26/27 Boat Quay, Singapore 049817 Singapore
Review: Great people ! everyone there was drinking at least one drought at one time ;) I saw a lot of corporate employees letting them free with good beer and good music ! fantastic mood ! Very crowded, like everyone near that gulf came there. Enjoy!

Name: Imperial Treasure Super Peking Duck Restaurant
Location: 290 Orchard Road The Paragon #05-42/45, Singapore 238859 Singapore
Review: I was at champagne bar with my friends and I wanted to make my orders, but keep getting ignored by her because apparently she was talking to this fat male customer. Called for her a few times but she keeps saying she's coming up. Seriously, I was in a rush for time. I was angry but regardless I did not flare up or raised my voic

Name: Imperial Treasure Super Peking Duck Restaurant
Location: 290 Orchard Road The Paragon #05-42/45, Singapore 238859 Singapore
