We also ordered the chicken and cashew dish $14.80), spring rolls ($8.00 for 4x small size rolls) and vegetarian egg fried rice ($7.80 per serve). We were told the egg rice serving for $7.80 was only enough for one person so we ordered 2 between us, but it was enough for about 3 or 4 of those small bowls, with our main dishes meat added to it, so we didn’t finish the second one. The hand towel provided in the gold wrapping was added to the bill at a cost of 30c each, and we paid a 10% device charge and 7% GST on top of the prices in the me

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Went here with my wife and her friend.  We had a selection of dishes, vegetables and meats.  All very tasty.  Enjoyed the meal however I thought it was a bit expensive

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Food took some time to arrive which I took as a good sign - it was not pre-cooked. Place is a bit tired but food hygiene was top class. May be a bit expensive but at least you can pay with the card for orders over 20 dollars.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Had dinner with clients and was utterly disappointed with the dishes served. Had steam fish and it was not fresh. The meat platter taste as if the meat has been a couple days old.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: If you’re looking for a great casual and clean spot to eat really good food Fatty Weng’s is great! The staff are so warm and helpful you feel like family. Great Chili Crab with fried rolls to dip in that delicious spicy sauce. Every dish was delicious and they even accommodated my friends needs for a Gluten-free meal. Plus big pours of wine by the glass. All very nice and reasonable too!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Nice staff snd tasty food for a person used Chinese food in Nordic countries. Food was rich in tastes and good. Helpfull and nice staff. Aircondition was nice compared to hotness on streets.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Ordered several dishes for a family of 5 pax, most of their dishes were small and pricey( average $15 per dish,smal

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We are regulars but the manager still wants to charge us corkage for our wine. Soon hock is very good but too expensive and the other food is only so so....

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Ordinary at best. Unfriendly service and definitely not value. We asked what was in the BBQ platter and was told whatever was available. Better value elsewhere in China Town.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Not much to look at from the outside, but amazing food and great service, really reasonably priced too.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Recommended for lunch by family and not disappointed. The duck was excellent and the service very good. Would certainly return

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review:
Not recommended. Menu has  limited choices, food standard is below average.                                 

It’s a shame that the food didn’t live up to the expectations

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: There is nothing like good Chinese food and this was NOTHING like good Chinese food. We ordered 3 main courses at lunchtime yesterday and the first to come along was a drab, tasteless, grey brown, small portion of Chicken and Cashew nuts. There was literally NO seasoning whatsoever to the point I summoned the waiter to ask if the Chef knew how to cook? Not even the dreaded MSG!! There were no red or green slices of peppers to brighten up this insipid, pathetic excuse for a dish. The Chef obviously had no interest in his work or cared two hoots for his custome

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: After a raining period, manage to get a table for 7. Good food. Unfortunately cashiers did not discount the wet tissue after returning to them. Tap my credit card without asking.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Have been coming here regularly due to its deep fried SOON HOCK FISH ( quite wonderful ). But PRICE was excessive ( S$80+ for 900 gsm ) and worst, manager insisted on charging S$20 corkage for a bottle of wine ( and I am come here and always order huge meal ).

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Enjoyed the AC. Spouse had the sliced fish and I had the prawns with vegetables. Hadn't expected the prawns to be served with shells and heads. Food was OK, but not exceptiona

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: The duck (& pancakes) here are very tasty. It is also nice to get a seat outside to view all the goings on in Chinatown. A definite recommendation for tasty food for a reasonable price.Also good to go with kids.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Awesome food. The chef has a long history in Singapore. A local recommended this restaurant and I greatly enjoyed everything that I ordered.  The restaurant was clean and staff was friendly.  Check out the wine poor!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We stopped in here one evening during the Autumn Moon Festival. Service was efficient, no overly friendly, however no problems. Food was quite good but not cheap for you can actually get elsewhere. However the saving grace is that you get to sit inside in air conditioning, which makes the extra cost more than bearable in the Singapore heat.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: After a busy morning at the Chinatown markets we stopped on the corner of food street and had some lunch at this restaurant. I ordered a prawn and crab fried rice that was hot and freshly prepared. Air conditioned inside but there is also outdoor seating too.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We've been travelling around China for the past month, and this was easily the worst dining experience we've had. I rarely write scathing reviews, but this place surely deserves it. We should have known there was trouble when there were no patrons in the restaurant at 12PM. We went in because it SEEMED clean and had air conditioning (our kids were overheatin

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: It is located on the corner  and everybody you ask knows the place, so its impossible to miss it. Everything we ate was tasty. The service was fast. The restaurant is very clean and orderly.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Best lemon chicken ever. Small portion was huge amount. Great value, great food. Rice was excellent as well. Hubby had medium noodles. Like a mountain. Don't miss visit to Chinatown.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Fantastic reliable food! Great to have local Singapore food! Good service and friendly staff! We have followed Fattys for 30 years!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Try Maxwell food centre or Chinatown Complex instead. This place is too expensive for the food it serves. Might be good for families in pursuit of a comfortable environment to dine in the heat of Singapore.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We wanted for our last dinner in Singapore some duck for dinner and we cam across Fatty Weng Restaurant in china town busy street food area. this place do not look like much from the outside but after looking at the menu and the price we where happy to try they picking duck. Perhaps no the cheapest duck ($S35/half duck) for this area but this dish was nice, tasty and crispy. We started with the duck skin roll professionally carved at the table with cucumber and sauce perhaps a little more garnish would have been nice to compliment the duck. For main we asked amongst 3 or 4 chose the Sichuan style which was nice and tasty but with too much chili added (and I love spicy food) but the dried fry chili were over powering the delicate flavor of the duck. We also had the prawn noodle as a main to share but the prawn didn't have a lot of flavor and looked like they where steamed and not fried and lacked flavor. The service was casual in a basic décor. But we where happy enough to enjoy our last night in Singapore. Thanks anyway.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Went to this restaurant with my mom-in-law and families. This restaurant has been around since 1960s so it is well knowm for its Cantonese cusinie. The chefs are accommodative and will suit the customers' taste by adding or reducing salty of the food. The branch at Burlington Sq is eay to locate as it is just beside Sim Lim Square. If you are driving, advisable to park at OG as it is just a traffic light away and cheaper. They are famous for Deep Fried Fish in Special Sauce (that the chef will not share his secret) and Chilli Crab. Their Peking duck and tiger prawn are delicious too.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: I would advise to avoid this place, so many other better places to go to. The service was quite poor - forgot my rice, had to ask not once but twice for it. On top of that, the dumplings were the worst I’ve had - tasted like they had been in the freezer for a while and then lightly heated. Then to add salt to the wound, it was very expensive. Could have gone to one of the many fantastic hawker centres to spend my money on something tasty, as well as supporting the other hardworking locals who work their butts off cooking AND providing servic

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Chilli crab was delicious and reasonably priced (2 for $58). But the service was average. We arrived at 930 for dinner and were rushed for closing at 1030. The dinner was good though. We also enjoyed lemon chicken and sweet and sour pork. Oh - and a jug of Tiger.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Pretty good place in Chinatown. I very rarely order sweet and sour pork 🥩 as usually it is badly done. Quite the exception here. Great with a fried rice 🍚 and washed down with Tiger 🐯

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: A healthy number of patrons in any restaurant is always a good recommendation and so it was here with eastern and western diners about equal in number. It was lunchtime and so we only ordered two dishes - spring rolls and prawns in garlic noodles. They were delicious and well-washed down with a large reasonably-priced Tiger beer! Thanks Fatty!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review:
This company charges for tap water, per glass. 
Staff watched us the while time its very awkward to eat while someone is staring at you. 
Toilets - filthy need a good clean

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Great Service and outstanding quality of fish, chicken and duck it was very well price

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Didnt offer a fork (i cant use chopsticks) , had to pay for your serviettes and the nut mix they give you on arrival which they said was “complimentary” food expensive for the serving size, but the staff were friendly

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: The food was great, it is right near the chinatown food street. Although the food was great, we found it quite pricey, usd100 for a 1.1kg chilli crab, we also ordered peking duck, which was go

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We were on our first day in singapore and had no time to do homework on restaurants so popped in here as it had good reviews. It is nothing flash and is just a corner restaurant in China town but we were really impressed. We had the chilli crab which was really really tasty but $75 which is about £35 In proper money. We also had sweet n sour pork ( best I have had ), house ribs ( wow ) and what we thought were singapore noodles but they were not and they were not good.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: ...for a restaurant but perhaps not the best reason to eat the

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: First came to this restaurant when it started in Albert St, later it moved to badminton hall and now in Smith St in Chinatown. It has been some 40 years since my first visit and their signature dish remain excellent. Service OK and other food average but corkage of SD 20 / bottle...

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We tried the famous Singaporean’ Chinese New Year dish - Yu Sheng Lo Hei (Prosperity Toss). It is an auspicious festive salad dish to celebrate CNY. It is believed that the height of the toss will bestow a growth in the dinner’s fortun

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Terrible food and service. Mushroom vegetable dish tasted tinned and spicy soup was like dish water. Chicken was like pigeon meat. Filthy toilets and rude staff. Do not eat here. Walk down the street and go somewhere for decent food that’s a lot cheaper

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We liked this place so much we came back for a second time. We loved the sweet and sour pork and the honey ribs. I'm not a duck fan but the other people in our party loved the duck. At first they came out and cut it up and make appetizers. They then took it away. They took all of the duck off the bones and made a stir fry out of it and brought it back out to the table. I heard the stir fry was outstanding. Also, the tiger beer was only 8 dollars. The bottle was about a liter and I was only expecting a 12 oz. bottle which would be typical in the U.S. so we thought that was a great price compared to other places we drank at in Singapore.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Not offensive but nothing to make this place stand out either.   Felt we could have got food of a similar quality from the street traders probably at a lower cost.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Travelling from Australia to Singapore, Fatty's is always on our shortlist of restaurants. The "Nuclear Chicken" (known as Hotpot chicken on the menu) is highly recommended; and the salted egg yolk prawns are superior to similar dishes at high-end restaurants in Singapore. And the duck - can't be faulted. We went back a second time on this trip just for the duck - the flavour and tenderness is better than anything we can get in Australia.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We visited on a Friday evening and had the Singapore Chilli Crab.  This was the first time that we have had the dish.  It was superb and will be having it again next time that we are in Singapore.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: There are many places to eat in Chinatown but I'd been advised by my sister in law that a trip to Fatty Weng was a must. We were not disappointed, there is a good choice of food and the Fried Noodles were just lovely, and not unreasonably priced.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: You can definitely find better food within a 1 block radius but this is a nice air conditioned place with very professional and nice staff. Has the feeling of a tourist trap and it definitely is a bit pricey compared to surrounding competition. If you want a safe comfortable place without all the hustle and yelling of the better chinatown spots, this is your place.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: This was the second time we have visited this restaurant (1st time 3 years ago) and ordered Peking Duck. (P

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Rated this restaurant. Generous servings, fast service, reasonable prices, great duck.....what more could you want. Definitely worth a visit.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: I visited Fatty Weng’s on my own. I needed to sit down with a cold beer and something nice to e

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Quite unethical stuff coming from this place. You order a duck and they bring it out to you only to return it to the back and give you a single stir fried dish. I guess 50% of it was missing when it came back to

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: I was impressed with their warmth, friendly welcoming behaviour and speed of service. That was the best part in our dini

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: I can truly recommend truly this restaurant. Authentic food and a good portion .  Lemon Chicken war the best.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Fast service and fast food.  Little Fatty served us, he was very helpful.  Beer wasn't cheap but where is it cheap in this town? I ordered the vermicelli and it was surprising... luckily there were others on hand to help finish it for me.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: This restaurant had great food but it took up to 1 hour for all the food to arrive.  Very disappointing!!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review:
Nice Cantonese Cuisine 
Was a fan of their food since their beginnings at Guillemard Road 
Recommended

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: After a day of touring, sightseeing and rejection at Clarke Quay we ventured to China town and found this oasis. Great food, respectful service ( a few items were missing from our feast) but this had no impact on yummy food and cold beer. A great find in a busy environment.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review:
Good value and nostalgic food.
Brings back memories of old school Chinese restaurant cuisine.  Nothing fanciful but just good enough to keep us satisfied and happy.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We called in here for lunch on a Friday but the sulky miserable waitress was not happy that we were not ready to order when she came back to our tab

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Great service here without question. Good was quite good. Quite pricey though for the serving size. If unfamiliar with the area, this is safe choice in a nice setting.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We are here because most other places were closing and this was still open! Service ok, food was good with plenty of it. We struggled to finish it all! Reasonably priced.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We had come to Chinatown Food Street to walk round the stalls and have some dinner. At 9.30pm many of the restaurants had started to close but Fatty Weng was open. The food was ok, normal Chinese menu. Service was good and friendly staff. Small portions are big enough for 2 to share, the rice too!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: After shopping in Chinatown we're making our way to Chinatown Seafood for their S$6.95 Tiger Beer when we came across this place. Same beer price, great deal for S'pore, but also a nice, very clean little restaurant. Very attentive staff, and even though we only had mee were very pleased. Prices a higher than hawker stalls, but reasonable.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review:
Fantastic service ..
Fantastic food ...
Made all my family feel welcome and relaxed and explained the menu fully ! Even found $50 on floor which is worth the tip !!!
If back in Chinatown will definitely call again 👌

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: During our stay we visited China town twice and dined here on both occasions food was good and staff very friendly and at prices which were relatively cheap in comparison to parts of the city

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review:
Every visit to Singapore we make time for Peking Duck and a beer at Fatty Weng in Chinatown
Great location, great food and great value

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review:
Good Peking duck with double service . 
Good sauce and tiger beer .
Staff is cordial . Not cheap but good quality .

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Had dinner here with family. It was quite costly for 4 but the meal was excellent. Had the Singapore chilli crab on the recommendation of the waiter. Our opinion all round the table was- meh! Its an overrated meal.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We have previously been to the Fatty Weng Restaurant, but not for several years and in that time it has had a makeover. It used to have Peking duck hanging in the window with photos of the owner along with influential customers on the wall. All now disappeared, the ducks because of health and safety legislation. However the duck was as good as ever and is recommended. The restaurant is good value and we ate there 3 times. Charging for the nuts is a bit OTT but we realised they were an additional cost and refused them, however we did need the hand wipes and a decent napkin would be a welcome addition to the service which is good.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: This restaurant is probably the best one in the China Town of Singapore. My beautiful young wife and I enjoyed the Peking duck twice in that place, which was surprisingly good: crispy skin, tender juicy meat, carving before guests' eyes. Quite similar to that of Beijing restaurants, except for the soup, which is lacking here.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review:
Came across this place whilst wandering around chinatown looking for a pit stop for lunch. It looked OK so in we went.
Typical chinese fare, no real complaints from us but it was nothing special. Service was reasonable. Overall, quite pricey.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Getting charged for facial towelettes and a crappy bowl if nuts  ripped off Don't bother going food is average  workers bored stiff

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We ate here in 2005 when we were last in Singapore and had enjoyed it greatly. Consequently we decided to return to sample the Crispy du

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Reasonably priced restaurant in Chinatown, we drank beers and ate our faces off. It was delicious and the portions are huge.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Been here 3 times now on each visit to Singapore. Service is great, the food amazing and not overly priced.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Our last day in Singapore after 3 weeks on the QM2, had a gorgeous meal in Fatty Wengs, the staff were great even helped me with the chop sticks, will definitely go again next time we are in Singapo

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Visited on a Saturday lunch time. Service and food were very good. Situated in a very busy area of Chinatown I would guess that you will fall across this restaurant rather than find it. If you do find it I don't  think you'll  be disappointed.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Excellent meal provided a good price in good time by very friendly accommodating staff. Well worth a visit

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We had an early lunch there. Food was acceptable but nothing special. Found it a bit overpriced to what I am used to have in Chinese places across Asia. Recommend the food stalls in the street, who seem to offer similar dishes at slightly more reasonable prices. Some staff was friendly other rather indifferent.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Not sure how authentically Singaporean is this restaurant, but food was alright, the peking duck was great and so were all the other dishes. However, given that it is in China town, i am not sure i would head back there as there are other choices to choose from.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We stopped by here by chance. Had not reviewed prior to sitting do

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We went to Chinatown for our first dinner in Singapore. Staff were very helpful and attentive. Food was fantastic! we will definately return.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Food was very average. We all had upset stomachs after eating this evening. We were charged for nuts and wet towels that were on the table when we sat down. The only good thing was the air conditioning.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We sat on a table outside basically in the road and wondered if we had made the right choice of restaurant. Food was so good especially the Peking duck that was sliced in front of us put into pancakes and then the remainder taken to the kitchen to be served in a delicious sauc

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: my husband and I dined at this lovely Chinese restaurant and had a great dish of sweet and sour pork, rice and drinks. Loved the atmosphere(we say outside)

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: An expensive place to have dinner with the family. Dishes were small and food was only so-so. Two thumbs down.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: So we couldn't be bothered trawling through Chinatown looking at restaurants.We were hungry and the big cheap Tiger beer advert pulled us in. Went for half a Peking duck together with a fried rice. Both tasted great and there was enough for 2 of us. With 3 large Tiger the bill was around 80 SGD. Not a cheap meal, but the service was good and the outside seats are great for people watching!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We had lunch on two occasions at this restaurant and one both occasions it was delicious. It was great to escape the heat and humidity of China Town. The food was delicious and the service was great. If you visit China Town we would recommend this small restaura

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Very friendly waiter (Lionel) recommended pork ribs, Peking duck, we added the egg fried rice and Chinese mushrooms everything was delicious with Tiger beer to wash it all down with..... yummy a little pricey for lunch but look at what all 4 of us ate....

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: A nice restaurant with a terrace a bit of the street and thus a possibility to have quietly some good food. And this you find certainly in Fatty Weng! The menu is different then in the other places and it has good choices. You can choose between small and large protions. And the portions are large! The service is excellent. Very quick and with a lot of attention. We had the chicken in special sauce and the beef with black pepper. The rice with small silver fish was also delicious. The price is fairly reasonable. Anyway the quality of the food is good, so this compensates a lot. I'm certainly going back!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Visited just before Chinese New Year so it's very colourful. Allow extra time to get to the restaurant because the area is heaving with people. Great buzz. Felt perfectly sa

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Had the crab, whole baked fish and pork ribs ( as most tourists do) - very very nice but we had similar dishes previously for far less cost. Beers were pricey and couldn't get bottled water. Next meal we went to the street stalls and ate in the communal eating area, had a great time. Go here if you need the air con, otherwise eat like the locals.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Wanted to try some authentic Chinese food whilst in Chinatown and Fatty Weng didn't disappoint. Nice table, clean, Tiger beer, soup, sweet and sour pork with rice, all served quickly by very friendly staff. We had a great night, so much so,we went back the following day for lunch. Really good, give it a go!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: We had too much hawker food on our Singapore trip and wanted some original chinese food in chinatown. This restaurant is conveniently located and has a modern design and friendly staff. We had their signature fish and 4 more main dishes: all in all good food but high price and small portion (even if you order medium size).

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Stopped here for lunch while in Chinatown. Very busy place, but service was very quick and although we only intended to have a light lunch, the food was so good, we were quite full by the time we left. We didnt have the Peking duck, which is their speciality, but others around us did, and it looked delicious. A definite must if your in Chinatown.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Reserved table for 8 for lunch. A variety of dishes, but Peking duck was the fave. Crispy skin carved at the table and the waiter rolled up the pancakes with spring onions plum sauce and the crispy skin. The rest of the duck was carved and served separately. Delicious!

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Just stopped off for a snack here, didn't try the recommended jellyfish salad but had our first crispy duck. Served with a cold beer and a side of deep fried chicken, delicious. Not as cheap as the hawker bar on the rest of the street but well worth it if you aren't confident on the street food way of eating.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Waited for 20 minutes for someone to take our food order. Then another 25 minutes for it to arrive on our table (it's in the wok was the stock answer when I enquired about the del

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: After walking through Chinatown for quite some time, we picked Fatty Weng. Staff was very friendly, but we didn't get the food at the same time. So 3 of us had their meals and 1 had to wait very long. When we finally got the bill, we were quite shocked. We didn't order any exclusive dishes, just some fried rice and chow mein and some meat, but it was really expensive. This wasn't the first restaurant we had been to in Singapore, so we could compare the prices. The food was good, but too expensive. There's so much more in Chinatown.

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: I took my relatives visiting Singapore to Chinatown last night. I was looking for a value-for-money resto for dinner, and chose Fatty Weng after some quick Googling. Most of the reviews said the food was tasty BUT there were 'surprise' charges in the receip

Name: Fatty Weng Restaurant
Location: 37 Smith Street #01-01,# 02-01, Singapore 058950 Singapore
Review: Ok..not good not bad...the "since 1967" sucked me in...it may be typical in Singapore but they forced the purchase of wet naps on the bill and did a forced gratuity that I didn't notice till later so I double tipped...the fried rice was actually really good, but how hard is that to make..the chile prawns were hot and decent...id keep walking.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: cutest themed cafe, which actually has good tasting food ! we loved the breakfast options, there was also a small section to buy gifts such as backpacks, tshirts, and stationary. not too crowded either

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Totally enjoyed the meal. Big portion but were served so prettily that it’s a joy to dig thru the yummy bacon, salad, eggs and brioche bre

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review:
Tried othe cartoon theme cafe such as charlie brown before and food was really bad...so I was really surprise that the food is good ! 
Ambience is good, not much crowd on a weekday and promo giving 30% discount!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: nice ambience, friendly staff, food is alright. just to catch the last chance before it closed down.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: You don’t expect theme cafes to have good food, but this was actually good. We enjoyed our dinner. It’s a little unfortunate that they’ll be ending as they did not get the renewal of the licence. Well, hope for the next good one to pop out.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: big portion of food, good taste and resembles typical cafe food. unique point is the face of gudetama which is an amusing touch to the food presentation.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: It's my 3rd time there. Lots of beautiful and cute Gudetama characters and pictures, good atmosphere, comfortable, happy, good service, delicious, love it, unforgettable restaurant, will come back again and again.......

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Food was good, but for the price point I was hoping for better. The aesthetic experience is really the only reason to visit.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Loving the cute and cozy restaurant full of Gudetama characters. The Shiok Pork Ribs is good for 2 persons but the ribs taste a bit dry. I like the butterscotch latte.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Look at those photos... nough said. The food were good, not the best but we did enjoy our dine. Recommended for having a good food IG.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Cute picture worthy place to visit. Food was surprisingly decent but limited food choices that were pricey.  Nonetheless it’s the kind of cafe one goes to if one is a huge gudetama fan- for the experience.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The food was actually quite well made and had really good design, concept and plating. It was almost too cute to eat! However, it is quite pricey and also has limited options. There isn’t a kids menu so the adult main course is a bit too much for one serving for a child.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review:
Very cute even though it's pricey, but worth to try! 
Tried their big breakfast and pork rib and lobster soup!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The truffle fries were delicious and hot.  The eggs benedict was cute, but very cold in the center.  The hamburger too was cute as pictured, but the two giant, greasy, meatlike patties were indigestible and just a bit actually made my son sick.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: If you like Gudetama, or you like quirky, character covered food and drink. This is your place. The coffee is average so not paying for the amazing quality drink. Just an average coffee with Gudetama on it. Would I visit again... probably not.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Very cute! good for photo taking. Melody  cafe is next to it. Food was nice but kinda pricey. Overall experience is great!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review:
The kids love this place and got very excited about the themed restaurant. 

Food menu is good and also have lunch and tea sets. 

However, some of the moving art work wasn't working when we were there otherwise it's all good.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: This cafe is an interesting place to visit. Especially if you are looking for a restaurant to keep kids occupied during a meal. The character Gudetama means lazy egg and is from Sanrio - creators of Hello Kitty. The menu has lots of choices (kid friendly meals too). There are many Gudetama items dotted around the cafè - great as props for photography. Staff are friendly which is also a big plus.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The cafe is cute but overpriced. We had the tea mocktails that were actually really nice and there was quite a lot in it! As for the theme, they have a few Gudetama cushions around to cuddle or pose with but they’re a bit worse for wear! I’d probably skip this place and go to the My Melody cafe or a cat cafe instead!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Visited with kids because attracted by the kids eat free promo, with every main dish ordered. Kids love their eggs deco. Service was not attentive. Food was OK but lack variety and pricey. Kids meal sgd 13 but there's really nothing much, mainly French fries, egg and sausag

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Just had a coffee and cheesecake so cannot talk about the food quality but dishes looked good. Place is very cool

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Pork ribs $38 , dry but succulent. But the worst is that its an eggy place but as my picture shows theres a ring of grey sulphur between the white and yolk, not acceptable.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The food is delicious, but price too high if not with discount vouchers. Especially desert. If a $7.5 dollars desert u expect more, but no, nothing special. I rather go lady M, at least the taste worth the pr

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Before ordering, it will be better to check the portion of the food so that there wont be too much food . Remember to inform them to serve your dessert later, apparently they serve all your orders together .

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Although food delicious but table too small for 4pax  to accommodate us for 5 pax, so can’y Really enjoy it. Plate  and Utensils only provided for 4pax. So no experience on the environment

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Cafe with nice ambience and cute decor. Food is good but the price is on the high side. OK to try for the experience.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: my sister surprised me on my birthday by taking me here. everything was gudetama themed. we ordered from a tablet. it is pricey which made me love my sister more because she way paying. the food were regular but made special with gudetama logo. the waiter snobs, although they agreed to take our pictures, they did not return our smile. i had a lousy picture to remember my birthday. we had to make do with selfie

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: I enjoyed going here because we don't have themed restaurants like this where I'm from! It was friggin' adorable. That along was worth the price. However, the food was pricey (which can't be expected at an eatery like this), and the food wasn't even 'that good', regardless of the price. The drinks were great. I'm a huge french fry lover, specifically Parmesan fries - and the Parmesan fries that were ordered from here weren't as good/edible as I had hoped. I only had a few before I had to stop. They LOOKED amazing - I'm not sure if its the oil used, or the amount of time the fries were cooked, they just tasted 'off'. If you go here, I'd recommend staying with ordering drinks only. They at least tasted good and aren't priced as ridiculous.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The restaurant who sell concept , not food or service . The food is pretty nice with the decoration of Gudetama . But the taste of the food is really disappointing and the service is quite fair with the price that they charged . However , if you are the fans of Gudetama or IG person you can have cute photos there for sure .

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Visited the cafe in Dec 2018. It is worth noting that the cafe is half the original size as half of it has become the my melody cafe. The decor was great with the gudetama theme all over. The menu had an obvious slant to eggs as expected and much of the food comes with gudetama theming as well. The prices of the food were a bit expensive but the portions were quite sizeable. Had the pizza slice which was huge and quite tasty.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: This Gudetama-themed cafe is a must-visit for the Gudetama fans as the decor, from the egg-shell chairs, Gudetama cushions to the Gudetama adorned walls and ceiling are all screaming Instagram. Even the food display and cutlery used are all Gudetama-related and they are super adorable. However, the food itself is only average, but the portion is quite big so it may be wiser to share to prevent food wastage.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The environment can unleash the kid in you. The food was too cute to eat but nevertheless great. The price is average for a breakfast meal.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: We visited for brunch and the service was pretty fast. Foodwise, it was okay. The pizza was tasty if a little salty, while the Big Nua breakfast was a generous portion, and had t(e baked beans served in a egg she

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Terrible service received from the male staff. Totally unhappy to serve the food to the table. Drink were slide on the table instead of places it nicely. Food will place rudely on the table.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Come visit if you’re a Gudetama fan. The cafe’s decor is cute! The food is good but slightly pricey.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Had desserts here; primarily for the children. Service was fine, the setting was cute — egg yolks everywhere! But it is kitschy and food was very pricey for what we had. Two desserts cost us close to $50!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: We reserved a table of 7. Only 4 or 5 sets of cutleries were on the table. We had to go and get the missing ones ourselves. After eating, we asked the waitress to clear the dishes. Each time they came, they only took a few dishes with them and didn't come back for the rest. We ended up telling them a few times to get all the dishes cleared from our table. The presentation of the food looks good. But the taste isn't good. Pork ribs is quite dry, doesn't have any sauce to go with it. Beef was quite stiff. Bacon salty. Out of the 7 dishes we ordered, only the pizza taste satisfactory.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Have always passed by this restaurant and decided to visit since it's the school holidays. We bought the chope voucher, paid $35 for $50 value. As we went during the tea break time at about 2.30pm, they had a few promotion items so we could order a lot more items. All in all, the food was quite good for a theme restaurant standard. I would only like to highlight that the servers seemed to be very busy. So for a few times I need to walk up to them to get extra cutleries. Probably coming once for the experience is enough.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: A small but well decorated place. Food was delicious at a reasonable price, especially kids menu. Service staffs were inattentive, they simply forgotten to serve the complimentary dessert for my children and when asked, they just gave an excuse that the ice cream machine was not functioning. However, I still saw them serving ice cream to other people.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: We were a group of five, reserved our visit and bought voucher via Chope, The service was quick, the decoration was cute and adorable. We ordered 1 Rib - I don't care, 1 truffle fries, 2 Gude Puddings, 1 Hula Hula. The Rib was okay-ish, it could be better. The truffle fries was abundant, we couldn't finish them so we asked for take away. The Hula Hula was refreshing. The bomb was the Gude Pudding. Super cute and delicious. Combination of cookie crumble, vanilla ice cream, soft pudding, whipped cream, caramelized banana, orange tuile, topped with a cherry on top. Definitely will come back for the pudding, and maybe try the other mains and desserts.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Ambience was relaxing, not crowded and surrounded by beautiful picturesque backdr

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: I'm a Gudetama lover so this is really my happy pla

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Who doesn't want to eat an egg full of existential dread? The decor in this place is hilarious and very Instagram-worthy. Selection is fairly modest and could use a few more vegetarian options. That being said, the food is simple, tasty, and the portion is quite large, though I would hope that would be the case considering the sizeable bill.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The cafe was tastefully decorated according to Gudetama theme! Food was good for a theme cafe although prices are expected to be on the steeper side. Very good for Instagram photos too. Reservations are recommended and while I really like the whole concept, It will be a long time before I visit again due to the steep prices and limited food variety.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Food quality is average, but the food presentation is impressive!  Restaurant is under-staffed though so service response is slow.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: This is our 2nd visit. We came not long after its opening and this time around for a birthday celebration. We were a big group of about 24 people (half are kids). We went on a public holiday lunchtime. Service was slow. We were not impressed during our 1st visit, but this 2nd visit confirms

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Excellent service provided by staff and the food plating was extremely instagram-able which is rather rare for such themed cafe after a certain period of time. The delicious food was an added bonus as well! My only gripe was that we spent $75 for both person despite only having a main each and sharing a drink between us.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: We were there for breakfast. We didn't feel welcomed as there was no smile nor greeting. We were brought to the table and was given a kids menu by a male waiter. No words, nothing. Food was nothing to shout about either. Variety was also limited. Never will return again.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Ordered grilled chicken with waffle. With the price I pay $23 (after service charge and gst would be 28), I would have expected a better plating and presentation. To be fair, the food was decent but not wowing me or worthy enough to make me come for second visi

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Restaurant is super cute and food is surprisingly yummy. Main courses are good. Love the tamago and yoghurt desserts!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: I have to choose one themed-restaurant to take my students to on a yearly basis. Last year, I took my student to Hello Kitty restaurant at Changi Airport and this year, I took two students to Gudetama Cafe Singapore on 21 June 2018 for lunc

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Nice decor cute concept. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and coffee they are serving. The portions are decent as well, to an extent my friend and I are pretty full after our mai

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Those lazy eggs are definitely too cute to eat, but against all odds they are quite delicious until you get to the cashier and boom your bill is huge even for 1 person considering the food that they ser

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: It is a must-see place if you are a fan of the character and/or into concept cafes like this. It is mid range in terms of prices, but some meals can be shared (depending on how hungry you guys a

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: I don't know why people are complaining about the wait staff. Clara was enthusiastic, friendly and working like she was fuelled by something unSingaporean. Give it up for Cla

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The waiting staff don’t live up to the expectations of a themed restaurant. In fact they are worst than staff at McDonald’s. go for the cuteness of the themed restaurant but don’t expect too much from the waiting staff! They aren’t bad but they look sad!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Stopped by here this afternoon after a long walk around the IT Fair in the same comple

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Cute place for hanging around in Suntec Mall. If you are a fans of Gudetama, you should come and eat in this Restaurant. Good service and the taste not so bad the foo

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: First of all, customer service is non existent. We waited nearly 6 minutes to get seated when the restaurant was half full at best. Waiters walked past us, had enough time to have conversations with each other but not to look over, notice us, and seat us, despite our many attempts to call out to them/get their attention. When we finally did manage to get their attention, we requested for a booth but they told us we couldn’t sit there because it had yet to be cleared. We told them that we were fine with waiting for it to be cleared but then they said that all (there were about 4) of the booths had been pre reserved so we couldn’t sit there anyway. Fair enough, but at 3 pm on a Sunday afternoon, that seems almost paltry for an excuse. But never mind, I can accept that I suppose. Next, the menu: ranges from $16 (truffle fries, soup) to an eye popping $38.50 for pork ribs, with the average menu item being around $29. Nevertheless, we gave the lobster bisque a try. The bread bowl came slightly soggy, the bisque slightly cold. The egg was... an egg. We decided to save ourselves more grief and left, but that brief foray into the world of gudetama cost us $16++. I honestly think that you pay for nothing more than the hyp

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: A good experience at this cafe. Surprisingly the cafe serves good of relatively good quality. Can’t complain much. The “nua” breakfast was not bad, and so were the drinks we had ordered. Overall a pleasant experience.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Thumbs up for the cafe manager- Erica, who arranged a little something special for my nephew who celebrated his 11th birthday at Gudetama Cafe!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: I was attracted by the cartoon like atmosphere at first. Once I tasted the food, the verdict is 'it looks as good as it tasted'. Another place I'll visit again. However, the service staff was not sure of my reservation request. In the end, I got to use my persuasive tone to get the seats at the hut. I guess business seems so good that they probably won't going to make any improvements on their service.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Went there to celebrate son’s birthday and didn’t expect too much.  Ordered 3 rib-I, one came out steak only slightly warm n carrots were cold while the other 2 were ok. Pizza was nice. Service generally ok.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Cute display of dishes. Be ready to take lots of photos there.....We had a friendly and lovely waitress.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: This is a perfect place for Gudetama and Japanese Culture fans, the food tastes good and looks very amusing. Perfect for kids and adults alike.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Super cute, family friendly and Instagram friendly cafe. the food was expensive, though it is to be expected.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: i will come back again. Cheft is best cook by here and taste is excellence. Next time i will come back again.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Innovative cafe and good food that exceeded our expectations. Come if you're a gudetama fan. Even if you're not, you may be converted cause everything is so cute.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: I love the food there and the interior is really cute with gudetama theme but since the place is not that big, we have to wait for quite a long time to have the service :(

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: our party of 8 celebrated my eldest daughter's 17th birthday dinner here and we had a blast!  Food was wonderful and the staff accommodated all our requests!  They even brought out a nice backdrop for us to blow out the birthday candles!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Went there because there wasn't a queue. After the visit, we now know why there wasn't a queue. Food was not hot, extremely expensive, kids' meal was spicy (why would anyone give spicy food to kids???). Service staff were slow, inattentive and not polite. Asked for bill and was impatiently given the palm-up "Wait" handsign. Had to go to the counter to pay myself since the bill didn't co

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Ah, tables and chairs were clearly in disrepair, with cracks and discolouration on the tables and chairs, and some of them were unstable too! For any other restaurant this might not come to be an issue but it is meant to be a themed restaurant where the decor matters more than usua

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The food is nice and tasty we will come back to dine in here again the staff is friendly and kind hearted.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review:
Nice dining place at convenient location near Convention centre, variety of food choices, kid-friendly environment. Friendly staffs.
Merchandise overpriced.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Desserts at Gudetama were great. I loved the restaurant decor and how the there was integrated into the design of the food.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Their Facebook page said that if we celebrate our birthday there, the staff would give us an "unforgettable experience". My group experienced slow service, forgotten requests and nothing special. The food looked really cute and tasted not bad. We can get better food and service for those prices elsewhere. This is a place to just go once for the fun and cute experience of eating Gudetama

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Booked with Chope and was given a booth for 3 pax. Glad I made reservations as the queue was long on Christmas eve! I felt happy as soon as I stepped into the restaurant, the decor really brightens you up. Usually I don't have expectation on food for themed restaurant but Gudetama's food quality was not bad at all, and they were so cute to look

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Quite crowded and pricey but cute and good for children food not that worth it though so can consider drinks

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Offered the booth seats as we booked in advance via Chope. Overall the food is above average, the service crews are friendly too. Highly recommended for family dining 👍🏼

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review:
Food suit me and the deco of the restaurant also very creative.

Maybe cab add in more choice especially desert and drink.

If able to adjust the price will be more better.  Or maybe participate with any other promotion.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Dirty cutlery, service staff don’t bother to replace them after passing them the dirty cutlery, steak was stringy.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: visited on 17 Dec 2017. bad service from service crew all round. I was taking photo on my iPhone of the first main course on the table when the second dish arrived. The waitress saw that I was taking a photo and don't even bother to wait for me to take the snap first. She looked impatient and hurriedly place the dish on the table. She can't even wait three seconds for me to finish up a quick snap? Next, we did not order drinks and were also not served plain water. We saw that other tables were served plain water. So I tried to get the attention of a waiter who saw me but he was serving the table next to me. He nodded to acknowledge me but when he finished with that table, he did not come my way. I spent the next 5 mins trying to get the attention of the two waiters who looked busy and purposefully avoided eye contact with customers. We were already more than half way through the meal before we manage to get hold of a waitress to serve us water. We can't wait to finish up my meal quickly and leave.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Instagram worthy cute restaurant. Food was quite big portion. Will return with kids too. I'm sure they will love it.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Great option for family and kids. Came here for coffee and waffles. Food is definitely on the pricier end but worth it if you are a big fan of gudetama!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Food is quite pricey but thankfully it taste not bad. Won’t really say its value for money but basically you are paying for the themed food. This is more of a one time visit just to experience kinda restaurant.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: It was my second time to treat my foreigner friends come with their family, even though not much option to choose, but looking at those kids’ smiling face are quite worth it because you can take a chance to snap pictures with their Gudetama decorations and setting. Price and taste wise can be considered average

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Went there for lunch, wasn't expecting much of the food due to various poor reviews of their main course. However, contrary to those reviews, the main courses we ordered were good.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Food taste ok, but the price rather expensive. Go there for an experience with gudetama, as it's the theme of the cafe.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Food was tasty and instagram worthy. Ramen dessert was very Creative and friends liked it very much. Will visit again

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Had a good time exploring the cafe and enjoying the foods. I also took some kawaii photos. However, i think that The price is quite steep especially the marchandise.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Went there for a birthday celebration, on request of the birthday friend who’s a Gudetama fan. The cheesy sweet potato fries with beef is a starter you absolutely have to get. The amount of cheese is very generous, and it feels like you’re biting into a slice of pizza with each bite. The smoked salmon eggs benedict was yummy too, with very generous portions. Service-wise, upon being informed that it was our friend’s birthday, they brought out a huge Gudetama birthday sign and a complementary dessert plate with a little cake (: my only gripe about the cafe is that it is pretty pricey. Each Main costs about $24 and above, and their sweet drinks cost about $8.50, all before GST. So for 7 pax, the total bill came up to about $240 for approx. 5 mains, 3 starters and 5 (non-alcoholic) drinks.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: The cafe is designed for a cartoon of an egg. Everything was so cute so we kept taking photos. They have the egg design perfectly. Can’t remember the food but had fun while it lasted !!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Super cute food but not worth the price for the ingredients used. Paying for the experience I guess!

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review:
We used the chope app and enjoyed good discounts 
We loved the decor and the food presentation was so pretty . However , we hope the cafe can include more non spicy sausages and some cutlery need replacement

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: when i first stepped into the cafe, i was greeted with a warm smile and was treated like a king for the day.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: You don't have to be a Gudetama fan to dine at this restaurant that serves good food with great service. But you'll probably be one after your visit as the restaurant put in every effort in the decor to create the ultimate Gudetama dining experience for their fans.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Sitting in the restaurant with all the cute Gutedama items and deco, it makes one feel excited and hung

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: Had the merry xmas platter and the food wad good. The pizza was also yummy and soft. Will be back again.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: They have very creatively designed and decorated dishes especially their desserts. The serving for the main course is really huge.

Name: Gudetama Cafe
Location: 3 Temasek Boulevard Suntec City Mall 01-361 Suntec City Mall, Singapore 038983 Singapore
Review: It was a fun evening at Gudetama cafe..we loved the ambience as it was so fun with all decor of Gudetama...restaurant celebrates our birthday with a free cake and a headboard for photo taking.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: so we ordered butter crab and chilli crab and white pepper crab. butter crab was bitter. had a weird taste. chilli crab did not look good but tasted slightly below average. to me it just tasted spicy. white pepper crab was not bad. waitress kept watching us from a distance. only nice thing that was worth eating was the mantou. overall bad. will not come back.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: Been here several times recently and only for the chilli crab which is excellent. Ive had this dish on several places in Singapore but believe this to be the best. Its certainly not the cheapest but quality of crab and flavours of the sauce in my mind make it great value. Service can be hit and miss at times but generally I have enjoyed my visits to this restaurant.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: Visiting Singapore for the first time in many years, my accommodation was just over the road from the "famous" No Billboard Restaura

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: Ordered chili and white pepper crab. Seemed not as fresh as our other experiences in Singapore and Malaysia of the same dish. Maybe experts can speak to it more. See pictures.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review:
- Service was disappointing, Food quality was below average for the price and smell of fruits was disgusting 
+ The restaurant was clean and the food was safe to eat as they make it in a kitchen which is visible.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review:
Visited this nice place and much enjoyed there great dish - White Pepper Crab
Great service and very nice stuff

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: Spent the entire day wandering around Little India and Chinatown. Went back to the hotel for a couple of hours rest. Dinner was upon us and we headed out aga

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review:
Returned with my parents after 10 years and they were overjoyed with how delicious it was, authentic chilli crab, fresh seafood and much cheaper than in hong kong.
Honey ribs were also great and the staff were very attentive.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review:
The food was great! But i have to agree with some reviews, it's a bit overpriced!

Only thing is you get a chance to eat at the original No Signboard restaurant. You can see the history of the place posted in the wall.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: Have to say that this place is geared and marketed for tourists. Unfortunately there are better ones out there, even in the hawker centres. Not too bad still for its price.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: We decided to check out this place since it was one of the recommended places to eat chilli crabs in Singapore. I have eaten chilli crabs in other restaurants in Singapore before. The waitress taking our orders was trying to convince us to order all...More

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: I had great expectations about trying chili crab at this establishment as recommended by the guidebook.  It was not spicy at all, sauce rather sweet, large crab but expensive dinner in a place that looks like a hole in the wall.  Waiters spoke Mandarin, poor...More

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review:
Eating at No signboard seafood in Geylang is always a joy. I prefer the setting outdoors in a bit of a shabby place and enjoying the best seafood available in Singapore.
My favorite black pepper crab was complemented by garlic prawns, lemon chicken, pork ribs...More

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: amazing place, low key, local, cheap & fantastic food! the crab is absolutely to die for food and the continuous change of your beer glass for a new frozen glass will keep your head cool whilst stuffing your tummy.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review:
We stopped by here for a business dinner, small group, to get some crabs! It was pricey for sure, even the rice which was a small serve was $40 !! Crazy!

The crabs were very good though, we had two different sorts and they were...More

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: Came in with the office and had a really good dinner. So much food...the calamari and squid were really good, and the staff kept our beers full. Very attentive staff. The highlight of the night was the crab, of course. I prefer the pepper crab...More

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: We order its signature dish, white pepper crab and it’s really yummy. But too many side charges for different items. If you don’t need any snacks placed on the table, better tell the waiter to take it away, otherwise, they will charge you in the...More

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: Standard Peranakan food served at absurdly high prices.   Constantly pestering by staff on commission trying to sell you everything from a  few peanuts for $3 a pop to wine and beer which they keep pouring into your glass to insure you reorder as quickly as...More

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: The crab was outstanding. Bloody hot. I will definitely be back. For visitors, be warned it is really outdoor, so very warm. Dress very casual.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review:
We were brought here several years ago by my husband’s brother. It is a busy restaurant, I believe one should book. We didn’t book because we went there very early 5:30pm, we were the first there. When we left, the restaurant was full. 
We wanted...More

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: This is not a cheap place, but the white pepper crab is delicious. The black pepper and chili pepper are good, just as good as any other place.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
Review: We wanted to try the famous chilli mud crabs while in Singapore and this place was recommended to us by a local. We ordered the chilli mud crab and also white pepper mud cra

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 414 Geylang Road, Singapore 389392 Singapore
