Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Tried the Koshari bowl and it was so good. I added a side of Labna cheese inside and it blended in so well! Glad to have discovered my new favourite joint!

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review:
My Wife and I were at Fill A Pita yesterday for lunch and I have to say the hummus was so delicious. We try the 2 pax platter which had 4 sides and comes with a pita bread. Highly recommended. 

Best Hummus in Town

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: i gotta admit as an Egyptian & a serious lover of Koshary, this place is exceptional. the pita bread (had the falafel) is delicious as well as the houmous. a highly recommended place to eat.. and the portions are great!

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I’ve just had lunch  at fill a pita and was so contented with their falafels. I ordered a single platter which came with 4 sides and a pita bread and will definitely be back again.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Hi, visited this place with my Wife for a lunch last week. Being vegetarian, we quite liked their extensive vegan menu. The falafel and other dish was nice. The staff was also very courteous. Highly recommended.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Went here for a quick lunch on way back to Raffles Place from Chinatown.  Unfortunately they were out of falafels!  However we had the mixed platter, which provided four fillers for the pita bread.  With the house lemonade, this was an excellent lunch.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Unfortunately this place was not open. I checked the website before going and did not see any info about their vacation. Not a big deal, but I missed out on great other options on the way. Especially if you are looking for vegan option

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Its one of the best authentic Mediterranean food. Falafels and hummus are absolute must here. Both Uncle and aunty provide great customer experience and help you in selecting the right food choice.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Best are the falafels, made with broadbeans instead of the usual chickpeas, although they are a bit pricey at $2.50 for a tiny piece. Friendly place with the Egyptian owner running the show himself. Hope the economics work out for them, as this location has high rents and they have lots of staff.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Hassan is always friendly and provides excellent customer service when we (fully vegan Singaporean lady and tall Brit man) come eat at his lovely restaurant. He happily ensures that everything we order will be vegan since he knows every ingredient in his sumptuous food. This quality is so important but sadly very rare in most of the F&B places in Singapo

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I just had a great vegetarian Koshari here, wonderful flavour, nice spices and a generous portion. It is very nice to have a vegetarian/vegan Egyptian restaurant in SGP!

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I went here not realizing it was vegetarian but decided to order something random just to try it. I got a pita with falafel and a type of cheese (can't remember what it was called). The pita itself actually comes with a sauce, cucumbers and tomatoes as well and since it was to go, the pita was stuffed and wrapped. I ate mine about 25 minutes after I purchased it, so it was only a little warm but was still great to e

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: This is the place to go if you are vegetarian and want to taste authentic arab food. In fact this is a good place for anyone who loves arab food.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: We ordered two Falafel pita and a side of Hummus and eggpla

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Wanted to find a good falafel And I found this for its good rating. Honestly. I didn’t find this authentic taste wise. The falafel was dry and too much hot sauce was addded. The tabuleh salad wasn’t up to mark either. When u order pita on side, All other places would already give u two pita breads here only 1!!!! I am gonna find a better option for middle eastern soon.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Very good place and very friendly staff!we were exhausted with our Singapore visit and we found these nice place to enjoy a very delicious pita and hummus.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: We've been coming here for 2 years now and the food has always been so delicious and fresh and affordable and healthy!! :) we love the pita bread with hummus, halloumi mix, koshari rice and moussaka!! A must try!! :) plus the boss and his wife are always so friendly and welcoming!

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Love the fresh tastey and healthy food! Falafels made to order!!!! The Hummus was so good, cost was affordable and a nice outdoor seating area : )

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Friendly and prompt service, nice al fresco ambience! Nice for a casual and quiet weekend lunch. Highly recommended for those seeking  authenic yet affordable middle eastern food!

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Great place for hummus, falafel, babaganoush in Singapore. We have been here multiple times and always the food is very fresh. Been eating here since 2+ years and never disappoints👍🏻

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Read the TA reviews and visited Fill a pita. Unfortunately we found the food just ok. the drinks were much more tasty though, we tried the tamarind and hibiscus. re: food, on the day we visited the falafels were hard, like they had been reheated at a high temp in the microwave. Hummus was also quite pungent for us. so all in all was average food and good drinks. assume food is better when the lunch hour crowd dies down. Staff were prompt and friendly. Food is not too costly

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: My wife is vegetarian so this came up on her Google search. It was 2 blocks from our hotel in China town so we tried out the lunch. We each got the platter and were not disappointed. The price was $13 which is cheap for Singapore and the food was fresh and very delicious. Mamdouh came over and asked how the food was and we started up a nice conversation about Macau, the city we're living in. If you like friendly people and good food don't miss this place.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Visited this for the third time as I was super happy with my previous visits. Unfortunately this time they disappointed me both in pricing and food qualit

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Quick, light, fresh, vegetarian, healthy, friendly service are the words I’ll use to describe this place.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review:
Loved the lunch here during office hours.we ordered the platte for 3and its was perfect.The falafels were hot pita bread was soft and garlic hummes was finger licking.

Will come here again.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Very friendly place with delicous food. Freshly prepared pitas with among others zucchini, eggplant and hummus. Recommended!

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I visited fill a Pita on a Saturday morning and ordered the 2 person Falafel platter. The whole experience was out of this world! You are first greeted by the gentle smile and polite tone of one of the hosts. I'm using the word "host" because through out our meal we felt that we are appreciated guests having our breakfast at the middle eastern generous house. If you throw your sight behind the counter you'd notice a kind lady manning the kitchen with the same care she'd put in preparing meals for her family at home. A true home cooking experience. Saturday was calm to the extent that the food was served at our table before we finished paying our bill. (As I came to understand from the host it's almost a full house at lunch hour on weekdays). As for the food, three words pretty much sums it up; Tasty, Healthy and high quality (okay 4!) the best ingredients are finely picked and almost everything is cooked with the finest olive oil. Dishes are not deep fried but carefully prepared in the oven to produce the healthiest possible combination out of these dishes. My eyes almost popped out checking the Mosakka and Koshary plates that other people ordered. I'm definitely going back to try each one of these delicacies.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Tasty, satisfying food that leaves you feeling healthier after eating it. One of my favourite places for lunch in the cbd. Particularly amazing labne.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: We have bee loyal visitors of Fill a Pita since 3+ years...and not just the ambience and location has changed for the better, the quality of food has simply magnified multiple times! Be it the coriander hummus, garlic hummus, falafel, halloumi, fava beans or labna cheese, taboulleh salad or the pita bread itself. Simply amazing taste. Our favourite place for lunch and we visit at least once a week. Do not miss their recent offering Pisaara, a mouth watering Egyptian dish hand made by Mr. Mamdu (the owner’s) wife. A true delight and a must visit if you love Mediterranean or Egyptian cuisine!!! Great hospitality and excellent food makes this place a winner!

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review:
The most authentic middle eastern food. Purely vegetarian and so many options
Must try the platter they have
Cheers

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I’ve been regularly going to Fill-A-Pita for over a year. It’s definitely my favourite place to go to for delicious and healthy Mediterranean food. Owned by an Egyptian man and a lovely Singaporean lady, the food is always prepared fresh with love. I usually grab the Falafel Pita and Hummus, and I haven’t found another place in SG that does it so well. It’s also vegetarian and vegan friendly. I’d recommend that people visit out of the office lunch time hours. Located on the cusp of the CBD, it gets quite crowded during lunch time (for good reason) and expect long wait times because the food is prepared fresh. It’s a small establishment so getting a table during lunchtime can be tough too. I’d recommend swinging by after 2pm for those who want a quiet lunch.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Food is so so but just not sure it’s worth the wait. Nice people but service real slow. Don’t go out of your way to eat there. If waking by and hungry than sure try it

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: It is a small place that mainly operates on weekdays - relying on the office crowd at lunchtime, but the food is simple yet delicious. Many of the dishes are vegan, I highly recommend the pita bread with hummus and falafels.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: It seems like the quality of food has gone down from the last time I visited this place in Shenton Way. Macaroni used for Koshari is not fresh and with stale tomato sauce on top.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Excellent food. Great service. Reasonable price. Definitely worth a visit if you’re in Singapore! Great selection/choice. We enjoyed the platter for 2. Would recommend.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Terrible owner! Everything else is nice but the whole experience of eating here was bad as the owner of this restaurant is rude. Usually there is a lady at the cash counter and she is nice. But if you see this old man who is the owner of this place, he is rude to his customers. They overcharge 1 dollar for credit card payments and if you ask them why politely, owner will simply shout or be rude to you instead of explaining politely. Never going to this place again!

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I love Mediterranean food and tried out fill-a-pita for lunch with family. The staff is very nice and courteous and we were attended to prompt

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I have been regular customer of Fill A Pita for last couple of years. This is one of the top favourite place for me to have lunc

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: This was our second visit in 3 days, it did not disappoint. The babaganoush, hummus and labna cheese served with warm pitta were lovely. The owner insisted we try the house special fava beans too (complimentary). All in we had a tasty lunch for two for SG$14.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I visited this place for the first time and the food is pretty decent. There is good variety available to choose from so you can possibly do multiple visit to try everything in the menu. If you would like your food to be spicy please request for it as the standard serving is not spicy enoug

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Love the food.Healthy baked falafels with fresh whole meal pita bread. Dips are great too. Warm and friendly owner. Great option for vegetarians in the business district.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: A friend recommended this place and it was well worth it! Delicious, home-made, fresh ingredients. Nice atmosphere and friendly owners. Vegetarian halal Middle Eastern cuisine. Recommend going on a Saturday afternoon for a chill environment.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: This was was a super place to eat before - the old owner had good character and gave this place a buzz. Now it's become a regular commercial restaurant - average service and scrimping on fillings. I ordered a Falafel Pita with chili and yogurt - but had to ask for garlic yogurt twice as they only give you like 10ml at time. I remember the days when Hassan used to just come and give the bottle to use. Hummus also served without a spoon. They also removed the free water tan

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I am a regular visitor and find the menu has an excellent selection of healthy lunch choices. The owners are very friendly and add to the great overall ambiance. I often have the mixed falafel and fava bean pita or the Koshari. I will continue to enjoy my lunch experiences at Fill a Pita.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review:
Disappointing salad portion. Their falafel taste very different to authentic middle eastern one and is not at all to my taste. 
Wouldn't go back.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Lovely ambience and great food. We had a platter which was good enough for 2 of us. Hibiscus drink is definitely recommend.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Was there last Friday. The pita served was hot and fresh that you could eat it on its own. The falafel was just fabulous. As i was there during non-peak, I had a chance to speak with the owner, Mamdouh. He is an Egyptian and I could tell he is extremely passionate about his food and in delighting his customers. Try also the Tamarind drink..its refreshing and I doubt you can find it anywhere else. Definitely a place to go if you are looking for Mid East Vegetarian food.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Was super excited to try this place out but genuinely disappointed by their falafel and Taboulleh sala

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Such lovely service for the sweet lady at the counter. Would definitely come past again. Big bonus for me is that the menu indicates which items have no garlic and no onion - ideal if you need a fructose friendly option

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: The staff here is genuinely so kind and helpful. While I was eating my food and being my normal messy self, the woman working the cashier grabbed a handful of napkins and came over to give them to me with a smile. No worker has ever done something like that for me unprompted, it was very sweet of her. I had the fava bean pita, which was super delicious and tasted fresh. Service was very quick and you can sample the ingredients if you'd like, such as the fava beans. This restaurant has great vegan options and even labels which menu items are vegan.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I have been told by my friends to give a visit to this place to taste their fo

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I have been at this awesome place a few times for lunch and also brought my visitors as fresh pitas, soups & hummus are absolutely beautiful (haven't tried everything from the menu yet but will return for sure very soon to do so

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: This is the place for top quality food and first class services. Selling pita, salads koshari brown rice and lenthil soup. A must visit when you are around the area.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: If you come here for the falafel pita you have to 100% tell them no chili unless you want South-east Asian level of spiciness x 100. This place advertises itself as Mediterranean and Middle Eastern, but ask yourself what Mediterranean or Middle Eastern pita has ever -DRENCHED- its pita with chili sauce. And I mean drenched. Look at their main picture at the top with a pita, it's red because it's ALL chili. Absolutely inedible unless you've got taste buds made of woo

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Food was affordable. Chilli sauce in the falafel pita was spicy, tangy and weird. Look for their specials on a board, which we missed. And an option of a pita pocket would be welcome. We could not finished the whole pita. It was messy to eat too with sauce leaking out. Lady at counter could explain and help us with choices.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: We had best falafel in Singapore at this place. It's organic and vegetarian. Walk on MBS before and after is unforgettable.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Called to check if we could reserve a table for 6 to celebrate a birthday on a busy Friday afternoon. When they heard it was a birthday, they gave us free drinks and cutlery for the cake. The food was fantastic and it was a lovely long lunch. Highly recommend the place.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: It is the last day of my Singapore trip and I am so glad I found this place. 'Save the best for last'. The staff is so friendly! The lady behind the counter was so sweet and helpful. I could' really decide what to take because I saw so many nice things on the menu. She helped me pick a few things so that I could try a little bit of everything. There was no babaganoush today, but they did have a new dish with eggplant on the menu that I could try. I had pita, hummus, favabeans, falafel and that new eggplant dish. And homemade lemonade! Everything was really deliciou

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review:
In spite of I'm coming from Egypt whereby you can get best Koshary or Falafel but the food in FaP was  tasty and the friendly atmosphere offered by staff was exceptional 
It's not easy to get all of this with low cost under one roof.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Staff were very friendly and explained what the names of the dishes meant. The sharing platter does not look much but was a huge portion enough for three ladies.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Customer service was second to none. We had the falafel pitta and hoummus which was lovely and incredibly filling. The staff then came over and asked us if we needed directions to the next place we were going to which was a nice touch. Well worth a visit!

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I have no idea what this place is rated so high. It's has overpriced tasteless fo

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Greeted with very friendly warmth and attention by the owner and staff, served piping hot and really delicious pita and falafel, with all the trimmings you could possibly wish for, cheeses, sauces, and even extra, steaming hot pita when the owner saw we had gobbled everything up. Such love poured into cooking their very own food and serving it with joy is rare indeed. I am thoroughly impressed; the people and the food made my day, thank you so much.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: Went the extra mile of going back with cash, payWave isn't on yet. The owner hoped for my sake it was worth it & I can categorically say it was in all aspects of engaging service, quality fare, washed down with homemade lemonade. Don't miss this lunch experience when in the city.

Name: Fill a Pita
Location: 3 Pickering Street Nankin Row 01-29 Nankin Row, China Square Central,, Singapore 048660 Singapore
Review: I went here a couple of times - the food was really nice (vegan options on the menu), however some options are not available on all days so be wary if you're going there for a specific dish. When I went one time there were no pita available (!).

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We went there for dinner. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic and being a Tuesday, we were only couple there. We were given a nice private seatin

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Have heard good review about the place and specially made a dinner booking for 26 Dec dinner. All good till I arrived at the restaurant. The staff said they had some families with kids (did not tell us the actual extent of how many) but would place us at a quiet corner. Sound good. Unfortunately it turn out that there were a lot of kids including babies and they were placed on both sides of the restaurant, hence, no matter where you sit, one will be surrounded by kids running and screaming around and babies crying. It was literally like a chaotic zoo in this big French restaurant which one would expect to find peace during meal. The food was alright, a bit underwhelming for the price. On top of that, I end up with a massive headache from the dinner due to the ruckus (first time having that). Had I known how bad the uncontrolled situation was at the restaurant, I would have just cancel my booking.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Made a reservation for afternoon tea on 27 Dec 2020. The afternoon tea starts at 3:30pm and ends at 5:30pm. I was there at 3:15pm and was told that they are trying to turnover the tables from lunch. Staff told me to come back later so I sat down in the lobby to wait for my friend. At this time, there was no queue. When it was 3:25pm, we walked to the restaurant and saw that a queue had formed. I was perplexed so went to enquire with the staff. People were waiting in line to get seated while the staff were still trying to turn over the tables. We only managed to get seated at 4pm. This was bad time management and it is really unacceptable coming from St. Regis. Although we started our afternoon tea late, they did not rush us to finish by 5:30pm and we stayed till about 6pm. I just didn't like the idea that we had to be in a Q for 35mins when our reservation was at 3:30pm and I was early. it was not what I expected from St. Reg

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Very disappointed with the afternoon tea. We visited on a Sunday after a whole day at the spa ( not inexpensive) and the savoury options were minimal. When we asked for more savouries, the server was not helpful at all. My husband is vegetarian and although we were told something was prepared, we found the food inadequate and in poor condition (soggy , tasteless) compared to a friend who was given a special vegan platter, extra sandwiches, cheese platter and fries , I felt we were treated very badly. The waiting staff were not helpful and had little regard that we are regular clientele of the hotels spa.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I celebrated my wedding anniversary here. I have ordered full courses from appetizer to dessert. The food was really good but what really impressed me is John who is able to give recommendations during ordering and provide “hyper care” whenever each course is served. He is always there to ensure that we know about the food that served and check our feedback whenever we are done. He also kind to prepare a cake with candle to surprise us and offer a tea (St Regis Signature Blend) to help us wash down the sweetness. (Cake & our dessert

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We managed to get a reservation at the Brasserie after a few attempts. It was grand and opulent, with impressive chandeliers decorating the high ceiling contributing to a sense of awe that we expected from the St Regis brand. However even that did not prevent a less than splendid experienc

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: An absolutely fantastic place to unwind and relax at this French restaurant for a cosy and delicious Afternoon tea, the spread is awesome too. Great staff and service makes it even more memorable.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review:
Overall experience is pleasant, the presentation of the food is decent. However, there is room for improvement in the pastries. 
The scones are good, especially go well with the jam provided.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Splendid dinner for our anniversary! Thank you for such a top-notch service and made us feel queen and king indeed :p You can never go wrong with every dish in this restaurant. Worth every penny! Definitely a highly recommended place.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We were excited to try the high tea here after hearing rave reviews but was sorely disappointed. First when we arrived we were surprised to see each table had clotted cream and jam already laid out on the tables. Not sure how long they have been out but our clotted cream had already began to melt; in this current pandemic surely it is not hygienic to have food items laid out before guests even arrive. The cups were not properly washed as well and there were bits of what appeared to be dried vegetable on the tea cup. There was no hand sanitiser or wipes or little paper/plastic bags to keep your face masks which is surprising as it is now common for most restaurants, especially in a so called six star hotel. The food was average, the mini lobster brioche was not very good and the brioche tasted like it was a few days old. The wait staff also seemed to be overwhelmed and it was hard to get their attention; probably understaffed considering it was a fully packed restaurant. Overall considering the price and amount of food, you can get better quality food at better prices at other 5 star hotels high teas. Would not come back again.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Despite reading the strong reviews here, we were initially underwhelmed by the odd lighting, the 5min wait to be seated, dirty (tho large) windows and the majority of diners dressed in shorts and/or Ts. But that feeling quickly changed once the food arrived. We like to try as many dishes as possible. Great to excellent: the escargots, the lobster salad, the Hokkaido scallops, the steak frites (the fries were so delicious we ordered an extra side, steak cooked spot on medium rare), the tooth fish (my wife commented how she appreciated that the fish was actually hot as opposed to just luke warm as is often the case in most restos). Wine wasn’t badly priced too considering the venue. Wife loved the bellinis. Service was also impressive - they didn’t miss a bea

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: 2nd time having dinner here. The 1kg steak is a must try. Super value for money specially if you are a amex platinum card holder you will get a 50% discount. All the food is awesome. I love the twist on the sauce not the normal wine, black pepper or mushroom. The service is also outstanding. Christianne explain the dish and serve everything that we need

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: This was a planned birthday celebration for my son who is serving his stint in NS. He could not make the celebration on his birthday as he had been scheduled for guard duty in camp. We were scrambling for an alternate venue and happily booked Les Saveurs for this Saturday lun

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Great food in a dining room bathed in daylight makes for a relaxing and uplifting lunch. Enjoyable and delicious

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: When we think about celebrations, Brasserie Les Saveurs is always our first option and it never disappoints this is our fourth visits. From the starter to the dessert the quality and tastes of everything was outstanding, might have been the best meal I have ever been served. Service was delightful and very professional although its a busy night during weekends and you can see all the staff is running around just to make sure that everyone is having a good experience. Thanks to Ron for looking after us and for the impeccable service!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I fell in love with this buffet experienc

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: It was our first time visiting a St. Regis hotel and it did not disappoint. Basically, it’s my hotel of choice for an afternoon tea because of the French setting. I love the Parisian vibes of the resto and it reminds me so much of our future wedding reception overseas. Well, of course, the service is as beautiful as the hotel. We were escorted to the cozy spot that makes our experience even more romantic. I was impressed as I did not expect that they will placed us at that area knowing it was a simple request I made upon making the reservation. Thank you so much for that. Huge thanks also to Ron who took care of us. From the time we were seated until we left, we felt his presence. Thank you for being the most attentive and most profession

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Nice hotel, Food and great service especially the crew name "RON"!! He was awesome and very accommodating. Thank you!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: The staff was very kind and the service was all great. All the sweet cakes and bread were artistic and coffee and tea were excellent. Dessert also served as a course gave me a fresh taste a little tired of the sweetness. I came here with my friends but I eill definetelt come back with my family next tim

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I have always been a fan of St. Regis and its bar but due to government restriction, bars are still not able to operate so this time, I tried, together with ny friends one of their F&B Offerings, Les Saveurs, and I have never been as impressed about any F&B establishment’s architectural design, but that’s just a bonus to the overall experience. Ron from Astro Bar has always been a pleasant team member, his service always exceeds my expectations. I would also like to commend the lady at the reception, which we forgot to ask the name, she addressed us with my friend’s surname, and that’s something rare in Singapore’s F&B Establishments. A total wow factor! And oh, the Lamb Chop was done perfectly they also have a nice platter of cheese. We’ll definitely come back.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I used to visit with friends.  The pretty atmosphere was good, and the attitude of the staff was very friendly.  I ordered afternoon tea, and the bread that came out was so pretty and delicious.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review:
I visited here for afternoon tea.
The scone and dessert was very nice and service also very comfortable. Thank u for rosie and jinny who served our table. I'll come again for afternoon tea.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: So we're not ready to mingle with the masses yet and have been indulging in the many takeaway and delivery offerings available out there, one of which was from the St Regis' Brasserie Les Saveu

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Had a quite nuclear family birthday dinner weekday night starting 2045 on night of 09 Sept 2020. Very pleasant Chinese staff at the door addressed us by name as we approached and brought us in before taking our orders patiently. She also discovered there was a birthday when I wandered out to the lobby hoping to buy a small cake ther

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Thanks to our Kabayan Ron, we really appreciate his service and he went extra mile to cater all of our requests from him. This is our happy picture together, so sorry we forgotten to wear our mask because we really want to take this photo with him. Thanks Kabayan! Keep up the good work. Cheers to good li

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We went on a Friday evening in late August where Singapore is still not quite back to normal but the restaurant was reasonably patronize

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Got to dine at Brasserie Les Saveurs at my recent staycation at St Regis Singapore Ambience at Brasserie Les Saveurs evokes a sense of classy extravagance. The small but opulent dining area impresses with its high ceiling, inimate mood lighting, floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the tropical gardens and sparkling poo

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: At $38++, each person was served with a selection of savory and sweet items, chocolate pralines, scones, a fruit salad and crepe. Our teapots were constantly refreshed as well and the St Regis tea blend we ordered was deliciou

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I was there for high tea with my cousin for her birthday celebration. The place was so beautiful and food was great after CB period,they did some improvements to the high tea menu. I would like to mention specially of the good customer service provided by Kuai. The whole high tea experience was elevated due to his detailed attention to the guests’ requirements. I would recommend my friends and family to come here again!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: In light of the current situation, most places aren’t offering afternoon tea buffet. That’s the same for Brasserie Les Saveurs @stregissg. Now they have beautifully crafted dessert served on a two-tier silver stand along with a platter of classic sandwiches and a bowl of fresh bak

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Try their sea bass! Also special thanks to John who waited on our table and provided excellent services. Michael was excellent as well. Remembered us and helped us with baby prams at the staircases. Excellent service and food at an elegant hall :)

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: This was a celebration dinner my wife and I had just before the Covid-19 shutdown. We have dined at the Brasserie on a number of occasions and the quality of the food and service is consistently high. Although, due to Covid-19 restrictions, the excellent and good value buffet was not available, its enforced absence has opened our eyes to some of the excellent French regional specialties on the a la carte menu. Thanks to Angie and Manish for providing us with another memorable experience. Looking forward to returning when circumstances permit!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Visited in the thick of social distancing! We were contemplating if to head but it's just me and my partner to celebrate my birthday and I must say Kuai, Bella and Zhiyu really gave top servi

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Excellent dessert, excellent duck and veal ma

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Kudos to the staff who helped me coordinate my proposal. Special thanks to Geraldine who handled my reservations and reserved the Alcove for me. Special mention to the team of Manish, Angie, Bella, Loke, Alex, Wei Qi & Shafiqah who helped prepare the proposal on the actual da

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Brasserie les Saveurs is excellent in its service ambience food and staff especially Manish Angie and Shafika

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Our family ate the seafood buffet here. The food quality was good but the selection was rather limited. There was not a large selection of items to choose from. We were also sat in a table in the middle of the restaurant below the air cond so we were not very comfortable. I would rate this 3.5 stars but there was live piano music so that makes it 4 stars.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: The service provided were impeccable! Staff are attentive and cheerful. Overall a nice ambience and experience. Food quality is good too!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Thank you all BLS team for your warm offers and excellent services. The st regis tea is really special. Highly recommended.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Great place to have food. I have appreciation for Kamal, the Indian Chef at the restaurant. He took care of our special dietary requirements which were not on the menu.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Very nice dinner, good selection for breakfast and great staff. Chef Hossen and team are polite and helpful.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Very nice ambience dinning environment, tks to Chef Hossen and team for such a great dining experience

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: My wife & I absolutely enjoyed our dining at Les Saveurs. It was wonderful & relaxing to dine at this brasserie with pianist playing soothing music. The service was also remarkable -- the service staff were always attentiv

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Arrived here today and just had a fantastic buffet lunch served by Manishi, Grace and Weiki. Food excellent and fresh and plenty of choices. All round professional service in a beautifully decorated room.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review:
First, amazing venue & ambiance with nice live music.
Delicious Menu from amuse-bouche to main course with nice wine pairing. 

Actually Brasserie Les Saveurs team had made my perfect dinner last night. Thanks to Manish, Jason, Bella for your kindness.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I loved the ambience of the restaurant. Cosy and comfortable with light music playing. We were sat down promptly by a wait staff and she explained the menu to us. I was highly recommended to select the buffet since I was the birthday gir

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Food wise, it was alright. This is a French restaurant but it was Asian buffet on the menu. We had chicken rice, laksa and I want to say steamed-pan fried fis

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I've tried several hotel buffet before. This is the worst buffet I have ever tried. The food was limited and it was not appetizing. I would say that one of their staff (male) was prompt in serving us and he was very friendly. The ambience is lovely but not the buffet food.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Celebrated a friend's birthday at BLS for dinner and enjoyed the duck very much. Meat fell off the bone and the flavours were balanced and savoury. It isn't served with any carbs so I ordered the truffle fries - not the greatest compliment for duck but they were truffle-y nonethele

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Celebrated our friends birthday at BLS and it was great, from the service to the food. Everyone was really friendly and helpful and the ambience is lovely

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Horrible experience for valentines day dinner!! food tastes terrible and waiting time was an hr between each dish!! was hungry waiting for our food! Ruined our valentines day!! This is a 5 star hotel and restaurant is charging us $300 plus for goodness sake! I would rather eat at the hawker centre than to ever step in here again. We deserve an explanation on what happened. Worst meal I had in my life.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: My worst fine dining experience in 10 years in Singapore. Waiting time of 30min between each course, a very disappointing overall taste, waiters lost on which course you're at, mistake on the order that was made in advance and confirmed again before the venu

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: It has been a troubled experience for our Valentine’s Day celebrations. It is ridiculous to have wasted the entire 5hrs for a 5 course dinner on waiting. On average, each course takes an hour to be served. I checked with a staff on the reason for the slow serving and He answered due to ‘peak period’. What a lousy excuse for a 5 star hotel. I started my dinner from 7pm all the way to 11pm. Without wanting to wait for another hour for my dessert to be served (which would be 12am!!!!!!), I requested them to pack and take away and that only took less than 5 mins to be done. The food quality is worst than a 3 star hotel standard. In fact, it’s a waste of money and time to spend on such a lousy ‘French’ restaurant. What a ‘fine’ dining I had! Totally ruin my day!!!!!!!!!!!! This Valentine’s event is such a failure!!!!!!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We had a lovely evening at this restaurant. Restaraunt manager Michael made us feel welcomed, while Jason n Manish pampered us with very good service. We will be back soon. Thank You brasserie Les Saveaur.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We had a pleasant valentines dinner at Brasserie Les Saveurs. There was a waiter Manisy who was very attentive and polite in his service. We requested to sit in the private section which has an intimate ambienc

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: This is my first bad review about a very established upscale hotel. Although this visit has been quite a while, I simply find it very unforgettable till today, hence writing this review. My husband and I were there last year to celebrate my birthday. The service was good till the end of the Brunch at 3pm. Knowing that the brunch ends at 3pm, my hub requested for wine top-up at 2.45pm. The waiter acknowledged but didn't come back to us. Hence at 3.03pm, my hub asked again, this time it was another waiter. To our amazement, he told us there will be a $23 charge for the wine after 3pm! My hub was very unhappy but he didn't say much and agreed to it. The point

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We were there to celebrate a birthday, and looked forward to the Seafood Buffet, which we were informed that it was cancelled when we arrived. As it was Chinese New Year, Yan Ting upstairs was full and Brasserie was totally empty. We were the only ones there, which was a romantic plus, with a pianist. The service was excellent and friendly, with Manish, aided by Tricia. Mickey (Mukesh) went out of his way to welcome us and was quite personable and socially engaging--he has a future in customer service. Manager Michael (Michel) also did his best to make the most out of a disappointment. They offered us a special Seafood platter which was EXCELLENT (lobster, King crab, prawns, mussels, clams, oysters on ice). Classic French onion soup VERY good, and crab salad. The lamb chops, which both of us order in restaurants regularly, were not good at all. We could barely eat them. We look forward to coming back and trying the Seafood Buffet.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I had a pleasant dinner at this restuarant located within St Regis. There was a waitress Tricia that was very attentive and polite in her service. I appreciate her effort and helpfulness to ensure that my night was enjoyable and memorable. The food served was great and well within expectation

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: fresh oysters with a good spread of delectable ham and salami, not to mention a good spread of appetizers. The clams and mussels were nice and juicy, particularly the clams had garlicky flavour.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: From the moment we arrived until we left 3 hours later, everything was perfection! My mom treated me to the Manolo Blahnik Afternoon Tea for my birthday, and it was absolutely fantastic. The food was delicious (and beautiful!), the champagne lovely and the tea wonderful. What put the cherry on the cake, however, was the superb service by Michael, Angelie and Irene - dreamteam! Absolutely recommended, whether it’s for Afternoon Tea or any other meal.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Had dinner at the restaurant yesterday. The food is good and service was exceptional. Had a window seat but can see the outdoor view is nice too. Was served by Mauish who was friendly and constantly checked with us whether the food is okay. Won’t hesitate to dine here again

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Dear chef nirosg

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I went there for the first of the year high tea and I would like to express my most sincere gratitude to all the staff working there for the memorable experience ... as a professional in the F&B industry I would like o recognise the professionalism and high level of service of Jason a manager working there who was able to assist me with everything I request!! As expected ST.Regis is meeting my expectation, thank you for making my first visit to ST REGIS a memorable on

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: The Brasserie Les Saveurs is a pleasant place to have dinner with the resident pianist entertaining patrons. The menu is very limited but servings are plentiful and tasty. The same for the wines, very limited but we could not go past the nice Bordeaux. The staff were pleasant and attentive. Thank you for assisting my wife with here wheel chair.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We had the afternoon high tea at St Regis Hotel. The ambience was great. The choice of food was limited. It was overpriced for the type of food. We can find better food elsewhere with this type of payment.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: 2 night stay with breakfast for 2..the staff were good! Food is ok. Not much a selection more typical western food, some local and Asian cuisine, seating area is beautiful..they usually served start around 6:30am ...

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: This is worst buffet I’ve ever been to. Variety is extremely small, only a few dishes of hot food, no raw seafood or sashimi, dessert variety is ok but low quality. This place is not recommended if you are looking for a good buffet place. Small variety and quality is not as expected.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Had an AMEX love dining promotion, so 2 adults could dine at 50% o

Review:
Service was poor. Was told that bread would be served but it didn’t come. We had to ask for them. 

Quality of food was below expectations. Salmon was a little hard and dry. Overcooked?

Bill also took a long time to be settled.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore

The service was tremendous.
The staff benedict and ellison was super accommodating and helpful would definitely come back here again!!! 
Kudos to Brasseries Les Saveurs!

We love it.
Thank you much chef niroshan for ur fresly bake 
Almond croissant .
Thank you.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Love it ! With some friends we chose Brasserie les Saveurs to celebrate our Thanksgiving dinner - and we do not regret our choice. Welcomed by Rackel - and well pampered by Michael and Alex team during all the dinn

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review:
Celebrated my wife's birthday on October 2019.
A Restaurant with a High ceiling with a French Venetian setting makes it cozy & stylish.
Much impressed by Service Crew, Manish, Angie & Geraldine.
I will be back again for sure.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We had gone to celebrate a birthday and the staff was great and welcoming and made it an ocasion to remember. They were attentive and interactive and took effort to help us celebrate this day! Thanks to the team -- manish, angie,bella,trisha,irene,geraldine and michael!!great food and ambiance as well.

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: We had the cote de bouve prime rib to share. It was so tender, like a ribeye! Manish also handed us a carpark voucher without us asking for it - he noticed our car key!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Manish was awesome again! Always Super happy with his service. He was extremely accommodating last week when my aunt asked if we could sing happy birthday as a small group and he rounded up a couple of his colleagues to join in. Thanks again! I’ll be always be back!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I am totally in love with the service and food here. Tip top service and always check with us if we need any other services. The food here is also amazing. I ordered the crab salad and oven baked sea bass. The environment is also very cozy. Thank you to the staffs in brasserie les saveurs. Keep up the good work!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: A promising start with very attentive staff when we arrived but soon turned into a very very disappointing evening. Starter was a little slow to be served but was a good dish, after that it was downhill. After 1h wait the staff eventually offered us some complementary drinks, and said we would get our dishes shortly. When the mains finally arrived another 20 mins later they were just mediocre dishes and same can be said of the desserts. The managers response, following my complaint was to reduce the bill by what amounted to 20%, barely more than the tax and so called service char

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Splendid evening here, with an impressive service crew. Celebrated my anniversary here, and the crew was nothing but kind and helpful with their assistance. I asked if I could get a little something for my partner and a considerable amount of thought and effort was put into pushing the plan into motion. The level of politeness and courtesy is astounding. I am deeply impressed and I had a pleasant evening. 09/11/19

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Had lunch here recently with some friends and it was an okay and enjoyable experien

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I was at the restaurant on Nov 1st for dinner & service was all lacking. Our reservation was gotten wrong; our warm water never came; our request for butter got us no where; it was freezing cold in the restaurant. Everything was all wrong until B came into the pictur

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: The 4 of us visited during dinner for Restaurant Week on Friday 1st Nov. Food was good but service was excellent. We were very well taken care of by Dee and another female Chinese server (whom I neglected to get her name). We were all very cold due to the full blast of the aircon and without us asking, the female Chinese server brought us scarves to keep us warm. What great initiative on her part! As for Dee, she constantly checked with us to ensure we were well taken care off. Loved her friendly and easygoing manner. The service staff deserve a commendation for making our dining experience memorable!

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Recently during my trip to Singapore, I stayed at St Regis. I had a meal at the Brasserie Les Saveurs Restaurant along with my family. They serve amazing food there and the service provided was fantastic. I would like to thank Geraldine Seow who took care of us during our visit there. I would highly recommend everyone to visit the pl

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: My friends and I (3 of us) ordered the Épaule d’Agneau (lamb shoulder, slow-cooked for 48 hours) to share, and it was one of the best lamb I've had - so tasty and tender. We also ordered a Cassoulet, but it was quite different from what I had in Toulouse & Carcassonne... would have preferred a more authentic version, and the duck leg was also kinda dry. Dessert wise, the crème brûlée was decent, but the chocolate fondant was dry(!) on the inside. Nevertheless, the lamb and the awesome service more than made up for these little "missteps". In particular, we would like to commend Mr Jason Kuai for his very friendly and attentive service. Overall, we had an excellent dining experience, and immediately made a reservation to return in 2 week's ti

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: The seafood buffet is fantastic. The quality is good, fresh and tasty. The staff were amazing, especially Manish, who went the extra mile to take care of us and my younger siblings through ensuring that their drinks were suited to their tastebuds and the extra gesture of offering ice cream to them made the service second to none. All in all, the spread,servi

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: Afternoon Tea was great and special thanks to Kartie , Alex and Doris for the great hospitality! Will be be back again :)

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
Location: 29 Tanglin Road St. Regis Hotel Singapore The St. Regis Singapore, Singapore 247911 Singapore
Review: I would like to compliment Geraldine Seow, Jason Kuai & Syidel for the excellent service given from Brasserie Les Saveurs

Name: Brasserie Les Saveurs
