Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: On 33rd floor of finance centre , you’ll find worlds highest microbrewery. Sit outside for stunning view and enjoy drinks, beers , snacks, coffees . Great service

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: We came here 2 years ago and we loved it, so on our return trip to Singapore we thought we would eat here again. What a difference 2 years has made the staff were not friendly and were quite rude. The food was very disappointing and at extortionate prices we were left angry. If the food is good then you don’t mind paying that bit more but this food was terrible. We were told you needed to order 5 to 6 dishes between 2 people so we ordered sweet potato fries, regular fries, steak, chicken and mushrooms. We ordered way to much we only needed 1 fries between us and the fillet steak was ok but nothing to wow about and I don’t think you can go wrong with fried chicken. This meal cost £105 and absolutely was not worth the money. We asked for dessert menus but we never got them so we paid and left. Our waitress was not interested in doing her job and the atmosphere in the restaurant was strained, and only half the tables being used more people were drinking outside than in the restaurant. Would not return again which is disappointing

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: There is no denying the views are incredible. The food is OK, its expensive for what it is but tasted great. Service was quick and the selection of beers from the microbrewery were extensive. Well worth a visit but maybe stick to having drinks and nibbles on the terrace.

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: came back again with with a couple of friends - as usual we stayed outside on the terra

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Four of us had a great evening. Highlights of the evening was the leg of lamb and sizzling prawns. The leg of lamb fell off the bone succulent and full of flavour. We sat outside enjoying a fantastic view across to Marina Bay Sands. This is definitely one the top spots in Singapore. Service was very good ++ and special thanks to Fai the maître d’ who made our visit special and Mhel our waitress who gave us great service.

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Told the waitress that my husband was already inside the restaurant and they still requested me to show my reservation. I’m perfectly fine to do that but another guy whose friend was also inside the restaurant could just enter without showing any reservation? Feel so unfair. Alternatively they could just ask for my name? After I went in, the staff were slow and not attentive. Service was definitely not up to standard for the price I paid. Nevertheless, the view was astounding and the buffet spread for executive lunch was good (fresh prawn, salmon, chicken, duck etc).

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Decided to visit during an 8hr flight transfer and couldn’t have picked a better place. We got to the bar an hour before our dinner reservation and had a drink taking in the views which are exceptiona

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: The view is the main reason why people would visit here. Food was ok. Being the tallest micro-brewery in the world, their beer is a must have.

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: This microbrewery located at the top of Singapore overlooking the Marina has one of the most breathtaking views of the city. The atmosphere is smart casual, buzzing with activity. Our server was gracious and knowledgeable, providing the right level of attention that one would expect at a restaurant of this stature

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: The view is worth the price in gold! However the staffing needs a bit more training hospitality. Seeing the light show from that high up is breathtaking. The only reason I’m giving it ’very good’ as opposed to ‘excellent’ is the blatant request to hurry up and give up our outside prime table. It was awkward to be asked to vacate even BEFORE receiving the check. The atmosphere is brilliant and feels luxe, but this will be a one and done as the food and drinks were nothing to write home about.

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: My fiance and I attended the New Year's eve event at Level 33 and were overly impressed by not only the venue, but the food, beverages and service we receiv

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review:
Fantastic Food
Fantastic Service
Fantastic Beer
Absolutely Stunning view
Make sure you book in advance and visit level 33, you won't be disappointed.

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Awesome view, average beer and over-priced fo

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Modern and funky vibe. Beer was great - but fine dining portion sizes for meals. Best to share 5 small plates between 4 people minimum. Dishes were good quality. Son 18 was very keen to have a meal here and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Very attentive staff.

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Awesome for any reasons: food, view, beer and location. We ate in this fantastic brewery instead go to the top of Marina Bay hotel. The view is perfect as well and you can tasting a special burger with a cold beer. The location is pretty relaxing and nic

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: The views of SIN are A++. No doubt about that. The menu is limited and the beer was very bland and similar tasting. Friendly staff. My recommendation — Go for one quick drink, enjoy the vibe and view, and move on.

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Beer perfect.. Come 4pm to 6 pm.. Best place from Marina bay. All time i come here before fly back to Switzerland

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Great service and the food is good (as usual).  Would go again for the excellent atmosphere. Thanks for the experience!

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: We celebrated New Year 2020 here after doing a fair bit of research prior to travel - and whilst not the cheapest option it was amazing. The venue is great, the view fantastic, food was excellent and the staff we dealt with all outstandin

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Went there a few days ago for a business lunch. View was good and food was ok. BUT, the place was seriously understaffed and not much experience. They like to look at areas with less custome

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: We were well greeted warmly at reception and proceeded to the bar to sample some craft ale. The barman was friendly and witty and served us our drinks after which we went outside for the views which are of course gre

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: the food is delicious some items only. The dessert is very disappointed. The waitress started loss patient but after that okay. Overall, we enjoyed the views!!

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: The food is nice although it is quite expensive. They have various types of beer. The view from the top is marvellous. The semi-buffet lunch is great.

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: Christmas Eve with the family

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: The rooftop terrace has incredible views of Marina Bay and it was the perfect place to watch the holiday fireworks! The atmosphere inside is more restaurant than bar, so we were happy to have grabbed a spot outside. Pretty cool to say that we had a beer at the highest microbrewery in the world.

Name: LeVeL33
Location: 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01 Marina Bay Financial Centre Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981 Singapore
Review: A wonderfull view of the marina, in a restaurant where the top atraction is craft beer tasting, including beer cocktails 😱. Very friendly staff, wanting to get you the best table possible. Food prices just a little bit to high if you ask me.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review:
Very bad service and attitude. Very typical of singapore restaurants that's doing well. Food wise so so. Oh yes and no one picks up the phone when we tried to book 

Will I come back? Of course NOT

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Had a catch up with friends at yum Cha restaurant. Didn’t know it was so popular during weekday and had to Wait 1hr plus in queue to get in. Restaurant out look was typical, nothing special to comment on. Ordered ala carte dim sum instead of buffet style. Dim sum taste was average though the expectation was higher. In general, everything was average. Nothing spectacular.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We called to reserve a table but was brushed off by staff “no need reservation, just come”. The impression was there are tables availab

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: I am not a dim sum connoisseur by any means but everything I tasted here was delicious and I loved the fried noodles with mixed seafood. These types of places are always better with good company - enables you to order a wider selection and take your time to savor the different tastes and textures whilst chatting and sipping on some delicious teas. Would definitely want to return soon - it was super busy even for a Friday lunchtime so recommend booking ahead.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: For the uninitiated, Yum Cha (meaning: drink tea) has evolved from that of a leisurely natter over piping hot Chinese tea and handmade snacks to that of an international cuisi

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Fresh Food were well cooked and delicious with prompt service during visit with my administrative assistant, ex-Treasurer and financial advisor on 30 September 2020 7.00 p.m.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Went with the family just before 3pm when their buffet offer star

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Went here for a larger group gathering and had a great time. We all shared a table full of Dim Sum and drinks. Overall found it to be great value, all of the food fantastic while the menu was extensive trying many new things. The service was also very good with a great atmosphere.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We were recommended this place on a previous visit to Singapore and took the time to find it again. I am pleased to say it lived up to our recollection – excellent choice of freshly prepared dishes served as they are ready (don’t be alarmed when they arrive separately) – service is brisk and efficient. You may refuse the dish of peanuts that arrive when you sit down – they are a chargeable item.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: My wife and I visited Yum Cha with our Hello SIngapore guide during a night tour of Singapore. When we weren't too enthused about eating from the street vendors, he brainstormed and proposed Yum Cha after we asked for dim sum. Not sure what "cha" means, but it was totally "yum." The place was hopping but accommodated us immediately. There were all types, from businessmen to small tour groups. The dim sum was served in baskets of threes, which worked out perfectly for the 3 of us. Item 0111 was our hands-down favorite!! it was like a delicious cloud of warm yuminess!!! We were a bit concerned about the variety since we don't eat pork, but there were plenty of options for us. During our stay, we ate at some fine places, but this would be the place we most look forward to visiting next time.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We were recommended Yum Cha restaurant by our hotel. We are definitely not fussy eaters but we have experienced better tasting items practically anywhere else - nothing specia

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Prot

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: A meal here was part of a cruise excursion. You'd be hard pressed to find the entrance amongst the rabbit warrens of Singapore's China town. Must be popular as there was a fair queue to get in. Service was very quick and the food was served hot and all was tasty. No complaints from our group of 20.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Had a gathering with friends here. Wide varieties of foods mainly snacks (dim sum) to choose from. Good foods provided. To get the best out of the foods, it is best consumed while it is hot. We even ordered a prosperity to

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Tried after much feedback from friends on the place. Overall the food was good and staff was quite attentiv

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: admittedly, it is hard to find in the hearth of Singapor´s Chinatown: you have to walk up one storey and the way is not really inviting - it is dirty to be straight. BUT, inside it is like ion an old-time Chinese busy place, with waitresses that have aged with the restaurant and that will help you with the right choices aminos the many delicacies. I just love all these different dumplings and fish and appetizers - and all come in small portions - so best is to come with a group and sha

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: we ordered pork steamed buns - good taste and sufficient filling, shrimp mango dumplings - good for what they are, and half a peking duck, which was the worst we have ever had (and we have enjoyed peking duck all over the world). little flavor in skin, wrapped in wonton wrappers not pancakes, and the duck itself was tasteless and tough. what was worse, the staff seemed to have no appreciation that when your guests don't eat an item that they should ask what the problem is and perhaps made an adjusted to the bill. we should have returned the various Hawkers

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: I visited this restaurant today.It was recommended by my hotel.My daughter and myself have a shellfish allergy and are nervous eating in restaurants when we don’t speak the language.A lady called Susan helped us pick some dishes that were suitable.She was so helpful and the food was delicious. I would recommend this restaurant and hopefully will go again.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We really enjoyed our visit & brunch here! Tasty foods! It’s hectic and busy but a lot of fun! Lots of foods for all tastes!!

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Recommended by a friend as a good place for dim sum but I find the food average & ambience poor. It was noisy & the air carried a strange musky stench. Thought the char siew pau tasted like factory-made ones that could be found at most coffee shops. The vegetarian noodles seemed pretty oily & lacking in taste. Dim sum were so-so. However, the saving grace was the scallop congee which was smooth & nice.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Was busy lunchtime in Chinatown but we waited less than 5 minutes were seated at a good sized table for the 5 of us and we were served quickly and it was yum! Can highly recommend the olive fried rice - sounds unusual but it was delicious.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We came here due to the reviews and was easy to fi

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We had dinner at the Yum Cha Restaurant guided by Mrs. Magi (Tour East Company). I requested a vegetarian set menu. The rest of the group had chicken and seafood. My set menu consisted of a corn soup, eggplant side dish, vegetable rice & broccoli. My dessert was the smooth mango pudding with mango chunks. The soup was ok, the eggplant was tasty, the rice was ok too, broccoli was simple and the pudding was perfect, it was cool and not too sugary. The place was packed with diner

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Quality of dumplings was average to good (so 3-4 stars of 5). Be careful with „extras“ like tea, which is normally free, costs 1.8$ per person, also the towels and 20 peanuts.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We found this restaurant after a recommendation by the barman in our hotel. We took his advice and were not disappoint

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Revisited after a two year absence. This is the third time we have lunched here , only because we were told of a good Yum Cha restaurant but not its name, so we found ourselves back once more. I have previously reviewed this restaurant and we had decided to not return owing to the dreadful condition of the lavatories. ( This time a little better). On this occasion we were tired and hungry and decided to give it another try as the food had been good. Once more we were not disappointed with food quality. Service ranged from polite and helpful to stony silence. Another reviewer has commented that you will be charged for the peanuts on your table, whether or not you eat them. We did not see if the peanuts had been left by previous diners or refreshed or completely replaced so it is better to ask them to be removed. Who knows where the fingers of previous diners have been? You will also be charged for the face wipes provided instead of napkins. A small charge in the overall price, which is not cheap, but, in Australian terms, a RIP OFF!

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We recently visited Yum Cha as part of a group tour package which included dinner on a visit to Chinatown and various sites around Singapore. We were really surprised by the quality and selection of the food we were provided here. The sweet and sour fish was great! Only negative was that we felt a bit rushed to eat everything served.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Beware! They will even charge you for napkins and peanuts, the dim sum was good and overall food is good but beware you will get charged for the tea the peanuts and towels that you never ordered, food is already a bit expensive and you still need to pay for stuff you don't normally have to pay for and is already served on the table, I was charged SG$ 4.00 for just a handful of peanuts that were on the table before we sat down, also wet napkins...

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: I was held back by their price tags & ordered only a few dishes to try. I think their food can be easily found elsewhere at a cheaper price. You just have to know where to look. This eatery makes money off tourists. Just one look & you kn

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Worse Worse Worse. Wait Wait Wait. We asked one of the push cart auntie and she reply us, 'That is not my sector. (Xiao LongBao) I can't check for you'.You have to wait more LONGER loh!'Then she keeps on selling the speciality signature food in her push car

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: This was the first time that we went to this yum cha restaurant. We had a nice and enjoyable lunch. We didn't have a reservation however they made room for

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We went to this restaurant on our first night in Singapore as we were recommended it but it was disappointing. We thought we were going to have a proper yum cha all inclusive price but we didn’t. The food we ate was a lot of battery dough type food and weren’t sure of many other dishes. There wasn’t a great selection to choose from. Ate T far better places while we stayed in China town. Not expensive.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: I‘d not come back here again, there are better options around. Taste wasn’t impressive, big parts of the menu weren’t available, service was there ... but not really into serving with passio

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We were 4 couples who arrived without a booking but they were able to sit us within 2 minutes. Peanuts and wipes were provided on the table, which we found out when paying the bill are charged for (peanuts S$2). Ladies bring carts around with the various baskets of dumplings etc and the dishes ordered are recorded under the relevant price section on the paper sheet located on the table. We had chicken feet, crispy fish skins, prawn dumplings and a few other dishes that I have forgotten the names of. All the food tasted very good. The service was efficient and the ladies would explain all about each dish they showed you. Would come back if visiting Singapore.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We had a lovely meal in Chinatown for dinner and decided to go back and find some yumcha (Dim Sum) for lunch.....and this place cam up in our sear

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Amazing dim sum, I had to visit my first day in Singapore as in my town in Spain, there are no restaurants that serve dim sum so when I landed, I headed for an amazing dinner there. I tried a few dishes and everything was mouthwatering. It wasnt expensive either bearing in mind that Singapore is not a cheap pla

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Most of the dishes were delicious with very few exceptions. It is not too expensive. Definitely worth visiting again!

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Brought my father in law here for lunch to celebrate Father’s Day and the restaurant was packed. Not easy to get a parking lot to begin with. Waited about 25 min for a tab

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: When was the last time you saw dimsum carts being pushed around? What a reminder of the old days. No computer menus for ordering with a pencil here, back to the ladies pushing carts and showing you their baskets of dumplings. And the food was very good t

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Service here was fantasti

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: First, I’d like to say if you are looking for authentic Chinese food that locals frequent this is your go to and you won’t be disappointed. You may need to search a little to find it but it’s worth the effort in my opinion. The staff was friendly the food was great and we were very happy with everything. We were charged $2.00 for peanuts that were already on the table when we arrived that we never ate and 30 cents each for wet wipes (no napkins), I don’t really agree with this practice and only found out about it after we returned to our hotel. I personally don’t find it to be a huge deal but I would think if you mention it to the staff they would work with you on this if it’s a problem. I would definitely return and I recommend giving it a try if you are looking for a local restaurant for true authentic Dim Sum.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Deliciousness served hot and well presented. Use the lift get to this restaurant upstairs if needed as stairs steep. Lift is accessable from the side entrance. Ask for table in the airconditioning area unless you are happy to overheat. Don't use the the wipes unless you want to be charged also the bowl of peanuts have a charge.We turned the peanuts down and they were taken away but once home found them on our bill $2. Tea is served almost right away but again is charged at $5.40 for three people. Make sure you remind the for your drinks order. We had to wait a good while but restaurant was busy at 12.30 mid d

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review:
Looking for a classic?  

It's been years since I took out-of-town guests to this place.

Located in Chinatown.  Simple, in a bit of a rundown building.

The dim sum dishes were ok.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: On going up to pay the bill, I tapped my credit card on the card reader. It beeped as if approved, but apparently didn’t go through. Instead of saying, “I don’t know what happened/ the machine didn’t work/ sorry can you try again,” the cashier said: “I don’t trust you.” I pointed out trust is a very strong word. I asked if she could double check, and even after having paid in cash to make sure, she said “I don’t trust you, I don’t trust you.” Food is fine, but not worth the terrible customer service. There are plenty of other dim sum restaurants to choose from.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: The restaurant is in the heart of Chinatow! It's a real chinese restaurant. The food and service is very good.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Don't be frightened by the outside, and don't hesitate to take the elevator to this hidden restaurant. The place is not well-decorated, but it's full of local Chinese families, which is always a good sign. Staff is smiling and friendly, there is a great variety of dim sum options to choose from, but all of them are really good, tasty, with a lot of flavory juice inside! Much better than the so-called 'dim sum' specialist chain that is all over Singapore streets and malls... We loved it and will be back.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: After reading reviews on this restaurant decided would be a great place to go for a 30th birthday. How wrong we were, the food was plain & tasteless. The service was poor with the waitress unfriendly & hovering over us staring at us while we ate. Then when the bill arrived turns out we were charged for tap water, peanuts we didn’t order and also the wet wipes. Very disappointing experience and would not waste your time trying this place.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Fresh and delicious dim sum, great value and fast service, item options so many, highly recommend place to try Hong Kong dim sum!

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Popped in for lunch. The steamed dumplings were all delicious. Service was great with trolleys whizzing round with all the dishes to choose from. We got in just in time as the queue was huge when we lef

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We went for lunch at the recommendation of our hotel concierge and we both agree we had the best dim sum we have ever had.  Walking around Chinatown before and after lunch was a bonus.  The timing with Chinese new year made it more festive.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Place are not very up today, very old fashioned, selection is very good but portions are small. Service is not bad, because of dim sum restaurant in Singapore are very limited, this may be a only choice you can find here.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Right in the heart of China town, it features more then 40+ selection of dim sum, in traditional style from breakfast to all day dinning. Good selection of bean curd, poultry & meat, & seafood dishes. The name ‘Yum Cha’ means ‘drink tea’ in Cantonese. So no coffee even during breakfast. Operation style is typical HK-push cart style, stressful, don’t speak much English, the authentic way... Dim sum per head cost is less than S$25 per head, with the best dishes. After the feast you could explore Chinatown on foot for more Chinese culture immersion. The real and dying stuff in Singapore.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: A wonderful way to eat away the afternoon with delicious dim sum - not the flashiest place but great food is what you should go here for. Enjoy!

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Friends and family had Dimsum from 4-6 PM and service was great. Food arrived fast. Be aware à la carte dishes (non-dimsum) are normally served only during lunch hours and after 5.30

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: If you like Dim Sum, give Yum Cha a try. It is on the second floor on a corner, but the doorway is obscured by street stal

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Probably my 1st experience of dim sum. Trolleys are brought around with different dishes and you request the ones you want. What you order is marked on a card and totaled at the end, The food we had was very good. The staff were generally efficient although on a couple of occasions we requested food not on the trolleys..on the first occasion we never got the order and the second occasion we had to ask twice. It had clearly been forgotten as the waiter was most apologetic. Didn't really spoil my enjoyme

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: A hidden gem in Singapore's Chinatown and a fabulous change from food court dining. This restaurant may be difficult to find as it's upstairs and signage is not clear. Once found never forgotten. A lift is located at an entry on another street (parallel). The decor is old and tired but in keeping of Vintage times. Staff are dressed in a lovely red themed uniform and are friendly and attentive. Bookings is recommended for large groups and during busy periods as it does get noisy, otherwise the wait isn't too long. Don't expect personalised or over service during peak times as the goal of staff is to serve food AS

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: It is my first time here at Yum Cha and since I am on leave on a weekday, I decided to use Fave voucher for the dim sum buffet. Went exactly at 3pm and the place was about 70% packed on a Friday afterno

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Yum Cha was a family favorite when we lived here 8 years ago...I am very happy to say it is only better than I remember!

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Both Chinatown and Changi's branch do not serve dim sum buffet during weekend. Food was average. Service was average, could detect impatience but was not rude, waved a cheerful goodbye and please come again.Chinatown branch was at a dimly lit side road and on the second floor, signage was not bright so it is possible to miss its entrance. Huge restaurant with inner section closed as there were not many customers even on a Sunday night.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Visited this restaurant last weekend with my family. Had to wait a while as we were a party of 5 without any reservations. Got a seat soon enough and started ordering food - ordering as just pointing to the dim sum trolleys. One of the few rare restaurants that has dim sum trolleys where you just point at what you want. Har Gao (Steamed Prawn Dumplings) was excellent and very big - one of the best I have tasted. The rest were ‘good’ to ‘very good’. My Wife said that the Phoenix Claws were excellent (not my kind of thing). Overall, worth the trip there. Atmosphere was busy - not a place for quiet conversations

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: You could find traditional chinese food and snacks with reasonable price. Air-con comfort with many varieties to choose from the menu. There is also a buffet style during 2 to 6pm period with all you can eat.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: The restaurant has a traditional feel to it. We were in a big group of 12 and the place was buzzing with patrons. Despite that, the service was courteous and prompt. Nice food with good value for money.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We went for lunch, looked forward to a dim sum lunch in Chinatown, and saw it was a past “Excellence Award” winner from

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Very traditional dim sum restaurant serving a good variety of dim sum from a rolling cart and also you can order from the menu. I am a dim sum lover and this place is always great to go to. But be awrae it gets very crowded and you usually end up waiting on line unless you go at an off hour like 3:00PM. But it's worth it It can get bit loud and chaotic but that is part of the charm

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: The retaurant has changed its methods for selling dim sum. Instead of pushing their foods around in carts, you're expected to order from a order form. You don't get to see what you order unlike in the past, you get what you s

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Porridge lukewarm and tasteless. Think the hospital porridge taste better. The pork rib with garlic is all fat can’t b eaten. The roasted duck is soggy duck. Disappointed.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: As a Cantonese, average dimsum cannot really be tolerated. Below are those I have eate

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: One of the few places left in Singapore with trolley service yum Cha, this is a busy and delicious set up. Good selection of steamed and other dim sum as well as all the usual suspects in Yum Cha. Loud, busy and great for groups- you come here for a good time not a long time! Get there early or late if you don’t want to have to queue!

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Yummy yummy yummy especially dimsum, all staffs and service was very good also. I like everything here.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We have just had the best Yum Cha in Chinatown in Singapore. Great food, fried noodle scallops, fried crab claws,Beijing duck,roasted pork all really good. Can highly recommend this experience in Chinatown.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: I think a lot of customers will regret coming to this restaurant like myself and my family. The food is average and the service is extremely bad, especially when taking away the leftovers, they will lump everything into one box of different varieties like junk. When approach the stuff, they responded with very bad attitude and forcing us to accept their insincere apology. BE CAREFUL of coming to this place.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Family decided to venture to Chinatown for Yum Cha at 10am Sunday morning and was not disappointed. There was no queue but still fairly crowded. Food was great , and had alot of variety with the waiters and waitresses pushing carts of dim sum goodness

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Foods taste average. Nothing much special. Environment is a bit smelly unsure why. Not crowded. Easy accessable.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: In fairness we may have made poor choices! The dim sum did seem to be more substantial than flavourful. Nice environment and staff.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Not my first visit to Yum Cha Restaurant, happy that food and service still good. The aunties were very nice and attentive to my kids, ensuring food are served fast so that wont get hungry. Nice variety of dim sums, love most of the items. We enjoyed it. Would be nice if they can have family buffet rates/sets. Think kids do not eat too much so buffet price is slightly high, but overall experience, good!

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: A real treat if your visiting China Town. Its located on 2nd floor. A true foodie pit stop you must experience.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: 여러종류의 딤섬을 맛보고싶을때 방문합니다. 망고새우 들어간 딤섬과 새우 딤섬 정말 추천합니다 ! 평일 저녁에 가면 사람이 별로 많지 않아서 더 좋은것 같

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: After a number of recommendations, we went to this restaurant for dinner. We ordered 3 dumpling dishes, a roast pork dish, vegetables and drin

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: The unique selling point is the dim sum trolleys which brought back nostalgic memories when I was a child in Hong Kong. But that’s about it. The food is pretty average. The place is a bit tattered. Staff not particularly responsive. Any novelty value wears off very quickly.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: After a morning at Gardens by the Bay, my group of eight was famished. So we cabbed it to Yum Cha where we ordered so much food we were afraid we had overdone it. We hadn't. We ate it all. My mouth is watering remembering the meal. Four stars instead of five because service was a little chilly and a couple of dumplings were a little gummy (but we were at end of lunch service, which may have contributed to that).

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: After 30 plates of these Dim Sum, we could hardly use words to descri

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Been here a few times whenever I’m in Singapore, and haven’t been disappointed. For a change their congee with century eg is pretty god, and so is their chinese turnip cake. I can’t fault their service, which is generally fast and efficient and that’s it. It’s in an interesting part of town and the atmosphere is genuinely good.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review:
Brought some friends from Switzerland for lunch there. Most of the dim sum were good except for the roast pork. The skin was not crispy at all and the meat was 80% fat and 20% lean. 
Prices were a little on the high side.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: A lot of variety of dim sum to choose from. Food is delicious. But be prepared to queue for one hour. Price is reasonable.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We used to live in Singapore three years ago, and Yum Cha was one of the places we'd go to get good local Chinese food. The atmosphere used to be lively, as it was full of people. The food was still good, but there were only three other tables occupied throughout the time we were there for dinner. There are better places to go now. Sadly, it is not like it used to be.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review:
The restaurant is on the second floor, elevator is available. Air cond was good(Singapore is hot)
You have to try their Xiao Lun Bao! 
The mochi rice chicken (wrapped in leaves) weren’t that excellent.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review:
The food is good and not expensive. Jasmine tea was very nice.
The air conditioning have some bad smell.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: I was really underwhelmed about this restaurant which is a shame as there are so many other places nearby which I passed to get he

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We happened to dine here as Tak Po is closed down, and we enjoyed our lunch a lo

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Terrible service. Not the impressive Yum Cha I remembered. We had not enough chairs for our group of 6, no space because the other table had their bags on a chair right next to our table, unable to move back because the tea/cutlery station was next to u

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Loved the food and the efficient service. A decent menu and easy to get to. Staff were pleasant. Nice clean surroundings.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review:
located in the middle of China town. Very authentic oriental design restuarant with vast choice of Cantonese Dim Sum. 

The mini egg tart is a.must try.here.
The only set back is the mildew smell, probably the furniture is too old

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We ate here as a part of a tour, so had a set menu, which may explain our rating. Other diners appeared to be enjoying their food more than we did. The set menu had the usual suspects: a soup, a chicken with sauce dish, a fish with vegies and sauce, pork fried rice, a broccoli dish, and a mango pudding for dessert. The food was not bad, just uninspired, as was the service. I would hope that one could do better in Chinatown in Singapore.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: A friend in Singapore recommended this place and I wasn’t disappointed. They kept bringing round dim sum on trolleys and it was very reasonably priced, spacious and air conditioned. Definitely worth the short wait to get in.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: Great service unfortunately matched with bad dim sum. Cold roast, soft spring roll skins, badly done up dumpling soup etc doesn’t justify the 30% higher price there. De Bao Dim Sum at the adjacent street is so much better.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: The food was served very promptly. Knowing that we came in even number and dim sum are served in odd number. Service crew took the initiative to cut it for us.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: We were all craving a good dim sum lunch and found Yum Cha by pure chance. They had a good selection of dim sum for lunch and we enjoyed all of them. The main room is pleasant and has a really good atmosphere and the fact that it is on the 1st floor makes it calmer than other places in Chinatown.

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: The Tim sum is nice and hot when served but the service is not as good cause our tea hv to ask a few time then they add water

Name: Yum Cha Restaurant
Location: 20 Trengganu Street #02-01 Jinshan Hotel off Temple street, Chinatown, Singapore 058479 Singapore
Review: I went here after reading the mainly good reviews on TA. I found this place to offer very poor value for money and the dim sums themselves lacked flavour with very small portion sizes and fillings. I mean, I’ve had better dim sum all the way in the U.K. If this place is meant to be one of the better dim sum places in Singapore then I’m afraid you are better of choosing a different cuisin

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review:
Due to Covid situation, very well organized and peaceful lunch ever had in IKEA.
Kudos to staff to make it happen. Food quality is average as usual. Lamb Shank, has a very distinctive strong smell.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: When we come to Ikea we always come by the cafe for some meatball, chicken wings and once in awhile their cider. They also have flavoured soda which is interesting too.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Went IKEA on a whim one Sunday morning as we need to get some stuff for our house. So impressed at the breakfast, value for money and yummy. The breakfast set only cost $5 and the pancakes are so fluffy with FREEFLOW maple syrup! Hashbrown is hot and crispy. The salmon crossaint has huge chunks of salmon only cost $2+. With the IKEA family card we got 2 free hot drinks. Our cafe styled breakfast cost less than $10! They also had vegetarian fried bee Hoon which I will try next time. Will be back.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review:
I use to be a regular customer for ikea and of course the cafe too since I move to the nearby neighbourhood. 

The cafe food are terrible now days and its getting  bad to worst. 

Kinda disappointed and feel sad about it

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: My wife needed to pick up some stuff from IKEA and we visited the Tampines Store which open for business at 10am. Along the way was hunting for a place to eat breakfast without success. We finally arrived at 9.35am and lo and behold the cafeteria was already open and serving breakfast. Choice is reasonable including halal section. IKEA should consider announcing they serve breakfast and earlier than the official 10

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: My Order 20002885 did not arrive as promised in the delivery note. I called the customer hotline many times but each time had to hang up the phone after 30 mins because ikea did not answer. It’s a frustrating experience to deal with a company that does not deliver. I won’t hesitate to make a police report if ikea does not promptly respond to my email. Is this company a big scam?

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Tourists can take advantage of good gourmet food at the IKEA. Not fancy but better than many cafes, hotles or restaurants. Very reasonable price too.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: IKEA is always known for its meatballs, and for a good reason! The meatballs never seem to fail you, and 20 meatballs never seem to be too much. The mashed potato at the side is rather dry though, and rather unpalatable to

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Tuesday 22nd October and we travelled on board the MRTfrom City Hall Station to Bedok Statio

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: For years, IKEA cafeteria serves delicious cuisine at value for money prices. Must try their Swedish meat balls and fried chicken wings!

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review:
sometimes when you are searching for creative ways to decorate your home/room, this is the best place to be!
plus their food is excellent.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: After all these years, IKEA has kept it real with their customer service. After all, furniture is their core business but they have had the smarts to cater well to their customer

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: I did a custom made wardrobe for my new house and after only 3 months, it looked like this with some disgusting mold. I paid about $1600 for it. The IKEA customer service was not keen to help me and told me to just vinegar to clean it. I tried all ways to clean the cupboard but was careful as I didn't wish to make the condition worse. However, to no avail. The customer service also commented that it's the humidity in my room. My other cupboard which I bought from another shop was fine and is still in excellent condition. Such terrible workman ship with poor quality and not even reasonably priced at all. Truly disappointing because it's my own place and I have to stare at that ugly cupboard everyday when I come home. Shall not recommend their custom made stuff to any of my friends. If I could give 0 star I would.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: I bought some hotdogs and spring rolls with drink to go at level 3. When I asked if I need to present my ikea card, the cashier said no need. Then I asked is is no longer issuing points. She said card must be presented before payment. But at the first place she didn’t ask at all. I was the one asked her. So end up I didn’t get my points. I wasn’t given receipt too. She still give a a unhappy and irritated face. So no choice, I went over to put sauce in my hotdogs then found out no mustard. I walk back to the cashier again and inform both mustard dispenser are empty. She said shout to kitchen side no mustard. I waited for a few minutes and people start to queue around for mustard. But still no action till another people notified again. So end up for the first time I had lousy hotdogs since without mustar

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review:
Anyone LOVE Soya?
Available Soya Ice Cream@@ ikea - and only 50cents 😍🥰

Yummy, kids love it 
Should try when in the area

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Food is located inside their Tampines branch. Accessible by free shuttle  from Bedok MRT station and Tampines MRT. Tried their best seller meatballs ang it was very good. They are also selling them at their food market. dining area is bigger than their Alexandra branch

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: All day dining. Great for families and elderly friendly. Try their signature dishes - Swedish Meat  balls with Berry sauce. And fried Chicken Wings with Swedish Lager beer. 👍

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: While shopping when u get tired, just take a break eating at the IKEA outlet. They  have a variety of western food that one can enjoy. The coffee and other drinks are refillable. The cakes are amazing.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Just about everyone would make a beeline here before hitting the store. The affordable grub is the main draw, most head there to get their delicious fried chicken wings & aromatic coffee f

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review:
We simply love to spend at least once a week at IKEA Tampines 

- a spacious space for family time 
- fabulous food 
- children space is fun 
- parking is free (one of the very few places in Singapore)

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Decent swedish food but this place is very very crowded on weekends. I love the meatballs, chicken wings and cold water prawns (if available).

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Honestly. What is there to eat? Swedish meatballs ( which has pork in it), bad fish, mediocre local dishes. Jossling w tons of families w kids and adults looking for a cheap meal. Rude and loud patrons.  I rather starve.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: I visit Ikea Restaurant @ Tampines pretty often. I like the baked salmon, salmon lasagne and mushroom soup. You can ask for more cream sauce for your salmon. The cakes are sugar-overloaded and it is 'diabetes served on plate'. The coffee tastes like 'black water' and super diluted. The chicken wings are deep fried to the extent like 'chicken on drought'! They need to change their menu more frequent. Service wise, it is very fast. You have to clear your plates and cups after meal. Super crowded on weekends and PHs.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: When you come to an Ikea restaurant and you don't get the Swedish meatballs, you aren't coming for the full experience. I tell you, we ordered 40 meatballs (20 in a plate) and it was gone in minute

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: We visited on a week end when the crowd was huge. The queue was long and moving slowly. However, the supplies were enough and we got everything we wanted.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: One of Ikea’s bestsellers when it comes to food is meatballs and chicken wings. I seldom let an Ikea visit go by without partaking of those treats. Simply so go

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: The menu is decent to satisfy one’s taste and the price is affordable. Only downside is the Long queue during peak hours.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: I visited Ikea Alexandra to get some potted plants for the office. Ikea offers presentable and nice potted plants, household items like cutlery, bedding accessories at mostly affordable pri

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Since we are at ikea shopping, so decided to have some snac

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: This place is insanely popular. Not sure why. The service is non existent and the food is really very so so. We don’t quite know why anyone would come to eat here!

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: The meatball was delicious with strawberry jam aside on it. But they serve was no too hot. And also the buffalo wings was marvelous taste and soft when because the crispy.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Though is value for money but staff did not manage the queue very well . People jumped queue while you queued up like a fool .Queued at least 20 minutes to get into the restaura

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: There are two Ikea in Singapore which is the Alexandra Road and Tampines. There is also free bus shuttle from MRTs like Pasir Ris MRT, Bedok MRT and Tampines MRT to Ikea Tampines. You can also refer to the bus schedule on the website to see the timing. This was my first time visiting and trying out the restaurant at Ikea in Singapo

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Read so much about the changes to the restaurant especially the chicken wings. Halal and non-halal prepared not the same style. Rather tasteless for the non-halal. Most food looked bland including ours. Very limited choices for the halal section. Asked for a cup for my bottled water was told I had to pay for it. Seriously? Why can't they provide a disposable cup if they are worried we might steal soft drinks?

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: IKEA Singapore has a wide variety of household needs from clothes storage to kitchen cabinets to chairs and more. It is also a place great for family with young children. Young children can play for up to 1 hour in the enchanted Swedish Forest while we shop at IKEA. After a long day shopping, it was rewarding to have a good meal at IKEA restaura

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: One of my favorite place for meal and would sometimes visit the cafe rather to buy stuff from Ikea. Quite disappointed that they have removed their chicken wings from the menu. Best dishes I would recommend - Portuguese egg tarts, meatballs and their spring rolls. Parking is free but the cafe is always pack on weekends.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Recently visited IKEA with my father for their Ramadan buffet which was priced at $19.90 per adult, where you could eat from 6 30pm-10pm with free flow soft drinks. The food selection was quite decent for the price we paid. As expected, the IKEA beef meatballs were present on the menu!! Their chicken rendang was fragrant and fried wings tasty. Would have hoped for their maggi goreng and fried rice to be more flavourful. Service at the buffet is impeccable, kudos to IKEA staff for being personable and likable. Staff clear your table before your plates clutter. The dessert section was great with a selection of malay kuehs, chocolate eclairs, swiss rolls and fruit cocktail mix, which all tasted rly good. The free flow drinks are unique as they have fruit flavoured water which some may find refreshi

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Chicken wing was discontinued due to quality issue . But I had a beef cheek set n it was really well done n tasty . Usual free coffees tea for members .

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Yes their meatballs has shrunk, probably they find the need to make more money than usual, that is how I see it, instead of just a stop over for shoppers, their restaurant is a go to place for people that love their meatballs but apparently they see the need to make more. They don't serve the same sizes as what they used to, especially right after their renovation, they also renovated their meatball sizes IMHO.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Food is quite lowly priced here. But options in fish, chicken is very limited. They have chicken wings, salmon and chicken chops apart from some cold salads in fish. You get varieties of cakes. If you have gone to IKEA for shopping then this is the best option.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Went to IKEA Alexandra on my last visit in SG. Quite surprise with their menu..their nasi lemak is quit nice and cheap! It's only 4$! A good cup of coffee or tea for only 50 cent. A good choice to have a quick brunch before shopping in Anchorpoint Mall which is just across the road

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: We don't have Ikea in New Zealand and we really enjoyed our time there. Loved the food at the cafe! Amazing value!

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Decided to have dinner at IKEA Tampines after work. It was a Friday. The restaurant was packed. But things runs like clockwork. Qs were orderly and staff efficient. The chicken wings never fail to entice. Soft drinks were free flow. Also tried the Muslim section. Quite goo

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review:
Tried their meat balls again and it is still bad.
Food is worst that fast food places.
Maybe it is cheap that's why there is always a crowd.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Everything is self explanatory,

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Ikea has it in for families, taking care of kids while their parents shop around for housing products. And after getting what they need, the cafeteria with its reasonable pricing and a menu full of yummy treats like the meatballs and delicious chicken wings wld fill us up. And before we leave for the day, satisfied with our meal and purchases, we would most probably join the kids as we indulge in an ice cream cone because, why no

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Dining at IKEA is convenient. The food is good but nothing really to rave about. Prices are kept reasonable and I think given the unique experience of eating in a retail outlet this place remains popular with Singaporeans.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: There is nothing to complain about the IKEA rest

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: self-service is expected of ikea cafeteria so that's not an issue. but it was very crowded and the food tastes very very processed. value is good though.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: very reasonably priced food. self-service style. go along the stations and pick up what you want and pay, find a seat, enjoy. wont go wrong with the meatballs and chicken wings. the cakes are quite good as well. there's a strictly halal corner. refillable coffee is a big disappointment though we should not expect much. big spacious dining area. remember to clear your own trays/trolleys.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: It always nice to eat out at places like this. Getting in to the crowd n buying and eating it while it is hot. Great meat ball, pastry and unlimited coffee! Will be going again.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: IKEA is a little like coming home everywhere all over the glo

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Good value for money, very efficient way to avoid starvation while shopping. Recommend the salads and of course the meatballs!

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: We've been here 2 times. Our favorite food is the swedish meat ball. It's really good. Great place for a family meal

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Me and my wife love spending the day at ik

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Every month we visit Ikea just to eat our favorite Meatballs and chicken wings, my daughter really love their food. Though sometimes a bit crowded and no seats available, we can back anytime as their shops is only nearby the cafeteria. They are selling cheap food and unlimited drinks for only $1.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Crowded, noisy, rude, bad table manners, dirty, inconsideration. Having been a student in Sweden and visited Ikea, the local joint is a disgrace and let down. The taste of meatballs and soup is far off the mark. Training videos instructing local visitors on better dining environment prior to entry should be a requisite. Don't come here on weekends. Many are window-shoppers and families gather to eat and eat in another of their routine outing. This is not a place to visit for international visitors. A failure at promoting the best.of Swedish culture and cuisine. If one has been to Ikea Stockholm you will understand what I am decrying. Pass instead of Heij.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: furniture and ideas are okay and best suited for small apartment spaces and for people who do not want to fix any permanent furniture

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Been here a few times, and finding a seat is always very tough. Food here is acceptable. We always like to order mushroom soup as got many mushroom slices in the soup.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: This restaurant is always noticeably busy. Today was no exception at 2.30 on a weekday afterno

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Food is definitely good. Taste-wise and price-wise. Pretty good variety. Nice to know it has been keeping its tradition of providing good food together with good furnitur

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: We went on a Sunday. It was really crowded but for someone like me that comes from a country without Ikea, we were willing to endure the long queue just to eat their famed meatball

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: After shopping at IKEA, decided to have lunch there. It's always crowde

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Food is good except that on my day of visits, only 2 persons were serving and que was long. However, the food is good and there's special rate for member. Worth the wait.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Went to Ikea in Tampines this week for shopping and a bite to e

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: It has been a while since I last visited the Ikea Café. Despite hearing some not so positive feedbacks about it recently, I decided to go along when my colleague suggested going there for lunch. Beside, I do missed their meatballs and chicken win

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: While they have done their best to make the process as fast as possible, the place has way too many people and getting and paying for food takes a lot of tim

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: First time at an IKEA cafe, the food was delicious, fresh and cheap! The salmon and hollandaise was really flavoursome as were the meatballs. The marzipan dessert looked really cute and was delicious!

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: As always, avoid the dinner/lunch hour, do go early like 11.30am or 5.00pm. Then you will enjoy the meal more and feel less frustrat

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Great place to just hang of you're simply looking waste a lot of time queuing but provides satisfaction to your tummy. Having small children along is tricky but they seem to love the place

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: You can find so many things in ikea, even the cafeteria has a good selection of Asian and western food. During Chinese New Year, you can even come here to Loh hei, the chicken wings is very Crispy and tasty.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: We have visited Ikea many a times but always avoided going to the restaurant because of the crowd and many a times unable to find a sea

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Nice if you can find a table.....it's usually very crowded. Prices are reasonable which possibly explains why it's perpetually busy. Drinks are bottomless (free refills!) which makes them great value!

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: We loved to eat here every time we visit IKEA store. the Salmon is very fresh, even my kids like it. Swedish meatball is very yumm

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: I'm glad that Ikea provides Halal-certified food in their cafeteria. The food menu changes daily and are quite affordable too. Soft drinks are free-flow at only a dollar. 👍

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: The queue is always long but fast. Even the restaurant is big it's hard to find a seat. Chicken wings is my fave food here.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Both restaurant is getting pricy now.Salmon used to be affordable but not no

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: good food, very reasonable prices ..

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Was at Ikea Alexandra checking out some furniture. Was a little hungry and needed a quick bit

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: You can't go past the $2 Hot Dog Deal! Dog, drink & cone, the kids love it, while we get to use it as a bribe to shop. Win-W

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: Best place for Chicken Wings and the Meatball !!! Yum !!! Even though the cafe its always crowded but the cashiers and staffs and pretty fast in movements. Only thing is you got to wait for a table for a long time :)

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: The line can be very long so a fast track to get your food is to queue at the Halal counter which has fewer choices on the menu but the popular meatballs, chicken wings are available. The Nasi Goreng and Nasi Padang are not bad comparing to most food courts.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
Review: This is not the first time these local Chinese aunties who served food are terribly rude & appalling but several times over the months since 2013. In contrast, the Malay cashiers are so polite & pleasant esp Cik Siti. Every time coming to Ikea was a happy event for me to bring my family there & everytime these local Chinese aunties never fail to be crude & blatantly rude to courteous diners who queued up patiently & had to swallow such nonsensical treatment. I observe the servers at the Muslim Corner dont behave like these arogant local Chinese aunties. The Filipino staff were polite & helpful. I reckon management has to seriously look into these matter because it spoils our happy day patronising Ikea. Besides having good products, service is equally vital in any businesses. Dont give lame excuses that these local Chinese aunties cant communicate English properly because if their attitude serving customers is abyssal, even their gestures & facial expressions & tone of voice could reflect their rottenness. Learn from the Japanese people, despite zero command of English, we had no complaints whatsoever with their service because they serve with a highly motivated positive attitude. It's the right attitude that matters most, the rest will fall in place.

Name: Ikea Cafeteria
Location: 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 Singapore
