Review: My mother and I had a wonderful time at Antidote (we had the special Nespresso collaboration menu). We especially loved the selection of TWG teas, the fluffiest vanilla scones, and the savory items. Special thanks to James, who was an absolutely delight and took such great care of u

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: I came here on a weekday afternoon with a friend to have afternoon tea we were seated near the window facing the hotel's drop off point and on the main road. We did not want to be seated near the window facing the drop off point it was dark and dim and we requested if another seat could be arrange however their staff said that they are fully booked and there were no more other seats available and he said some customers had to seat at the b

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Tai Tai life on a Saturday afternoon, simple savoury tartlets and sweet treats! Egg mayo (savoury) and Nescafe Mascarpone Choux (sweet) are good!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Excellent service from the staffs and very friendly and delicious high tea set and the starters were good too.  Thank you

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Great service (Jong). He is attentive to our needs and takes great photos. Truly enjoyed ourselves. Ambience is really nice.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Like the variety of food. The staff, James and Sherica, are very friendly and helpful.  Location is good, very close to train station.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: We’ve been coming here over the years, and Antidote is remarkable for being a hotel bar with reliably good drinks. Not cheap, but reasonably priced for the quality. Competitively priced, even. The real star is the quality of service, though. James was attentive and considerate, while also being discreet and giving us our space. All of experiences with Antidote staff have been similar. We don’t normally eat at Antidote, but the seasonal menu on this occasion (casual british?) was particularly good (James’s recommendation). We’ve never had a bad night at Antidote. I don’t think i’ve even had a boring drink at Antidote.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Had an amazing night cap at Anti:Dote Fairmont Singapore. We had East District and Old is Gold cocktails. Great service by James, Jong and Anton and our night ended with a special Christmas Elixir! Thank you for a great experience!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: I was fortunate enough for this gem to be in the hotel in which I was staying for several months. Have eaten and drank here on many occasions and would gladly return. Food is excellent and the cocktails even bett

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: had afternoon tea yesterday with nice varities of sweets and savories plus free flow drinks which was great, thanks to arven and james for accomodating us

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Great experience. The pop up menu is great! Especially recommend the heirloom tomato salad and the Scotch egg! Jong was a fantastic host! The cocktails - especially my old fashioned - were great too!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Had an amazing session with the family here. Enjoyed many different teas that went well with their savoury pastries and sweet desserts. It was a small celebration for my mum’s birthday and they gave a complimentary slice of cake with candle~ Mum loved it by the way. My dad being cheeky, asked if he could have a slice too and Angela who served us was really nice and gave him one. She was really patient too when we were taking a bit more time when choosing from a long list of teas. Highly recommend it!!!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Went for the seasonal menu: 4-course lunch set with wine pairing and ala carte fish & chips. Small quantity but top quality, especially the scallops and beef! We were seated at the sofa, very comfy with baby and enough space for the stroller. Our waiter James was very friendly and attentive.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Delicious high tea. Nice ambience for get-together with friends. Excellent service by James and Maggie.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review:
Afternoon tea set come with a white box ..
Very nice afternoon tea set with professional staff service ! 
Recommended 😋😋

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Was my second time to antidote is still my favourite bar in Singapore, the bartender was very friendly and kind the name was Angela ,the cocktail fantastic and the food as well .

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Absolute treat from start to finish. The service was efficient, personal and friendly. We had the set dinner and finished every course, delicious. It was also a lovely touch that we were given a celebratory drink for our anniversary - a really lovely way to spend our evening. Thanks!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: High tea set is always a place to wind down, have a long chat, catch up time with people that matters to you. What is better is the selection of sweets and savoury bites combined with a cup of their signature coffee / tea (free flow for both) that makes wonderful time flies by so quickly when you are indulged with the conversation and events of the people that matters to you. What a place that offers the antidote to your city stress.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Giselle was really friendly and helpful. The service here was really good and the ambience was nice.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: I was served by Giselle and Maggie. The service was excellent and I felt well taken care off. Ambience was great.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Food was great and we enjoyed ourselves! The staff even called us a day before to ask if we had any requests for a birthday celebration for a friend. Thanks James for the amazing service today as well!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Michelin star quality at casual dining prices. Thanks to James and Maggie for excellent hosting!  We took the wine pairing too and were not disappointed!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Service from James was excellent. Food wise was only ok in my opinion. Maybe because high tea is not really my cup of tea

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: James great service. Good wine pairing great for the UK pop

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Nice ambience and tasty pastry!  Thanks James n Maggie for the excellent services!  Like the cavier sandwich!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Very cosy and the service staff Giselle is great. Very attentive to customer needs. The food was delicious.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: It was a beautiful place with a calming ambience, with excellent service. We were served by Jong who looked after our ever need.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review:
Excellent,polite and friendly service by Jong.
Good quality food.
Comfortable seating for relaxing and conducive atmosphere for conversations.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: It’s been awhile since we had the chance to go for Hi-tea. Anti:dote was awesome just as the reviews suggested. Service by Jong was excellent and the food was so yummy!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Nice ambience and great customer service. We had the nespresso afternoon tea set. Nice and chill afternoon. Great food 😋 ❤

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review:
The staff were very patient and kind towards my requests. 
Great and peaceful place for me and my child. 
We really enjoyed ourselves and the food.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Nice food and ambience. Great service by James! 👍🏻 Will definitely come back here again with my friends.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: We have been wanting to try out afternoon tea in Singapore after our fabulous experience in London. I am so glad to be able to try out the afternoon tea at Antidote in Fairmont. Service, ambience and food was all super on point. James is super attentive and we are really happy with the service provided by him. Looking fwd to another afternoon tea session at Antidote!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Would like to thank kuya James and others for the service and the kitchen/bar staff for the awesome food and drinks!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Awesome service and lovely food. Great start to the weekend. Thoroughly enjoyed the savouries and sweets.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: A lovely place to enjoy a yummy high tea set. The staff were very friendly and we appreciated the exceptional service. The pink flamingo tea that was recommended was very flavorful!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Great food presentation, pleasant service from the team, love both savoury and sweet pastries. Would defo be back and recommend anti:dote

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Had lunch at Antidote on a Saturday. Food was amazing and the service was impeccable also. Highly recommended!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: My partner made a reservation for 4 pax for a Friday afternoon high tea for my birthday. Upon arrival, my partner’s mum wished me a happy birthday and while having our food, one of the waiter (didn’t get his name) serve me a slice of cake with a candle. Was so surprised as we didn’t state it’s for a birthday celebration. So we questioned 1 of the staff and she said the staff overheard our conversation. This waiter is so attentive! Thank you so much for this! You made our day.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: James was especially helpful to accommodate us when we didn’t have a prior reservation. Excellent service.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Antidote is having an event in conjunction with breast cancer awareness month so their macaroons had the pink ribbon logo. I think it’s very meaningful to have this collaboration. Enjoyed the atmosphere n treats beautifully placed in the lavish iconic leathered drawer. But one thing could have been better is that my table could be more spaced out from the one beside as I could hear what the other is table is talking about, it was abit distracting. Overall still a nice experience to chill and enjoy the hi tea with my friend.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Excellent and personable service. Everyone was fantastic. Special mention to Maggie for taking care of us, and to the bartender (I’m sorry, we did not get your name) who made sure that our drinks order was double checked. Will be back!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Presentation of high tea set was absolutely beautiful not to mention the dainty teacups that came with it. Ambience was quaint. Service was attentive & friendly.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: We only have 30min. to waste before our dinner booking at Prego which is under same chain of Fairmont. Anti:dote is the only cafe open which has a bar. Place was crowded but seats were empty at bar counter. So we told server we'll have a cocktail at the bar counter! He said so long you're drinking, you HAVE TO purchase a small dish whether is fries, burger etc. We said no as this will spoil our dinner at Prego and we only have 30min. Server said NO this is their policy. We tried to talk to him nicely can he please ask his manager as this is too bizarre since Prego is also part of Fairmont. He said NO again this is their policy. Can I know who came out with this policy at Fairmont? I'm sure if he/she owns the bar, he/she will kick himself for having such a silly inflexible policy. We want to support local as much as we can, but we will never support such an environment.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Anti:dote is the ground floor bar of the Fairmont hotel in Singapore, but feels more like a standalone bar, quite segregated from the rest of the hotel, which is a big plus! You could go and enjoy a few drinks with friends here on a Friday night or add some food into the mix also. This was not my first visit to Anti:dote and I don’t expect it will be my last, definitely one of the best whiskey sours I have had in Singapore and my wife was also happy with her cocktail

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Food presentation is great. However taste is average, and didnt meet expectation as per presentation.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Always wanted to dine at Antidote since opening. It was long check lost for me before i can finally check in and mark this is one of the Best high tea i ever h

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Went here for the business lunch set and I was pleasently surprised at how good the food was! I don't have high expectations for set lunches. It was about $38 for the 3 course set, so I was expecting small portions and ok food. But WOW that salad was so generously portioned and they don't skimp on the salmon tartare. The salmon club sandwich was also HUGE and pretty tasty. The service was really fast and friendly. I was really impressed with my visit today! Definitely recommend!

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Came here for a Christmas gathering with my girls and we were definitely wow-ed by the extravagance of the high tea set. Don't be deceived by the term 'hightea' because it was extremely filling and delicious. We honestly didn't expect to be so full! Great service too by the staff at Anti:dote.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: High tea for those with a sweet tooth. This set has more sweets than savoury bites. Comes presented in a pretty little drawer together with the jams and scones at the bottom. It is an unrefillable and fixed set although requests made to change certain items due to allergies was made specially for us. Excellent service from staff.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review:
Try the experience!
What a top location to enjoy a High Tea experience.
Excellent service , great atmosphere.
Value for money.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: From the first time we arrived until the day we left all the staff were exceptional. They remembered our name and our drinks the whole time we were there. Nothing was to much of a bother for them and if some part of your order was delayed you were given a on the house glass champagne. In my opinion on of the best bars I have ever been to.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Very poor variety of hi tea items and it’s non refillable. We have 3 people and each item comes in pairs. Even the tea is non refillable. There are many hi tea available in singapore hotels and all are refillable. The pastries are cold. Never ever going there again

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Me and my wife went to this place to chill. The menu and the food was very nice. A big thanks to Raj for his good service and hospitality👍

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: A wonderful experience . Were greeted warmly by Giselle and she looked after every detail to make our evening excellen

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Was welcomed warmly by one of the staff and was seated in the corner which was overall, a decently conducive place to catch up on some work. Elegant and cosy ambience with friendly staff. Would return to try out the afternoon tea and more items on the menu as I was only there for a drink.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Had a quick cocktail here after a very fulfilling dinner with my bestfrien

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Impressive display of food and it was appetising. Service staff was courteous and approachable. Atmosphere was cosy and warm.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Highly recommended venue for friends and families. Didn’t see any kids when I was there but they’ll provide baby chairs if you ask for them. The high tea set was gorgeous! My photos don’t do it justice - it really is a beautiful as the images you see when you google “Anti:dote high te

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review:
ANTI:DOTE is the best place to relax and enjoy high tea.
Service staff Jong and Gragory was very friendly and helpful.
Wish to visit again.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: It was my first time to chill and enjoy drinks with friends at Anti:dote. Gabrielle recommended me a fruity drink named "Rabbits Hole" wherein I was also impressed coz it was unique and tasty I've never tried it before. Service was Excellent by Gabrielle..even though he was stationed at the bar but he always finds a way to make everything alright with us. Thanks also to Claudio for taking time to look for us. Kudos to Anti:dote we make sure to recommend you to our friends.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Nice place! We went there on a weekday thus the place isn’t packed (not sire though if it usually is as it’s our first time). Ambiance is good and I’d recommend it if you’re looking for a quiet and cozy place catch up with friends. Drinks can be improved though. Their Singapore Sling is too sweet and their Rabbit Hole cocktail tasted just okay (nothing too special) considering the price you pay for. Although their classic mojito and their whiskey-based drink called Donkey Kong are excellent. Their spirits and wine selection is I would say decent. Special mention to Gab! He’s fantastic and really made sure we’re having a good time. He made recommendations and is totally attentive to all our needs.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: We booked a table for four but we are one afternoon tea set  short of the order. Only three sets of afternoon tea were prepared. That's was really too bad.

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Booked the high teal 5 days before attending, advising that one person did not eat seafood. Tea came with seafood, staff fixed this and I would like to acknowledge the chefs ability in correcting the mistake in a short ti

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Met a friend of ours who came from overseas and had cocktail plus tapas. Was highly recommended due to an award winning bartender but we were extremely disappointed by the cocktail. All we did was paid for the presentation and the contents itself was a major disappointment. Most of our cocktail tasted weird and the alcohol content was so low we couldn't taste any. The plus point was the tapas which was pretty decent but over priced and the portion are too small . Unlikely to come back again after paying SGD160 for 4 cocktails and 3 tapas

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: My husband and I came here for afternoon tea. It was lovely. Aside for being not overly expensive nothing beats the presentation of this absolutely gorgeous afternoon tea. The selection of treats were quite nice. The addition of a chosen starter (we chose the truffle egg) and take home cookies were a nice touch. Overall I liked the sweet selections over the savouries. The staff were friendly enough, nothing outstanding to no

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Was there to celebrate a friend's birthday. Requested for the bday cake to be serve at 2359 hours but came 15min earlier....🤔🤔🤔...Anyway the setting itself is not intimate enough so yeah 3 out of 5 is a fair deal...

Name: Anti:dote
Location: 80 Bras Basah Road Level 1, Singapore 189560 Singapore
Review: Anti:Dote did a collaboration with Shanghai Tang to give a well-crafted amazing menu of an Afternoon T

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: My family ordered Cereal Prawns, they serve Big Prawns, really filling ! We get pleasant smile and very good service from waitress @ front counter taking our temperature & those whoe served us the food ! My family and I immediately booked our family reunion dinner for this coming Chinese New Year !

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The food taste only average but the bill was unexpectedly pricey. Crab costs $100 but was small and doesn’t taste that great. Chinese tea for one pax costs $8.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: This is our go-to place for dim sum.  The dim sum is good and has always been but the lunch is made more enjoyable with the friendly and efficient staff. Keep it up. You guys are the main reasons we always go back.  Thank you.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: have dinner there with my parents and the service is very good. We ordered crab dishes with the promotion and was informed that the crab have not arrived, however, we got informed < several times > once the fresh crabs are delivered and assure us that they have arrange the cooking immediately.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We visit this restaurant whenever we crave for good dim sum. They are made to order, served steaming hot and paced so that each order are not too close; letting you enjoy your meal. And the service is top notch. The staff are friendly, polite and very prompt. We enjoyed our lunch. Thank you.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We were there for dinner. Tried the shark fin soup with crab meat, steam cod fish in garlic sauce, chilli crab, butter prawns, scallop with broccoli, roasted sliced duck, steam king prawns with garlic, fried beehoon. The food were all awesome with quality. Although its a bit pricey but we were really very satisfied with the portions and taste. Had a hearty dinner

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Standard of the food dropped drastically. The seafood were not fresh at all. Crab was overpriced - 1kg at $120 (23 August 2020). Visit at your own risk.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The dim sums from No Signboard are probably the most underrated and delicious ones in Singapore. Look pretty too!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review:
Had chilli crab (tasted nothing out of this world), mee goreng (more like char kway teow) and fried squids and the bill came to almost $230.00.
Jumbo seafood tastes much better and cheaper
Will not return

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We went there to try the world famous Singapore Chilli Crab. We got a huge Alaskan crab and decided to have half of it as Singaporean Chilli Crab and the other half Salted Egg Crab. It was incredible!! We loved every single mouthful and it got us hooked on salted egg everything!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review:
Its a wonderful experience.
The Restaurant's wall are hang with beautiful graphical seafood painting.
The waiter patiently explains the food preparation & Serve the dishes with pride.
Dishes in small serving are just nice especially the 3 crabs cook in different flavors.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Amazing taste and high quality seafood. King crab is a little pricey but reasonable. One of the best restaurant to visit when in Singapore.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The famous chilli crabs never disappoints us. Love the mini buns too. Ordered 3 other dishes. 3 adults and 1 kid, Costa is SGD240++.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Great taste but just too costly. The normal crab is $100 per KG. The white pepper crab taste great. The white pepper taste goes into the flesh of the crab so super yummy

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Had dinner with colleagues there, order their signature white paper and chilli crabs and other few dishes, the crabs are not fresh and the food doesn’t taste fantastic as described. Considered not worth the money for the quality we had.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: My hubby and I wanted to have celebrate a special occasion and went for lun

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Overpriced, terrible food and average service. The crab was not fresh and the other dishes were sub standard compared to the other restaurants. I am suprised they are still around given the phlethora of good restaurants in Singapore. The food from the hawker centres taste better and is way cheaper. They even charge for paper napkins. I recommend heading to Jumbo Seafood Restuarant as the food is way better especially their crab and they don’t charge for the paper napkins.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We ordered chilli crab, lobster and other.. the spices and sauces are yet the best i ever ate at singapore.. a little bit expensive but its worthed for the taste..

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We ordered the set menu for 2 which includes a lobster salad for starters, a crab dish, a soup, a choice of vegetable and dessert, for $250. With tea, towels, peanuts and service it comes up to about $30

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review:
Food was good but not excellent. I do find the food was a little over priced. They do offer different types of crabs and lobster. 
Staff was efficient even though restaurant was crowded.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Foods are taste good. Staffs are nice and helpful. Especially one of them can speak in Cantonese. But a little bit expensive.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Super disappointed by the quality of food. To think we paid so much for substance food. White pepper crab was a little overcooked and too salty. If I pay 100 bucks for a crab I expect it to be well cooked and not overcooke

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: They’ve many branches in town, this one located in Vivo city so it’s good for people who’s staying in Sentosa come out for a nice dinner. Their crabs are one of the best, we ordered white pepper one and shrimp which is super spicy but tasty, their service is good, we went there late and half place was empty so they can be more focusing on service.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Good, affordable dim sum with excellent service. Had a side order of their cereal prawns. They were ok but I’ll order a different prawn dish next time. Enjoyed my lunch. Will return.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Good food, fair price and good service and friendly staff.  Vivo City, good location.  It is easy to make reservation online.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The white pepper crab and prawns is really fresh and sweet. Great eefu mian too! Service is good and food serves pretty fast.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Went there last Sunday for dinner .Ordered chilli crab,honey pork ribs and a vege.. crab was a great disappointment, meat was not fresh and very soggy. Chilli sauce was salty and watery , this is one of the worst chilli crab I had . Pork was cold and covered with too much fatty meat. I think coffee shop Zhi char can do a better job than no sign board.. overall food was pricey and not worth the money at all , a total disappointment !

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The reservation thru chope was seamless. Restaurant staffs were friendly.  But the chilli crab was average only as the sauce was not thick enough. Bun was nice.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review:
3 of us, ordered 4 dishes. Bill come out to be almost 500. 

Ordered a normal Crab for 3 persons, cost about 300. 

Service is good. 

Food taste is not bad. But I find it too expensive.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Ordered the set menu. Food was quite good and reasonable value. What was outstanding was the service. The main waitress serving our table saw my mum struggling somewhat with her crab, and patiently helped her de-shell and removed the crab meat onto my mum's dish. She also take the initiative to prepare plates and forks for the birthday cake we brought along, and helped us cut and serve the cake. Kudos to her and her colleagues!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Love for crab? Then let’s have a Crab-by dinner. Ideal for family dinner. But price point is a little too high. Chili crab is not world best but worth a try. Coffee ribs is a must if you are a fan for ribs

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Ambience is good staff is frien

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Never actually got the food ordered, got one dish, asked for the next 30 mins later and then after almost one hour gave up on getting the Chilli grab - go elsewhere these guys are not real - this was also recommend by the Marina Bay Sands concierge- fail

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: This is the third time we visited there. We ordered crabs , lobsters , abalones , prawns , scallops and desserts. All are keep at a good cooking standard. Do remember to bring encough cash if you not pay by mobile payment or credit cards.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: I went to No signboard Esplanade with a group of clients last sunday (3 March 2019). This excuse of a restaurant deserves to be shut down for a couple of reason

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Firstly, I booked window seats for 4 pax but I was given a center seating. Cereal prawns were heavily overfried which makes the prawn in very oily states. century egg spinach was too soupy and cold. Chill crab and fried bun were cold and the buns were soggy. It was heavily used of ready to use concentrated chicken stock for the broth which used in chicken shell soup. It was such a terrible food dining which i wont want to experience it again.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We called the famous Sri Lanka crab (both pepper & chilli) the pepper crab taste plain, the meat Not fresh, the taste is same as those meat tt has kept in the fridge for quite a while. Chilli crab the sauce is better than the pepper crab. The rest of dishes so so

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Service good and friendly but a bit slow. Typical Chinese seafood with absolutely delicious crabs and shrimps. The fish dishes a bit messy with a lot of sauce covering the fish and make it tricky recognising the bones. Value for money is not perhaps the best but atmosphere of a bit better restaurant cost money. More a place for a business dinn

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We were disappointed we could not apply yr 10% discount voucher after making reservation. Food was bad ... prawns with cereal were overdone. Prices expensive for dinner with vegetables, bean curd , prawns n sweet n sour pork .... $195.00

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: This is a very nice and somewhat upscale restaurant with several locations around the city. Expect the usual high prices for drinks and food but the quality is worthwhile. Do expect to pay a modest fee for water and handy wipes. The menu is extensive and offers a wide variety of fresh seafood. It can be a little intimidating when you order as most fish comes by weight. The kitchen was very accommodating and helped us deal with a food allergy.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We felt fairly isolated in this restaurant that seemed to cater to local families. The food was expensive, but good. We especially liked the steamed vegetables and shrimp.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: I can't deny that the crab was delicious, however, as compared to other places in Singapore, the crabs here are definitely overpriced for its taste. I could easily find crabs that cost cheaper but taste better in Singapore.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: So disappointed in our experience at this restaurant. The food was average in quality but VERY expensive. The service was absolutely appalling, not once were we attended by a member of staff to order our meals or a drink and the staff were very rude. To top it all off, there were hand towels on the table in place of any kind of serviette/ napkin and when we recieved the bill we had been charged for every hand towel!! The only good aspect of this restaurant is the view. Do not waste your money!!!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The food wasnt deem good. Extremely pricy as compared to other seafood restuarants. Wouldnt recommend it

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Came with a reservation. Did some homework to make sure I order everything right for the family. During the research, I’ve already seen people complained about the restaurant either say they don’t have any reasonable cost crab available in stock or just pick whatever the most expensive one if you forget to a

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: 螃蟹沒有我以前吃的好吃，但價錢卻貴上許多。服務還算可以，考慮這種價位，我認為服務品質應該更高。The crab is not as good as I used to eat, but the price is far more ..

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: visit the Vivo City one every time I visit Singapore. I have to say I am satisfied every time and this time is no exception. Food and service just excellent and my family just love it. Will definitely come again in the future.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Overall experience was good, but mee goreng and crab meat fried rice was average only. The rest was delicious!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: I have requested for less spicy for the chilli crab so that my daughter and friend are able to enjoy it. They really did & they really enjoy it very much! Thank you!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: I also had the same experience as what many people had before me. I booked this place because my old friends from Korea visited me. When I made the reservation, they didn't tell me that Sri Lanka King crab wasn't available but when we were about to order they told us that only Alaska crab is available..... having guests with me, thought it wasn't proper to leave the place and of course it is typical to treat "chilli crab" for our guest in Singapore... which left me no choice but order chilli crab. We had four adults and two (4 years & 1.5 year old kids) and the bill costs over SGD 500... no one had any alcohol for your information... Place like Singapore, I doubt that this kinda place will last long... Now I can see what there are many people dining in that place. PLease don't go!!!!!!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Food was good but way way too expensive. Service was just horrendous. Servers brough out all our food together and when the lazy susan was full, did not attempt to adjust but just left it on our side of the table

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: A nice restaurant in which I will definitely go every time I visit Singapore. This Outlet is located in Vivocity, which is convenience for those visiting / staying in Sentosa. Try their signature dishes - Chilli / Pepper Crab, you'll surely love it!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The dim sum are fresh and unique combi for the carrot cake and Chee Cheong Fun. Attentive staff and friendly

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We love their crabs. This is the place where we always bring our overseas friends. Their cooks prepared some of the best tasting crabs in Singapore. We were never disappointed every time we visit their restaurant. But to be very honest, their restaurant can do with some renovations, it looks a little dated.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Were disappointed as we were told that Sri Lankan crabs ($50-60 per kilo) were all sold out the night before ?! The menu given gave two other options --Canadian crab for $128 each or Alaskan crab fro $200 per kilo. Would have left but didnt want to disappoint family and it turned out to be a great disappointment anyway.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review:
I love the crabs, big and tasty. price are super high as everybody said.

be careful with the cold towel in the plastic package, they charge you even you use it or not. half self service.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: This restaurant was recommended to us by an airline hostess as we were flying into Singapore, as she had recently eaten there. So what did we have? - chilli crab of course (very nice, but we've had better), and a beautiful seafood Mee Goreng. Add two beers onto that and the total bill was AUS$146. Look, the chilli crab was good - no actually, it was great - but I'm scoring really pedantically as Singapore is the home of chilli crab so the dish should have been beyond reproach. A meal to die for, which unfortunately it wasn't. So it's 5-stars for the Mee Goreng and 3.5-stars for the chilli crab.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review:
they have mentioned the crab is 1.4kg but when we received, is not as big they have mentioned
prices are too expensive

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: I'll start off by saying that I love their original Geylang location so I expected this to be the same except indoo

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: I'm still not sure why they are that expensive. We chose Sri Lankan Crab - the cheapest of all - and had to choose either the 1.2 kg or 1.4 kg one (It's SGD 80-ish per kg). Their Chili Crab comes with a pool of chili soup mixed with so much eggs (heaven!). In terms of taste, they are just okay. We ordered a lot of other food, cereal prawn, black pepper beef (forget the name they listed), sweet and sour chicken, etc. They are good, but again, too expensi

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Went there early with family on a weekend. The restaurant was less than half full and it was before 7 pm. Was told they ran out of Sri Lanka crabs! In a seafood restaurant that prides itself on crabs! Ordered prawns which came up over fried in a too sweet sauce. The food costs 20% more than comparable restaurants and some portions were smaller than expected. A young coconut drink that would cost £2 in a hawker centre cost £5 here. Do yourself a favour and eat somewhere else.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Admittedly this restaurant seems to specialise in seafood but we went there yesterday evening because of the good reviews. We ordered a chicken dish and pork dish....both really disappointing for the amount we paid. Part of the chicken was still pink inside and was a major turn-off! The staff were not all professional. I would not recommend it!! Over-priced and disappointing!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: This is one of the leading seafood restaurant chains in singapore. Famous for the white pepper crab. Al the items we chose were seafood and vegetarian.bill comes to sgd75 per person. Staff members were attentive. Menu was extensive with a good mix of non meat items.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Cleanness, Service, Environment is just nice. Slight language barrier with foreign staff but managed to do well. The food is good but its a bit overpriced. Jumbo Seafood and Long Beach Seafood can do the same at a lower price.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Chilli crab is great if you like the spicy type of sauce (instead of the sweet/ketchupy sort). A little on the pricey side.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Went at 730pm on a weekday night to be informed by the waitress that they had sold out on their Sri Lankan crabs. We were forced to order the more expensive options, either the Canadian or Alaskan crabs. Waiters were inattentive and inexperienced and borderline rude. On top of that we were charged for ice water, wet wipes and peanuts as mandatory items, sky-rocketing the bill to a crazy amount. Will never return, you're better off at other restaurants.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review:
The food never fail to amaze me dispite the amount is high. 

My oversea boss love the chilli crab. The fish is also fresh, no not have fishy smell. 

Homemade beancurd was tasty as well.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Food was averagely cooked and service was bad. For example when I asked for a change of plate, the service staff will ask someone junior to do the service and we have to wait for a while. Very disappointed on the food as compared to the Geylang No Sign Board outlet.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: I find the seafood here is overpriced. When Comparing with Longbeach or Jumbo it lacks the quality and finesse

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The staff there is friendly and the food there is nice, espeically the chilli crab. Worth a try and will return again next time.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Singapore is a very small country and humid country and this time of the year, its always raining. I regularly visit Singapore not for its sights but for its food since it offers a wide variety of choices from the hawker type food to the michelin star restauran

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The restaurant staff always say that Srikanka crab is not availble which have to be pre-order. I don’t know whether it is business stragetic. Because it happens every branches. you still will get the Sri Lanka crabs if you show no intention to order more expensive crabs. If it’s really pre-order required, it can be highlighted when making a reservation or indicate on the official website

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We visited it in lunch time and want to try pepper crab. But it had no stock. How come a seafood restaurant signature dish would have no stock. There was just another group of guests there. Don’t try and don’t waste time there.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Great food with typical crabs cooked two ways, white peppers and chilli crabs.  Coffee coated bbq pork ribs equally good. Good place to entertain

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: I celebrate anniversary with my wife at No Signboard. I remembered the last time I had it a few years ago, it was goo

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: its the easiest place to get a taste of Singaporean seafood when staying in Sentosa. We had the black pepper crab and of course the must-try cereal pawns which were both very good. And the stuffed tofu too. But be prepared to pay a lot!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Like their chilli crab. Sauce is good and crab is fresh. We have been there every year for my hubby birthday.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Did a reservation through Chope and was not informed that their signature white pepper Sri Lankan crab. Went all the way down and was told no Sri Lankan crab was available.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: When 1 normal crab cost $128, Alaska crab is at $200 per KG, and a normal dish cost around $50, this is a very pricey restaurant to

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: 128 SGD for less than 700grams of crab - really not worth it. There are other places like Mellben, Jumbo, KEK, master crab that are better in quality, bigger in size and cheaper!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Visited the branch at Esplanade for the view but the standard of the food has gone down. The seafood was not really fresh despite how much the restaurant charged for it. The staffs were friendly enough tho.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We clearly prefer this restaurant to Jumbo Seafood. The white pepper crab was delicious and the waiter was very attentive, as we took our time to finish the meal. No trying to upset or rushing us in any way. As it is on the pricey side, I am giving it 4 circles.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The staff are great! The food are Good.! I will recommend to my friends and relative. The environment are also good and not so crowded.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Like other reviews, they said they don't have the cheaper options and suggested the much more expensive option and even it was the price per perso

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: It wasn't the best meal by any stretch of the imagination but the chili crab is something to be experienced. The Alaskan crab comes in a variety of different dishes all of which were delicious. The service was a little off at times but a fun evening even if the crab is expensive

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Fantastic Chilli Crab. One of the best in Singapore. However the price shows it. At $80 per kilo it is not cheap. However worth a splurge now and then for special occasions.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Clean and tidy restaurant, lunch time so not very busy, we had a booking and we sat inside out of the Singapore heat. Would be a good experience of a night time with all the lights of Marina Bay shinning over water, especially if sitting outside. Good food and service, wine considered expensiv

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Shocked to be told that their Sri Lanka crab was not available. Was offered more expensive options of the Canadian crab which was not fresh and expensive for its si

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Went to your geylang brunch and food was superb.  Rather disappointed with the food taste in vivo city.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: It was a great experience with the restaurant. Especially when it comes with great food and cozy atmosphere. Service from the staff was wonderful!

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Ever wanted the experience of being watched over by a hawk? Visit here

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: My colleagues and I had dinner at this restaurant last evening. The dinner reservation was 6:30pm and we arrived on time. We could see the restaurant was not too busy with only a few tables being occupi

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: I was on a whistle stop visit to Singapore to visit family and had to have Singapore Chili cra

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: We ordered black pepper crab, Lobster, crab fried rice, seafood hor fan, Hong kong style steam fish, Thai style fried chicken, double boiled herbal soup, tofu and Scallop with vegetable. Chinese tea was unlimited flow. All the dishes were very flavorful but pricy. The bill came up to about SGD70

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Restaurant in Vivo more like high end compare to other outlets which are more like food courts. Service is good and waiters are well train. Foods are tasty but abit pricy.

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: come to this place to indulge in the world famous Singapore chilli crab ,now I took on the crab and the lobster ,the food was .ok ,the sauce was pretty good ,but when the bill come thats when the shock hits home ,just under $300 Australian dollars for 3 of us .the worst part was that I was still not full ,had to go to another eat street to fill up ,which was another $100 dollars ,this place knows the tourist want to eat from their establishment and abuse that ,hopefully these poor reviews will be viewed and listened to .

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: When in Singapore, the one signature dish in the mind of a visitor is the famous chilli cra

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: Here on a Thursday night with a group of 5 colleagues. We got the set menu for 4 and added one veggie dish. Perfect size to share (actually, still very ful

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The famous oldest and delicious restaurant here and i saw Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong and his wife have come many time in only No sign board China town. Crabs are very very big, the smallest from 1kgs and normal until 2kgs. So fresh, crabs still swim in pool. Here there is just mouth eating porridge

Name: No Signboard Seafood
Location: 1 Harbourfront #03-02 Vivocity, Singapore 098585 Singapore
Review: The Chilli Crab was wonderful - could have been a little spicier. But excellent! A little too much for one but a great meal!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Third time here. Exceptional service and hospitality from the heart as usual from Khemika and the team- thank you for the lovely bubbly white wine. Also, the food was palatable and ‘morerish’, you will want to eat more and more. All dishes were beautifully plated like a stunning art piece by the talented Chef Ganesan- Thank you for making our lunch a most pleasant one! Highly recommended for cosy lunches, you just have to come and dine at The Rose Veranda at least once.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: #RoseVeranda finally reopens. Though we missed the salad selection but We simply love and enjoyed the elegantly presented new 3 course high-tea - Experience in Red. Icing on the cake.. Come dress in Red and you get a glass of complimenta

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Chef Ganesan Ashok was great explaining the ingredients and cooking of the meal. High tea was nice, not too sweet. Mains were splendid. Highly likely will come back.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Went for high tea at Rose Veranda with my cousin, sister and best friend. The service was excellent and the food was amazing! The starters were so unique and delicious. The mains were delicious and I dont even have to mention the desserts : Out of this world! They had apparently just introduced a new concept with the colour red and everything was so attractive and delightful. The staff were so polite, jovial and attentive. Chef Ganesan Ashok personally came over to speak to us and to all the other tables too and explained the different dishes. Hats off to the team at Rose Veranda! Our first visit and definitely won't be our last!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review:
New concept by RV, super worth it and most importantly it taste superb! 

68++ per set for 2! 

Includes an appetizer, a choice of main course, followed by a 3-tier tea stand to be shared among 2! 

:)

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Visited the restaurant for high tea with a frien

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Earlier in February, I stepped into The Rose Veranda and was immediately welcomed by a staff who ushered me to a table beside a row of floor-to-ceiling glass windows. I sat alone at the table, with perfect acoustics for people watching. The staff attended promptly whenever I had a request and all of them were knowledgeable about the menu. I am especially impressed with the dessert selection near the main entrance of The Rose Veranda. It is absolutely the bomb. I spent the day with a good buffet spread and time went by so quickly. However, if I am to select just one aspect about my Rose Veranda experience, it would be Chef Ganesan - his hospitality and the mastery of his specialty. He took the time to present his creation, explaining its origins and conception. All in all a gustatory delight.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I love this place. I'm always warning welcomed not when I step into rose verandah... but the minute I send in my reservation to the LOVELY ANGEL SONG :) she always makes my day. I first encountered angel when I needed to make special arrangements as I was using a walking stick.. she ensured the lovely ladies took good care of

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: After five years in Singapore, I still consider the Rose Veranda as my favorite place to enjoy a buffet (and I have tried a lot

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: This place is open from 12.00pm to 5.00pm. So whether you are here for brunch, lunch, hi-tea, you can have a buffet spread. The ambience is wonderful. The seat are comfortable sofas. Food spread is good. It's a mix of Asian and Western fusion. Wish they had self-made rojak. The sashmi was very fresh and the main roast was fantastic. Dessert section is a joy to watch. Some of the desserts made had intricate details. Insta photo worthy. Overall, a good experience and a beautiful place to treat a friend to his/her birthday party. They even give a free 1/4 kg birthday, which they will pack for u nicely if you can't eat there.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: We were there for a leisure high tea, 4 adults and 2 kids. We were very happy with their service and am especially impressed by how amicable Chef Ganesan is. He personally served my 2 year old and 4 year old nieces at the ice cream station. When I commented that my mum wanted chocolate ice cream which was not available, he immediately went into the kitchen and whipped out the nicest dark chocolate ice cream ever! What a professional! Thanks! I would go back again.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review:
Yesterday I went to rose veranda.
Welcome drink was very nice
I have very good time in Rose veranda
Service was kind and so nice
I appreciate to them♡(Lina, Julia, Joyce, Arianne)
I want to visit next time also

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: 02/06/20 I had a first time visit at Rose veran

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Very cosy and peaceful surroundin

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Nice place to chill. I love how fresh the prawns were for the Laksa and the cheese platter is great but can be quite hidden away

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Decided to give rose veranda a try for my friend’s birthday and the experience turned to be a really pleasant one. The staffs were polite and helpful, changing the cutlery and refilling our drinks promptly! Also, Chef ganeson was exceptional and wowed my friends and I with his yummy dishes and hospitality! I will definitely be back!!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: We have been regulars at Rose Veranda at Shangri-La Singapore . This time we came with my parents to celebrate their anniversary. We requested for pure vegetarian food and an eggless cake

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Birthday celebration at the rose verandah was wonderful. The food there is always of excellent quality and the variety of dessert is excellent. What makes this dining experience even more special was when Chef Jack offered to cook something for my mum who has alzheimers and cannot take regular food. I was pleasantly surprised as i had called earlier to ask if there is the alacarte option and they had said no. Later on, the waitress also asked if we wanted some scones as the chef can bake some for us. Warm scones freshly baked! Really wonderful. The Rose Verandah really stood out when compared to other high tea places!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Came here for afternoon buffet with my friends. Staff Joyce and Lina ,Anne taking good care of us. Nice food selection. Especially fresh warm served scones.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Chef Shobhit's food is really delicious, the staff were really attentive too. Joyce was often bringing us cutlery and topping up drinks before we even asked for it. Fantastic experience.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: The food and service were very good as usual. Special mention to Ganesan for the awesome service! :)

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Great food, wide selection of teas, and excellent service. The staff were helpful and friendly but we were especially impressed by Chef Ashok. Chef Ashok is very dedicated and passionate about his work and it shows in how he interacts with the guest. We were very satisfied that he goes the extra mile to ensure that our dietary preferences (vegetarian) are being accommodated for and that the choices were sufficient for us.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Good ambience and great servi

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Superb services rendered! Great ambience and food is good as always. Chef Jack preparing his specialty dish for us was definitely way above and beyond. Restaurant also arranged a birthday cake for me without me mentioning! I wondered how did they know! Definitely caught me by surprise

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Is it a great deal? The cost of the high tea is just a little less than what you needed paid for a lunch buffet so go for the lunch one. But nice environment.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: The food and ambience are nice as well as the servers are very friendly and also very attentive like Lina, Allie, Joyce, Julia, Ann, will definitely come again!!!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: The sashimi is very fresh and all the staff Allie, Joyce, Lina , Julia, Ann very nicely and friendly also, me and my friend we all have very good experience at Rose veranda

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Had a beautiful high tea afternoon with friends in a lovely setting. Though a buffet, there were no crowds grabbing for food. Rather, a small intimate atmosphere prevailed throughout with impeccable service, attentive detail and outstanding food. Brilliant!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Great ambience!! Friendly and polite staffs. Food is a little limited in varieties but it's still of great quality !!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Rose Veranda is a great place to catch up with friends and relatives as the buffet lunch cum high tea period allows longer sitting as compared to other places.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I’m a self confessed foodie, growing up in a family where most of my relatives are in the F&B industry and also studying hotel management and then nutrition and dietetics.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I always like it at Rose Veran

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Had 2nd seating of high tea on Christmas Day at the Rose Verand

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Turkey, ham and super dessert counter. Best quality durian coconut cake, yum!! Came here with teenager and toddler, and grandma. Excellent choices of 2 types of quality tea. Will come back again.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: My wife, daughter, son in law and I had buffet lunch at Veranda (22Dec2019). Wide selection of food-both eastern and western. Of particular mention was the roast turkey, which was very flavorful, delicious and delightful. Sous Chef Mr Ganesan Ashok patiently explained to us the immense effort needed to get it done just right- from marinating the bird through to cooking it to perfection. Quite clearly he is knowledgeable. We enjoyed the food and the ambiance. The soothing music from the pianist a floor below the Veranda was an added bonus. It is a place to go to for a good meal, good service and no ear-piercing loud mus

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: My family and I enjoyed dining at Rose Veranda. Not only was the food good but the waiters and Chef Ganesh Ashok were very warm and friendly. Chef Ganesh Ashok recommended, cooked the dishes for us and he also shared his tips on how to cook certain dishes. Overall, it was a really good experience. Totally worth it

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: The staff and food quality at Rose Veranda completely exceeded my expectation . Staff is really helpful with choosing the tea section. When tea begins to empty ,keep offering for refill. Thanks for Richelle taking good care of us. And hostess Joyce assist with choosing the seat due to we prefer table by the glass .Whole afternoon time well spend with my friends!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Went for afternoon tea with my wife for anniversary celebration. Food is good. Staff Joyce is friendly and helpful. Thanks for the cake arrangement. And we love laksa here. Thank you chef Ganesan for suggestions.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I came to enjoy afternoon tea with my friends on holiday and It was fantastic. The food and tea were really nice and the service was perfect. Whenever the plate was empty, Richelle & Julia quickly cleaned it up with warm smile and kindly asked if there was anything to need. I had good memories of Rose Veranda and I have to recommend to my acquaintances for their superior relaxation.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Not sure why the morning session ended at 2pm on 30 Nov 2019. We visit around 2x a year and i don't think it closed so early previously, so this visit felt a bit rushed. Staff were also quite frazzle

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Overall dining experience was not i expect

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: The venue is nice but booking High Tea expected maybe ribbon sandwiches, scones etc but not full buffet. Buffet was lovely but better to do as lunch to take full advantage of food served.We had already eaten lunch before arriving at 2.30.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: This is our favorite place for high tea, enjoy the spreads, the tea selection and the ambient. Will love to come again.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: The food is good and the spread is fantastic. It's so worth and service staffs makes us so comfortable and serves us so well Miss Elizabeth recommended good tea and Mr Ganesan Ashok, the sous chef is very hospitable and very knowledgeable with the food served and he even did some adjustments for my friend as she loves extreme spicy food. Very good service! Very good food! Very comfortable environment!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Had a good time with my friends. The food was great and the staff was the best. Especially Allie was the most attentive and wonderful staff. Definitely will go back and recommend to others.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I visited the rose veranda last week. When I visit the Rose veranda, the staff gave me warm welcome. I ordered the recommendation hightea of Luna, it was really nice. The rose veranda has good atmosphere, so i really want to visit this place again on my next birthday:) I’m especially grateful to Luna,Joyce and chloe for providing great service. Thank you!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I visited The Rose Veranda with my mum on 5th November and was warmly greeted by the service staff. The selection of teas was utterly impressive and I would like to thank Lina, Joyce, and Alie, for patiently tending to my mum's needs -- from introducing the buffet spread, translating the tea menu and providing very helpful recommendations, to even entertaining her curiosity. Special shout out to Chef William and Chef Kai Sen, who tended to my mum's no-beef diet restriction, and offered us some savory tarts and delicious tender pork belly skewers. The laksa impressed my mum quite a bit and it's pretty on par with the pork belly skewers. There was a great spread of dessert and I strongly recommend the scones (which you have to order from the service staff as they are not displayed) and the surprisingly fragrant sago gula melaka glass. It is a pity that we couldn't try more food or desserts because we were so stuffed, so it definitely gives us an excuse to revisit the place again!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I’m a fan of scores! Thank you Lina serves us an amazing scones. My friend and I enjoy so much at Rose Veranda in Shangri la hotel. Lots of food options. We are also tea lover. Love Gryphon brand tea especially nice recommendations from Allie. And I would like to appreciate Richelle for surprise my friend for Birthday celebration with cake and candle!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Today, I visited Rose Baranda with my friends. It was so good to choose because there were delicious foods and various teas. Chloe, who was the first to respond, explained various teas well so I could enjoy the tea. And I also thank Lina for taking care of me and my friends with a smile from beginning to end. Thanks a lot you all!

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: First try at Shangri-la hotel for Afternoon tea buffet. Delicious food especially signature laksa and lovely dessert station. Besides, I would like to appreciate staff Lina and Julia who provides good service.Recommended tea section in passion. Will come back soon with my friends.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Recommended foo

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I went to rose veranda 1 weeks bef

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: I visited here with my friend. And we had a great time. Food was nice and staffs also really kind. Especially thank u for Joyce, Luna, Chloe. I want to visit here later soon.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Nice view and good atmosphe

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: By far the worst meal in Shangri-La. For a price of $56++/pax the spread was disappointing & dishes were kind of a mismatch. Beef stew, fried vegetables, mashed potatoes, bryani & black pepper clams were quite odd to begin with. I admit I had a high expectation given it is Shang & It definitely pale in comparison to The Regent Hotel weekend high te

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
Review: Rose Veranda is one of the best if not the best restaurant for high tea buffet. The waitresses, Shelley and Ritchelle were so friendly and helpful. Great food, great ambience. No doubt we had a great time here. Will definitely be back here soon.

Name: The Rose Veranda
Location: 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-La Hotel Mezzanine Level, Tower Wing, Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore 258350 Singapore
